Japanese: アイテムのアップグレード
スポーンポイントをリセット

English: Thank you, warrior. We who lived on in this shape were denied the peace of death for too long. We go now...
Swedish: Tack, krigare. Vi som levt vidare i denna form har länge nekats dödens fridfulla famn. Nu går vi vidare...
French: Merci, guerrier. Nous qui vivons sous cette forme, rejetés par la mort depuis si longtemps. Nous partons trouver le repos, à présent...
Italian: Thank you, warrior. We who lived on in this shape were denied the peace of death for too long. We go now...
German: Vielen Dank, Krieger. Wir, die wir so unser Dasein fristen mussten, wurden um den Frieden des Todes betrogen. Doch jetzt wird es Zeit …
Spanish: Muchas gracias. A los que vivimos con esta forma se nos negó la paz de la muerte durante demasiado tiempo. Ya es hora de partir...
Russian: Спасибо, воин. Нам, живущим в этой форме, слишком долго отказывали в покое после смерти. Мы уходим...
Romanian: Thank you, warrior. We who lived on in this shape were denied the peace of death for too long. We go now...
Bulgarian: Thank you, warrior. We who lived on in this shape were denied the peace of death for too long. We go now...
Macedonian: Thank you, warrior. We who lived on in this shape were denied the peace of death for too long. We go now...
Finnish: Thank you, warrior. We who lived on in this shape were denied the peace of death for too long. We go now...
Danish: Thank you, warrior. We who lived on in this shape were denied the peace of death for too long. We go now...
Icelandic: Þakka þér, stríðsmaður. Við sem lifðum áfram í þessu gervi, voru neitað friðar eftir dauða oss. En nú förum við...
Turkish: Teşekkürler savaşçı. Bu surette yaşayan bizlere ölümle gelen azloluş uzun süredir yasaktı. Şimdi göçüyoruz...
Lithuanian: Thank you, warrior. We who lived on in this shape were denied the peace of death for too long. We go now...
Czech: Děkuji ti, válečníku. Nám, kteří jsme žili v této podobě, byl příliš dlouho odepřen klid smrti. Teď odcházíme...
Hungarian: Köszönöm, harcos. Mi, akik ebben az alakban éltünk, túl sokáig tagadtuk meg a halál békéjét. Most elmegyünk...
Slovak: Thank you, warrior. We who lived on in this shape were denied the peace of death for too long. We go now...
Polish: Dziękuję, wojowniku. Tym, którzy żyli w tej postaci, zbyt długo odmawiano spokoju śmierci. Teraz odejdziemy...
Dutch: Bedankt, krijger. Ons, die in deze vorm hebben geleefd, werd al te lang de vrede van de dood ontzegd. Nu vertrekken we…
Portuguese: Thank you, warrior. We who lived on in this shape were denied the peace of death for too long. We go now...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Agradeço, combatente. Nós, que vivemos nessa forma, não sentimos a paz da morte há muito tempo. Mas agora vamos…
Chinese: 感谢你，勇士。 像我们这样的灵体从来没有得到过正真的平静，即使我们已经死去。 现在我们可以离开了...
Japanese: 戦士よ、礼を言う。 この姿で生きている我らは、長く死の安息に拒まれていた。 これで旅立てる...
Korean: 고맙다, 전사여. 이 모습으로 살았던 우리는 오랫동안 죽음의 안식에 거부당해 왔다. 이제 떠날 수 있다. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 感謝你，勇士。 像我們這樣的靈體從來沒有得到過正真的平靜，即使我們已經死去。 現在我們可以離開了...

English: So you were my death? You look so small and soft… Tell Odin he may have broken this form but the wilderness will never submit to his rules...
Swedish: Så du skänkte mig döden? Du ser så liten och mjuk ut… Berätta för Oden att han må ha besegrat denna form, men att vildmarken aldrig kommer böja knä inför honom.
French: Alors, voilà ma faucheuse. Vous aviez l'air minuscule, fragile... Dites à Odin que vous avez peut-être brisé cette forme, mais que les contrées sauvages ne se plieront jamais à ses règles...
Italian: So you were my death? You look so small and soft… Tell Odin he may have broken this form but the wilderness will never submit to his rules...
German: So, du warst also mein Tod, wie? Dabei siehst du so klein und weich aus … Sag Odin, dass er diese Form erfolgreich gebrochen hat. Aber dass sich die Wildnis niemals seinen Regeln unterwerfen wird …
Spanish: ¿Has sido tú quién ha acabado conmigo? Eres un ser tan pequeño y delicado... Hazle saber a Odín que aunque haya acabado con esta forma, la naturaleza jamás se someterá bajo su yugo...
Russian: Такова моя смерть? Ты выглядишь как воплощение хрупкости... Скажи Одину, что хоть он и смог разрушить эту форму, ему никогда не подчинить дикую сущность...
Romanian: So you were my death? You look so small and soft… Tell Odin he may have broken this form but the wilderness will never submit to his rules...
Bulgarian: So you were my death? You look so small and soft… Tell Odin he may have broken this form but the wilderness will never submit to his rules...
Macedonian: So you were my death? You look so small and soft… Tell Odin he may have broken this form but the wilderness will never submit to his rules...
Finnish: So you were my death? You look so small and soft… Tell Odin he may have broken this form but the wilderness will never submit to his rules...
Danish: So you were my death? You look so small and soft… Tell Odin he may have broken this form but the wilderness will never submit to his rules...
Icelandic: Svo þú varst mér að bráð? Svo lítil og aumingjaleg vera... Segðu Óðni að hann gæti hafað brotið þetta form, en náttúran mun ekki krjúpa á hné fyrir honum...
Turkish: Beni öldüren sen miydin? Çok küçük ve yumuşaksın... Odin'e de ki bu bedeni alt etmiş olabilir ama vahşi doğa hiçbir zaman ona boyun eğmeyecek...
Lithuanian: So you were my death? You look so small and soft… Tell Odin he may have broken this form but the wilderness will never submit to his rules...
Czech: Takže to ty jsi moje smrt? Vypadáš tak malý a slabý... Řekni Odinovi, že tuto formu možná zlomil, ale divočina se nikdy nepodřídí jeho pravidlům...
Hungarian: Szóval te okoztad a halálomat? Olyan aprónak és puhának tűnsz... Mondd meg Odinnak, hogy ugyan megtörte ezt az alakot, de a vadon sosem fog engedelmeskedni a szabályainak...
Slovak: So you were my death? You look so small and soft… Tell Odin he may have broken this form but the wilderness will never submit to his rules...
Polish: Więc to ty jesteś moim posłańcem śmierci? Wyglądasz jak drobne chuchro… Powiedz Odynowi, że może i złamał mnie, lecz dzicz nigdy nie podda się jego rządom…
Dutch: Dus jij was mijn dood? Je lijkt zo klein, zo zacht… Vertel Odin dat hij deze vorm heeft gebroken, maar dat de wildernis zich nooit zal onderwerpen aan zijn heerschappij…
Portuguese: So you were my death? You look so small and soft… Tell Odin he may have broken this form but the wilderness will never submit to his rules...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Então você foi minha morte? Você é uma coisa tão pequena e macia… Diga a Odin que ele pode ter quebrado essa forma, mas a natureza nunca se curvará às regras dele…
Chinese: 所以你就是我的击杀者? 你看起来微小又软弱... 告诉奥丁，他是摧毁了我的肉身，但是我的灵魂永远不会对他屈服。
Japanese: すなわち、そなたが私の死か？しかしあまりにも小さく、柔らかい... オーディンに伝えよ。 この姿を滅ぼしても、荒野は決して彼の掟には従わぬとな...
Korean: 네가 나의 죽음이었다고? 넌 정말 작고 연약해 보이는데. . . 오딘에게 전해라. 그는 비록 이 몸을 꺾었지만, 황야는 결코 그의 통치에 따르지 않을 것이라고. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 所以你就是我的擊殺者? 你看起來微小又軟弱... 告訴奧丁，他是摧毀了我的肉身，但是我的靈魂永遠不會對他屈服。

English: Little thing of blood and bone, I should have snapped you like a twig! Now I wither and die, let the great tree have me...
Swedish: Du lille varelse av ben och blod... Jag borde brutit dig som en kvist! Nu förtvinar jag och dör, må Yggdrasil ta mig...
French: Petite chose de sang et d'os, j'aurais dû vous briser en deux comme une branche ! À présent, je fane et meurs, que le grand arbre m'accueille...
Italian: Little thing of blood and bone, I should have snapped you like a twig! Now I wither and die, let the great tree have me...
German: Unbedeutendes Wesen aus Blut und Knochen. Ich hätte dich wie einen Zweig brechen sollen! Jetzt verwelke und sterbe ich. Möge der große Baum mich empfangen …
Spanish: ¡Tendría que haberte partido a la mitad como a una rama, maldito saco de sangre y huesos! Ahora mi destino es pudrirme y morir. Que el gran árbol se apiade de mí...
Russian: Ничтожество из крови и костей, я должен был сломить тебя, как ветку! Теперь я засыхаю и умираю, пусть великое древо заберет меня...
Romanian: Little thing of blood and bone, I should have snapped you like a twig! Now I wither and die, let the great tree have me...
Bulgarian: Little thing of blood and bone, I should have snapped you like a twig! Now I wither and die, let the great tree have me...
Macedonian: Little thing of blood and bone, I should have snapped you like a twig! Now I wither and die, let the great tree have me...
Finnish: Little thing of blood and bone, I should have snapped you like a twig! Now I wither and die, let the great tree have me...
Danish: Little thing of blood and bone, I should have snapped you like a twig! Now I wither and die, let the great tree have me...
Icelandic: Litla vera af hold og blóði. Ég hefði átt að brjóta þig eins og spíta. Nú visna ég og dey, megi mikla tréð hafa mig...
Turkish: Kan ve kemikten olma küçük şey, seni ince bir dal misali kırmalıydım! Şimdiyse yitip gidiyor, ulu ağaca göçüyorum...
Lithuanian: Little thing of blood and bone, I should have snapped you like a twig! Now I wither and die, let the great tree have me...
Czech: Maličkost z krve a kostí, měl jsem tě zlomit jako větvičku! Teď chřadnu a umírám, nech mě pohltí velký strom...
Hungarian: Vér és csontok kicsiny lénye, ketté kellett volna törnöm téged, akár egy gallyat! Most elsorvadok, és meghalok, hadd követeljen magáénak a nagy fa...
Slovak: Little thing of blood and bone, I should have snapped you like a twig! Now I wither and die, let the great tree have me...
Polish: Chuchro z krwi i kości, powinienem cię złamać w pół jak gałązkę! Teraz usycham i umieram, a wielkie drzewo mnie pochłonie…
Dutch: Klein ding van bloed en beenderen, jou had ik als een twijgje moeten kunnen breken! Nu zal ik hier verdorren en sterven; laat de grote boom mij meenemen…
Portuguese: Little thing of blood and bone, I should have snapped you like a twig! Now I wither and die, let the great tree have me...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Coisinha de sangue e osso, eu deveria ter quebrado você como um galho! Agora eu apodreço e morro, que a grande árvore me receba…
Chinese: 用血和骨做成的低等生物，我早该把你像树枝一样折断的！而我现在却要在枯萎中死去，让我与世界之树融为一体吧...
Japanese: 血と骨でできた取るに足りぬ者よ。 おまえを小枝のように折っておくべきであった！私は枯れ、死につつある。 大いなる木に迎えられんことを...
Korean: 피와 뼈로 된 하찮은 자여. 너를 잔가지처럼 꺾었어야 했는데! 이제 나는 말라죽어 가고 있지. 위대한 나무가 맞이하기를. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 用血和骨做成的低等生物，我早該把你像樹枝一樣折斷的！而我現在卻要在枯萎中死去，讓我與世界之樹融為一體吧...

English: Sheathe your pride, creature of Odin! My long reign is at an end but those who come after me are greater still...
Swedish: Mantla din stolthet, du Odens kreatur. Min välde må ha tagit slut, men jag kommer ersättas av större, fruktansvärdare...
French: Réprimez votre fierté, créature d'Odin ! Mon long règne touche à sa fin, mais ceux qui me succéderont sont bien plus puissants...
Italian: Sheathe your pride, creature of Odin! My long reign is at an end but those who come after me are greater still...
German: Schlucke deinen Stolz herunter, Kreatur von Odin! Meine lange Herrschaft findet ihr Ende. Doch die, die nach mir kommen, werden mächtiger sein …
Spanish: ¡Enfunda ese orgullo tuyo, criatura de Odín! Puede que mi reinado llegue a su fin, pero mis predecesores son aún más poderosos...
Russian: Умерь свою гордость, создание Одина! Мое долгое правление подошло к концу, но те, кто придет после меня, еще сильнее...
Romanian: Sheathe your pride, creature of Odin! My long reign is at an end but those who come after me are greater still...
Bulgarian: Sheathe your pride, creature of Odin! My long reign is at an end but those who come after me are greater still...
Macedonian: Sheathe your pride, creature of Odin! My long reign is at an end but those who come after me are greater still...
Finnish: Sheathe your pride, creature of Odin! My long reign is at an end but those who come after me are greater still...
Danish: Sheathe your pride, creature of Odin! My long reign is at an end but those who come after me are greater still...
Icelandic: Vera Óðins, full af hroka. Mitt mikla veldi hér er kannski á enda, en þeir sem koma á eftir mér munu hafa meira vald en þú getur nokkurn tíman ímyndað þér...
Turkish: Odin'in yarattığı, kibrini bir kenara kaldır! Uzun süren hükümdarlığım sonuna geldi ama ardımdan gelenler daha da haşmetli olacak...
Lithuanian: Sheathe your pride, creature of Odin! My long reign is at an end but those who come after me are greater still...
Czech: Odlož svou pýchu, stvoření Odina! Moje dlouhá vláda je u konce, ale ti, kteří přijdou po mně, jsou silnější...
Hungarian: Fedd el a büszkeséged, Odin teremtménye! Hosszú uralkodásom véget ért, de azok, akik utánam érkeznek, még hatalmasabbak...
Slovak: Sheathe your pride, creature of Odin! My long reign is at an end but those who come after me are greater still...
Polish: Ukryj swoją dumę, stworzeniu Odyna! Moje długie panowanie dobiegło końca, ale moi następcy będą jeszcze potężniejsi…
Dutch: Houd je trots in toom, wezen van Odin! Mijn lange heerschappij mag dan ten einde zijn, wie na mij komt zal nog groter zijn…
Portuguese: Sheathe your pride, creature of Odin! My long reign is at an end but those who come after me are greater still...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Guarde seu orgulho, criatura de Odin! Meu longo reinado está chegando ao fim, mas aqueles que vêm depois de mim são ainda maiores…
Chinese: 收起你的高傲吧，奥丁捏的小泥人！虽然我的长期统治已经结束，但是我的追随者仍会更加强大...
Japanese: オーディンに創られし者よ、驕りを収めよ！長きにわたる我が王座は終焉を迎えるが、その後を襲う者はさらに偉大なるぞ...
Korean: 거만하게 굴지 마라, 오딘의 피조물이여! 비록 나의 오랜 통치는 끝났지만, 나의 뒤를 따르는 자들은 더욱 강하다. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 收起你的高傲吧，奧丁捏的小泥人！雖然我的長期統治已經結束，但是我的追隨者仍會更加強大...

English: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Swedish: Har du kommit för att stilla din skadeglädje, du lille? Vet du hur många gånger jag blivit dödad, knäckt, bannlyst, bränd och begraven? Du är inte först, och du kommer inte bli sist.
French: Vous venez vous gausser, petite chose ? Savez-vous combien de fois j'ai été tué, brisé, banni, brûlé et enterré ? Ce ne sera pas la première fois ni la dernière.
Italian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
German: Bist du hier, um anzugeben? Weißt du nicht, wie oft ich bereits getötet und gebrochen, verbannt und verbrannt und auch begraben wurde? Du bist nicht die erste und wirst auch nicht die letzte Person sein.
Spanish: ¿Vienes a regodearte, criatura? ¿Sabes cuántas veces me han matado, destrozado, desterrado, quemado y enterrado? No eres la primera persona... ni serás la última.
Russian: Собираешься позлорадствовать, ничтожество? Знаешь, сколько раз меня убивали, ломали, изгоняли, сжигали и хоронили? Много их было до тебя, много будет и после.
Romanian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Bulgarian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Macedonian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Finnish: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Danish: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Icelandic: Kemur þú með derring, litla vera? Veist þú hversu oft ég hef verið drepinn, brotin í bita, hrakin, brenndur, og jarðaður? Þú ert ekki sá fyrsti og mun ekki vera sá síðasti.
Turkish: Böbürlenmeye mi geldin küçük şey? Kaç sefer öldüğümü, düştüğümü, sürüldüğümü, yakıldığımı ve gömüldüğümü biliyor musun? İlk değilsin, son da olmayacaksın.
Lithuanian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Czech: Přišel jsi se pokochat, drobečku? Víš, kolikrát jsem byl zabit, zlomen, vykázán, spálen a pohřben? Nejsi první a nebudeš ani poslední.
Hungarian: Azért jöttél, hogy kárörvendj, kicsiny lény? Tudod, hányszor öltek és törtek meg, száműztek, égettek és temettek el? Nem te vagy az első, és nem is te leszel az utolsó.
Slovak: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Polish: Przybywasz, by zatriumfować, chuchro? Czy wiesz, ile razy zostałem zabity, pokonany, wygnany, spalony i pochowany? Nie jesteś pierwszy i nie będziesz ostatni.
Dutch: Kom je je verkneukelen, klein ding? Weet je wel hoe vaak ik ben gedood, gebroken, verbannen, verbrand, en begraven? Jij bent noch de eerste, noch zul je de laatste zijn.
Portuguese: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você vem para se gabar, coisa diminuta? Sabe quantas vezes já fui morto, quebrado, banido, queimado e enterrado? Você não foi o primeiro e nem será o último.
Chinese: 小东西，你是来嘲笑我的吗？你知道我已经被杀戮，撕裂，放逐，焚烧，掩埋过多少次了吗？你不是第一个这样做的人，也不会是最后一个。
Japanese: ちっぽけな者よ、これで満足か？私がどれほど何度も殺され、滅ぼされ、消され、焼かれ、埋められたか知っているか？おまえは最初ではないし、最後でもない。
Korean: 꼬마야, 나를 비웃으러 왔니? 내가 몇 번이나 죽고, 부서지고, 추방되고, 불타고, 묻혔는지 아니? 너는 처음도 아니고 마지막도 아니야.
Chinese_Traditional: 小東西，你是來嘲笑我的嗎？你知道我已經被殺戮，撕裂，放逐，焚燒，掩埋過多少次了嗎？你不是第一個這樣做的人，也不會是最後一個。

English: You dream of a hundred ghosts crowding thickly around your bedside, seeking warmth and life until something thumps deep below the ground and they jump like crumbs on a drumskin and are gone.
Swedish: Du drömmer om hundratals spöken som trängs vid sidan av sängen, i jakt på värme och liv.\nNågot skälver djupt under jorden, och de hoppar som smulor på trumskinn innan alla är väck.
French: Vous rêvez d'une centaine de fantômes agglutinés autour de votre lit, à la recherche de chaleur et de vie, jusqu'à ce que quelque chose frappe lourdement depuis le sol. Ils bondissent comme des miettes sur une peau de tambour et disparaissent.
Italian: You dream of a hundred ghosts crowding thickly around your bedside, seeking warmth and life until something thumps deep below the ground and they jump like crumbs on a drumskin and are gone.
German: Du träumst von hunderten von Geistern, die sich dicht aneinandergedrängt um dein Bett versammeln und auf der Suche nach wärmendem Leben sind - bis irgendetwas unter der Erde zu pochen beginnt, wodurch sie wie auf einer Trommel herumspringen und dann verschwinden.
Spanish: Sueñas con cientos de fantasmas que se aglomeran junto a tu lecho y van en busca del calor de la vida. Sin embargo, un golpe que proviene de las profundidades los perturba tanto que se desvanecen al instante.
Russian: Вам снится сотня призраков, плотно столпившихся у вашей постели в поисках тепла и жизни. Но вдруг землю сотрясает дрожь, что-то прорывается из глубины земли, и призраки исчезают.
Romanian: You dream of a hundred ghosts crowding thickly around your bedside, seeking warmth and life until something thumps deep below the ground and they jump like crumbs on a drumskin and are gone.
Bulgarian: You dream of a hundred ghosts crowding thickly around your bedside, seeking warmth and life until something thumps deep below the ground and they jump like crumbs on a drumskin and are gone.
Macedonian: You dream of a hundred ghosts crowding thickly around your bedside, seeking warmth and life until something thumps deep below the ground and they jump like crumbs on a drumskin and are gone.
Finnish: You dream of a hundred ghosts crowding thickly around your bedside, seeking warmth and life until something thumps deep below the ground and they jump like crumbs on a drumskin and are gone.
Danish: You dream of a hundred ghosts crowding thickly around your bedside, seeking warmth and life until something thumps deep below the ground and they jump like crumbs on a drumskin and are gone.
Icelandic: You dream of a hundred ghosts crowding thickly around your bedside, seeking warmth and life until something thumps deep below the ground and they jump like crumbs on a drumskin and are gone.
Turkish: Rüyanda yüzlerce hayaletin yatağının yanı başında toplandığını, sıcaklık ve yaşama doğru çekildiğini hissediyorsun. Sonra derinlerdeki bir şey toprağı sarsıyor ve hayaletler davul derisindeki ekmek kırıntıları misali sıçrayıp kayboluyorlar.
Lithuanian: You dream of a hundred ghosts crowding thickly around your bedside, seeking warmth and life until something thumps deep below the ground and they jump like crumbs on a drumskin and are gone.
Czech: You dream of a hundred ghosts crowding thickly around your bedside, seeking warmth and life until something thumps deep below the ground and they jump like crumbs on a drumskin and are gone.
Hungarian: Száz szellemről álmodsz, ahogy az ágyad köré zsúfolódnak, meleg és élet után kutatva, amíg valami mélyen a föld alatt nem dobban, és úgy ugranak fel, akár a morzsák a dobbőrön, majd nyomuk vész.
Slovak: You dream of a hundred ghosts crowding thickly around your bedside, seeking warmth and life until something thumps deep below the ground and they jump like crumbs on a drumskin and are gone.
Polish: Śnisz o setkach duchów tłoczących się gęsto wokół twojego łóżka, szukających ciepła i życia, aż coś uderza głęboko pod ziemię, a one podskakują jak okruchy na membranie bębna i znikają.
Dutch: Je droomt van honderd geesten die je bed omringen, op zoek naar warmte en leven, tot diep onder de grond iets klopt en ze opspringen als kruimels op een trommelvel... en verdwijnen.
Portuguese: You dream of a hundred ghosts crowding thickly around your bedside, seeking warmth and life until something thumps deep below the ground and they jump like crumbs on a drumskin and are gone.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você sonha com uma centena de fantasmas aglomerando-se ao redor da sua cama, em busca de calor e vida até que algo bate bem no fundo do solo e eles pulam como migalhas em um tambor e vão embora.
Chinese: 你梦到成百上千的幽灵在你床前周围徘徊，似乎想从你这里得到温暖和生命的气息。 然而地下却传来了巨响，而这些躁动的灵魂转瞬即逝。
Japanese: 夢の中で、無数の幽霊たちがベッドのまわりを取り囲み、温かみと命を求めてのぞきこむ。 不意に地中でどすんという音が聞こえ、幽霊は太鼓の皮の上のパンくずのように跳び上がって消える。
Korean: 꿈속에서 수백의 유령들이 침대 주위를 에워싸고 온기와 생명을 찾아 기웃거립니다. 갑자기 땅속에서 쿵 소리가 들리고 귀신은 북의 가죽위 부스러기처럼 뛰어올라 사라집니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 你夢到成百上千的幽靈在你床前周圍徘徊，似乎想從你這裡得到溫暖和生命的氣息。 然而地下卻傳來了巨響，而這些躁動的靈魂轉瞬即逝。

English: You dream of running through a meadow, the sky alight with pale fire. There is a thunder of hoofbeats behind you but when you turn, nothing is there.\n\nYou awaken with your heart pounding in your chest.
Swedish:
Du springer barfota genom en äng, skyn upplyst av bleka lågor.
Hovslag ljuder likt åska bakom dig, men när du vänder dig om finns ingen där.

Du vaknar med hjärtat i halsgropen.
French: Vous rêvez d'un pré dans lequel vous courez, et le ciel est coloré par un feu pâle. Des bruits de sabot martèlent le sol derrière vous, mais vous ne voyez rien quand vous vous retournez.\n\nVous vous réveillez, le cœur battant la chamade.
Italian: You dream of running through a meadow, the sky alight with pale fire. There is a thunder of hoofbeats behind you but when you turn, nothing is there.\n\nYou awaken with your heart pounding in your chest.
German: Du träumst davon, wie du über eine Aue rennst, während der Himmel von bleichem Feuer erfüllt ist. Hinter dir vernimmst du donnernde Hufe. Doch als du dich umdrehst, ist nichts zu sehen.\n\nDu erwachst mit einem pochenden Herzen in deiner Brust.
Spanish: Sueñas que corres a través de una pradera mientras el cielo parece iluminado por un pálido fuego. Oyes el tronar del trote de unas pezuñas tras de ti, pero cuando te giras... no hay nada.\n\nTe despiertas con el corazón desbocado.
Russian: Во сне вы бежите по лугу. Небо сияет, словно бледный огонь. Позади слышен грохот копыт, но когда вы поворачиваетесь, там ничего нет.\n\nВы просыпаетесь с колотящимся в груди сердцем.
Romanian: You dream of running through a meadow, the sky alight with pale fire. There is a thunder of hoofbeats behind you but when you turn, nothing is there.\n\nYou awaken with your heart pounding in your chest.
Bulgarian: You dream of running through a meadow, the sky alight with pale fire. There is a thunder of hoofbeats behind you but when you turn, nothing is there.\n\nYou awaken with your heart pounding in your chest.
Macedonian: You dream of running through a meadow, the sky alight with pale fire. There is a thunder of hoofbeats behind you but when you turn, nothing is there.\n\nYou awaken with your heart pounding in your chest.
Finnish: You dream of running through a meadow, the sky alight with pale fire. There is a thunder of hoofbeats behind you but when you turn, nothing is there.\n\nYou awaken with your heart pounding in your chest.
Danish: You dream of running through a meadow, the sky alight with pale fire. There is a thunder of hoofbeats behind you but when you turn, nothing is there.\n\nYou awaken with your heart pounding in your chest.
Icelandic: You dream of running through a meadow, the sky alight with pale fire. There is a thunder of hoofbeats behind you but when you turn, nothing is there.\n\nYou awaken with your heart pounding in your chest.
Turkish: Rüyanda yemyeşil bir çayırda koşuyorsun ve gökyüzü solgun bir ateş misali parlıyor. Arkanda dörtnala koşan toynak sesleri duyuyorsun ama döndüğünde arkanda hiç kimse yok.\n\nUyandığında kalbin deli gibi çarpıyor.
Lithuanian: You dream of running through a meadow, the sky alight with pale fire. There is a thunder of hoofbeats behind you but when you turn, nothing is there.\n\nYou awaken with your heart pounding in your chest.
Czech: You dream of running through a meadow, the sky alight with pale fire. There is a thunder of hoofbeats behind you but when you turn, nothing is there.\n\nYou awaken with your heart pounding in your chest.
Hungarian: Arról álmodsz,, hogy egy réten rohansz, az ég pedig halovány tűzzel világít. Mennydörgő patadobbanásokat hallasz magad mögül, de amikor megfordulsz, nem találsz ott semmit.\n\nDübörgő mellkassal ébredsz.
Slovak: You dream of running through a meadow, the sky alight with pale fire. There is a thunder of hoofbeats behind you but when you turn, nothing is there.\n\nYou awaken with your heart pounding in your chest.
Polish: W śnie biegniesz przez łąkę, niebo płonie bladym ogniem. Za tobą rozlega się stukot kopyt, ale kiedy się odwracasz, nic nie widzisz.\n\nBudzisz się z bijącym sercem w piersi.
Dutch: Je droom dat je door een weide rent; de lucht lijkt te branden. Achter je klinkt het gedonder van hoeven, maar wanneer je je omdraait zie je niets.\n\nMet zwaar kloppend hart ontwaak je.
Portuguese: You dream of running through a meadow, the sky alight with pale fire. There is a thunder of hoofbeats behind you but when you turn, nothing is there.\n\nYou awaken with your heart pounding in your chest.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você sonha em correr por uma campina, o céu iluminado com uma fogueira fraca. Cascos trovejam logo atrás, mas quando você se vira, não há nada lá.\n\nVocê acorda com o coração batendo forte no peito.
Chinese: 你梦到你在青青草原上奔跑，天空中飘落微弱的火焰。 你听到了如雷的踢声，你猛然转身，却什么都没看见。 \n\n你在自己砰砰的心跳中醒来。
Japanese: 夢の中で、草原を走っている。 空はおぼろな火で明るくなっている。 背後から蹄の音の轟きが聞こえるが、振り向くと何もない。 \n\n目を覚ますと胸の中で心臓が激しく打っている。
Korean: 당신은 창백한 불꽃으로 밝혀진 하늘 아래에 초원을 달리는 꿈을 꾸었습니다. 뒤에서는 천둥과도 같은 발굽 소리가 나지만 뒤를 돌아보면 아무것도 없습니다. \n\n두근거리는 심장소리에 잠에서 깨어납니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 你夢到你在青青草原上奔跑，天空中飄落微弱的火焰。 你聽到了如雷的踢聲，你猛然轉身，卻什麼都沒看見。 \n\n你在自己砰砰的心跳中醒來。

English: In your dream, the forest rises before you, dragging the trees upward like a cloak, its dark mass hiding the stars. At the mountain's peak, vast antlers frame the moon...
Swedish: I din dröm reser sig skogen framför dig; träden sveper uppåt, uppåt, likt en mantel, vars mörka massa döljer stjärnorna.\nVid bergets topp ramar väldiga horn in månen.
French: Dans votre rêve, des forêts se dressent devant vous, les arbres voilant les étoiles comme un manteau sombre. Au sommet de la montagne, d'immenses bois encadrent la lune...
Italian: In your dream, the forest rises before you, dragging the trees upward like a cloak, its dark mass hiding the stars. At the mountain's peak, vast antlers frame the moon...
German: In deinem Traum erhebt sich der Wald vor deinen Augen, der die Bäume wie einen Umhang nach oben zieht und mit seiner massigen Gestalt die Sterne bedeckt. Beim Gipfel des Berges wird der Mond von einem gewaltigen Geweih umrahmt …
Spanish: En el sueño, el bosque se alza ante ti. Los árboles se yerguen hacia el cielo como si de una capa se trataran, cubriendo así las estrellas. En la cima de la montaña, una cornamenta rodea a la luna...
Russian: Вам снится лес. Его деревья поднимаются так высоко, что скрывают звезды, словно плащом. На вершине горы огромные рога обрамляют луну...
Romanian: In your dream, the forest rises before you, dragging the trees upward like a cloak, its dark mass hiding the stars. At the mountain's peak, vast antlers frame the moon...
Bulgarian: In your dream, the forest rises before you, dragging the trees upward like a cloak, its dark mass hiding the stars. At the mountain's peak, vast antlers frame the moon...
Macedonian: In your dream, the forest rises before you, dragging the trees upward like a cloak, its dark mass hiding the stars. At the mountain's peak, vast antlers frame the moon...
Finnish: In your dream, the forest rises before you, dragging the trees upward like a cloak, its dark mass hiding the stars. At the mountain's peak, vast antlers frame the moon...
Danish: In your dream, the forest rises before you, dragging the trees upward like a cloak, its dark mass hiding the stars. At the mountain's peak, vast antlers frame the moon...
Icelandic: In your dream, the forest rises before you, dragging the trees upward like a cloak, its dark mass hiding the stars. At the mountain's peak, vast antlers frame the moon...
Turkish: Rüyanda orman önünde ayaklanıveriyor, ağaçları pelerin misali çekiyor ve karanlık kütlesi yıldızları perde çekiyor. Dağın zirvesindeki dev boynuzlar, Ay'ı çevreliyor.
Lithuanian: In your dream, the forest rises before you, dragging the trees upward like a cloak, its dark mass hiding the stars. At the mountain's peak, vast antlers frame the moon...
Czech: In your dream, the forest rises before you, dragging the trees upward like a cloak, its dark mass hiding the stars. At the mountain's peak, vast antlers frame the moon...
Hungarian: Álmodban az erdő kinő előtted, csuklyaként felfelé rántva a fákat, sötét tömege pedig elrejti a csillagokat. A hegy csúcsán hatalmas agancsok keretezik a Holdat...
Slovak: In your dream, the forest rises before you, dragging the trees upward like a cloak, its dark mass hiding the stars. At the mountain's peak, vast antlers frame the moon...
Polish: W śnie twoim oczom ukazuje się las, ciągnący drzewa w górę jak płaszcz, a jego ciemna masa ukrywa gwiazdy. Na szczycie góry rozległe poroże otacza księżyc…
Dutch: In je droom zie je het bos voor je opstijgen en worden de bomen als een mantel omhoog getrokken, de donkere massa de sterren verhullend. Op de piek van de berg omsluit een groot gewei de maan…
Portuguese: In your dream, the forest rises before you, dragging the trees upward like a cloak, its dark mass hiding the stars. At the mountain's peak, vast antlers frame the moon...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Em seu sonho, a floresta surge à sua frente, arrastando as árvores para cima como um manto, sua massa sombria escondendo as estrelas. No pico da montanha, enormes chifres emolduram a lua…
Chinese: 在你的梦里，森林被一股无形之力像斗篷一样被掀起，无尽的黑暗遮住了星星，天地浑浊。 在山顶上，犄角勾勒出了月亮的形状...
Japanese: 夢の中で、森が眼前に立ち上がる。 木々はマントのように引きずり上げられ、その黒い塊が星を隠す。 山の頂では巨大な鹿の角が月を縁取っている...
Korean: 꿈에서, 숲이 당신 앞에 우뚝 솟아, 나무들을 망토처럼 거느리며 위로 끌었고. 어두운 거체는 별들을 가립니다. 산의 꼭대기에서 거대한 뿔이 달을 두릅니다. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 在你的夢裡，森林被一股無形之力像斗篷一樣被掀起，無盡的黑暗遮住了星星，天地渾濁。 在山頂上，犄角勾勒出了月亮的形状...

English: You dream that you are flying over mountaintops, all of Valheim spread out below you.\n\nAs you wheel and dive in the cold air, a great shape soars up past you to block the sun. In the darkness, it speaks. "Seek me."
Swedish:
Du drömmer att du flyger över bergstopparna, hela Valheim öppet under dig.

Du virvlar och dyker i den kyliga luften, innan en väldig skepnad plötsligt tornar upp sig, och täcker solen från sikt.
I mörkret talar den. "Sök mig."
French: Vous rêvez que vous survolez le sommet des montagnes et que vous voyez tout Valheim, de là-haut.\n\nVous tourbillonnez dans l'air froid, jusqu'à ce qu'une grande forme vous dépasse et bloque le soleil. Elle vous parle dans les ténèbres : « Partez à ma recherche ».
Italian: You dream that you are flying over mountaintops, all of Valheim spread out below you.\n\nAs you wheel and dive in the cold air, a great shape soars up past you to block the sun. In the darkness, it speaks. "Seek me."
German: Du träumst davon, über die Gipfel der Berge zu fliegen - unter dir das weite Valheim.\n\nWährend du durch die kalte Luft saust, erhebt sich hinter dir etwas Großes in die Höhe und verdeckt die Sonne. Dann vernimmst du im Dunkeln eine Stimme: "Suche mich auf."
Spanish: Sueñas que sobrevuelas las montañas mientras todo Valheim se extiende bajo tus ojos.\n\nMientras giras y desciendes por los aires gélidos, una silueta descomunal asciende ante ti para bloquear el sol. En la oscuridad, te susurra: "Encuéntrame".
Russian: Вам снится, что вы летите над горными вершинами, а весь Вальхейм раскинулся под вами.\n\nВы ныряете в холодный воздух, и мимо вас, закрывая солнце, проносится громадная фигура. Она говорит в темноте: «Найди меня».
Romanian: You dream that you are flying over mountaintops, all of Valheim spread out below you.\n\nAs you wheel and dive in the cold air, a great shape soars up past you to block the sun. In the darkness, it speaks. "Seek me."
Bulgarian: You dream that you are flying over mountaintops, all of Valheim spread out below you.\n\nAs you wheel and dive in the cold air, a great shape soars up past you to block the sun. In the darkness, it speaks. "Seek me."
Macedonian: You dream that you are flying over mountaintops, all of Valheim spread out below you.\n\nAs you wheel and dive in the cold air, a great shape soars up past you to block the sun. In the darkness, it speaks. "Seek me."
Finnish: You dream that you are flying over mountaintops, all of Valheim spread out below you.\n\nAs you wheel and dive in the cold air, a great shape soars up past you to block the sun. In the darkness, it speaks. "Seek me."
Danish: You dream that you are flying over mountaintops, all of Valheim spread out below you.\n\nAs you wheel and dive in the cold air, a great shape soars up past you to block the sun. In the darkness, it speaks. "Seek me."
Icelandic: You dream that you are flying over mountaintops, all of Valheim spread out below you.\n\nAs you wheel and dive in the cold air, a great shape soars up past you to block the sun. In the darkness, it speaks. "Seek me."
Turkish: Rüyanda dağların üstünde uçtuğunu ve tüm Valheim'ın altında uzandığını görüyorsun.\n\nSoğuk havada yön değiştirip dalışa geçerken, büyük bir suret hızlıca arkanda yükseliyor ve güneşi kapatıyor. Karanlıkta şunları söylüyor: "Beni bulmalısın."
Lithuanian: You dream that you are flying over mountaintops, all of Valheim spread out below you.\n\nAs you wheel and dive in the cold air, a great shape soars up past you to block the sun. In the darkness, it speaks. "Seek me."
Czech: You dream that you are flying over mountaintops, all of Valheim spread out below you.\n\nAs you wheel and dive in the cold air, a great shape soars up past you to block the sun. In the darkness, it speaks. "Seek me."
Hungarian: Arról álmodsz, hogy a hegytetők felett repülsz, és Valheim egésze alattad terül el.\n\nAhogy a hideg levegőben forogsz és buksz alá, egy hatalmas alak szárnyal fel melletted, hogy eltakarja a Napot. Megszólal a sötétben: - Keress meg!
Slovak: You dream that you are flying over mountaintops, all of Valheim spread out below you.\n\nAs you wheel and dive in the cold air, a great shape soars up past you to block the sun. In the darkness, it speaks. "Seek me."
Polish: Śnisz, że przelatujesz nad szczytami gór, a całe Valheim rozpościera się pod tobą.\n\nKiedy obracasz się i dajesz nura w zimnym powietrzu, wielki kształt szybuje obok ciebie, blokując słońce. W ciemności przemawia do ciebie: „Szukaj mnie”.
Dutch: Je droomt dat je over de bergtoppen vliegt, en heel Valheim zich onder je uitstrekt.\n\nTerwijl je in de kou salto's vliegt en naar beneden duikt, zweeft een grote vorm je voorbij en blokkeert de zon. In de duisternis spreekt het tot je: "zoek me".
Portuguese: You dream that you are flying over mountaintops, all of Valheim spread out below you.\n\nAs you wheel and dive in the cold air, a great shape soars up past you to block the sun. In the darkness, it speaks. "Seek me."
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você sonha que está voando sobre as montanhas, Valheim espalhada abaixo de você.\n\nConforme você gira e mergulha no ar frio, uma grande forma ascende e bloqueia o sol. Na escuridão, você ouve: "Me procure".
Chinese: 你梦到你在雪山顶飞翔，俯瞰整个英灵神殿。 \n\n当你开始在冷风中徘徊，一个巨大的影子遮住了太阳。 它对你说：“找到我。 ”
Japanese: 山々の頂きの上を飛んでいる夢を見る。 Valheimのすべてが眼下に広がっている。 \n\n身を翻して冷たい空気の中に飛び込むと、大きな影がかすめるように上昇し、日の光を遮る。 闇の中でそれが言う。 「私を探せ」
Korean: 산꼭대기 위를 날고 있는 꿈을 꾸고 있습니다. 발헤임의 모든 것이 눈앞에 펼쳐져 있습니다. \n\n몸을 돌려 차가운 공기 속으로 뛰어들면 커다란 그림자가 스치듯 상승해 햇빛을 가립니다. 어둠 속에서, 그것이 말합니다. "나를 찾아라. "
Chinese_Traditional: 你夢到你在雪山頂飛翔，俯瞰整個瓦爾海姆。 \n\n當你開始在冷風中徘徊，一個巨大的影子遮住了太陽。 它對你說：“找到我。 ”

English: You dream of a river running uphill, of green shoots turning downward into the earth…
Swedish: Du drömmer om en strid flod som flyter uppåt, om gröna skott som sträcker sig ned, ned i jorden…
French: Vous rêvez d'une rivière qui remonte la montagne, de plantes qui poussent sous terre...
Italian: You dream of a river running uphill, of green shoots turning downward into the earth…
German: Du träumst von einem Fluss, der den Berg hinauf fließt, und von grünen Sprösslingen, die sich dem Erdreich entgegenstrecken …
Spanish: Sueñas con un río que fluye cuesta arriba y con brotes verdes que crecen hacia el centro de la tierra...
Russian: Вам снится река, бегущая в гору, и зеленые побеги, уходящие в землю…
Romanian: You dream of a river running uphill, of green shoots turning downward into the earth…
Bulgarian: You dream of a river running uphill, of green shoots turning downward into the earth…
Macedonian: You dream of a river running uphill, of green shoots turning downward into the earth…
Finnish: You dream of a river running uphill, of green shoots turning downward into the earth…
Danish: You dream of a river running uphill, of green shoots turning downward into the earth…
Icelandic: You dream of a river running uphill, of green shoots turning downward into the earth…
Turkish: Rüyanda yukarı doğru akan bir nehir ve toprağın içine doğru büyüyen filizler görüyorsun…
Lithuanian: You dream of a river running uphill, of green shoots turning downward into the earth…
Czech: You dream of a river running uphill, of green shoots turning downward into the earth…
Hungarian: Egy felfelé rohanó folyóról álmodsz; zöld hajtásokról, amelyek a föld felé fordulnak...
Slovak: You dream of a river running uphill, of green shoots turning downward into the earth…
Polish: Marzysz o rzece płynącej w górach, o zielonych pędach opadających w dół w ziemię…
Dutch: Je droomt van een rivier die heuvelopwaarts stroomt, en groene scheuten die de aarde induiken...
Portuguese: You dream of a river running uphill, of green shoots turning downward into the earth…
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você sonha com um rio que corre montanha acima, com plantas que florescem para dentro da terra…
Chinese: 你梦到了水往高处流，树往地下走....
Japanese: 山を登る川と、地中に突き刺さる木の芽の夢を見た...
Korean: 강물이 위로 흐르며, 초록 새싹들이 땅으로 꺼지는 꿈을 꿨습니다. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 你夢到了水往高處流，樹往地下走....

English: Once again, you run at the head of your warriors, the weight of your father's axe in your hand.\n\nYou wake with the war-cry on your lips…
Swedish: Återigen springer du i täten av dina krigare, vikten av din faders yxa i handen.\n\nKrigsropet är kvar i halsen när du vaknar…
French: Vous prenez encore une fois la tête de votre groupe de guerriers, la hache de votre père pesant au creux de votre main.\n\nVous vous réveillez, un cri de guerre dans la gorge...
Italian: Once again, you run at the head of your warriors, the weight of your father's axe in your hand.\n\nYou wake with the war-cry on your lips…
German: Du rennst erneut deinen Kriegern voran, während du die schwere Axt deines Vaters in den Händen spürst.\n\nAls du erwachst, hast du einen Kriegsschrei auf den Lippen …
Spanish: Vuelves a estar a la cabeza de tus guerreros, y llevas el peso del hacha de tu padre en las manos.\n\nTe despiertas con un grito de guerra en los labios...
Russian: Вы снова стоите во главе своих воинов, ощущая в руке тяжесть отцовского топора.\n\nВы просыпаетесь с боевым кличем на устах...
Romanian: Once again, you run at the head of your warriors, the weight of your father's axe in your hand.\n\nYou wake with the war-cry on your lips…
Bulgarian: Once again, you run at the head of your warriors, the weight of your father's axe in your hand.\n\nYou wake with the war-cry on your lips…
Macedonian: Once again, you run at the head of your warriors, the weight of your father's axe in your hand.\n\nYou wake with the war-cry on your lips…
Finnish: Once again, you run at the head of your warriors, the weight of your father's axe in your hand.\n\nYou wake with the war-cry on your lips…
Danish: Once again, you run at the head of your warriors, the weight of your father's axe in your hand.\n\nYou wake with the war-cry on your lips…
Icelandic: Once again, you run at the head of your warriors, the weight of your father's axe in your hand.\n\nYou wake with the war-cry on your lips…
Turkish: Bir kez daha, elinde babanın baltasının ağırlığını hissederek savaşçılarına önderlik ediyorsun.\n\nDudaklarındaki savaş narasıyla uyanıyorsun…
Lithuanian: Once again, you run at the head of your warriors, the weight of your father's axe in your hand.\n\nYou wake with the war-cry on your lips…
Czech: Once again, you run at the head of your warriors, the weight of your father's axe in your hand.\n\nYou wake with the war-cry on your lips…
Hungarian: Ismét a harcosaid élén rohansz, apád baltájának súlyát érezve a markodban.\n\nAjkaidon a harci kiáltás hangjával ébredsz...
Slovak: Once again, you run at the head of your warriors, the weight of your father's axe in your hand.\n\nYou wake with the war-cry on your lips…
Polish: Znów przewodzisz swoim wojownikom, dzierżysz w dłoni ciężki topór ojca\n\nBudzisz się z okrzykiem wojennym na ustach…
Dutch: Je loopt wederom aan het hoofd van je krijgers, je vaders bijl in je hand; een gewichtig wapen.\n\nMet een oorlogskreet op je lippen ontwaak je...
Portuguese: Once again, you run at the head of your warriors, the weight of your father's axe in your hand.\n\nYou wake with the war-cry on your lips…
Portuguese_Brazilian: Uma vez mais, você corre na frente de seus guerreiros, o peso do machado de seu pai em suas mãos.\n\nVocê acorda com o grito de guerra em seus lábios…
Chinese: 你又梦到了你踏着战士们的头颅前进，手里握着你父亲的战斧。 \n\n你在战争的呐喊中醒来...
Japanese: また、父の斧を手にして戦士たちを率いていた。 \n\n目覚めた時、口にはときの声の名残が残っていた...
Korean: 다시한번 당신은 전사들을 이끌고 있으며 당신의 손에는 아버지가 물려주신 도끼의 무게감이 느껴집니다. \n\n당신의 입가에 맺힌 전쟁의 함성과 함께 잠에서 깨어납니다. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 你又夢到了你踏著戰士們的頭顱前進，手裡握著你父親的戰斧。 \n\n你在戰爭的吶喊中醒來...

English: In your dream, you sit beside a fire in a great hall, surrounded by the chatter of familiar voices.\n\nTheir faces blur like smoke and their names slip your mind, but the warmth of their memory lingers…
Swedish: I din dröm sitter du vid elden i en stor hall, med bekanta rösters sorl runtom dig.\n\nDeras ansikten är suddiga som rök, och deras namn undgår dig, men värmen från deras minnen kvarstår…
French: Dans votre rêve, vous vous asseyez près d'un feu dans une grande salle, au milieu de voix familières.\n\nLeurs visages se brouillent et leurs noms vous échappent, mais leur souvenir demeure avec tendresse...
Italian: In your dream, you sit beside a fire in a great hall, surrounded by the chatter of familiar voices.\n\nTheir faces blur like smoke and their names slip your mind, but the warmth of their memory lingers…
German: In deinem Traum sitzt du neben einem Feuer in einer großen Halle und du bist von den Gesprächen bekannter Stimmen umgeben.\n\nObwohl ihre Gesichter verschwommen sind wie Rauch und du ihre Namen vergessen hast, spürst du die Wärme ihrer Erinnerungen …
Spanish: En el sueño, te sientas junto a una fogata en un gran salón. Oyes voces conocidas por todas partes.\n\nLos rostros están cubiertos por una neblina y no consigues recordar sus nombres, pero la calidez de los recuerdos sigue ahí...
Russian: Во сне вы сидите у огня в большом зале, вас окружает болтовня знакомых голосов.\n\nЛица расплываются, как дым, и имена ускользают из памяти, но тепло воспоминаний остается...
Romanian: In your dream, you sit beside a fire in a great hall, surrounded by the chatter of familiar voices.\n\nTheir faces blur like smoke and their names slip your mind, but the warmth of their memory lingers…
Bulgarian: In your dream, you sit beside a fire in a great hall, surrounded by the chatter of familiar voices.\n\nTheir faces blur like smoke and their names slip your mind, but the warmth of their memory lingers…
Macedonian: In your dream, you sit beside a fire in a great hall, surrounded by the chatter of familiar voices.\n\nTheir faces blur like smoke and their names slip your mind, but the warmth of their memory lingers…
Finnish: In your dream, you sit beside a fire in a great hall, surrounded by the chatter of familiar voices.\n\nTheir faces blur like smoke and their names slip your mind, but the warmth of their memory lingers…
Danish: In your dream, you sit beside a fire in a great hall, surrounded by the chatter of familiar voices.\n\nTheir faces blur like smoke and their names slip your mind, but the warmth of their memory lingers…
Icelandic: In your dream, you sit beside a fire in a great hall, surrounded by the chatter of familiar voices.\n\nTheir faces blur like smoke and their names slip your mind, but the warmth of their memory lingers…
Turkish: Rüyanda, büyük bir salondaki ateşin yanı başında oturuyor ve çevrendeki tanıdık sesleri işitiyorsun.\n\nSimaları sis misali bulanıklaşıyor ve isimleri hatırandan siliniyor ancak anılarına dair duyduğun o sıcaklık kalmaya devam ediyor…
Lithuanian: In your dream, you sit beside a fire in a great hall, surrounded by the chatter of familiar voices.\n\nTheir faces blur like smoke and their names slip your mind, but the warmth of their memory lingers…
Czech: In your dream, you sit beside a fire in a great hall, surrounded by the chatter of familiar voices.\n\nTheir faces blur like smoke and their names slip your mind, but the warmth of their memory lingers…
Hungarian: Álmodban egy hatalmas teremben, egy tűz mellett ülsz, és ismerős hangok fecsegése vesz körül.\n\nAz arcukat homály fedi, akár a füst, a nevük pedig elveszik az elmédben, de emlékeik melege megmarad...
Slovak: In your dream, you sit beside a fire in a great hall, surrounded by the chatter of familiar voices.\n\nTheir faces blur like smoke and their names slip your mind, but the warmth of their memory lingers…
Polish: We śnie siedzisz obok ognia w wielkiej komnacie, otoczony gwarem znajomych głosów.\n\nIch twarze rozmazują się jak dym, a imiona ulatują z głowy, lecz ciepło ich pamięci pozostaje…
Dutch: In je droom zit je naast een vuur in een grote hal, omgeven door bekende stemmen.\n\nHun gezichten vervagen als rook, hun namen blijven je ontgaan, maar de warmte van hun herinnering blijft...
Portuguese: In your dream, you sit beside a fire in a great hall, surrounded by the chatter of familiar voices.\n\nTheir faces blur like smoke and their names slip your mind, but the warmth of their memory lingers…
Portuguese_Brazilian: Em seu sonho, você se senta ao lado de uma lareira em um grande salão, o som de vozes familiares ecoando em seus ouvidos.\n\nOs rostos borram feito fumaça e os nomes escapam de sua mente, mas o calor das memórias permanece…
Chinese: 在你的梦里，你坐在一座灯火通明的宫殿里，周围都是熟悉的人在笑谈。 \n\n但是你却看不清他们模糊的脸，你已经不记得他们的名字，但是那温暖的氛围却久久萦绕心怀...
Japanese: 夢の中で、大広間にたかれた火のそばに座っていた。 まわりでは懐かしい声がおしゃべりをしている。 \n\n彼らの顔は煙のようにぼやけ、彼らの名前は思い出せないが、その温かい思い出だけが残っている...
Korean: 꿈에서, 익숙한 목소리들이 떠드는 소리에 둘러싸인 채로 위대한 전당의 불가에 앉아 있습니다. \n\n그들의 얼굴은 연기처럼 희미하고 이름들은 그대의 머릿속을 스쳐 지나가지만 그들에 대한 따스한 기억은 여전히 남아있습니다. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 在你的夢裡，你坐在一座燈火通明的宮殿裡，周圍都是熟悉的人在笑談。 \n\n但是你卻看不清他們模糊的臉，你已經不記得他們的名字，但是那溫暖的氛圍卻久久縈繞心懷...

English: You stand at the prow of a leaping ship, the salt spray before you and the joyful shriek of gulls above.\n\nFolded within a dream, you remember what it was like to be alive in the land of your birth.
Swedish: Du står i fören av ett dansande skepp, havsskummet sprutar, och fiskmåsarna skriker ovan dig.\n\nI drömmens famn minns du hur det kändes att leva.
French: Vous vous tenez à la proue d'un navire filant sur le courant, les embruns vous aspergent le visage et les cris enjoués des mouettes résonnent au-dessus de vous.\n\nCe rêve vous rappelle quel goût avait votre vie sur votre terre natale.
Italian: You stand at the prow of a leaping ship, the salt spray before you and the joyful shriek of gulls above.\n\nFolded within a dream, you remember what it was like to be alive in the land of your birth.
German: Du stehst am Bug eines über die Wellen gleitenden Schiffes. Vor dir die Salzgischt und über dir das freudige Geschrei der Möwen.\n\nIm Innern eines Traumes erinnert du dich, wie du dich während deines Lebens in deinem Heimatland fühltest.
Spanish: Estás en la proa de un barco, con el salitre ante ti y los graznidos de las gaviotas que provienen del cielo.\n\nGracias al sueño, recuerdas lo que era seguir con vida en tu tierra natal.
Russian: Вы стоите на корме плывущего корабля, соленые брызги летят вам в лицо, а сверху радостно кричат чайки.\n\nПогрузившись в сон, вы вспоминаете, какова была жизнь в месте, где вы родились.
Romanian: You stand at the prow of a leaping ship, the salt spray before you and the joyful shriek of gulls above.\n\nFolded within a dream, you remember what it was like to be alive in the land of your birth.
Bulgarian: You stand at the prow of a leaping ship, the salt spray before you and the joyful shriek of gulls above.\n\nFolded within a dream, you remember what it was like to be alive in the land of your birth.
Macedonian: You stand at the prow of a leaping ship, the salt spray before you and the joyful shriek of gulls above.\n\nFolded within a dream, you remember what it was like to be alive in the land of your birth.
Finnish: You stand at the prow of a leaping ship, the salt spray before you and the joyful shriek of gulls above.\n\nFolded within a dream, you remember what it was like to be alive in the land of your birth.
Danish: You stand at the prow of a leaping ship, the salt spray before you and the joyful shriek of gulls above.\n\nFolded within a dream, you remember what it was like to be alive in the land of your birth.
Icelandic: You stand at the prow of a leaping ship, the salt spray before you and the joyful shriek of gulls above.\n\nFolded within a dream, you remember what it was like to be alive in the land of your birth.
Turkish: Suları yararak ilerleyen bir geminin baş kısmında duruyorsun ve tuzlu su hemen önünde püskürürken, tepende martılar neşeyle ötüyor.\n\nBu rüya sana, memleketindeyken hayatta olmanın nasıl bir his olduğunu hatırlatıyor.
Lithuanian: You stand at the prow of a leaping ship, the salt spray before you and the joyful shriek of gulls above.\n\nFolded within a dream, you remember what it was like to be alive in the land of your birth.
Czech: You stand at the prow of a leaping ship, the salt spray before you and the joyful shriek of gulls above.\n\nFolded within a dream, you remember what it was like to be alive in the land of your birth.
Hungarian: Egy szökellő hajó szélén állsz, előtted sós permettel, feletted pedig a sirályok vidám sikoltozásával.\n\nEgy álomban bezárva visszaemlékszel, milyen volt a szülőföldeden élni.
Slovak: You stand at the prow of a leaping ship, the salt spray before you and the joyful shriek of gulls above.\n\nFolded within a dream, you remember what it was like to be alive in the land of your birth.
Polish: Stoisz na dziobie podskakującego na falach statku, w ustach czujesz słony smak morskiej bryzy, słyszysz radosny wrzask mew unoszących się w powietrzu.\n\nPogrążony we śnie, pamiętasz, jak to było żyć w kraju ojczystym.
Dutch: Je staat op de boeg van een varend schip, en de zoute zee strekt zich voor je uit, terwijl de meeuwen die boven je vliegen vrolijk krijsen.\n\nVerwikkeld in je droom herinner je je hoe het was om te leven in je geboorteland.
Portuguese: You stand at the prow of a leaping ship, the salt spray before you and the joyful shriek of gulls above.\n\nFolded within a dream, you remember what it was like to be alive in the land of your birth.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você está na proa de um navio, a névoa salina à sua frente e o grito alegre das gaivotas acima.\n\nEm sonho, você recorda de como era viver na terra onde nasceu.
Chinese: 你站在船头，波涛汹涌，咸湿的海风迎面而来，海鸥在欢快地鸣叫。 \n\n在梦里，你回忆起了在你的故乡活着的感觉。
Japanese: 飛ぶように進む船の舳先に立っている。 前には海のしぶきがあり、頭上ではカモメが楽しげに鳴いている。 \n\n夢の中に包まれながら、故郷の地で生きる感触を思い出す。
Korean: 당신은 힘차게 나아가는 배의 뱃머리에 서 있으며, 소금이 그대 앞에 흩뿌려지고 갈매기가 머리 위에서 기쁜 듯이 울고 있습니다. \n\n꿈속에 가라앉아, 고향땅에서 살아있었던 느낌이 어떠했는지 기억해 냅니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 你站在船頭，波濤洶湧，鹹濕的海風迎面而來，海鷗在歡快地鳴叫。 \n\n在夢裡，你回憶起了在你的故鄉活著的感覺。

English: You dream of a great tree reaching out through the night. One half of its branches crackle with flames, the others are green with leaves.
Swedish: Du drömmer om ett väldigt träd som sträcker sig genom natten. Hälften av dess grenar härjas av eld och flammor, men den andra halvan är täckt av löv.
French: Vous rêvez d'un grand arbre qui s'étend dans la nuit. Des flammes font craquer la moitié de ses branches, tandis que l'autre moitié est couverte de feuilles vertes.
Italian: You dream of a great tree reaching out through the night. One half of its branches crackle with flames, the others are green with leaves.
German: Du träumst von einem großen Baum, der die Nacht durchbricht und gen Himmel wächst. Die eine Hälfte seiner Äste steht in Flammen, die andere besitzt grüne Blätter.
Spanish: Sueñas con un árbol que se extiende a través de la mismísima noche. La mitad de las ramas está ardiendo, mientras que la otra mitad está sana y tiene hojas esmeralda.
Russian: Вам снится огромное дерево, простирающееся сквозь ночь. Одна половина его ветвей объята пламенем, другая покрыта зелеными листьями.
Romanian: You dream of a great tree reaching out through the night. One half of its branches crackle with flames, the others are green with leaves.
Bulgarian: You dream of a great tree reaching out through the night. One half of its branches crackle with flames, the others are green with leaves.
Macedonian: You dream of a great tree reaching out through the night. One half of its branches crackle with flames, the others are green with leaves.
Finnish: You dream of a great tree reaching out through the night. One half of its branches crackle with flames, the others are green with leaves.
Danish: You dream of a great tree reaching out through the night. One half of its branches crackle with flames, the others are green with leaves.
Icelandic: You dream of a great tree reaching out through the night. One half of its branches crackle with flames, the others are green with leaves.
Turkish: Rüyanda gece boyunca uzanan dev bir ağacı görüyorsun. Dallarının bir kısmı ateşler için çatırdarken, diğer yarısı da yemyeşil yaprakla bürülü bir hâlde.
Lithuanian: You dream of a great tree reaching out through the night. One half of its branches crackle with flames, the others are green with leaves.
Czech: You dream of a great tree reaching out through the night. One half of its branches crackle with flames, the others are green with leaves.
Hungarian: Egy hatalmas fáról álmodsz, amely kinyúlik az éjszakába. Ágainak egyik fele lángoktól pattog, a másikat zöld levelek borítják.
Slovak: You dream of a great tree reaching out through the night. One half of its branches crackle with flames, the others are green with leaves.
Polish: Śnisz o wielkim drzewie wyłaniającym się w nocy. Jedna połowa gałęzi trzeszczy w płomieniach, druga jest pełna zielonych liści.
Dutch: Je droomt van een grote boom die door de nacht reikt. De ene helft van zijn takken branden, de andere helft is bedekt met groene bladeren.
Portuguese: You dream of a great tree reaching out through the night. One half of its branches crackle with flames, the others are green with leaves.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você sonha com uma grande árvore estendendo-se durante a noite. Metade dos galhos crepita com as chamas, os outros estão verdes e cheios de folhas.
Chinese: 你梦到了一颗参天大树在黑夜里向你走来。 \n它一半已经被火烧裂，而另一半却生机盎然。
Japanese: 夜を突き抜けて伸びる大きな木の夢を見た。 その枝々の半数は音を立てて燃え、あとの半数は緑の葉を茂らせている。
Korean: 당신은 밤중에 위대한 나무가 다가오는 꿈을 꾸었습니다. 나무의 절반은 화염에 휩싸여 타닥거리고, 나머지는 녹색 잎이 무성합니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 你夢到了一顆參天大樹在黑夜裡向你走來。 \n它一半已經被火燒裂，而另一半卻生機盎然。

English: In a chamber hung with golden drapes, you kneel before the throne of a veiled king. "Sleep is but a mask," he tells you, lifting the veil slowly.\n\nYou wake screaming.
Swedish:
I en gulddräperad kammare knäböjer du framför en beslöjad konung.
"Sömn är blott en mask," berättar han, och lyfter slöjan.

Du vaknar skrikandes.
French: Dans une chambre aux rideaux dorés, vous vous agenouillez devant un trône où se tient un roi voilé. « Le sommeil n'est qu'un masque, » vous dit-il, soulevant lentement son voile.\n\nVous vous réveillez en hurlant.
Italian: In a chamber hung with golden drapes, you kneel before the throne of a veiled king. "Sleep is but a mask," he tells you, lifting the veil slowly.\n\nYou wake screaming.
German: In einer Kammer mit goldenen Vorhängen kniest du vor dem Thron des verschleierten Königs nieder. "Der Schlaf ist nur eine Maske", spricht er zu dir, bevor er langsam den Schleier hebt.\n\nDu wachst schreiend auf.
Spanish: Te arrodillas ante el trono de un rey cubierto por un velo en una sala adornada con cortinas doradas. "El sueño no es más que una máscara", te dice mientras levanta el velo con parsimonia.\n\nTe despiertas con un alarido en la garganta.
Russian: В зале с золоченой драпировкой вы преклоняете колени перед троном короля. «Сон — это всего лишь маска», — говорит он вам, медленно приподнимая вуаль.\n\nВы просыпаетесь с криком.
Romanian: In a chamber hung with golden drapes, you kneel before the throne of a veiled king. "Sleep is but a mask," he tells you, lifting the veil slowly.\n\nYou wake screaming.
Bulgarian: In a chamber hung with golden drapes, you kneel before the throne of a veiled king. "Sleep is but a mask," he tells you, lifting the veil slowly.\n\nYou wake screaming.
Macedonian: In a chamber hung with golden drapes, you kneel before the throne of a veiled king. "Sleep is but a mask," he tells you, lifting the veil slowly.\n\nYou wake screaming.
Finnish: In a chamber hung with golden drapes, you kneel before the throne of a veiled king. "Sleep is but a mask," he tells you, lifting the veil slowly.\n\nYou wake screaming.
Danish: In a chamber hung with golden drapes, you kneel before the throne of a veiled king. "Sleep is but a mask," he tells you, lifting the veil slowly.\n\nYou wake screaming.
Icelandic: In a chamber hung with golden drapes, you kneel before the throne of a veiled king. "Sleep is but a mask," he tells you, lifting the veil slowly.\n\nYou wake screaming.
Turkish: Altın perdelerle dolu bir odadasın ve yüzü örtülü bir kralın önünde diz çöküyorsun. "Uyku yalnızca bir maskedir", dedikten sonra örtüyü yavaşça kaldırıyor.\n\nÇığlık çığlığa uyanıyorsun.
Lithuanian: In a chamber hung with golden drapes, you kneel before the throne of a veiled king. "Sleep is but a mask," he tells you, lifting the veil slowly.\n\nYou wake screaming.
Czech: In a chamber hung with golden drapes, you kneel before the throne of a veiled king. "Sleep is but a mask," he tells you, lifting the veil slowly.\n\nYou wake screaming.
Hungarian: Aranyfüggönyökkel teleaggatott szobában egy fátyolos király trónja előtt térdelsz. Az alvás csupán egy álarc - szól hozzád, és lassan felemeli a fátylat.\n\nSikoltozva ébredsz.
Slovak: In a chamber hung with golden drapes, you kneel before the throne of a veiled king. "Sleep is but a mask," he tells you, lifting the veil slowly.\n\nYou wake screaming.
Polish: W komnacie obwieszonej złotymi zasłonami klękasz przed tronem króla z zakrytą twarzą. „Sen to tylko maska” – przemawia do ciebie, powoli unosząc zasłonę.\n\nBudzisz się z krzykiem.
Dutch: In een kamer vol gouden wandtapijten kniel je voor de troon van een gesluierde koning. "Slaap is slechts een masker," zegt hij, en tilt langzaam zijn sluier op.\n\nSchreeuwend ontwaak je.
Portuguese: In a chamber hung with golden drapes, you kneel before the throne of a veiled king. "Sleep is but a mask," he tells you, lifting the veil slowly.\n\nYou wake screaming.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Em uma câmara com cortinas douradas, você se ajoelha diante do trono, a face do rei encoberta por um véu. "O sono é apenas uma máscara", diz ele, erguendo o véu lentamente.\n\nVocê acorda gritando.
Chinese: 在一个挂着金色窗帘的大厅里，你跪在一个蒙着面的国王座前。 “长眠不过只是我的面具。 ”他说道，并缓缓地掀开了他的面纱。 \n\n你在尖叫中醒来。
Japanese: 黄金のとばりが降りている部屋の中で、ベールに覆われた王の玉座の前にひざまずいている。 「眠りは仮面に過ぎぬ」と彼はいい、ベールをゆっくりと持ち上げる。 \n\n悲鳴をあげて目を覚ます。
Korean: 황금 커튼이 달린 방 안에서, 베일에 가려진 왕의 옥좌 앞에 무릎을 꿇고 있습니다. 그는 "잠은 가면일 뿐"이라며 베일을 천천히 들어 올립니다. \n\n비명을 지르며 잠에서 깨어납니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 在一個掛著金色窗簾的大廳裡，你跪在一個蒙著面的國王座前。 “長眠不過只是我的面具。 ”他說道，並緩緩地掀開了他的面紗。 \n\n你在尖叫中醒來。

Japanese: フューリングバーサーカー
既に接続されています
バージョンが異なります
パスワードが違います

English:
Wanderer, look to your feet
That tread upon our tomb
One thousand bones without their meat
Will drag you to your doom
Swedish:
Vandrare, vänd blicken nedåt
Du som träder på vår grav
Ett tusen och ett kala ben
Drager dig till undergången
French:
Voyageur, regardez donc vos pieds
Qui foulent notre lieu de repos
Un millier d'os décharnés
Vous tireront jusqu'à votre tombeau
Italian:
Wanderer, look to your feet
That tread upon our tomb
One thousand bones without their meat
Will drag you to your doom
German:
Wanderer schau, schau zu deinen Füßen
Schau, was du tust, du betrittst unser Grab
Hier liegen unsere Knochen, du wirst es büßen
Wir ziehen dich herunter, du brauchst einen Sarg
Spanish:
Caminante, mira hacia tus pies
Que pisotean nuestra tumba
Miles de huesos sin piel
Te llevarán a la ruina
Russian:
Странник, под ноги смотри,
На могилу нашу не ступай,
Тысяча костей без мяса мы,
Жизнь свою ты нам отдай.
Romanian:
Wanderer, look to your feet
That tread upon our tomb
One thousand bones without their meat
Will drag you to your doom
Bulgarian:
Wanderer, look to your feet
That tread upon our tomb
One thousand bones without their meat
Will drag you to your doom
Macedonian:
Wanderer, look to your feet
That tread upon our tomb
One thousand bones without their meat
Will drag you to your doom

Wanderer, look to your feet
That tread upon our tomb
One thousand bones without their meat

Danish:
Wanderer, look to your feet
That tread upon our tomb
One thousand bones without their meat
Will drag you to your doom
Icelandic:
Wanderer, look to your feet
That tread upon our tomb
One thousand bones without their meat
Will drag you to your doom
Turkish:
Ey gezgin, ayaklarına bak
Bak ve mezarımıza bastığını gör
Burada etinden sıyrılmış bin kemik yatar
Sonun pek bir yakındır
Lithuanian:
Wanderer, look to your feet
That tread upon our tomb
One thousand bones without their meat
Will drag you to your doom
Czech:
Wanderer, look to your feet
That tread upon our tomb
One thousand bones without their meat
Will drag you to your doom
Hungarian:
Vándor, nézz a lábad elé,
amely a sírunkat tapossa!
Ezernyi csont, hús nélkül
húz majd le téged a sírba.
Slovak:
Wanderer, look to your feet
That tread upon our tomb
One thousand bones without their meat
Will drag you to your doom
Polish:
Wędrowcze, spójrz na swe stopy
Stąpające po grobie
Tysiąc kości bez mięsa
To twej śmierci tropy
Dutch:
Zwerver, kijk toch naar benee
Je staat hier op ons graf
Naar onder de grond slepen we je mee
en naar je doem, als straf
Portuguese:
Wanderer, look to your feet
That tread upon our tomb
One thousand bones without their meat
Will drag you to your doom
Portuguese_Brazilian:
Vide seus pés, viajante
Em nossos túmulos pisando
Mil ossos sem carne
Seu fim virá rastejando
Chinese:
游荡者，看看你的脚下吧
那踏在我们坟墓上的脚步
成千上万的没有肉体的骨架
它们会带你坠入深渊
Japanese:
さすらい人よ、足元を見よ
汝が歩むは我らが墓の上
肉を失いし千の骨が
汝を破滅に導くであろう
Korean:
방랑자여, 발 밑을 조심하라
우리의 무덤을 밟은 자는
천 개의 살점 없는 뼈들이 
파멸로 이끌고 갈지어니
Chinese_Traditional:
遊蕩者，看看你的腳下吧
那踏在我們墳墓上的腳步
成千上萬的沒有肉體的骨架
它們會帶你墜入深淵

English:
His antlers are branches of iron
They crack the rocks and bring down mountains
His hooves are the sound of thunder
His voice a howling gale
Swedish:
Hans grenade horn, med järn spetsade
De bräcker sten och fäller berg
Hans hovslag faller som åska
Hans röst en ylande kuling
French:
Ses bois sont des branches de fer
Ils fendent la montagne et fissurent les rochers
Ses sabots résonnent comme le tonnerre
Sa voix est une tornade déchaînée
Italian:
His antlers are branches of iron
They crack the rocks and bring down mountains
His hooves are the sound of thunder
His voice a howling gale
German:
Sein Geweih aus Eisen, ist kein Witz
Es zerschmettert alles: Berg, Baum und Kind
Seine Hufe klingen, wie ein mächtiger Blitz
Seine Stimmt tönt wie der mächtige Wind
Spanish:
Tiene una cornamenta de astas de hierro
Con ellas rompe rocas y montañas sin esfuerzo
Sus pezuñas cargan con el sonido del rayo
Su voz es un vendaval solano
Russian:
Его рога словно ветви железа:
Они камни и горы крушат.
Копыта его словно гром.
Голос его — воющий шторм.

His antlers are branches of iron
They crack the rocks and bring down mountains
His hooves are the sound of thunder
His voice a howling gale

Boynuzları demirden birer dal
Kayaları deler ve dağları devirir
Toynakları gök misali gürler
Sesi bora misali eser

His antlers are branches of iron

Agancsai vaságak,
Sziklákat törnek, hegyeket döntenek.
Patái mennydörgés,
Hangja üvöltő szelek.
Slovak:
His antlers are branches of iron
They crack the rocks and bring down mountains
His hooves are the sound of thunder
His voice a howling gale
Polish:
Jego poroże stanowią żelazne gałęzie
Rozbijają skały i powalają góry
Jego kopyta wydają dźwięki grzmotu
Jego głos brzmi jak wyjąca wichura
Dutch:
Een gewei gemaakt van ijzer
Brengt berg en rots ten val
Hoeven als een donderslag
Zijn stem een stormgeschal
Portuguese:
His antlers are branches of iron
They crack the rocks and bring down mountains
His hooves are the sound of thunder
His voice a howling gale
Portuguese_Brazilian:
Sua galhada são ramos de ferro
E quebra rochas e derruba montanhas
Seus cascos são o som de um trovão
Sua voz um vendaval uivante
Chinese:
他的犄角是钢铁一般的存在
可以开山劈石
他的蹄声如雷贯耳
他的声音尖利沙哑
Japanese:
彼の角は鉄の枝
岩を砕き山を崩す
彼の蹄は雷の轟き
彼の声は吠える大風
Korean:
그의 뿔은 쇠로 이루어져 있으며
바위를 부수고 산을 무너뜨린다. 
발굽은 천둥 소리를 내며
목소리는 질풍처럼 울부 짖는다.
Chinese_Traditional:
他的犄角是鋼鐵一般的存在
可以開山劈石
他的蹄聲如雷貫耳
他的聲音尖利沙啞

English:
Black wings across the moon and sun
Down from the mountain our mother comes
Her weeping tears will fall like rain
Her voice will call us home again
Swedish:
Svarta vingar över sol och måne
Från bergen kommer vår moder
Hennes tårar faller likt regn
Hennes röst kallar oss åter hem
French:
Occultant soleil et lune de ses ailes noires
Venue de la montagne, notre mère approche
Ses larmes tombent comme une pluie sans espoir
Sa voix nous appelle et résonne contre la roche
Italian:
Black wings across the moon and sun
Down from the mountain our mother comes
Her weeping tears will fall like rain
Her voice will call us home again
German:
Schwarze Flügel vom Mond bis zur Sonne
Schwebt unsere Mutter vom Gebirge hernieder
Ihre weinenden Tränen fallen wie Regen
Ihr Stimme ruft uns erneut Heim
Spanish:
Alas negras que cubren el sol y la luna
Desciende de la montaña nuestra madre, que solo es una
Sus lágrimas caen como el llover
Su voz nos dirá que debemos volver
Russian:
Солнце с луною крылами затмит
Наша матерь, спускаясь с высокой горы,
Ливнем она свои слезы прольет,
Голос ее нас домой отведет.

Black wings across the moon and sun
Down from the mountain our mother comes
Her weeping tears will fall like rain
Her voice will call us home again

Down from the mountain our mother comes
Her weeping tears will fall like rain

Black wings across the moon and sun

Her weeping tears will fall like rain

Ay ve güneşe uzanan kara kanatlar
Annemiz dağdan aşağıya süzülür
Gözündeki yaşlar yağmur gibi yağar
Sesi bizi tekrar eve çağırır

Black wings across the moon and sun
Down from the mountain our mother comes
Her weeping tears will fall like rain
Her voice will call us home again
Czech:
Black wings across the moon and sun
Down from the mountain our mother comes
Her weeping tears will fall like rain
Her voice will call us home again
Hungarian:
Fekete szárnyak a Hold és Nap előtt,
anyánk a hegyről lefelé tart.
Könnyei esőként fognak záporozni,
hangja újra hazahív mindannyiunkat.
Slovak:
Black wings across the moon and sun
Down from the mountain our mother comes
Her weeping tears will fall like rain
Her voice will call us home again
Polish:
Księżyc i słońce otacza czarnoopióry
Nasza matka spada z góry
Jak deszcz popłyną łzy uronione
Jej głos przywoła nas znów do domu
Dutch:
Zwarte vleugels over zon en maan
Daar komt onze moeder aan
Ziedaar, ze huilt haar tranendal
En roept ons naar huis van overal
Portuguese:
Black wings across the moon and sun
Down from the mountain our mother comes
Her weeping tears will fall like rain
Her voice will call us home again
Portuguese_Brazilian:
Asas negras sobre sol e lua danças
Da montanha, os pés da mãe se lançam
Seu choro como triste chuva a desabar
Vem nos chamando de volta ao lar
Chinese:
黑色的翅膀遮住了太阳和月亮
盘旋在山峰上的是龙之母
她的眼泪会化成雨
她的哀鸣在召唤我们回家
Japanese:
月と日をわたる黒い翼
山を下り我らが母来たる
母の涙は雨のごとし
母の声は再び我らを家へと呼ぶ
Korean:
달과 태양을 가로지르는 검은 날개
산에서 내려와 우리의 어머니가 오셨네. 
그녀의 울음소리는 비처럼 쏟아지며
그녀의 목소리는 우리를 다시 집으로 부를지어니
Chinese_Traditional:
黑色的翅膀遮住了太陽和月亮
槽旋在山峰上的是龍之母
她的眼淚會化成雨
她的哀鳴在召喚我們回家

English:
First of the Forest, King-in-the-Wood
Lord over those who dwell at his feet
His roots will grow where cities once stood
Their blood his wine, their flesh his meat
Swedish:
Först i skogen, Trädens Konung
Herre över alla de som dväljs vid hans fötter
Hans rötter växer där städer en gång stod
Deras blod hans vin, deras kött hans mål
French:
Seigneur de ceux qui rampent à ses pieds
Roi de la forêt, Premier sylvain
Ses racines s'étendront à la place des cités
Leur chair est sa viande, leur sang est son vin
Italian:
First of the Forest, King-in-the-Wood
Lord over those who dwell at his feet
His roots will grow where cities once stood
Their blood his wine, their flesh his meat
German:
Ich bin König, bin Erster im Wald
Ich beherrsche die Tiere, ich kenn' ihre Pein
Meine Wurzeln wuchern, bei Städten sehr alt
Ihre Fleisch ist mein Mahl, ihr Blut ist mein Wein
Spanish:
Primigenio del bosque, rey de las arboladas
Gobierna a todos los que se encuentran bajo sus pisadas
Sus raíces llegarán hasta los lugares en los que antaño había ciudades
Su sangre será su vino, y sus cuerpos su carne
Russian:
Царь лесной, что леса самого древней,
Повелитель тех, кто прозябает у его ступней.
Его корни прорастут, где были раньше города,
Кровь их для него вино, а плоть — еда.
Romanian:
First of the Forest, King-in-the-Wood
Lord over those who dwell at his feet
His roots will grow where cities once stood
Their blood his wine, their flesh his meat
Bulgarian:
First of the Forest, King-in-the-Wood
Lord over those who dwell at his feet
His roots will grow where cities once stood
Their blood his wine, their flesh his meat

Lord over those who dwell at his feet
His roots will grow where cities once stood
Their blood his wine, their flesh his meat

First of the Forest, King-in-the-Wood
Lord over those who dwell at his feet
His roots will grow where cities once stood
Their blood his wine, their flesh his meat

First of the Forest, King-in-the-Wood
Lord over those who dwell at his feet
His roots will grow where cities once stood
Their blood his wine, their flesh his meat
Icelandic:
First of the Forest, King-in-the-Wood
Lord over those who dwell at his feet
His roots will grow where cities once stood
Their blood his wine, their flesh his meat
Turkish:
Ormanın İlki, Korunun Kralı
Dibine sinenleri koruyup kollar
Evvel şehirlerin dikildiği yerde büyür kökleri
Kanları onun şarabı, etleri onun yemeğidir
Lithuanian:
First of the Forest, King-in-the-Wood
Lord over those who dwell at his feet
His roots will grow where cities once stood
Their blood his wine, their flesh his meat
Czech:
First of the Forest, King-in-the-Wood
Lord over those who dwell at his feet
His roots will grow where cities once stood
Their blood his wine, their flesh his meat
Hungarian:
Első az erdőben, a fák királya,
a lábánál letelepedők ura.
Gyökerei ott nőnek, ahol városok álltak,
vérük az ő bora, húsuk az ő húsa.
Slovak:
First of the Forest, King-in-the-Wood
Lord over those who dwell at his feet
His roots will grow where cities once stood
Their blood his wine, their flesh his meat
Polish:
Pierwszy z Lasu, Królu Lasu
Spraw, by nad poddanymi panowanie trwało
Korzenie wyrosną tam, gdzie stały miasta zawczasu
Ich krew jego winem, jego mięsem ich ciało
Dutch:
Heerser van het bos, koning van het woud
Heer voor al zijn protegees
Wortels groeiend waar steden waren
Drinkt hij hun bloed, en eet hun vlees
Portuguese:
First of the Forest, King-in-the-Wood
Lord over those who dwell at his feet
His roots will grow where cities once stood
Their blood his wine, their flesh his meat
Portuguese_Brazilian:
Primeiro da Floresta, Rei da Floresta
Soberano daqueles que habitam seu sustento
Raízes sobre uma cidade que resta
Sangue é seu vinho, carne é seu alimento
Chinese:
森之最，林中王
居住在这里的人都臣服在他脚下
他在曾经繁荣的土地上肆意生长
鲜血是他的红酒，血肉是他的美食。
Japanese:
林の初め、森の王
足元の住人たちを統べる者
彼の根はかつて都市であった場所に伸びる
彼らの血が彼の酒、彼らの肉が彼の糧
Korean:
숲의 첫 번째, 숲의 왕
발 앞에 있는 자들을 다스리는 지도자
그의 뿌리는 한때 도시들이 들어섰던 자리에 자라날 것이며
그들의 피는 그의 와인이며 그들의 살점은 그의 고기일지니
Chinese_Traditional:
森之最，林中王
居住在這裡的人都臣服在他腳下
他在曾經繁榮的土地上肆意生長
鮮血是他的紅酒，血肉是他的美食。

English:
Long ages past, he wore a crown
Beneath a blood-red sky
Now naught is left of all he was
But his spirit cannot die
Swedish:
Under en blodröd himmel
För eoner sedan bar han kronan
Nu finns honom ingenting kvar
Men hans ande kan ej dö
French:
Il y a bien longtemps, il portait couronne
Sous un ciel rouge sang
Il n'est plus que l'ombre de sa personne
Mais son esprit n'a rien de mourant
Italian:
Long ages past, he wore a crown
Beneath a blood-red sky
Now naught is left of all he was
But his spirit cannot die
German:
Vor vielen, vielen Jahren trug er eine Krone
Der Himmel war rot, man konnte es seh'n
Heut' ist er nichts, ist Asche, ist Staub
Doch sein Geist wird niemals vergeh'n
Spanish:
Hace eones, solía llevar una corona
Bajo un cielo teñido de sangre roja
Ahora no queda nadie de quien antaño fue
Y su espíritu no puede perecer
Russian:
Давным-давно корону он носил
Под небом красным, словно кровь.
Теперь он превратился в дым,
Но дух его не ждет покой.
Romanian:
Long ages past, he wore a crown
Beneath a blood-red sky
Now naught is left of all he was
But his spirit cannot die
Bulgarian:
Long ages past, he wore a crown
Beneath a blood-red sky
Now naught is left of all he was
But his spirit cannot die
Macedonian:
Long ages past, he wore a crown
Beneath a blood-red sky
Now naught is left of all he was
But his spirit cannot die
Finnish:
Long ages past, he wore a crown
Beneath a blood-red sky
Now naught is left of all he was
But his spirit cannot die
Danish:
Long ages past, he wore a crown
Beneath a blood-red sky
Now naught is left of all he was
But his spirit cannot die
Icelandic:
Long ages past, he wore a crown
Beneath a blood-red sky
Now naught is left of all he was
But his spirit cannot die
Turkish:
Çağlar evvel tacı vardı
Ve sema kan kırmızısı
Artık eski hâlinden eser yok
Ama ruhu tadamaz ölümü
Lithuanian:
Long ages past, he wore a crown
Beneath a blood-red sky
Now naught is left of all he was
But his spirit cannot die
Czech:
Long ages past, he wore a crown
Beneath a blood-red sky
Now naught is left of all he was
But his spirit cannot die
Hungarian:
Egy elmúlt korban koronát viselt
a vérvörös égbolt alatt.
Már nem maradt belőle semmi,
de a lelke nem pusztulhat.
Slovak:
Long ages past, he wore a crown
Beneath a blood-red sky
Now naught is left of all he was
But his spirit cannot die
Polish:
Dawno temu nosił koronę
Pod niebem krwistoczerwonym
Teraz nic z niego nie zostało
A jego duch nie zostanie zgładzony
Dutch:
Ooit droeg deze vorst een kroon
Onder de lucht met rood geverfd
Nu rest ons niets van wat hij was
Behalve zijn geest die nimmer sterft
Portuguese:
Long ages past, he wore a crown
Beneath a blood-red sky
Now naught is left of all he was
But his spirit cannot die
Portuguese_Brazilian:
Tempos longínquos, coroa usava
Sob um céu rubro e vital
Hoje nada do que foi mais lhe restara
Senão o pobre espírito imortal
Chinese:
很久很久以前，他还带着皇冠
在血红色的苍穹之下
而现在，他一无所有
但他的灵魂却一直在徘徊
Japanese:
はるか昔、彼は王冠を戴いていた
血の赤の空の下で
今や彼には何も残らぬ
しかし彼の霊は死ねぬ
Korean:
오래 전에, 그는 왕관을 썼습니다
핏빛 하늘 아래
이제 그는 아무것도 남지 않았으나
그의 영혼은 아직까지도 죽지 못하고 있습니다
Chinese_Traditional:
很久很久以前，他還帶著皇冠
在血紅色的蒼穹之下
而現在，他一無所有
但他的靈魂卻一直在徘徊

English: Held against your ear, you hear tiny whisperings within...

Bulgarian: Held against your ear, you hear tiny whisperings within...

English: Sharper than flint, a sleek messenger of death.
