English: Wolves are natural survivors. This one was just unlucky. Now its pelt will warm you in the snow.
Swedish: Vargar är födda överlevare. Den här hade otur. Nu kommer den hålla dig varm i snön.
French: Les loups sont des survivants. Celui-ci a juste joué de malchance. Sa fourrure vous tiendra désormais chaud par temps de neige.
Italian: Wolves are natural survivors. This one was just unlucky. Now its pelt will warm you in the snow.
German: Wölfe sind natürliche Überlebenskünstler. Dieser hier hatte einfach nur Pech. Aber immerhin wird sein Pelz jetzt dich vor dem Schnee schützen.
Spanish: Los lobos son supervivientes por naturaleza, pero este tuvo mala suerte. Su piel te dará calorcito en la nieve.
Russian: Волки умеют выживать. Этому просто не повезло. Теперь его шкура согреет вас в холода.
Romanian: Wolves are natural survivors. This one was just unlucky. Now its pelt will warm you in the snow.
Bulgarian: Wolves are natural survivors. This one was just unlucky. Now its pelt will warm you in the snow.
Macedonian: Wolves are natural survivors. This one was just unlucky. Now its pelt will warm you in the snow.
Finnish: Sudet ovat luonnollisia selviytyjiä. Tämä yksilön kohtalo oli vain epäonninen. Nyt sen turkki pitää sinut lämpimänä lumessa.
Danish: Wolves are natural survivors. This one was just unlucky. Now its pelt will warm you in the snow.
Icelandic: Úlfar eru náttúrulegir eftirlifandar. Þessi hinsvegar varð óheppinn. Nú hefur þú feld hanns til að hlýja þér í snjónum.
Turkish: Kurtlar hayatta kalma konusunda doğuştan uzmandırlar ama bu arkadaş biraz talihsizmiş. Postu artık kar soğuğunda seni ısıtacak.
Lithuanian: Wolves are natural survivors. This one was just unlucky. Now its pelt will warm you in the snow.
Czech: Vlci přežijí ledacos tenhle měl však smůlu. Nyní tě jeho kůže zahřeje, když sněží.
Hungarian: A farkasok természetes túlélők. Ez a példány csak szerencsétlenül járt. Az irhája mostantól téged melegít a hóban.
Slovak: Vlci sú od prírody majstri v prežití. Tento mal len smolu. A teraz ťa bude jeho kožušina zahrievať v zime.
Polish: Wilki potrafią przeżyć w każdych warunkach. Ten miał po prostu pecha. Teraz jego futro ogrzeje cię na mrozie.
Dutch: Wolven zijn van nature overlevers. Deze had gewoon pech. Nu houdt zijn huid je warm in de sneeuw.
Portuguese: Wolves are natural survivors. This one was just unlucky. Now its pelt will warm you in the snow.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Lobos são sobreviventes naturais. Esse só deu azar. Agora sua pele vai aquecer você na neve.
Chinese: 狼是天生的生存强者。 只是这一匹比较倒霉。 现在，它的皮毛将在雪中温暖您。
Japanese: 狼には生き延びる本能がある。 これは不運な一頭だ。 今、その毛皮は雪の中でも身体を温めてくれる。
Korean: 늑대는 생존에 타고난 동물입니다. 다만 이 늑대는 운이 좋지 않았습니다. 이제 이 털 가죽은 눈 속에서 당신을 따뜻하게 해줄 것입니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 狼是天生的生存強者。 只是這一匹比較倒楣。 它的皮毛在雪中溫暖您。

Japanese: オレンジ色のうまいヤツ。

French: Une délicieuse soupe chaude faite principalement de carottes.
Italian: Una zuppa di carote, calda e gustosa.

Romanian: A warm tasty soup made of mostly carrots.
Bulgarian: A warm tasty soup made of mostly carrots.
Macedonian: A warm tasty soup made of mostly carrots.

Czech: Teplá a chutná polévka převážně z mrkví.

Portuguese_Brazilian: Uma sopa quente saborosa feita com cenouras.

Japanese: 主にニンジンから作られた温まるスープ。

French: Un maillon de chaîne de fer.
Italian: Un anello di catena di ferro
Spanish: Eslabón de una cadena de hierro.
Portuguese: Um pedaço de corrente de ferro.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Um elo de corrente de ferro.

Swedish: Ett bröstpansar gjort av hamrat brons.

Chinese_Traditional: 將青銅錘打後製成的胸甲。

English: An iron scale mail, this will turn all but the strongest of blows.
Swedish: En fjällbrynja av järn skyddar dig mot allt utom de hårdaste slag.
French: Une cuirasse en fer, bonne pour faire dévier tout sauf les coups les plus puissants.
Italian: Una corazza di ferro, questo respingerà tutto tranne i colpi più forti.
German: Eine eiserne Brustplatte, die fast jeden Angriff aushält.
Spanish: Una armadura de escamas de hierro que puede desviarlo todo, excepto los golpes demasiado fuertes.
Russian: Чешуйчатый доспех из железа, способен выдержать удар любой силы.
Romanian: An iron scale mail, this will turn all but the strongest of blows.
Bulgarian: An iron scale mail, this will turn all but the strongest of blows.
Macedonian: An iron scale mail, this will turn all but the strongest of blows.
Finnish: Raudasta valmistettu rintahaarniska, tämä kääntää kaikki paitsi vahvimmat iskut.
Danish: An iron scale mail, this will turn all but the strongest of blows.
Icelandic: Brjóstplata úr járni, sem ver allt nema sterkustu höggin.
Turkish: En güçlü darbeler dışındaki tüm darbeleri karşılayan demir pul zırh.
Lithuanian: An iron scale mail, this will turn all but the strongest of blows.
Czech: Železná kroužková zbroj, toto zlomí vše krom těch nejsilnějších úderů.
Hungarian: Egy vaspikkelyes mellvért, mely a legerősebb csapásokon kívül mindent kivéd.
Slovak: Železná šupinatá zbroj, ktorá podľahne iba najsilnejším úderom.
Polish: Zbroja z żelaznych łusek, która ulegnie jedynie najsilniejszym ciosom.
Dutch: Een maliënkolder van ijzeren plaatjes. Weerstaat zelfs de stevigste klappen.
Portuguese: Uma verdadeira cota de malha, desvia tudo menos o mais forte dos golpes.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Uma malha de escamas de ferro que absorverá até os golpes mais fortes.
Chinese: 铁鳞甲，几乎能挡下除最强一击之外的所有攻击。
Japanese: かなり強力な打撃も弾ける、鉄のスケイルメイル。
Korean: 철 미늘 갑옷은 가장 강한 타격을 제외한 대부분의 공격을 막아낼 수 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 鐵鱗甲，幾乎能擋下除最強一擊之外的攻擊。

Spanish: Una túnica hecha con pieles animales.

English: Finely wrought and strong enough to turn even the sharpest blades.
Swedish: Vackert smidd och stark nog att vända även de vassaste klingor.
French: Forgée avec talent et assez solide pour arrêter les lames les plus aiguisées.

Slovak: Jemne spracovaný a dostatočne silný na to, aby odolala aj tým najostrejším čepeliam.

German: Immerhin besser, als nackt zu sein.
Japanese: 何も着ないよりはマシ。
トロル革のチュニック

English: Trolls are hard to skin but their leather is tough and warm.
Swedish: Troll är svåra att flå, men deras läder är kraftigt och varmt.
French: Les trolls sont difficiles à dépouiller mais leur cuir est doux et chaud.

German: Trolle sind schwer zu häuten, aber ihr Leder ist zäh und warm.
Spanish: Despellejar a un trol no es tarea sencilla, pero su cuero es fuerte y cálido.
Russian: Свежевание тролля - задача не из простых, зато их шкура прочная и теплая.
Romanian: Trolls are hard to skin but their leather is tough and warm.
Bulgarian: Trolls are hard to skin but their leather is tough and warm.
Macedonian: Trolls are hard to skin but their leather is tough and warm.

Icelandic: Tröll eru erfið að flekja, en skinn þeirra gera ein bestu og endingargóðu leðrin
Turkish: Trollerin derisini yüzmek zordur ama derileri serttir ve sıcak tutar.
Lithuanian: Trolls are hard to skin but their leather is tough and warm.

Slovak: Koža trollov sa ťažko sťahuje, ale ich koža je tvrdá a teplá.

Chinese: 巨魔的皮很难剥，但是它们的皮结实又保暖。

English: A wolfskin jerkin, warm and wild-looking. It protects against the cold.

Bulgarian: A wolfskin jerkin, warm and wild-looking. It protects against the cold.
Macedonian: A wolfskin jerkin, warm and wild-looking. It protects against the cold.

French: Un éclat de coquille de crustacé.

English: Far heavier than it looks, with a faint humming sound from within.
Swedish: Mycket tyngre än det ser ut. Ett svagt, spinnande läte hörs från insidan.
French: Bien plus lourd qu'il n'y paraît, un faible bourdonnement en provient.
Italian: Far heavier than it looks, with a faint humming sound from within.
German: Sieht wesentlich schwerer aus, als es ist. Aus dem Innern ist ein schwaches Summen zu vernehmen.
Spanish: Pesa bastante más de lo que parece y emite una especie de zumbido.

Bulgarian: Far heavier than it looks, with a faint humming sound from within.
Macedonian: Far heavier than it looks, with a faint humming sound from within.
Finnish: Paljon painavampi kuin miltä se näyttää, sen sisältä kuuluu heikko hyminä.

Portuguese: Far heavier than it looks, with a faint humming sound from within.

English: The last frozen tears of a dragon, pulsating with mysterious energy.
Swedish: De sista frusna tårarna från en drake, pulserande med mystisk energi.
French: Les dernières larmes gelées d'un dragon, frémissant d'une mystérieuse énergie.

English: Rotten and putrid-smelling. Why do you want this?
Swedish: Rutten och illaluktande. Vad ska du ens ha det till?

Macedonian: Rotten and putrid-smelling. Why do you want this?

Chinese: 已腐烂，散发着恶臭。 你为什么想要这个？

Japanese: 耐えられない程の悪臭がする…

English: This tool is hard enough to crack even the most stubborn rocks.

English: If your eye marks a thing for death, let your arm send the messenger.
Swedish: Om ditt öga märker något till döden, låt din arm skicka medelandet.
French: L’œil marque la cible, le bras envoie le message.
Italian: Se il tuo occhio marchia a morte una cosa, lascia che il tuo braccio invii il messaggero.
German: Wenn dein Auge ein Ziel ausfindig macht, soll dein Arm der Überbringer deiner Botschaft sein.
Spanish: Si avistas algo que debe morir, deja que tu brazo envíe a la mensajera.
Russian: Глаза замечают жертву, копье же ее поражает.
Romanian: If your eye marks a thing for death, let your arm send the messenger.
Bulgarian: If your eye marks a thing for death, let your arm send the messenger.
Macedonian: If your eye marks a thing for death, let your arm send the messenger.
Finnish: Jos sinun silmäsi merkitsevät olennon kuolemaan, anna kätesi lähettää sen viestintuoja.
Danish: If your eye marks a thing for death, let your arm send the messenger.
Turkish: Gözünün kestirdiği hedefe ölümü, bırak kolun göndersin.
Lithuanian: If your eye marks a thing for death, let your arm send the messenger.
Czech: Pokud tvé oko zachytí cíl nech svou ruku poslat smrtelnou zprávu.
Hungarian: Ha a szemeddel halált kívánsz valamire, engedd, hogy a karod indítsa útnak a hírnököt.
Slovak: Ak tvoj zrak našiel obeť, nechaj svoju ruku poslať tohto posla smrti.

Chinese: 当你的眼睛露出杀意，请抬手给出死亡一击。

Korean: 눈으로 죽음을 선사할 대상을 찾았다면, 팔로 전령을 보내 주세요.
Chinese_Traditional: 揮動你的臂膀送出死亡訊息。

English: Even in death, the wolf's tooth aches for flesh.
Swedish: Även död så suktar vargens tand efter kött.
French: Même dans la mort, la dent du loup cherche la chair fraîche.

Spanish: Incluso tras la muerte, el colmillo de lobo anhela carne fresca.

Macedonian: Even in death, the wolf's tooth aches for flesh.
Danish: Even in death, the wolf's tooth aches for flesh.
Icelandic: Jafn vel í dauða, þá þyrstir úlfs tönnin kjöt.
Turkish: Kurdun sivri dişi ölüyken bile ete duyduğu açlıkla sızlıyor.
Lithuanian: Even in death, the wolf's tooth aches for flesh.

Hungarian: A farkas agyara még a halála után is húsra vágyik.
Slovak: Aj po smrti túži vlčí zub po mäse.
Polish: Nawet po śmierci ząb wilka pragnie mięsa.
Dutch: Zelfs dood vraagt de wolventand om vlees.
Portuguese: Mesmo na morte, a presa do lobo sonha com a carne.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Mesmo na morte, a presa do lobo anseia pela carne.
Chinese: 即使死了，狼的牙齿仍在渴望着血肉。
Japanese: たとえ死んでいても、狼の牙は肉を切り裂く。
Korean: 사후에도 이 늑대의 이빨은 사냥감의 육신을 찾아 헤맵니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 即使死了，狼的牙齒仍在渴望著血肉。

English: A weapon worthy of the gods! If you get hit with this, you'll know it...
Swedish: Ett vapen värdigt gudarna! Blir du träffad av den här kan du knappast undgå att märka det...
French: Une arme digne des dieux ! Si vous en êtes frappé, vous le saurez...
Italian: Un'arma degna degli dei! Se verrai colpito da essa, te ne accorgerai...
German: Eine Waffe, die der Götter würdig ist! Wenn Du davon getroffen wirst, wirst Du es wissen …
Spanish: ¡Un arma digna de los dioses! Si te atacan con ella, lo lamentarás...
Russian: Оружие, достойное богов! Удар от него невозможно спутать ни с чем другим…
Romanian: A weapon worthy of the gods! If you get hit with this, you'll know it...
Bulgarian: A weapon worthy of the gods! If you get hit with this, you'll know it...
Macedonian: A weapon worthy of the gods! If you get hit with this, you'll know it...
Finnish: Jumalten arvoinen ase! Tulet kyllä tietämään jos sinua isketään tällä...
Danish: A weapon worthy of the gods! If you get hit with this, you'll know it...
Icelandic: Vopn virði goðanna! Ef þú færð högg frá þessu, þá munt þú vita það...
Turkish: Tanrılara layık bir silah! Bununla aldığın bir darbeyi hissetmemek gibi bir şansın yok...
Lithuanian: A weapon worthy of the gods! If you get hit with this, you'll know it...
Czech: Zbraň hodná bohů! Pokud vás zasáhne, budete to vědět...
Hungarian: Az istenekhez méltó fegyver. Ha ezzel eltalálnak, azt észre fogod venni...
Slovak: Zbraň hodná bohov. Budeš vedieť, ak ťa ňou trafia...
Polish: Broń godna bogów! Jeśli cię uderzy, na pewno będziesz o tym wiedzieć...
Dutch: Een wapen dat de goden waardig is! Als je hiermee geraakt wordt, ga je dat weten…
Portuguese: Uma arma digna dos deuses! Se fores atingido por ela, saberás...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Uma arma digna dos deuses! Você saberá se for atingido por ela.
Chinese: 配得上众神的武器！被它打一下，你就知道厉害了……
Japanese: 神々にも相応しい武器！これで殴られれば実感できるはずだ…
Korean: 신들에게 어울리는 무기입니다! 한번 맞아 보면 알게 될 것입니다. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 配得上眾神的武器！被它打一下就會知道它的厲害了……

Dutch: Een steen. Dat je het maar weet.

German: Eine innere Hitze geht von dem Kern aus.
Icelandic: Þú finnur mikinn hita koma innst úr kjarnanum.
Dutch: Klopt van de hitte die het vanbinnen heeft.
Japanese: 内部の熱で脈打っている。

English: A thing of death and beauty, it catches the light with a greenish glow.
Swedish: Ett vackert men dödligt ting. Den fångar ljuset med ett grönaktigt sken.
French: Une arme aussi belle que létale, luisant d'un éclat vert.
Italian: Un'oggetto di morte e bellezza, riflette la luce con un bagliore color smeraldo.
German: Eine schöne Klinge, die an den Tod erinnert. Besitzt einen grünen Schimmer.
Spanish: Una mezcla de belleza y muerte que refleja la luz con un tono verdoso.
Russian: Смертельно красивый меч с зеленым отливом.
Romanian: A thing of death and beauty, it catches the light with a greenish glow.
Bulgarian: A thing of death and beauty, it catches the light with a greenish glow.
Macedonian: A thing of death and beauty, it catches the light with a greenish glow.
Finnish: Kuolemasan ja kauneuden työkalu. Se hohtaa kevyesti vihreänä valon osuessa siihen.
Danish: A thing of death and beauty, it catches the light with a greenish glow.
Icelandic: A thing of death and beauty, it catches the light with a greenish glow.
Turkish: Ölüm saçan bu güzelim kılıç, yeşilimsi bir parıltıyla ışığı yakalıyor.
Lithuanian: A thing of death and beauty, it catches the light with a greenish glow.
Czech: Věc smrti a krásy, zachytí světlo nazelenalým zářením.
Hungarian: Egy halálos és gyönyörű eszköz, amely zöld ragyogásával elnyeli a fényt.
Slovak: Vec smrti a krásy, zachytáva svetlo nazelenalým vyžarovaním.
Polish: Kwintesencja śmierci i piękna, odbija światło zielonkawym blaskiem.
Dutch: Een ding dat zowel dodelijk als beeldschoon is, en in het licht iets groens heeft.
Portuguese: Uma coisa de morte e beleza, captura a luz com um brilho esverdeado.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Uma ferramenta de morte e beleza, reflete a luz com um brilho esverdeado.
Chinese: 死亡与美丽共同体，闪耀的绿光可以抓住光。
Japanese: 死と美を体現するこの剣は、緑を帯びた光を持つ。
Korean: 죽음과 아름다움의 물건, 빛을 받으면 녹색으로 빛난다.
Chinese_Traditional: 死亡與美麗共同體，閃耀的綠光可以抓住光。

French: Buveuse de sang, une amie assoiffée.
Italian: Bevitore di sangue, un amico assetato
Russian: Ничто не сможет удовлетворить его бездонную жажду крови.
Dutch: Een bloeddrinker. Deze vriend heeft dorst.
Portuguese: Bebedora de sangue, uma amiga sedenta.

English: Unsheathed, it sizzles and spits with deathless fire, an impossible blade.
Swedish: Bubblar och fräser med levande eld, ett fantastiskt svärd.
French: Une fois dégainée, elle grésille et crache sous un feu sans fin, une lame incroyable.
Italian: Sguazzato, sfrigola e sputa con il fuoco senza vita, una lama impossibile.
German: Ein Schwert, das von einem magischen Feuer umspielt wird. Hütet euch vor dem todlosen Feuer.
Spanish: Al desenvainarla, crepita y emite un fuego inmortal; es una espada increíble.
Russian: Невероятный клинок, что сверкает и обжигает неугасимым пламенем.
Romanian: Unsheathed, it sizzles and spits with deathless fire, an impossible blade.
Bulgarian: Unsheathed, it sizzles and spits with deathless fire, an impossible blade.
Macedonian: Unsheathed, it sizzles and spits with deathless fire, an impossible blade.
Finnish: Tupesta vedettynä, se sihisee ja sylkee kuolematonta tulta. Uskomaton terä.
Danish: Unsheathed, it sizzles and spits with deathless fire, an impossible blade.
Turkish: Kınından çıkarıldığında tıslayarak etrafına ölümsüz bir ateş saçan, imkânsız görünümlü bir kılıç.
Lithuanian: Unsheathed, it sizzles and spits with deathless fire, an impossible blade.
Czech: Po vytažení z pochvy syčí a plive oheň, neuvěřitelná čepel.
Hungarian: Kivonva sistereg, és múlhatatlan tüzet köpköd; egy lehetetlen penge.
Slovak: Neuveriteľná čepeľ, ktorá po vytiahnutí z pošvy syčí a prská neutíchajúci oheň.\n
Polish: Niebywałe ostrze, które wyciągnięte z pochwy skwierczy i zieje niegasnącym ogniem.
Dutch: Eenmaal uit de schede sist het en spuwt het een ondood vuur. Een onmogelijk zwaard.
Portuguese: Desembainhada, crepita e chia com chamas imortais, uma espada impossível.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Desembainhada, ela chia e cospe chamas imortais, uma lâmina impossível.
Chinese: 出鞘之后，嗞嗞地吐出不灭之火，只存在于传说之中。
Japanese: 鞘から抜くと、ジュージューと音を立て消えない炎を吐く、素晴らしい剣。
Korean: 칼집에서 꺼내면 꺼질 줄 모르는 불길이 이글거리는 기이한 검입니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 出鞘之後，嗞嗞地吐出不滅之火，這是只應存在於傳說的劍。

English: The straight line between life and death runs along the edge of this blade.
Swedish: Linjen mellan liv och död går längs eggen på detta svärd.
French: La ligne séparant la vie et la mort longe le fil de cette lame.
Italian: La linea fra vita e morte corre sul filo di questa spada
German: Ein eisernes Langschwert, das von einer langen Linie geziert ist.
Spanish: La fina línea entre la vida y la muerte recorre el filo de esta espada.
Russian: Черта между жизнью и смертью пролегает вдоль лезвия этого клинка.
Romanian: The straight line between life and death runs along the edge of this blade.
Bulgarian: The straight line between life and death runs along the edge of this blade.
Macedonian: The straight line between life and death runs along the edge of this blade.
Finnish: Elämän ja kuoleman välillä kulkeva suora linja matkaa tämän terän reunalla.
Danish: The straight line between life and death runs along the edge of this blade.
Turkish: Ölüm ve yaşam arasındaki o ince çizgi, bu kılıcın kenarı boyunca uzanıyor.
Lithuanian: The straight line between life and death runs along the edge of this blade.
Czech: Život a smrt přebíhá na hraně této čepele.
Hungarian: Az élet és halál között húzódó határ ezen penge mentén halad végig.
Slovak: Priama čiara medzi životom a smrťou vedie pozdĺž okraja tejto čepele.
Polish: Prosta linia między życiem a śmiercią biegnie wzdłuż krawędzi jego ostrza.
Dutch: De grens tussen leven en dood loopt over de rand van dit zwaard.
Portuguese: A linha reta entre a vida e a morte passa pelo gume desta lâmina.
Portuguese_Brazilian: A linha que divide a vida e a morte está no fio desta lâmina.
Chinese: 剑刃划过，生命不再，死亡来临。
Japanese: 生と死とを分かつ直線が、この刀身の刃に沿って走っている。
Korean: 삶과 죽음의 경계선이 검날을 따라 흐르고 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 劍刃劃過之處，生命不復存在。

English: Purest of metals, nothing unclean can abide its touch.
Swedish: Den ädlaste av metaller. Inget orent står ut med att vidröra den.
French: Faite du métal le plus pur qui existe, elle viendra à bout de toutes les impuretés.
Italian: Il più puro dei metalli, il suo tocco castiga tutto ciò che è immondo.
German: Nichts Unreines kann seine Berührung ertragen.
Spanish: El más puro de los metales; las impurezas no pueden soportar su tacto.
Russian: Созданный из чистейшего металла, этот меч сразит любую нечисть, что попадется ему на пути.
Romanian: Purest of metals, nothing unclean can abide its touch.
Bulgarian: Purest of metals, nothing unclean can abide its touch.
Macedonian: Purest of metals, nothing unclean can abide its touch.
Finnish: Metalleista puhtain. Mikään epäpuhdas ei voi sietää sen kosketusta.
Danish: Purest of metals, nothing unclean can abide its touch.
Icelandic: Purest of metals, nothing unclean can abide its touch.
Turkish: En saf metalden yapılan bu kılıcın dokunuşu karşısında kirli hiçbir şey dayanamaz.
Lithuanian: Purest of metals, nothing unclean can abide its touch.
Czech: Nejčistší z kovů, nic nečistého nedokáže dodržet jeho dotek.
Hungarian: A legtisztább fém. Semmilyen tisztátalan dolog nem képes ellenállni az érintésének.
Slovak: Najčistejší kov, nič nečisté neznesie jeho dotyk.
Polish: Najczystszy z metali, nic nieczystego nie wytrzyma jego dotyku.
Dutch: Het puurste metaal, en niets onreins is er tegen bestand.
Portuguese: O mais puro dos metais, nada impuro resiste ao seu toque.
Portuguese_Brazilian: O mais puro dos metais. Nada impuro é incapaz de suportar seu toque.
Chinese: 最纯净的金属，不洁之物都无法承受它的功击。
Japanese: 最も清浄な金属、いかなる不浄なものもこれに触れれば耐えられない。
Korean: 가장 순수한 금속으로, 부정한 존재는 그 손길을 견딜 수 없습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 最純淨的金屬，不潔之物都無法承受它的攻擊。

Japanese: オーディンの蜂蜜酒の角杯

English: Odin's finest warriors deserve the finest drinks.
Swedish: Odens mäktigaste krigare förtjänar de finaste drycker.
French: Les plus grands guerriers d'Odin méritent les meilleures boissons.
Italian: I migliori guerrieri di Odino meritano le migliori bevande.
German: Die besten Krieger Odins verdienen nur die erlesensten Getränke.
Spanish: Los mejores guerreros de Odín se merecen las mejores bebidas.
Russian: Лучшие воины Одина заслуживают самых лучших напитков.
Romanian: Odin's finest warriors deserve the finest drinks.
Bulgarian: Odin's finest warriors deserve the finest drinks.
Macedonian: Odin's finest warriors deserve the finest drinks.
Finnish: Odinin parhaimmat soturit ansaitsevat kaikkein maukkaimmat juomat.
Danish: Odin's finest warriors deserve the finest drinks.
Icelandic: Odin's finest warriors deserve the finest drinks.
Turkish: Odin'in gözde savaşçıları en kaliteli içkileri hak eder.
Lithuanian: Odin's finest warriors deserve the finest drinks.
Czech: Nejlepší Odinovi bojovníci si zaslouží nejlepší kus oblečení.
Hungarian: Odin legkiválóbb harcosai a legjobb italokat érdemlik.
Slovak: Odinovi najlepší bojovníci si zaslúžia tie najlepšie nápoje.
Polish: Najznamienitsi wojownicy Odyna zasługują na najszlachetniejsze trunki.
Dutch: Odins beste krijgers verdienen de beste drank.
Portuguese: Odin's finest warriors deserve the finest drinks.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Os maiores guerreiros de Odin merecem as melhores bebidas.
Chinese: 奥丁最棒的战士值得最好的饮品。
Japanese: オーディンの最高の戦士には最上の飲み物がふさわしい。
Korean: 오딘의 가장 뛰어난 전사들은 가장 뛰어난 술을 마실 자격이 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 為配上奥丁最優秀的戰士的最出色飲品。

English: A bar of pure tin ready to be worked.
Swedish: En tacka rent tenn, redo för smide.
Italian: Una barra di stagno puro pronta per essere lavorata.
German: Ein Barren aus reinem Zinn, bereit zum Verarbeiten.
Spanish: Lingote de estaño listo para trabajarse.
Russian: Слиток чистого олова, может быть весьма полезным.
Romanian: A bar of pure tin ready to be worked.
Bulgarian: A bar of pure tin ready to be worked.
Macedonian: A bar of pure tin ready to be worked.
Danish: A bar of pure tin ready to be worked.
Turkish: İşlenmeye hazır bir saf kalay külçesi.
Lithuanian: A bar of pure tin ready to be worked.
Czech: Cihla čistého cín připravená ke zpracování.
Slovak: A bar of pure tin ready to be worked.
Polish: Sztabka czystej cyny gotowej do obróbki.
Dutch: Een staaf van puur tin, klaar om bewerkt te worden.
Portuguese: Uma barra de estanho puro, pronto para ser trabalhado.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Uma barra de lata pura, pronta para ser moldada.
Japanese: 純粋なスズののべ棒。 加工できる。
Korean: 순수한 주석 주괴로 사용할 준비가 되었습니다.

English: Unrefined tin. Needs to be refined in a smelter.
Swedish: Oraffinerad tennmalm. Behöver behandlas i en Smältugn.
French: Minerai d’étain. Doit être raffiné dans une fonderie.
Italian: Stagno grezzo. Dev'essere raffinato nella fonderia.
German: Unverarbeitetes Zinnerz. Muss in einem Schmelzofen verhüttet werden.
Spanish: Estaño sin refinar. Ha de refinarse en un horno de fundición.
Russian: Необработанное олово. Необходимо обработать в плавильне.
Romanian: Unrefined tin. Needs to be refined in a smelter.
Bulgarian: Unrefined tin. Needs to be refined in a smelter.
Macedonian: Unrefined tin. Needs to be refined in a smelter.
Danish: Unrefined tin. Needs to be refined in a smelter.
Turkish: İşlenmemiş kalay. Eritme fırınında işlenmesi gerekiyor.
Lithuanian: Unrefined tin. Needs to be refined in a smelter.
Czech: Nerafinovaný cín. Musí být rafinován v huti.
Hungarian: Megmunkálatlan ónérc. Egy olvasztókemencében kell finomítani.
Slovak: Unrefined tin. Needs to be refined in a smelter.
Polish: Nierafinowana cyna do uszlachetnienia w odlewni.
Dutch: Ruwe tin. Moet worden verfijnd in een smelterij.
Portuguese: Estanho por refinar. Deve ser refinado numa Fundição.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Lata bruta. Precisa ser refinada em um Fundidor.
Chinese: 未精炼的锡。 需要放入炼炉中精炼。
Japanese: 製錬されていないスズ。 溶鉱炉で製錬する必要がある。
Korean: 제련되지 않은 주석입니다. 용해로에서 제련해야 합니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 未精煉的錫。 需要放入熔爐中精煉。

English: It brings light and warmth, drives back the darkness.
Swedish: Den ger värme och ljus, driver bort mörkret.
French: Elle apporte lumière et chaleur, repoussant les ténèbres.
Italian: Porta luce e calore, respinge l'oscurità.
German: Spendet Wärme und Licht und kann auch als Waffe verwendet werden.
Spanish: Emite luz y calor, por lo que aleja a la oscuridad.
Russian: Излучает свет и тепло, прогоняет прочь тьму.
Romanian: It brings light and warmth, drives back the darkness.
Bulgarian: It brings light and warmth, drives back the darkness.
Macedonian: It brings light and warmth, drives back the darkness.
Finnish: Se tuo valoa ja lämpöä sekä ajaa pimeyden pois.
Danish: It brings light and warmth, drives back the darkness.
Icelandic: Gefur hita, ljós, og nýtist sem vopn líka.
Turkish: Çevresine ısı ve ışık yayarak karanlığı kovar.
Lithuanian: It brings light and warmth, drives back the darkness.
Czech: Přináší světlo a teplo, zahání temnotu.
Hungarian: Fényt és meleget hoz, valamint visszaveri a sötétséget.
Slovak: Prináša svetlo a teplo, zaháňa temnotu.\n
Polish: Przynosi światło i ciepło, oddalając ciemność.
Dutch: Brengt je licht en warmte en houd de duisternis op afstand.
Portuguese: Traz luz e calor, afasta as trevas.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Traz a luz e o calor, repelindo a escuridão.
Chinese: 发出明亮温暖的光芒，驱散了黑暗。
Japanese: 明るさと暖かさをもたらし、暗闇を退ける。
Chinese_Traditional: 發出明亮溫暖的光芒，驅散了黑暗。

English: A thick and sturdy hide. This is why trolls are so hard to kill.
Swedish: En tjock och kraftig hud. Detta är anledningen till att troll är så svåra att döda.
French: Une peau épaisse et robuste. La raison pour laquelle les trolls sont si difficiles à tuer.
Italian: Una pelle spessa e robusta. Questo è il motivo per cui i troll sono così difficili da uccidere.
German: Sehr dickes und stabiles Leder. Darum sind Trolle so schwer zu töten.
Spanish: Una piel dura y resistente. Por eso es tan difícil matar a los trols.
Russian: Толстая, крепкая шкура. Именно из-за нее троллей так сложно убить.
Romanian: A thick and sturdy hide. This is why trolls are so hard to kill.
Bulgarian: A thick and sturdy hide. This is why trolls are so hard to kill.
Macedonian: A thick and sturdy hide. This is why trolls are so hard to kill.
Finnish: Paksu ja kestävä nahka. Tämän takia peikot ovat hankalia tapettavia.
Danish: A thick and sturdy hide. This is why trolls are so hard to kill.
Icelandic: Þykkt og sterkt leður. Útskýrir hvers vegna tröll eru svona erfið að drepa.
Turkish: Kalın ve sağlam bir deri. Trolleri öldürmek bu yüzden zordur.
Lithuanian: A thick and sturdy hide. This is why trolls are so hard to kill.
Czech: Silná a pevná kůže. Proto je tak těžké zabít Trolly.
Hungarian: Vastag és szívós bőr. Ezért olyan nehéz végezni a trollokkal.
Slovak: A thick and sturdy hide. This is why trolls are so hard to kill.
Polish: Gruba i mocna – to dlatego tak trudno zabić trolle.
Dutch: Een dikke, stevige huid. Daarom zijn trollen dus zo moeilijk te doden.
Portuguese: Uma pele grossa e resistente. É por isto que os trolls são tão difíceis de matar.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Pele grossa e robusta. É por isso que trolls são tão difíceis de matar.
Chinese: 厚重结实的皮。 这是巨魔很难被杀死的原因。
Japanese: 分厚く頑丈な皮。 これが、トロルを殺すのが困難な理由だ。
Korean: 두껍고 튼튼한 가죽입니다. 그래서 트롤을 처치하기가 그만큼 어렵습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 厚重結實的皮。 這是巨魔很難被殺死的原因。

Japanese: スライムのトロフィー

English: A smelly lump of sticky matter.
Swedish: En stinkande klump med kladdig materia.
Italian: Un mucchio puzzolente di materia appiccicosa
Spanish: Un bulto de materia pegajosa y apestosa.
Romanian: A smelly lump of sticky matter.
Bulgarian: A smelly lump of sticky matter.
Danish: A smelly lump of sticky matter.
Turkish: Vıcık vıcık bir maddeden ibaret pis kokulu bir yumru.
Lithuanian: A smelly lump of sticky matter.
Portuguese: Um monte malcheiroso de material pegajoso.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Uma massa fedida de material pegajoso.
Chinese: 一大块黏乎乎、散发着恶臭的东西。
Japanese: 悪臭のする、べとつく物質の塊。
Chinese_Traditional: 一大塊黏糊糊、散發著惡臭的東西。

English: A smelly lump of sticky matter.
Swedish: En stinkande klump med kladdig materia.
Italian: Un mucchio puzzolente di materia appiccicosa
Spanish: Un bulto de materia pegajosa y apestosa.
Romanian: A smelly lump of sticky matter.
Bulgarian: A smelly lump of sticky matter.
Danish: A smelly lump of sticky matter.
Turkish: Vıcık vıcık bir maddeden ibaret pis kokulu bir yumru.
Lithuanian: A smelly lump of sticky matter.
Portuguese: Um monte malcheiroso de material pegajoso.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Uma massa fedida de material pegajoso.
Chinese: 一大块黏乎乎、散发着恶臭的东西。
Japanese: 悪臭のする、べとつく物質の塊。
Chinese_Traditional: 一大塊黏糊糊、散發著惡臭的東西。

English: This boar head would make for a nice decoration in any house.
Swedish: Detta vildsvinshuvud skulle utgöra en präktig dekoration i vilket hus som helst.
French: Cette tête de sanglier sera parfaite pour décorer une maison.
Italian: Questa testa di cinghiale sarebbe una buona decorazione per qualsiasi casa.
German: Dieser Wildschweinkopf würde sicher eine schöne Dekoration für ein Haus abgeben.
Spanish: Esta cabeza de jabalí quedaría bonita de decoración en cualquier casa.
Russian: Эта голова кабана станет красивым украшением любого дома.
Romanian: This boar head would make for a nice decoration in any house.
Bulgarian: This boar head would make for a nice decoration in any house.
Macedonian: This boar head would make for a nice decoration in any house.
Finnish: Tästä villisian päästä saisi hienon koristeen mihin tahansa taloon.
Danish: This boar head would make for a nice decoration in any house.
Icelandic: This boar head would make for a nice decoration in any house.
Turkish: Bu domuz başı her türlü ev için harika bir dekorasyon malzemesi olur.
Lithuanian: Ši šerno galva gerai atrodytų ant bet kurių namų sienų.
Czech: Tato kančí hlava by byla pěknou dekorací v každém domě.
Hungarian: Ez a vaddisznófej bármely házban kellemes díszt jelentene.
Slovak: Táto kančia hlava by bola peknou dekoráciou v každom dome.
Polish: Ta głowa dzika byłaby piękną dekoracją w każdym domostwie.
Dutch: Deze zwijnskop is voor ieder huis een mooie versiering.
Portuguese: This boar head would make for a nice decoration in any house.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Esta cabeça de javali daria uma bela decoração para qualquer casa.
Chinese: 这个鬓猪战利品在任何房间里都会是一个不错的装饰品。
Japanese: この猪の頭は、どの家に置いてもすばらしい装飾となる。
Korean: 이 멧돼지의 트로피는 어느 집에 두어도 훌륭한 장식품입니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 這個鬢豬戰利品在任何房間裡都會是一個不錯的裝飾品。

English: Bones and viscous goo, held together by some unseen force.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Swedish: Ben och trögflytande vätskor, sammahållna av någon osedd kraft.\n\nHäng upp det på en sten i cirkeln.
French: Des os et une substance visqueuse, maintenus ensemble par une force invisible.\n\nOffrez-la aux Pierres sacrificielles.
Italian: Queste ossa e melma viscosa sono unite da una forza invisibile.\n\nOffrile alle Pietre Sacrificali.
German: Knochen und zähflüssiger Schleim. Wird durch eine nicht sichtbare Kraft zusammengehalten.\n\nBringe diesen Gegenstand bei den Opfersteinen als Opfer dar.
Spanish: Estos huesos y esta masa viscosa se mantienen unidos por una fuerza intangible.\n\nHaz una ofrenda en las piedras de sacrificio.
Russian: Кости и вязкая слизь, удерживаемые какой-то невидимой силой.\n\nПринесите их к жертвенным камням.
Romanian: Bones and viscous goo, held together by some unseen force.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Bulgarian: Bones and viscous goo, held together by some unseen force.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Macedonian: Bones and viscous goo, held together by some unseen force.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Finnish: Luita ja sitkeää limaa, joku tuntematon voima pitää sitä kasassa.\n\nTarjoa se Uhrauskiville.
Danish: Bones and viscous goo, held together by some unseen force.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Icelandic: Bones and viscous goo, held together by some unseen force.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Turkish: Görünmeyen bir güç tarafından bir arada tutulan kemik ve yapışkan madde yığını.\n\nOnu Kurban Taşları'na adak olarak sun.
Lithuanian: Bones and viscous goo, held together by some unseen force.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Czech: Kosti a viskózní maglajz držené pohromadě nějakou neviditelnou silou.\n\nNábídni ji obětním kamenům.
Hungarian: Csontok és viszkózus ragacs, amelyeket egy láthatatlan erő tart össze.\n \nFelajánlhatod az áldozati köveknek.
Slovak: Kosti a hustá, lepkavá hmota, držaná pohromade neviditeľnou silou.\n\nPrines tento dar k Obetným kameňom.
Polish: Kości i lepka maź spojone przez niewidzialną siłę.\n\nZłóż w ofierze Kamieniom Ofiarnym.
Dutch: Beenderen en kleverige drab die bijeen wordt gehouden door een ongeziene kracht.\n\nBied het aan als offer bij de Offerstenen.
Portuguese: Bones and viscous goo, held together by some unseen force.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Ossos e gosma viscosa, unidos por uma força invisível.\n\nOfereça às pedras de sacrifício.
Chinese: 骨头和黏糊糊的不明物，被一股无形的力量绑在了一起。 \n\n向祭坛献祭。
Japanese: 骨と粘液が、目に見えぬ力によって一つにされている。 \n\n犠牲の石に捧げよう。
Korean: 뼈와 점성액이 보이지 않는 힘에 의해 뭉쳐져 있습니다. \n\n제물석에 바치십시오.
Chinese_Traditional: 骨頭和黏糊糊的不明物，被一股無形的力量綁在一起。 \n\n到獻祭石獻祭。

English: A mess of black soil and old bone, thankfully quiet now.
Swedish: En blandning av svart jord och ben, tacksamt tyst nu.
French: Un tas de terre noire et de vieux os heureusement réduit au silence.
Italian: Un ammasso di terra nera e vecchie ossa, per fortuna al riposo per ora.
German: Ein Gewirr aus schwarzer Erde und alten Knochen aus dem zum Glück das Leben entwichen ist.
Spanish: Un montón de tierra y huesos viejos. Por suerte, ya está en silencio.
Russian: Месиво из грязи и старых костей, хорошо, что больше не шевелится.
Romanian: O gramada de pamant negru si oase vechi, din fericire linistite acum
Bulgarian: A mess of black soil and old bone, thankfully quiet now.
Finnish: Lopultakin hiljaa, sotkuinen kasa mustaa maata ja vanhoja luita.
Danish: A mess of black soil and old bone, thankfully quiet now.
Icelandic: Óreiða af svörtum jarðvegi og gömlum beinum, sem betur fer kyrrstætt.
Turkish: Kara topraktan ve eski kemiklerden ibaret bir yığın. Neyse ki artık sessiz.
Lithuanian: A mess of black soil and old bone, thankfully quiet now.
Czech: Směs černé půdy a starých kostí, naštěstí již je potichu.
Hungarian: Fekete föld és régi csont keveréke, szerencsére már elcsendesült.
Slovak: Zmes čiernej zeme a starých kostí, teraz to je už našťastie potichu.
Polish: Sterta czarnej ziemi i starych kości, na szczęście już nieruchomych.
Dutch: Een zootje zwarte grond en oude beenderen die nu gelukkig stil zijn.
Portuguese: Uma mistura de terra preta e ossos velhos que, por sorte, neste momento está sossegada.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Uma mistura de terra preta e ossos velhos que, por sorte, está sossegada agora.
Chinese: 由黑土和古老骨头随意组成，谢天谢地，现在已经安歇。
Japanese: 黒土と古い骨をごちゃ混ぜにしたもの、ありがたいことに今は静か。
Korean: 검은 흙과 낡은 뼈로 엉망진창이 되어 있지만, 다행히 지금은 조용합니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 這團混沌的黑土廢骨沈默了。

Japanese: デスキートのトロフィー

English: You don't like touching this thing even when it's dead.
Swedish: Du gillar inte att vidröra den även i det här tillståndet.
French: Même mort, il est déconseillé de toucher cette chose.
Italian: Seppur morta, non ti piace toccare questa cosa.
German: Obwohl dieses Ding tot ist, würdest du es lieber nicht anfassen.
Spanish: Está muerto y, aun así, no te hace ninguna gracia tocarlo.
Russian: Даже труп этой штуки лучше не трогать.
Romanian: You don't like touching this thing even when it's dead.
Bulgarian: You don't like touching this thing even when it's dead.
Macedonian: You don't like touching this thing even when it's dead.
Finnish: Et pidä tämän koskettamisesta vaikka se onkin kuollut.
Danish: You don't like touching this thing even when it's dead.
Icelandic: You don't like touching this thing even when it's dead.
Turkish: Bu şeye ölü hâldeyken bile dokunmak hoşuna gitmiyor.
Lithuanian: You don't like touching this thing even when it's dead.
Czech: Nerad se dotýkáš té věci, i když je mrtvá.
Hungarian: Még akkor sem szereted megérinteni ezt a lényt, ha már elpusztult.
Slovak: Nerád sa dotýkaš tejto veci, i keď je už mŕtva.
Polish: Nie zechcesz go dotknąć, nawet gdy jest martwy.
Dutch: Al is dit ding dood, toch raak je het liever niet aan.
Portuguese: Não gostas de tocar nesta coisa mesmo quando está morta.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você não gosta de encostar nisso mesmo quando já está morto.
Chinese: 就算它已经死了你也会害怕碰它。
Japanese: 死んでいたとしても、あまり触りたくない。
Korean: 죽어 있다고 해도 만지기 싫어지는 형체.
Chinese_Traditional: 就算它已經死了你也會害怕碰它。

English: A fine specimen but you'll need to kill more than deer to enter Valhalla.
Swedish: Ett fint exemplar, men du behöver döda mer än rådjur för att komma in i Valhalla.
French: Un joli spécimen, mais vous devrez tuer plus que des cerfs pour entrer au Valhalla.
Italian: Un bell'esemplare ma avrai bisogno di uccidere molto più che cervi per entrare in Valhalla.
German: Ein wahres Prachtexemplar, aber du musst mehr als nur Hirsche töten, um nach Walhalla zu kommen.
Spanish: Es un buen espécimen, pero tendrás que matar más que ciervos si quieres entrar al Valhalla.
Russian: Великолепное животное, но убийство простого оленя не откроет вам врата в Вальгаллу.
Romanian: Un specimen bun, dar vei avea nevoie de mai mult decat caprioare pentru a intra in Valhalla
Bulgarian: A fine specimen but you'll need to kill more than deer to enter Valhalla.
Macedonian: Добар пример, но ќе треба да убиеш повеќе од срна за да влезеш во Валхала.
Finnish: Oivallinen näytekappale, mutta sinun tulee tappaa muutakin kuin peuroja päästäksesi Valhallaan.
Danish: A fine specimen but you'll need to kill more than deer to enter Valhalla.
Icelandic: Fínasta eintak, en þú þarft að drepa meira en dádýr til að komast inn í Valhöll.
Turkish: Avdaki hünerlerine iyi bir örnek olsa da Valhalla'ya girmek için geyikten fazlasını öldürmen gerekecek.
Lithuanian: Neblogas egzempliorius, bet tau reikės nužudyti daugiau, nei elnią, norint patekti į Valhalą.
Czech: Skvělý exemplář, ale abyste mohli vstoupit do Valhally, budete muset zabít víc než jeleny.
Hungarian: Szép példány, de egy szarvas megölésénél többre lesz szükséged, hogy belépj Valhallába.
Slovak: Vynikajúci exemplár, ale aby ste mohli vstúpiť do Valhally, budete musieť zabiť viac než len jeleňa.
Polish: Niezły okaz, lecz by dostać się do Walhalli, zabicie jelenia nie wystarczy.
Dutch: Een mooi exemplaar, maar je zult meer moeten doden dan alleen een hert om Walhalla in te mogen.
Portuguese: Um belo espécime, mas para entrar em Valhalla tens de matar mais do que veados.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Um belo espécime, mas é preciso matar mais do que cervos para entrar em Valhalla.
Chinese: 优良的物种，但你如果只杀鹿是不能进入瓦尔哈拉的。
Japanese: 見事な標本だが、鹿を殺した程度ではヴァルハラには入れない。
Korean: 좋은 표본이지만 사슴을 처치하는 정도로는 발할라에 들어갈 수 없습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 一個不錯的標本，但如果想進入英靈殿只有殺鹿是不夠的。

Italian: Un bell'esemplare ma avrai bisogno di uccidere molto più che cervi per entrare in Valhalla.
German: Ein wahres Prachtexemplar, aber du musst mehr als nur Hirsche töten, um nach Walhalla zu kommen.
Spanish: Es un buen espécimen, pero tendrás que matar más que ciervos si quieres entrar al Valhalla.

Romanian: Un specimen bun, dar vei avea nevoie de mai mult decat caprioare pentru a intra in Valhalla

Macedonian: Добар пример, но ќе треба да убиеш повеќе од срна за да влезеш во Валхала.

Danish: A fine specimen but you'll need to kill more than deer to enter Valhalla.

Lithuanian: Neblogas egzempliorius, bet tau reikės nužudyti daugiau, nei elnią, norint patekti į Valhalą.
Czech: Skvělý exemplář, ale abyste mohli vstoupit do Valhally, budete muset zabít víc než jeleny.
Hungarian: Szép példány, de egy szarvas megölésénél többre lesz szükséged, hogy belépj Valhallába.
Slovak: Vynikajúci exemplár, ale aby ste mohli vstúpiť do Valhally, budete musieť zabiť viac ako len jeleňa.
Polish: Niezły okaz, lecz by dostać się do Walhalli, zabicie jelenia nie wystarczy.
Dutch: Een mooi exemplaar, maar je zult meer moeten doden dan alleen een hert om Walhalla in te mogen.
Portuguese: Um belo espécime, mas para entrar em Valhalla tens de matar mais do que veados.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Um belo espécime, mas é preciso matar mais do que cervos para entrar em Valhalla.
Chinese: 优良的物种，但你如果只杀鹿是不能进入瓦尔哈拉的。
Japanese: 見事な標本だが、鹿を殺した程度ではヴァルハラには入れない。
Korean: 좋은 표본이지만 사슴을 처치하는 정도로는 발할라에 들어갈 수 없습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 一個不錯的標本，但如果想進入英靈殿只有殺鹿是不夠的。

English: The head of a dragon, majestic even in the rigor of death.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Swedish: En drakes huvud, majestätiskt även i dödens kalla grepp.\n\nHäng upp det på en sten i cirkeln.
French: La tête d'un dragon, majestueux jusque dans la mort.\n\nOffrez-la aux Pierres sacrificielles.
Italian: La testa di un drago, maestoso anche nella rigidità della morte.\n\nOffrila alle Pietre Sacrificali.
German: Der Kopf eines Drachen, der sogar im Tod majestätisch wirkt.\n\nBringe diesen Gegenstand bei den Opfersteinen als Opfer dar.
Spanish: Cabeza de una dragona que no ha perdido ni un ápice de majestuosidad tras la muerte.\n\nHaz una ofrenda en las piedras de sacrificio.
Russian: Голова дракона, величественная даже после смерти.\n\nПринесите ее к жертвенным камням.
Romanian: The head of a dragon, majestic even in the rigor of death.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Bulgarian: The head of a dragon, majestic even in the rigor of death.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Macedonian: The head of a dragon, majestic even in the rigor of death.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Finnish: Lohikäärmeen pää, majesteettinen jopa kuoleman kangistamana.\n\nTarjoa se Uhrauskiville.
Danish: The head of a dragon, majestic even in the rigor of death.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Icelandic: The head of a dragon, majestic even in the rigor of death.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Turkish: Ölümden sonra bile haşmetini koruyan bir ejderha başı.\n\nOnu Kurban Taşları'na adak olarak sun.
Lithuanian: The head of a dragon, majestic even in the rigor of death.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Czech: Hlava draka, majestátní i po smrti.\n\nNabídni ji obětním kamenům.
Hungarian: Egy sárkány feje, amely még a halál szigorában is fenséges látványt nyújt.\n \nFelajánlhatod az áldozati köveknek.
Slovak: Hlava draka, majestátna aj napriek posmrtnej stuhnutosti.\n\nPrines tento dar k Obetným kameňom.
Polish: Głowa smoka, majestatyczna nawet po śmierci.\n\nZłóż w ofierze Kamieniom Ofiarnym.
Dutch: Een drakenkop die zelf in de dood nog iets majesteitelijks uitstraalt.\n\nBied het aan als offer bij de Offerstenen.
Portuguese: A cabeça de um dragão, majestosa até no rigor da morte.\n\nOferece-a às Pedras Sacrificiais.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Uma cabeça de dragão, majestosa mesmo nos rigores da morte.\n\nOfereça às pedras de sacrifício.
Chinese: 一条龙的头，即使它已经死去，但还是威严耸立。 \n\n向祭坛献祭。
Japanese: ドラゴンの頭。 死の苦しみにあっても壮大である。 \n\n犠牲の石に捧げよう。
Korean: 죽음의 고초에도 위엄을 간직하고 있는 용의 머리입니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 身為眾龍之首，即使死了仍威嚴聳立。 \n\n到獻祭石獻祭。

English: Scored with ancient scars, this head was the last sight of countless warriors.
Swedish: Belagt med uråldriga ärr var detta anlete otaliga krigares sista syn i livet.
French: Couturée d'anciennes cicatrices, cette tête a été la dernière vision de bien des guerriers.
Italian: Segnata da cicatrici antiche, questa testa fu l'ultima cosa che videro innumerevoli guerrieri.
German: Voller uralter Narben, war dieser Kopf das Letzte, was zahlreiche Krieger zu Gesicht bekamen.
Spanish: Esta cabeza, que está llena de cicatrices ancestrales, fue lo último que vio un sinfín de guerreros.
Russian: Эта голова, покрытая старыми шрамами, была последним, что увидели многие воины.
Romanian: Scored with ancient scars, this head was the last sight of countless warriors.
Bulgarian: Scored with ancient scars, this head was the last sight of countless warriors.
Macedonian: Scored with ancient scars, this head was the last sight of countless warriors.
Finnish: Monen iänikuisen arven värittämä, tämä pää oli viimeinen näky lukemattomalle määrälle sotureita.
Danish: Scored with ancient scars, this head was the last sight of countless warriors.
Icelandic: Scored with ancient scars, this head was the last sight of countless warriors.
Turkish: Kadim yara izleriyle kaplı bu baş, sayısız savaşçının gördüğü son şey oldu.
Lithuanian: Scored with ancient scars, this head was the last sight of countless warriors.
Czech: Tato hlava se starými jizvami byla posledním pohledem nespočtu válečníků.
Hungarian: Ősi hegek tarkítják ezt a fejet, amelynek a látványa számtalan harcos utolsó pillanatát jelentette.
Slovak: Táto hlava, poznačená starými jazvami bola to posledné čo videlo nespočet bojovníkov.
Polish: Ta głowa, naznaczona bardzo starymi bliznami, była synonimem śmierci dla niezliczonych wojowników.
Dutch: Bedekt met oeroude littekens was dit hoofd het laatste wat talloze krijgers vlak voor hun dood zagen.
Portuguese: Scored with ancient scars, this head was the last sight of countless warriors.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Cheia de cicatrizes, esta cabeça foi a última visão de incontáveis guerreiros.
Chinese: 数不尽的古老伤疤，诉说着千千万万个战士的故事。
Japanese: 数々の古傷に彩られたこの頭は、無数の戦士たちが最後に見たものとなった。
Korean: 오래된 상처들로 채색된 이 머리는, 수 많은 전사들이 마지막으로 본 광경이었습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 在傷痕中看得出，這個臉是無數戰士眼中最後的影像。

Japanese: ドラウグルのトロフィー

English: Bind up the mouth if it starts to whisper in the night...
Swedish: Bind för munnen om den börjar viska i natten...
French: Couvrez lui la bouche s’il commence à murmurer la nuit...
Italian: Cuciti la bocca se inizia a sussurrare durante la notte...
German: Stopfe den Mund, falls er in der Nacht zu flüstern beginnt...
Spanish: Ciérrale la boca si empieza a susurrarte por las noches...
Russian: Если услышите ночью шепот - заткните этой твари рот…
Romanian: Acopera gura daca incepe sa sopteasca noaptea
Bulgarian: Bind up the mouth if it starts to whisper in the night...
Macedonian: Запечати му ја устата ако почне да шепоти во ноќта...
Finnish: Ompele sen huulet yhteen, jos se alkaa kuiskailla yöllä..
Danish: Bind up the mouth if it starts to whisper in the night...
Icelandic: Bindu fyrir munnin ef það byrjar að hvísla um nætur.
Lithuanian: Bind up the mouth if it starts to whisper in the night...
Czech: Pokud začne v noci šeptat tak tomu svažte ústa...
Hungarian: Kösd be a száját, ha éjszaka suttogni kezdene...
Slovak: Zviažte tomu ústa, ak to začne v noci šepkať...
Polish: Przewiąż mu usta, jeśli w nocy zacznie szeptać...
Dutch: Bind de mond dicht als die 's nachts begint te fluisteren…
Portuguese: Se ele começar a sussurrar na noite, ata-lhe a boca.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Se ele começar a sussurrar durante a noite, amarre a boca dele.
Chinese: 它要是在晚上嘀嘀咕咕，就把它的嘴缝起来……
Japanese: 夜中にささやき始めたら口を縫い合わせよう…
Chinese_Traditional: 它要是在晚上嘀嘀咕咕，就把它的嘴縫起來……

Japanese: ドラウグルエリートのトロフィー

English: The dead stare of the glowing red eyes sends a shiver through your bones.
Swedish: Dess döda, rött skinande blick ger dig kalla kårar.
French: Le regard vide de ces yeux rouges et luisants vous donne des frissons.
Italian: Lo sguardo senza vita degli occhi rossi incandescenti ti fa venire i brividi nelle ossa.
German: Der tote Blick dieser leuchtenden roten Augen lässt dir das Blut in den Adern gefrieren.
Spanish: Un escalofrío te recorre todo el cuerpo a causa de la mirada sin vida de esos ojos rojos y brillantes.
Russian: Мертвый взгляд горящих красных глаз пробуждает дрожь в теле.
Romanian: The dead stare of the glowing red eyes sends a shiver through your bones.
Bulgarian: The dead stare of the glowing red eyes sends a shiver through your bones.
Macedonian: The dead stare of the glowing red eyes sends a shiver through your bones.
Finnish: Sen hehkuvien, punaisten silmien kuollut tuijotus saa kylmänvireet kulkemaan selkärankaasi pitkin.
Danish: The dead stare of the glowing red eyes sends a shiver through your bones.
Icelandic: The dead stare of the glowing red eyes sends a shiver through your bones.
Turkish: Parlayan kızıl gözlerdeki o ölü bakış, tüylerinin ürpermesine sebep oluyor.
Lithuanian: The dead stare of the glowing red eyes sends a shiver through your bones.
Czech: Mrtvý pohled zářících rudých očí vám zachvěl skrz kosti.
Hungarian: Az izzó, vörös szemek halott pillantása teljesen megborzongat.
Slovak: Zízajúca smrť z červených žiariacich očí ti roztrasie všetky kosti v tele.
Polish: Martwe spojrzenie świecących czerwonych oczu przyprawia cię o dreszcze.
Dutch: De dode, roodgloeiende ogen staren je aan, en je botten trillen.
Portuguese: The dead stare of the glowing red eyes sends a shiver through your bones.
Portuguese_Brazilian: O brilho avermelhado destes olhos mortos faz arrepiar os seus ossos.
Chinese: 红色的眼睛闪闪发光，死死地盯着你使你背脊发凉。
Japanese: 光る赤い目の死の凝視を見ると、背筋に悪寒が走る。
Korean: 붉게 빛나는 눈동자의 죽은듯한 시선에 등골이 오싹해집니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 紅色的眼睛閃閃發光，死死地盯著你使你背脊發涼。

Japanese: エイクスュルのトロフィー

English: This severed head oozes power.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Swedish: Det avkapade huvudet osar med kraft. \n\nHäng upp det på en sten i cirkeln.
French: Cette tête coupée regorge de puissance.\n\nOffrez-la aux Pierres sacrificielles.
Italian: Questa testa mozzata trasuda potere.  \n\nOffrila alle Pietre Sacrificali.
German: Dieser abgetrennte Kopf verströmt eine große Macht.\n\nBringe diesen Gegenstand bei den Opfersteinen als Opfer dar.
Spanish: Esta cabeza decapitada exuda poder.\n\nHaz una ofrenda en las piedras de sacrificio.
Russian: Эта отрубленная голова источает силу.\n\nПринесите ее к жертвенным камням.
Romanian: This severed head oozes power.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Bulgarian: This severed head oozes power.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Macedonian: This severed head oozes power.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Finnish: Tämä katkaistu pää tihkuu voimaa.\n\nTarjoa se Uhrauskiville.
Danish: This severed head oozes power.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Icelandic: Úr þessum haus blæðir ótrúlegir kraftar\n\nFarðu með hann til fórnsteinanna
Turkish: Bu kesik baştan güç sızıyor.\n\nOnu Kurban Taşları'na adak olarak sun.
Lithuanian: This severed head oozes power.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Czech: Tato oddělená hlava vyzařuje energii.\n\nNábídni ji obětním kamenům.
Hungarian: Ebből a levágott fejből áramlik az erő.\n\nFelajánlhatod az áldozati köveknek.
Slovak:
Táto odseknutá hlava vyžaruje silu.

Prines tento dar k Obetným kameňom.
Polish: Ta odcięta głowa emanuje mocą.\n\nZłóż w ofierze Kamieniom Ofiarnym.
Dutch: Dit afgehakte hoofd straalt kracht uit.\n\nBied het aan als offer bij de Offerstenen.
Portuguese: Esta cabeça degolada exala poder.\n\nOferece-a às Pedras Sacrificiais.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Esta cabeça decepada exala poder.\n\nOfereça às pedras de sacrifício.
Chinese: 你似乎能感到这头颅里无形的力量。 \n\n向祭坛献祭。
Japanese: 切り落とされたこの首はパワーを発している。 \n\n犠牲の石に捧げよう。
Korean: 잘려진 머리가 힘을 발산하고 있습니다. \n\n제물석에 바치십시오.
Chinese_Traditional: 你似乎能感到這頭顱裡無形的力量。 \n\n到獻祭石獻祭。

English: Once the king of the forest, the size of the antlers are truly impressive.
Swedish: En gång skogens konung. Storleken på hans krona är mäkta imponerande.
French: Autrefois roi de la forêt, la taille de ses bois est très impressionnante.
Italian: In passato è stato il re della foresta, la taglia delle corna è davvero impressionante.
German: Die Größe des Geweihs des einst so stolzen König des Waldes ist wirklich beeindruckend.
Spanish: Antaño era el rey de los bosques, y el tamaño de su cornamenta es impresionante.
Russian: Размеры рогов бывшего лесного короля действительно впечатляют.
Romanian: Once the king of the forest, the size of the antlers are truly impressive.
Bulgarian: Once the king of the forest, the size of the antlers are truly impressive.
Macedonian: Once the king of the forest, the size of the antlers are truly impressive.
Finnish: Kerran metsien kuningas, näiden sarvien koko on kerrassaan vaikuttava.
Danish: Once the king of the forest, the size of the antlers are truly impressive.
Icelandic: Eitt sinn konungur skógarins, stærð hornanna eru óttaleg
Turkish: Bir zamanlar ormanın kralı olan bu yaratığın boynuzlarının boyutu gerçekten muazzam.
Lithuanian: Once the king of the forest, the size of the antlers are truly impressive.
Czech: Dříve králem lesa, velikost paroží je opravdu působivá.
Hungarian: Egykoron az erdő királya volt. A szarvai valóban lenyűgözők.
Slovak: Veľkosť parožia tohto bývalého kráľa lesa je skutočne pôsobivá.\n
Polish: Niegdyś wielki król lasów. Wielkość tego poroża jest naprawdę imponująca.
Dutch: Eens de koning van het woud. De grootte van het gewei is zeer indrukwekkend.
Portuguese: Outrora o rei da floresta, o tamanho dos chifres é realmente impressionante.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Outrora o rei da floresta, o tamanho da galhada é muito impressionante.
Chinese: 作为曾经的森林之王，它角的尺寸着实让人惊叹。
Japanese: かつては森の王であった。 角の大きさには感嘆するしかない。
Korean: 한때는 숲의 제왕이었던 자, 그 뿔의 크기도 정말 인상적이다.
Chinese_Traditional: 前森林之王的角，它的尺寸確實讓人驚嘆不而。

English: This severed head oozes power.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Swedish: Det avkapade huvudet osar av kraft. \n\nHäng upp det på en sten i cirkeln.
French: Cette tête coupée regorge de puissance.\n\nOffrez-la aux Pierres sacrificielles.
Italian: Questa testa mozzata trasuda potere.  \n\nOffrila alle Pietre Sacrificali.
German: Dieser abgetrennte Kopf verströmt eine große Macht.\n\nBringe diesen Gegenstand bei den Opfersteinen als Opfer dar.
Spanish: Esta cabeza decapitada exuda poder.\n\nHaz una ofrenda en las piedras de sacrificio.
Russian: Эта отрубленная голова источает силу.\n\nПринесите ее к жертвенным камням.
Romanian: This severed head oozes power.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Bulgarian: This severed head oozes power.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Macedonian: This severed head oozes power.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Finnish: Tämä katkaistu pää tihkuu voimaa.\n\nTarjoa se Uhrauskiville.
Danish: This severed head oozes power.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Icelandic: Úr þessum haus blæðir ótrúlegir kraftar\n\nFarðu með hann til fórnsteinanna
Turkish: Bu kesik baştan güç sızıyor.\n\nOnu Kurban Taşları'na adak olarak sun.
Lithuanian: This severed head oozes power.\n\nOffer it to the Sacrificial Stones.
Czech: Tato oddělená hlava vyzařuje energii.\n\nNábídni ji obětním kamenům.
Hungarian: Ebből a levágott fejből áramlik az erő.\n\nFelajánlhatod az áldozati köveknek.
Slovak: Táto odseknutá hlava vyžaruje silu.\n\nPrines tento dar k Obetným kameňom.
Polish: Ta odcięta głowa emanuje mocą.\n\nZłóż w ofierze Kamieniom Ofiarnym.
Dutch: Dit afgehakte hoofd straalt kracht uit.\n\nBied het aan als offer bij de Offerstenen.
Portuguese: Esta cabeça degolada exala poder.\n\nOferece-a às Pedras Sacrificiais.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Esta cabeça decepada exala poder.\n\nOfereça às pedras de sacrifício.
Chinese:
这干瘪的头颅上的死去的皮感觉非常沉重。 


向祭坛献祭。
Japanese: 切り落とされたこの首はパワーを発している。 \n\n犠牲の石に捧げよう。
Korean: 잘려진 머리가 힘을 발산하고 있습니다. \n\n제물석에 바쳐십시오.
Chinese_Traditional:
這乾癟的頭顱上的死去的皮感覺非常沉重。 


到獻祭石獻祭。

English: Even in death, it seems to grin with secret knowledge.
Swedish: Även död tycks den flina med hemlig kunskap.
French: Même dans la mort, il a l'air de sourire avec des connaissances secrètes.
Italian: Persino nella morte, sembra sorridere con una conoscenza segreta.
German: Selbst im Tode scheint es noch über Sachen zu grinsen, die nur es weiß.
Spanish: Aún tras la muerte, parece sonreír guardándose su sabiduría.
Russian: Даже смерть не смогла стереть с его лица таинственную, всезнающую ухмылку.
Romanian: Even in death, it seems to grin with secret knowledge.
Bulgarian: Even in death, it seems to grin with secret knowledge.
Macedonian: Дури и во смрт, уште се смешка со своето тајно знаење.
Finnish: Jopa kuolleenakin, se näyttää virnistelevän täynnä salaista tietämystä.
Danish: Even in death, it seems to grin with secret knowledge.
Icelandic: Jafnvel í dauða, þá virðist það glotta.
Turkish: Ölüyken bile taşıdığı gizli irfanla sırıtıyor gibi görünüyor.
Lithuanian: Even in death, it seems to grin with secret knowledge.
Czech: I po smrti se zdá že se usmívá s tajnými znalostmi.
Hungarian: A halála után is mintha titkos tudás vigyora terülne el az arcán.
Slovak: Zdá sa, že aj po smrti sa uškŕňa, akoby vedel niečo čo my nie.\n
Polish: Nawet po śmierci wydaje się uśmiechać tak, jakby posiadał jakąś tajemną wiedzę.
Dutch: Zelfs dood lijkt de grijns een geheime kennis uit te stralen.
Portuguese: Mesmo na morte, ele parece sorrir com conhecimento secreto.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Mesmo na morte, todo o conhecimento secreto parece fazê-lo sorrir.
Chinese: 虽然它已经死亡，但好像在咧着嘴笑，倾吐着各种奥秘。
Japanese: 死して尚、秘密の知識を隠してほくそ笑んでいるように見える。
Korean: 사후에도 비밀스러운 지식을 품은듯이 미소를 짓고 있는 것 같습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 即使已經死去，但看起來像在嘲笑著我們的無知。

Japanese: フェンリングのトロフィー

English: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Swedish: Halvvägs mellan ulv och man, dess anlete fruset i en smärtad grimas.
French: Moitié homme, moitié loup, son visage est défiguré par un rugissement de douleur.
Italian: Metà uomo, metà lupo, il viso è bloccato in un ringhiare di dolore.
German: Halb Mensch, halb Wolf steht diesem Gesicht noch immer das letzte Todesfauchen ins Gesicht geschrieben.
Spanish: Medio hombre y medio lobo. Su rostro vive con una mueca de sufrimiento constante.
Russian: Наполовину волк, наполовину человек — его лицо застыло в гримасе боли.
Romanian: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Bulgarian: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Macedonian: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Finnish: Puoliksi mies, puoliksi susi. Sen kuolleet kasvot jäätyneinä murisemaan kivusta.
Danish: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Icelandic: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Turkish: Yarı kurt yarı insan olan bu yaratığın suratında acı dolu bir hırlayış donup kalmış.
Lithuanian: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Czech: Na půl vlk a člověk, tvář zmrzlá bolestí.
Hungarian: Félúton egy farkas és egy ember között. A pofája fájdalmas mordulásban merevedett meg.
Slovak: Na polceste medzi vlkom a človekom a jeho tvár stuhnutá v bolestnom vrčaní.
Polish: Pół wilk, pół człowiek – jego twarz zastygła w grymasie bólu.
Dutch: Half wolf en half mens, een gezicht dat is vastgezet in een grauw van pijn.
Portuguese: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Metade homem, metade lobo, o rosto está paralisado num rosnado de dor.
Chinese: 亦狼亦人，它的脸定格在了最扭曲痛苦的瞬间。
Japanese: 半狼半人。 その顔は痛みの唸りに凍りついている。
Korean: 늑대와 인간의 사이, 그것의 얼굴은 고통스러운 순간속에 굳어져 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 亦狼亦人，它的臉定格在了最扭曲痛苦的瞬間。

English: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Swedish: Halvvägs mellan ulv och man, dess anlete fruset i en smärtad grimas.
French: Moitié homme, moitié loup, son visage est défiguré par un rugissement de douleur.
Italian: metà uomo, metà lupo, il viso è bloccato in un ringhiare di dolore.
German: Halb Mensch, halb Wolf steht diesem Gesicht noch immer das letzte Todesfauchen ins Gesicht geschrieben.
Spanish: Medio hombre y medio lobo. Su rostro vive con una mueca de sufrimiento constante.
Russian: Наполовину волк, наполовину человек — его лицо застыло в гримасе боли.
Romanian: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Bulgarian: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Macedonian: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Finnish: Puoliksi mies, puoliksi susi. Sen kuolleet kasvot jäätyneinä murisemaan kivusta.
Danish: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Icelandic: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Turkish: Yarı kurt yarı insan olan bu yaratığın suratında acı dolu bir hırlayış donup kalmış.
Lithuanian: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Czech: Na půl vlk a člověk, tvář zmrzlá bolestí.
Hungarian: Félúton egy farkas és egy ember között. A pofája fájdalmas mordulásban merevedett meg.
Slovak: Na polceste medzi vlkom a človekom a jeho tvár stuhnutá v bolestnom vrčaní.
Polish: Pół wilk, pół człowiek – jego twarz zastygła w grymasie bólu.
Dutch: Half wolf en half mens, een gezicht dat is vastgezet in een grauw van pijn.
Portuguese: Half-way between wolf and man, its face frozen in a snarl of pain.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Metade homem, metade lobo, o rosto está paralisado num rosnado de dor
Chinese: 亦狼亦人，它的脸定格在了最扭曲痛苦的瞬间。
Japanese: 半狼半人。 その顔は痛みの唸りに凍りついている。
Korean: 늑대와 인간의 사이, 그것의 얼굴은 고통스러운 순간속에 굳어져 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 亦狼亦人，它的臉定格在了最扭曲痛苦的瞬間。

French: Trophée de troll de la forêt
Japanese: 森のトロルのトロフィー

English: The leathery skin bears the faded tracery of ancient symbols.
Swedish: Den läderartade huden bär spår från uråldriga symboler.
French: D’anciens symboles ternis par le temps ornent cette peau coriace.
Italian: La pelle coriacea porta i segni sbiaditi dei simboli antichi.
German: Die ledrige Haut trägt die Überreste uralter Symbole.
Spanish: La piel de cuero cuenta con una tracería apenas visible de símbolos ancestrales.
Russian: На грубой коже едва различимы какие-то древние символы.
Romanian: Pielea carpita are semne antice pe ea
Bulgarian: The leathery skin bears the faded tracery of ancient symbols.
Finnish: Sen nahkainen iho kantaa muinaisia, häivyttyneitä jälkiä vanhoista symbooleista.
Danish: The leathery skin bears the faded tracery of ancient symbols.
Icelandic: Leðurkenda húðin ber ummerki á sér af gömlum táknum.
Turkish: Trolün kösele gibi derisi, kadim sembollerin solmuş izlerini taşıyor.
Lithuanian: The leathery skin bears the faded tracery of ancient symbols.
Czech: Drsná kůže nese vybledlou kružbu starověkých symbolů.
Hungarian: A bőr ősi szimbólumok megfakult körvonalát viseli magán.
Slovak: Zhrubnutá pokožka vykazuje stopy kružby so starodávnymi symbolmi.\n
Polish: Szorstka skóra nosi ślady maswerków ze starożytnymi symbolami.
Dutch: De leerachtige huid bevat vervaagde sporen van oeroude symbolen.
Portuguese: A pele semelhante a couro com sinais desvanecidos de símbolos antigos.
Portuguese_Brazilian: A pele curtida exibe traços de símbolos antigos esmaecidos.
Chinese: 皮革般的皮肤上隐约可现古老印记的痕迹。
Japanese: 革のような肌には古代の紋章の消えかけた痕跡が並んでいる。
Korean: 가죽 같은 피부에는 흐릿해진 고대의 기호가 남아 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 粗糙的皮膚上帶有褪色的古老符號花紋。

Spanish: Trofeo del trol de la escarcha
Japanese: 霜のトロルのトロフィー

English: The eyes still glitter and swirl with silvery flecks. Don't look into them for too long...
Swedish: Ögonen virvlar fortfarande med glittrande fläckar. Titta inte i dem för länge...
French: Ses yeux brillent encore de mille feux argentés. Évitez de les regarder trop longtemps...
Italian: Gli occhi brillano ancora e si agitano con riflessi argentati. Non guardarli troppo a lungo ...
German: Silbrige Flecken glitzern und kreisen noch immer in den Augäpfeln. Lass deinen Blick nicht zu lange auf diesen Augen ruhen …
Spanish: Aún se ve el brillo de unas motas plateadas en los ojos. Será mejor que no te los quedes mirando...
Russian: В глазах тролля затаился жуткий серебристый блеск. Лучше в них не всматриваться…
Romanian: Ochii inca stralucesc cu lumini argintii. Nu te uita prea mult in ei...
Bulgarian: The eyes still glitter and swirl with silvery flecks. Don't look into them for too long...
Macedonian: Очите уште светат со јак блесок. Не гледај во нив предолго..
Finnish: Hopeat laikut sen silmissä kieppuvat ja kimaltelevat yhä. Parempi olla katsomatta niihin liian kauaa..
Danish: The eyes still glitter and swirl with silvery flecks. Don't look into them for too long...
Icelandic: Augun glitra og sveiflast með silfruðum flekkjum. Ekki stara í þau of lengi.
Turkish: Gözlerinin içindeki gümüş renkli benekler hâlâ parıldayıp fırıl fırıl dönüyor. Uzun süre bakma...
Lithuanian: The eyes still glitter and swirl with silvery flecks. Don't look into them for too long...
Czech: Oči se stále třpytí a víří stříbrnými skvrnami. Nedívejte se do nich příliš dlouho...
Hungarian: A szemek még mindig az ezüstös pöttyöktöl csillognak, és kavarognak. Ne nézz túl sokáig beléjük...
Slovak: Oči sa stále trblietajú a víria striebristými škvrnami. Nepozerajte sa do nich príliš dlho...\n
Polish: W tych wciąż błyszczących oczach wirują srebrzyste drobinki. Nie patrz w nie zbyt długo...
Dutch: De ogen fonkelen nog vol zilverige vlekken. Kijk er maar niet te lang in…
Portuguese: Os olhos ainda brilham e contêm salpicos prateados. Não olhes para eles durante muito tempo...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Os olhos ainda giram e cintilam com um brilho prateado, mas não fique olhando por muito tempo...
Chinese: 眼睛上银色的斑点仍在闪烁转动。 不要盯着它太久……
Japanese: その目には未だに銀色の輝きが渦巻いている。 あまり長い間見続けない方がいい…
Korean: 눈 앞이 아직 반짝이고 은색 얼룩이 아른거립니다. 너무 오랫동안 쳐다보지 마십시오. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 眼睛上銀色的斑點仍在閃爍轉動。 不要盯著它太久……

Slovak: Oči sa stále trblietajú a víria striebristými škvrnami. Nepozerajte sa do nich príliš dlho ...\n
Polish: W tych wciąż błyszczących oczach wirują srebrzyste drobinki. Nie patrz w nie zbyt długo...

Chinese_Traditional: 眼睛上銀色的斑點仍在閃爍轉動。 不要盯著它太久……

Japanese: フューリングのトロフィー

English: Loose folds of greenish skin gathered in around a pair of dark and hateful eyes.
Swedish: Löst hängande grönaktigt skinn samlat runt ett par mörka, hatiska ögon.
French: Des plis lâches de peau verdâtre se sont rassemblés autour d'une paire de yeux sombres et détestables.
Italian: Pieghe sciolte di pelle verdastra raccolte intorno a un paio di occhi scuri e odiosi.
German: Labbrige Falten grüner Haut rahmen ein Paar dunkler, hasserfüllter Augen.
Spanish: Pliegues de piel floja y verde alrededor de un par de ojos oscuros y bañados en odio.
Russian: Вокруг темных, злобных глаз собрались складки обвисшей, зеленоватой кожи.
Romanian: Loose folds of greenish skin gathered in around a pair of dark and hateful eyes.
Bulgarian: Loose folds of greenish skin gathered in around a pair of dark and hateful eyes.
Macedonian: Loose folds of greenish skin gathered in around a pair of dark and hateful eyes.
Finnish: Silmäpari, tummat ja vihaa täynnä, kehystettynä väljillä kerroksilla vihreähköä ihoa.
Danish: Loose folds of greenish skin gathered in around a pair of dark and hateful eyes.
Icelandic: Loose folds of greenish skin gathered in around a pair of dark and hateful eyes.
Turkish: Gevşek ve yeşil deri katmanları bir çift kara ve nefret dolu gözün çevresinde toplanmış.
Lithuanian: Loose folds of greenish skin gathered in around a pair of dark and hateful eyes.
Czech: Volné záhyby zelené kůže kolem páru temných očí plné nenávisti.
Hungarian: Zöld, megereszkedett bőr egy pár sötét és gyűlölködő szem köré csoportosulva.
Slovak: Prevysajúce záhyby nazelenalej kože okolo dvojice tmavých a nenávistných očí.
Polish: Luźne fałdy zielonkawej skóry zebrane wokół pary ciemnych i nienawistnych oczu.
Dutch: Losse, groene huidplooien rond een paar donkere, haatdragende ogen.
Portuguese: Pregas soltas de pele esverdeada, em volta de um par de olhos negros e cheios de ódio.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Pregas soltas de pele esverdeada envolvendo um par de olhos negros e cheios de ódio.
Chinese: 一双黑暗而愤恨的眼睛，周围堆积着松垮垮的绿色皮肤。
Japanese: 暗い憎しみを宿した両目の周囲に集まった、たるんだひだを持つ緑がかった皮膚。
Korean: 어둠과 증오가 가득한 눈 주위를 주름진 초록색 피부가 뒤덮고 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 一雙黑暗而憤恨的眼睛，周圍堆積著鬆垮垮的綠色皮膚。

Japanese: フューリングバーサーカーのトロフィー

English: The huge grizzled head is as heavy as a boulder.
Swedish: Det enorma, gråsprängda huvudet är tungt som sten.
French: Cette énorme tête grisonnante est aussi lourde qu'un gros rocher.
Italian: Questa enorme testa brizzolata è grande quanto un masso.
German: Dieser große grauhaarige Kopf ist schwer wie ein Felsen.
Spanish: Una cabeza canosa que pesa tanto como un peñasco.
Russian: Огромная седая голова, тяжелая, как валун.
Romanian: The huge grizzled head is as heavy as a boulder.
Bulgarian: The huge grizzled head is as heavy as a boulder.
Macedonian: The huge grizzled head is as heavy as a boulder.
Finnish: Sen suuri, arpinen pää vetää painollaan vertaa kivenlohkareelle.
Danish: The huge grizzled head is as heavy as a boulder.
Icelandic: The huge grizzled head is as heavy as a boulder.
Turkish: Bu koca boz kafa, bir kaya kadar ağır.
Lithuanian: The huge grizzled head is as heavy as a boulder.
Czech: Obrovská prošedivělá hlava je těžká jako balvan.
Hungarian: A hatalmas, ezüstös fej olyan nehéz, mint egy szikla.
Slovak: Obrovská zašedivená hlava je ťažká ako balvan.\n
Polish: Ta ogromna, siwa głowa jest ciężka niczym głaz.
Dutch: Het enorme, gepokte gezicht is zo zwaar als een rots.
Portuguese: The huge grizzled head is as heavy as a boulder.
Portuguese_Brazilian: A enorme cabeça grisalha é pesada como um pedregulho
Chinese: 巨大斑驳的头颅和一块巨石一样重。
Japanese: 灰色の大きな頭は、岩のように重い。
Chinese_Traditional: 灰白的巨大頭顱就和一塊巨石一樣重。

Romanian: ヤグルスのトロフィー

English: The crownless head of a dead king.
French: La tête nue d'un roi mort.
Italian: La testa senza corona di un re morto.
German: Der ungekrönte Kopf eines toten Königs.
Spanish: La cabeza sin corona de un rey muerto.
Romanian: The crownless head of a dead king.
Bulgarian: The crownless head of a dead king.
Macedonian: The crownless head of a dead king.
Danish: The crownless head of a dead king.
Icelandic: The crownless head of a dead king.
Lithuanian: The crownless head of a dead king.
Hungarian: Egy halott király korona nélküli feje.
Dutch: Het kroonloze hoofd van een dode koning.
Portuguese: The crownless head of a dead king.
Portuguese_Brazilian: A cabeça sem coroa de um rei morto.
Japanese: 死せる王の冠のない頭。

English: Sometimes, the eyes still move and the lips mutter silently...
Swedish: Ibland rör sig ögonen, och läpparna yttrar tysta ord...
French: Parfois, ses yeux bougent encore et ses lèvres articulent sans bruit.
Italian: A volte, gli occhi si muovono ancora e le labbra borbottano in silenzio...
German: Manchmal bewegen sich die Augen noch immer und die Lippen fangen an, still zu flüstern...
Spanish: A veces, los ojos se mueven y los labios murmuran en silencio…
Russian: Иногда его глаза двигаются, а губы тихо бормочут что-то...
Romanian: Sometimes, the eyes still move and the lips mutter silently...
Bulgarian: Sometimes, the eyes still move and the lips mutter silently...
Macedonian: Sometimes, the eyes still move and the lips mutter silently...
Finnish: Ajoittain sen silmät liikkuvat vieläkin ja sen huulet mutisevat hiljaa...
Danish: Sometimes, the eyes still move and the lips mutter silently...
Icelandic: Sometimes, the eyes still move and the lips mutter silently...
Turkish: Kimi zaman gözleri hâlâ kıpırdayıp dudakları sessizce bir şeyler fısıldıyor...
Lithuanian: Sometimes, the eyes still move and the lips mutter silently...
Czech: Někdy se oči stále pohybují a rty tiše mumlají...
Hungarian: A szemek néha még mozognak, az ajkak pedig csendben motyognak...
Slovak: Oči sa niekedy stále hýbu a pery ticho mrmlajú...
Polish: Czasem oczy wciąż się poruszają, a usta cicho mruczą...
Dutch: Soms bewegen de ogen nog steeds, en fluisteren de lippen stil…
Portuguese: Às vezes, os olhos ainda se movem e os lábios murmuram silenciosamente...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Às vezes, os olhos se movem e os lábios murmuram em silêncio…
Chinese: 有时候他的眼睛会动，有时候他会喃喃自语...
Japanese: 時々、その目が動き、唇が静かに何かをつぶやく...
Korean: 때때로 그의 눈이 움직이며 그의 입술이 묵묵히 무언가를 중얼거리곤 합니다. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 有時候他的眼睛會動，有時候他會喃喃自語...

Japanese: フューリングシャーマンのトロフィー

English: Even killing it couldn't wipe the knowing smile from its crooked lips...
Swedish: Inte ens döden kunde sudda ut det menande hånleendet från dess läppar...
French: Même la mort n'a pas pu effacer ce sourire rusé de ses lèvres tordues...
Italian: Neanche la morte ha potuto disfare quel sorriso saccente da quelle labbra storte...
German: Selbst im Angesicht des Todes hat sich dieser Schamane sein Augurenlächeln erhalten.
Spanish: Ni siquiera la muerte le ha borrado esa sonrisa socarrona que lleva plasmada en el rostro…
Russian: Даже смерть не смогла стереть всезнающую улыбку с его кривых губ...
Romanian: Even killing it couldn't wipe the knowing smile from its crooked lips...
Bulgarian: Even killing it couldn't wipe the knowing smile from its crooked lips...
Macedonian: Even killing it couldn't wipe the knowing smile from its crooked lips...
Finnish: Kuolemakaan ei pystynyt pyyhkimään kaikkitietävää hymyä sen kieroilta huulilta.
Danish: Even killing it couldn't wipe the knowing smile from its crooked lips...
Icelandic: Even killing it couldn't wipe the knowing smile from its crooked lips...
Turkish: Bu yaratığı öldürmek bile çarpık dudaklarındaki bilgiç sırıtışı silmeye yetmedi...
Lithuanian: Even killing it couldn't wipe the knowing smile from its crooked lips...
Czech: Dokonce i zabití nemohlo sundat úsměv z jeho křivých rtů...
Hungarian: Még a megölése sem volt képes letörölni a ravasz mosolyt a görbe ajkairól...
Slovak: Ani smrť nevymazala ten úsmev z jeho skrútených pier...
Polish: Nawet śmierć nie starła tego uśmiechu z jego wykrzywionych ust...
Dutch: Zelfs al is hij dood, toch heeft hij nog zo'n wetende grijns op z'n tronie…
Portuguese: Even killing it couldn't wipe the knowing smile from its crooked lips...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Nem a morte conseguiu tirar esse sorrisinho de seus lábios tortos.
Chinese: 就算杀掉他也不能抹去他诡谲的微笑...
Japanese: 死んでいてもなお、歪んだ唇の笑みは消し去れない...
Korean: 죽였는데도 그 비뚫린 입가에 맺힌 알고있는 듯한 미소는 지울 수 없었습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 即使殺掉他也不能抹去他詭譎的微笑...

Japanese: 灰色ドワーフのトロフィー

English: The mossy, severed head of a Greydwarf.
Swedish: Det mossiga, avkapade huvudet från en Grådvärg.
French: La tête moussue et tranchée d’un Naingris.
Italian: La testa mozzata e muschiata di un nano grigio
German: Ein moosbewachsener, abgetrennter Kopf eines Grauzwergs.
Spanish: La cabeza cortada y musgosa de un grisucio.
Bulgarian: The mossy, severed head of a Greydwarf.
Macedonian: Пресечената глава на џуџе уште има мов.
Danish: The mossy, severed head of a Greydwarf.
Lithuanian: The mossy, severed head of a Greydwarf.
Polish: Pokryta mchem, odcięta głowa Szarego karła.
Dutch: Het mossige, afgehakte hoofd van een Grijze dwerg.
Portuguese: A cabeça de um Anão Cinzento, coberta de musgo.
Portuguese_Brazilian: A cabeça coberta de musgo de um Anão Cinzento.
Chinese: 灰矮人被砍掉的头颅，长满了苔藓。
Japanese: 灰色ドワーフの苔むした生首。
Korean: 이끼로 뒤덮인 그레이 드워프의 잘린 머리입니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 從灰矮人身上砍下來的頭顱，長滿了苔蘚。

Italian: Trofeo della bestia dei nani grigi
Japanese: 灰色ドワーフの暴漢のトロフィー

English: It took seven blows to hack this gnarled head from its body.
Swedish: Det krävdes sju slag för att hacka loss detta knotiga huvud från sin kropp.
French: 7 coups auront été nécessaires pour ôter cette tête nouée à son corps.
Italian: Ci sono voluti sette colpi per separare questa testa nodosa dal suo corpo.
German: Es benötigte sieben Schläge, um den knorrigen Kopf von seinen Schultern zu trennen.
Spanish: Hicieron falta siete golpes para arrancarle esa cabeza retorcida del cuerpo.
Russian: Отсечь эту голову оказалось делом не из легких - потребовалось без малого семь ударов.
Romanian: It took seven blows to hack this gnarled head from its body.
Bulgarian: It took seven blows to hack this gnarled head from its body.
Macedonian: Ми требаа седум удари за да ја пресечам главата.
Finnish: Vei seitsemän iskua että sait hakattua tämän kyhmyisen pään irti sen kehosta.
Danish: It took seven blows to hack this gnarled head from its body.
Icelandic: Það tók sjö högg til þess að kljúfa haus af líkamanum.
Turkish: Bu boğumlu başı gövdesinden ayırmak için yedi darbe indirmen gerekti.
Lithuanian: It took seven blows to hack this gnarled head from its body.
Czech: Trvalo sedm úderů, než byla tato sukovitá hlava vyříznuta z těla.
Hungarian: Hét csapásba telt elválasztani ezt az eldeformált fejet a testétől.
Slovak: Trvalo to sedem úderov vyseknúť túto pokrútenú hlavu z toho tela.
Polish: Trzeba było siedmiu uderzeń, by odciąć tę wykrzywioną głowę od reszty ciała.
Dutch: Het koste zeven slagen om dit knoestige hoofd van het lichaam te scheiden.
Portuguese: Foram precisos sete golpes para separar esta cabeça deformada do resto do corpo.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Foram necessários sete golpes para separar esta cabeça deformada do resto do corpo.
Chinese: 足足砍了七下，才从身体上砍下这颗扭曲的头颅。
Japanese: このゴツゴツした生首を胴体から切り離すには7回も叩き切る必要があった。
Korean: 무기를 일곱 번이나 휘두른 끝에 이 쭈글쭈글한 머리를 잘라낼 수 있었습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 足足砍了七下，才從身體上砍下這顆扭曲的頭顱。

Italian: Trofeo dello sciamano dei nani grigi
Japanese: 灰色ドワーフのシャーマンのトロフィー

English: It may try to come back so be sure to prune any new shoots...
Swedish: Den kan försöka komma tillbaka, så var noga med att beskära alla nya skott...
French: Il pourrait essayer de revenir, alors taillez bien vos nouvelles pousses...
Italian: Potrebbe provare a tornare in vita quindi assicurati di esser pronto a colpirla di nuovo se necessario...
German: Es kann versuchen sich wieder zum Leben zu erwecken. Schneide jeden neuen Trieb augenblicklich ab...
Spanish: Podría regresar, así que no te olvides de cortar los brotes...
Russian: Эти твари способны возвращаться из мертвых, так что если заметите новые побеги, смело их отсекайте…
Romanian: It may try to come back so be sure to prune any new shoots...
Bulgarian: It may try to come back so be sure to prune any new shoots...
Macedonian: Можеби ќе се обиде да се врати, затоа биди спремен за уште...
Finnish: Muista karsia kaikki uudet vesot irti. Se saattaa yrittää tulla vielä takaisin...
Danish: It may try to come back so be sure to prune any new shoots...
Icelandic: Það mun reyna að koma aftur svo vertu viss um að eyðileggja allar rætur sem gætu sprottið upp
Turkish: Geri dönmeye kalkabilir, bu yüzden yeni filizleri budamayı ihmal etme...
Lithuanian: It may try to come back so be sure to prune any new shoots...
Czech: Může se to pokusit vrátit, takže ořízněte všechny nové výhonky...
Hungarian: Még megpróbálhat visszatérni az életbe, szóval ne felejtsd el lenyesni az esetleges sarjakat...
Slovak: Môže sa to pokúsiť vrátiť, takže všetky nové výhonky rýchlo orezať ...
Polish: Może próbować wrócić, więc pamiętaj o przycięciu wszelkich nowych pędów...
Dutch: Het kan terugkomen, dus zorg dat je nieuwe scheuten bijtijds verwijdert…
Portuguese: Ele pode tentar voltar, por isso não te esqueças de cortar quaisquer novos rebentos...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Ele pode tentar voltar, por isso não se esqueça de cortar qualquer broto novo que aparecer...
Chinese: 它可能会回来，注意修剪新枝……
Japanese: 万が一にも蘇らないよう、時々新芽を摘み取りに来た方がいいだろう…
Korean: 되살아날지도 모르니 잊지 말고 새싹을 전부 잘라내십시오.
Chinese_Traditional: 它也許會回歸，確保修剪任何新生的枝芽…
