English: Don't forget to upgrade your crafting stations, weapons and armor.
Swedish: Glöm inte att uppgradera verkstäder, vapen, och pansar.
French: N'oubliez pas d'améliorer vos établis, armes et armures.
Italian: Don't forget to upgrade your crafting stations, weapons and armor.
German: Vergiss nicht, deine Handwerksstationen, Waffen und Rüstungen aufzuwerten.
Spanish: No te olvides de mejorar las estaciones de elaboración, armas y armaduras.
Russian: Не забывайте улучшать свои ремесленные стойки, оружие и броню.
Romanian: Don't forget to upgrade your crafting stations, weapons and armor.
Bulgarian: Don't forget to upgrade your crafting stations, weapons and armor.
Macedonian: Don't forget to upgrade your crafting stations, weapons and armor.
Finnish: Älä unohda päivittää työpöytiäsi, aseitasi ja haarniskaasi.
Danish: Don't forget to upgrade your crafting stations, weapons and armor.
Icelandic: Ekki gleyma að uppfæra vinnustöðina, vopn, og brynjur.
Turkish: Üretim istasyonlarınızı, silahlarınızı ve zırhınızı geliştirmeyi unutmayın.
Lithuanian: Don't forget to upgrade your crafting stations, weapons and armor.
Czech: Nezapomeň vylepšovat tvoje výrobní stoly, zbraně a brnění.
Hungarian: Ne feledkezz meg a barkácsállomásaid, fegyvereid és páncéljaid fejlesztéséről!
Slovak: Don't forget to upgrade your crafting stations, weapons and armor.
Polish: Nie zapomnij ulepszać swoich warsztatów, broni i zbroi.
Dutch: Vergeet niet om je productiestations, wapens en harnassen te upgraden.
Portuguese: Don't forget to upgrade your crafting stations, weapons and armor.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Não se esqueça de melhorar suas bancadas de fabrico, armas e armaduras.
Chinese: 别忘了对你的制作台，武器和护甲升级
Japanese: 作成設備、武器、アーマーをアップグレードするのを忘れずに。
Korean: 제작 작업대, 무기 및 방어구를 업그레이드하는 것을 잊지 마십시오.
Chinese_Traditional: 別忘了對你的工作檯，武器和護甲升級

English: Eating food increases your health and stamina pools. Try to balance your three food slots accordingly.
Swedish: Att äta ökar maximal hälsa och energi. Försök balansera din kost för att maximera dess effekt.
French: Manger de la nourriture augmente vos réserves de vie et d'endurance. Essayez d'équilibrer vos trois emplacements de nourriture.
Italian: Eating food increases your health and stamina pools. Try to balance your three food slots accordingly.
German: Der Verzehr von Nahrung erhöht deinen Gesundheits- und Ausdauervorrat. Versuche, dir deine drei Nahrungs-Slots weise einzuteilen.
Spanish: Comer te aumenta la salud y el vigor. Tenlo en cuenta a la hora de encontrar el equilibrio en las tres ranuras de comida.
Russian: Потребление пищи увеличивает запас здоровья и выносливости. Постарайтесь поддерживать равное соотношение в слотах для еды.
Romanian: Eating food increases your health and stamina pools. Try to balance your three food slots accordingly.
Bulgarian: Eating food increases your health and stamina pools. Try to balance your three food slots accordingly.
Macedonian: Eating food increases your health and stamina pools. Try to balance your three food slots accordingly.
Finnish: Ruoan syöminen parantaa elämän ja energian kestoa. Yritä tasapainoittaa kolme ruokaslottia sen mukaisesti.
Danish: Eating food increases your health and stamina pools. Try to balance your three food slots accordingly.
Icelandic: Að borða mat bætir líf og þol. Þú getur borðað allt að þrjár gerðir af mat að hverju sinni.
Turkish: Beslenmek, sağlık ve kondisyon havuzlarınızı artırır. Üç yiyecek yuvanızı uygun şekilde dengelemeye çalışın.
Lithuanian: Eating food increases your health and stamina pools. Try to balance your three food slots accordingly.
Czech: Jedením si zvyšuješ zdraví a výdrž. Zkus odpovídajícím způsobem vyvážit svoje sloty na jídlo.
Hungarian: Az ételek elfogyasztása növeli az életerődet és a kitartásodat. Próbáld meg ennek megfelelően kiegyensúlyozni a három élelemfoglalatodat!
Slovak: Eating food increases your health and stamina pools. Try to balance your three food slots accordingly.
Polish: Spożywanie jedzenia zwiększa punkty życia i kondycję. Postaraj się odpowiednio zrównoważyć trzy miejsca na żywność.
Dutch: Voedsel eten verhoogt je gezondheids- en conditievoorraad. Probeer een goede balans in je drie voedselvakjes te hebben.
Portuguese: Eating food increases your health and stamina pools. Try to balance your three food slots accordingly.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Comer aumenta suas reservas de vida e de vigor. Tente equilibrar seus três espaços de comida de acordo.
Chinese: 进食会增加你的生命值和耐力值。 尽量尝试摄入不同的食物，营养均衡。
Japanese: 食べ物を食べると体力やスタミナが増える。 3つの食物スロットのバランスを取るように気をつけよう。
Korean: 음식을 먹는 것은 체력과 스태미나를 증가시켜줍니다. 세 가지 음식을 균형 있게 먹으세요.
Chinese_Traditional: 進食會增加你的生命值和耐力值。 儘量嘗試攝取不同的食物來源，營養均衡。

English: Upgraded stations enable various crafting options and lets you improve your equipment.
Swedish: Uppgraderade verkstäder låter dig skapa mer avancerade redskap, och förbättra din utrustning.
French: Les établis améliorés vous donnent accès à plus d'options de fabrication et vous permettent d'améliorer votre équipement.
Italian: Upgraded stations enable various crafting options and lets you improve your equipment.
German: Aufgewertete Handwerksstationen gewähren dir verschiedene Herstellungsoptionen und lassen dich deine Ausrüstung verbessern.
Spanish: Las estaciones mejoradas cuentan con más opciones de elaboración y te permiten mejorar el equipo.
Russian: Улучшенные стойки позволяют создавать различные варианты изделий и улучшать ваше снаряжение.
Romanian: Upgraded stations enable various crafting options and lets you improve your equipment.
Bulgarian: Upgraded stations enable various crafting options and lets you improve your equipment.
Macedonian: Upgraded stations enable various crafting options and lets you improve your equipment.
Finnish: Päivitetyt työpöydät lisäävät erilaisia rakennus ja käsityö vaihtoehtoja sekä antaa sinun parantaa varusteitasi.
Danish: Upgraded stations enable various crafting options and lets you improve your equipment.
Icelandic: Að uppfæra stöðvar leyfir þér að nýta fleiri uppskriftir og betrumbæta búnað
Turkish: Geliştirilmiş istasyonlar, çeşitli üretim seçeneklerini açarlar ve bu da ekipmanınızı yükseltmenize olanak tanır.
Lithuanian: Upgraded stations enable various crafting options and lets you improve your equipment.
Czech: Vylepšené stoly umožňují různé možnosti výroby a umožní ti vylepšit si vybavení.
Hungarian: A továbbfejlesztett állomások különböző barkácslehetőségeket, és a felszerelésed megjavítását teszik elérhetővé.
Slovak: Upgraded stations enable various crafting options and lets you improve your equipment.
Polish: Udoskonalone warsztaty pozwalają wykonywać więcej przedmiotów oraz ulepszać ekwipunek.
Dutch: Geüpgradede stations geven je de mogelijkheid tot verschillende productieopties en laten je je uitrusting verbeteren.
Portuguese: Upgraded stations enable various crafting options and lets you improve your equipment.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Estações melhoradas abrem várias opções de fabricação e permitem aprimorar seu equipamento.
Chinese: 升级制作台可以给你更多的制作选项并让你可以升级你的装备。
Japanese: 設備をアップグレードすると作成できるものの種類が増え、装備を充実させられる。
Korean: 제작 작업대를 업그레이드하면 더 많은 제작 옵션과 장비를 업그레이드할 수 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 升級工作檯可以給你更多的製作選項並讓你可以升級你的裝備。

English: There are four principal crafting types: woodworking, masonry, smithing, and cooking.
Swedish: Det finns fyra huvudsakliga hantverk: träslöjd, mureri, smide, och matlagning.
French: Il y a quatre types principaux de fabrication : ébénisterie, maçonnerie, forge et cuisine.
Italian: There are four principal crafting types: woodworking, masonry, smithing, and cooking.
German: Insgesamt gibt es vier Arten von Herstellungstätigkeiten: Holzbearbeitung, Steinmetzarbeit, Schmieden und Kochen.
Spanish: Los cuatro tipos principales de elaboración son: carpintería, albañilería, herrería y cocina.
Russian: Существует четыре основных типа ремесла: плотничество, ковка, готовка и зодчество.
Romanian: There are four principal crafting types: woodworking, masonry, smithing, and cooking.
Bulgarian: There are four principal crafting types: woodworking, masonry, smithing, and cooking.
Macedonian: There are four principal crafting types: woodworking, masonry, smithing, and cooking.
Finnish: On olemassa neljä pääasiallista käsityö tyyppiä: puusepän työt, muuraus, metallisepän työt ja ruoanlaitto.
Danish: There are four principal crafting types: woodworking, masonry, smithing, and cooking.
Icelandic: Það eru fjórir megingerðir af smíðavinnu: Trésmíði, múrverk, smiðja, og matreiðsla.
Turkish: Dört adet ana üretim türü vardır: Ağaç işçiliği, taş işçiliği, demir işçiliği ve yemek pişirme.
Lithuanian: There are four principal crafting types: woodworking, masonry, smithing, and cooking.
Czech: There are four principal crafting types: woodworking, masonry, smithing, and cooking.
Hungarian: Négy fő barkácsolási típus létezik: famegmunkálás, kőművesség, kovácsolás és főzés.
Slovak: There are four principal crafting types: woodworking, masonry, smithing, and cooking.
Polish: Istnieją cztery główne rodzaje rzemiosła: stolarstwo, kamieniarstwo, kowalstwo i gotowanie.
Dutch: Er zijn vier productietypen: houtbewerking, metselwerk, smeden en koken.
Portuguese: There are four principal crafting types: woodworking, masonry, smithing, and cooking.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Existem quatro tipos principais de fabricação: marcenaria, alvenaria, forja e culinária.
Chinese: 你有四种手工技能：木工，石工，锻造和烹饪。
Japanese: 基本的な作成の種類は、木工、石工、鍛冶、料理の4つ。
Korean: 네 가지 주요 제작 유형으로 목공, 석공, 대장간, 요리가 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 遊戲內共有四種工藝技能：木工，石工，鍛造和烹飪。

English: Enemies won't spawn near player built structures (e.g., crafting tables, camp fires, etc.)
Swedish: Grådvärgar föds från marken, men aldrig nära strukturer byggda av spelare, likt verkstäder och lägereldar.
French: Les ennemis n'apparaîtront pas près des structures construites par le joueur (ex : établis, feux de camp, etc.)
Italian: Enemies won't spawn near player built structures (e.g., crafting tables, camp fires, etc.)
German: Gegnern ist es nicht möglich, in der Nähe von Spielergebäuden (wie Handwerksstationen, Lagerfeuern, u. Ä.) zu erscheinen.
Spanish: Los enemigos no aparecerán junto a las estructuras que construyan los jugadores (mesas de fabricación, hogueras, etc).
Russian: Враги не будут появляться рядом со строениями игроков (например, верстаками, кострами и т. д.)
Romanian: Enemies won't spawn near player built structures (e.g., crafting tables, camp fires, etc.)
Bulgarian: Enemies won't spawn near player built structures (e.g., crafting tables, camp fires, etc.)
Macedonian: Enemies won't spawn near player built structures (e.g., crafting tables, camp fires, etc.)
Finnish: Viholliset eivät ilmesty lähelle pelaajien rakentamia rakennuksia. (esimerkiksi työpöydät, nuotiot, yms.)
Danish: Enemies won't spawn near player built structures (e.g., crafting tables, camp fires, etc.)
Icelandic: Óvinir birtast ekki nálægt byggingum spilara (til dæmis: varðeldur, vinnustöð, osfrv..)
Turkish: Düşmanlar, oyuncu üretimi yapıların yakınında canlanmazlar (üretim masası, kamp ateşi vb.)
Lithuanian: Enemies won't spawn near player built structures (e.g., crafting tables, camp fires, etc.)
Czech: Nepřátelé se neobjeví v blízkosti hráčských staveb (např. výrobní stoly, táboráky, atd.)
Hungarian: Az ellenfelek nem bukkannak fel a játékos által épített szerkezetek (pl. barkácsasztalok, tábortüzek, stb.) közelében.
Slovak: Enemies won't spawn near player built structures (e.g., crafting tables, camp fires, etc.)
Polish: Wrogowie nie odrodzą się w pobliżu budowli zbudowanych przez graczy (np. stołów rzemieślniczych, ognisk itp.).
Dutch: Vijanden zullen niet spawnen in de buurt van door spelers gebouwde objecten (zoals werkbanken, kampvuren, enz.)
Portuguese: Enemies won't spawn near player built structures (e.g., crafting tables, camp fires, etc.)
Portuguese_Brazilian: Inimigos não surgem perto das estruturas construídas pelos jogadores (como bancadas e fogueiras, por exemplo).
Chinese: 敌人不会在玩家的修建的建筑物附近有复活点（如：制作台，营火等等）
Japanese: 敵は、プレイヤーが作った建造物（作成テーブルや焚き火など）のそばには出現しない。
Korean: 적은 플레이어가 만든 구조물 근처에서 스폰되지 않습니다 (예시: 제작대, 모닥불, 등등. )
Chinese_Traditional: 敵人不會在玩家修建的建築物附近重生（如：工作檯，營火等等）

English: Sitting is the safest way to travel while on a boat.
Swedish: Sittandes är det bästa sättet att färdas i en båt.
French: S'asseoir est le moyen le plus sûr de voyager quand vous êtes en bateau.
Italian: Sitting is the safest way to travel while on a boat.
German: Sitzen ist die sicherste Weise, in einem Boot zu reisen.
Spanish: Viajar en barco es mucho más seguro si te sientas.
Russian: Безопаснее всего путешествовать на лодке в сидячем положении.
Romanian: Sitting is the safest way to travel while on a boat.
Bulgarian: Sitting is the safest way to travel while on a boat.
Macedonian: Sitting is the safest way to travel while on a boat.
Finnish: Turvallisin tapa matkustaa veneessä on istuen.
Danish: Sitting is the safest way to travel while on a boat.
Icelandic: Að sitja er öruggasta leiðin til að ferðast á bát.
Turkish: Tekneyle seyahat ederken en güvenli yöntem, oturmaktır.
Lithuanian: Sitting is the safest way to travel while on a boat.
Czech: Sitting is the safest way to travel while on a boat.
Hungarian: Ülve a legbiztonságosabb utazni egy hajón.
Slovak: Sitting is the safest way to travel while on a boat.
Polish: Siedzenie to najbezpieczniejszy sposób podróżowania łodzią.
Dutch: Als je per boot reist, is zitten de veiligste manier.
Portuguese: Sentado é a maneira mais segura de viajar enquanto estiveres num barco.
Portuguese_Brazilian: A maneira mais segura de viajar de barco é sentado.
Chinese: 航海时最安全的姿势便是坐着。
Japanese: 船で旅をしている時は、座っているのが最も安全だ。
Korean: 배로 여행을 하고 있을 때는 앉아 있는 것이 가장 안전합니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 航海時最安全的姿勢：坐著。

English: Upon your arrival in Valheim, try to find stones and branches on the ground to build your first weapon.
Swedish: När du anländer i Valheim, försök finna stenar och kvistar att bygga ditt första vapen med.
French: En arrivant à Valheim, essayez de trouver des pierres et des branches sur le sol pour fabriquer votre première arme.
Italian: Upon your arrival in Valheim, try to find stones and branches on the ground to build your first weapon.
German: Versuche nach deiner Ankunft in Valheim Steine und Zweige aufzulesen, um deine erste Waffe herzustellen.
Spanish: Intenta buscar piedras y ramas al llegar a Valheim para fabricar tu primera arma.
Russian: По прибытии в Вальхейм постарайтесь найти на земле камни и ветки, чтобы создать свое первое оружие.
Romanian: Upon your arrival in Valheim, try to find stones and branches on the ground to build your first weapon.
Bulgarian: Upon your arrival in Valheim, try to find stones and branches on the ground to build your first weapon.
Macedonian: Upon your arrival in Valheim, try to find stones and branches on the ground to build your first weapon.
Finnish: Kun saavut Valheimiin, koeta etsiä kiviä ja oksia maasta jotta voit rakentaa ensimmäisen aseesi.
Danish: Upon your arrival in Valheim, try to find stones and branches on the ground to build your first weapon.
Icelandic: Við komu þína til Valheims, byrjaðu á því að finna steina og trégreinar á jörðinni til að búa til fyrstu vopn þín.
Turkish: Valheim'a vardığınızda, ilk silahınızı üretmek için taş ve dal bulmayı deneyin.
Lithuanian: Upon your arrival in Valheim, try to find stones and branches on the ground to build your first weapon.
Czech: Upon your arrival in Valheim, try to find stones and branches on the ground to build your first weapon.
Hungarian: Valheimbe érkezésedkor próbálj meg köveket és ágakat keresni a földön, hogy megépíthesd az első fegyveredet.
Slovak: Upon your arrival in Valheim, try to find stones and branches on the ground to build your first weapon.
Polish: Po przybyciu do Valheim spróbuj znaleźć kamienie i gałęzie na ziemi, aby wytworzyć pierwszą broń.
Dutch: Probeer bij je aankomst in Valheim stenen en takken op de grond te vinden om er je eerste wapen mee te maken.
Portuguese: Upon your arrival in Valheim, try to find stones and branches on the ground to build your first weapon.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Ao chegar em Valheim, tente encontrar pedras e galhos no chão para construir sua primeira arma.
Chinese: 当你到达英灵神殿的时候，尝试在地上找到石头和树枝以制作你的第一个武器。
Japanese: Valheimに到着した時は地面に落ちている石や枝を見つけ、最初の武器を作ろう。
Korean: 발헤임에 도착하자마자, 땅에 떨어져 있는 돌과 나뭇가지를 찾아서 첫 무기를 만들어보세요.
Chinese_Traditional: 當你到達瓦爾海姆的時候，嘗試在地上找到石頭和樹枝以製作你的第一個武器。

English: It is generally a bad idea to venture outside at night...
Swedish: Det är överlag en dålig idé att färdas under nattetid...
French: C'est généralement une mauvaise idée de s'aventurer dehors en pleine nuit...
Italian: It is generally a bad idea to venture outside at night...
German: Es ist keine gute Idee, bei Nacht einen kleinen Ausflug zu unternehmen …
Spanish: No suele ser buena idea aventurarse por estos lares de noche...
Russian: Как правило, выходить на улицу ночью — это плохая идея...
Romanian: It is generally a bad idea to venture outside at night...
Bulgarian: It is generally a bad idea to venture outside at night...
Macedonian: It is generally a bad idea to venture outside at night...
Finnish: On yleisesti ottaen huono idea vaellella ulkona yö aikaan...
Danish: It is generally a bad idea to venture outside at night...
Icelandic: Það er almennt talið slæm hugmynd að ganga út fyrir skjól að nóttu til.
Turkish: Geceleri dışarıda dolaşmak genelde kötü bir fikirdir...
Lithuanian: It is generally a bad idea to venture outside at night...
Czech: It is generally a bad idea to venture outside at night...
Hungarian: Általánosságban rossz ötlet éjjelente kint barangolni...
Slovak: It is generally a bad idea to venture outside at night...
Polish: Wychodzenie na zewnątrz nocą to zasadniczo zły pomysł…
Dutch: Er 's nachts op uitgaan is doorgaans een slecht idee…
Portuguese: It is generally a bad idea to venture outside at night...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Costuma ser uma má ideia aventurar-se ao ar livre à noite…
Chinese: 总的来说晚上在室外游荡并不是一个好主意。
Japanese: 基本的に、夜、外を出歩くのはやめた方がいい...
Korean: 밤에 밖에 나가 모험을 하는 것은 위험해. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 總的來說晚上在室外遊蕩並不是一個好主意。

English: Hunting deer with a ranged weapon provides a good source of meat and skin.
Swedish: Att jaga rådjur med pilbåge eller spjut är en bra källa till hudar och kött.
French: Chasser des cerfs avec une arme à distance permet d'obtenir facilement de la viande et du cuir.
Italian: Hunting deer with a ranged weapon provides a good source of meat and skin.
German: Das Jagen von Wild mit einer Distanzwaffe ist eine gute Quelle für Fleisch und Felle.
Spanish: Caza ciervos con armas a distancia para tener una buena fuente de carne y piel.
Russian: Охотясь на оленей с оружием дальнего боя, можно добыть много мяса и кожи.
Romanian: Hunting deer with a ranged weapon provides a good source of meat and skin.
Bulgarian: Hunting deer with a ranged weapon provides a good source of meat and skin.
Macedonian: Hunting deer with a ranged weapon provides a good source of meat and skin.
Finnish: Peurojen metsästäminen etäaseilla tarjoaan hyvän lähteen lihalle ja nahkalle.
Danish: Hunting deer with a ranged weapon provides a good source of meat and skin.
Icelandic: Að veiða dádýr með boga reynist vera góð leið til að afla sér kjöt og leður.
Turkish: Menzilli silahla geyik avlamak, iyi bir et ve deri kaynağıdır.
Lithuanian: Medžiojant elnius lankais galima lengvai ir greiti prisirinkti odos bei mėsos.
Czech: Hunting deer with a ranged weapon provides a good source of meat and skin.
Hungarian: Egy távolsági fegyverrel szarvasra vadászni jó hús- és bőrforrást jelent.
Slovak: Hunting deer with a ranged weapon provides a good source of meat and skin.
Polish: Polowanie na jelenie przy użyciu broni dystansowej stanowi niezawodne źródło mięsa i skóry.
Dutch: Op herten jagen met een afstandswapen levert je een goede bron van vlees en huid op.
Portuguese: Hunting deer with a ranged weapon provides a good source of meat and skin.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Caçar cervos com uma arma de longo alcance fornece uma boa fonte de carne e pele.
Chinese: 用远程武器猎杀鹿是不错的肉和皮毛来源。
Japanese: 飛び道具で鹿を狩ると、良い肉と皮が手に入る。
Korean: 원거리 무기로 사슴을 사냥하면 고기와 가죽을 얻을 수 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 用遠程武器獵殺鹿是不錯的肉和皮毛來源。

English: Build a rudimentary shelter as soon as possible!
Swedish: Bygg ett dugligt skydd så fort som möjligt!
French: Bâtissez un abri de fortune au plus vite !
Italian: Build a rudimentary shelter as soon as possible!
German: Errichte so schnell wie möglich eine rudimentäre Unterkunft.
Russian: Постройте простейшее убежище как можно скорее!
Romanian: Build a rudimentary shelter as soon as possible!
Bulgarian: Build a rudimentary shelter as soon as possible!
Macedonian: Build a rudimentary shelter as soon as possible!
Finnish: Rakenna alkeellinen suoja heti kun mahdollista!
Danish: Build a rudimentary shelter as soon as possible!
Icelandic: Búðu þér til einfalt skjól sem fyrst.
Turkish: Basit de olsa en hızlı şekilde bir sığınak inşa edin!
Lithuanian: Build a rudimentary shelter as soon as possible!
Czech: Build a rudimentary shelter as soon as possible!
Hungarian: Amilyen hamar csak lehetséges, építs egy kezdetleges menedéket!
Slovak: Build a rudimentary shelter as soon as possible!
Dutch: Bouw zo snel mogelijk wat rudimentaire beschutting!
Portuguese: Build a rudimentary shelter as soon as possible!
Portuguese_Brazilian: Construa um abrigo rudimentar o quanto antes!
Chinese: 你需要尽快建造一个基本的住所！
Japanese: 雨風を避けるための簡素な場所をできるだけ早く作ろう！
Chinese_Traditional: 儘早建造一個基本的住所！

English: Different enemies are weak to different damage types. For instance, Greydwarfs don't like fire.
Swedish: Olika fiender har olika svagheter. Grådvärgar skyr eld.
French: Les ennemis sont vulnérables à différents types de dégâts. Les Naingris n'aiment pas le feu, par exemple.
Italian: Different enemies are weak to different damage types. For instance, Greydwarfs don't like fire.
German: Unterschiedliche Gegner sind gegen unterschiedliche Schadenstypen empfindlich. Beispielsweise verabscheuen Grauzwerge das Feuer.
Spanish: Los enemigos son débiles a ciertos tipos de daño. A los grisucios, por ejemplo, no les gusta el fuego.
Russian: Разные враги уязвимы к разным типам урона. Например, грейдворфы боятся огня.
Romanian: Different enemies are weak to different damage types. For instance, Greydwarfs don't like fire.
Bulgarian: Different enemies are weak to different damage types. For instance, Greydwarfs don't like fire.
Macedonian: Different enemies are weak to different damage types. For instance, Greydwarfs don't like fire.
Finnish: Erilaiset viholliset ovat heikkoja erilaisille vahinkotyypeille. Esimerkiksi Harmaakääpiöt eivät tykkää tulesta.
Danish: Different enemies are weak to different damage types. For instance, Greydwarfs don't like fire.
Icelandic: Mismunandi skepnur þola ílla mismunandi hluti. Til að nefna, þá þola grádvergar ekki eld.
Turkish: Farklı düşmanlar, birbirinden farklı hasar türlerine karşı zayıftır. Örneğin, Bozcüceler ateşi sevmezler.
Lithuanian: Different enemies are weak to different damage types. For instance, Greydwarfs don't like fire.
Czech: Different enemies are weak to different damage types. For instance, Greydwarfs don't like fire.
Hungarian: A különböző ellenfelek eltérő sebzéstípusra érzékenyek. Például a szürketörpök nem szeretik a tüzet.
Slovak: Different enemies are weak to different damage types. For instance, Greydwarfs don't like fire.
Polish: Różni wrogowie są podatni na różne typy obrażeń. Na przykład szare karły boją się ognia.
Dutch: Verschillende vijanden hebben verschillende zwakheden. Grijze dwergen zijn bijvoorbeeld niet dol op vuur.
Portuguese: Different enemies are weak to different damage types. For instance, Greydwarfs don't like fire.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Diferentes inimigos são fracos para diferentes tipos de dano. Os anões cinzentos, por exemplo, não gostam de fogo.
Chinese: 不同的敌人会被不同的伤害削弱。 比如灰矮人就怕火。
Japanese: 敵によって、与えやすいダメージのタイプは違う。 例えば灰色ドワーフは火が苦手だ。
Korean: 공격 유형에 따라 적이 약해집니다. 예를 들어, 그레이 드워프는 불에 약합니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 不同的敵人會有不同的弱點。 比如灰矮人就怕火。

English: When you have built a bed, do not forget to claim it.
Swedish: Glöm inte att göra anspråk på en säng när du byggt den.
French: Une fois le lit fabriqué, n'oubliez pas de vous l'approprier.
Italian: When you have built a bed, do not forget to claim it.
German: Vergiss nicht, dein Bett in Besitz zu nehmen, nachdem du es hergestellt hast.
Spanish: Cuando fabriques una cama, no te olvides de ocuparla.
Russian: Когда вы построите кровать, не забудьте занять ее.
Romanian: When you have built a bed, do not forget to claim it.
Bulgarian: When you have built a bed, do not forget to claim it.
Macedonian: When you have built a bed, do not forget to claim it.
Finnish: Kun rakennat sängyn, älä unohda merkitä sitä omaksesi.
Danish: When you have built a bed, do not forget to claim it.
Icelandic: Þegar þú hefur búið til rúmm, mundu að eigna þér það.
Turkish: Bir yatak inşa ettiğinizde, yatağı sahiplenmeyi unutmayın.
Lithuanian: When you have built a bed, do not forget to claim it.
Czech: When you have built a bed, do not forget to claim it.
Hungarian: Amint építették egy ágyat, ne felejtsd el magadénak beállítani!
Slovak: When you have built a bed, do not forget to claim it.
Polish: Kiedy już zbudujesz łóżko, nie zapomnij go przypisać.
Dutch: Vergeet niet om als je een bed maakt, dat ook op te eisen.
Portuguese: When you have built a bed, do not forget to claim it.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Depois de construir uma cama, não se esqueça de reivindicá-la.
Chinese: 当你制作了一张床后，别忘了认领它。
Japanese: ベッドを作ったら、確保しておくのを忘れずに。
Korean: 침대를 만들고, 등록하는 것을 까먹지 마세요.
Chinese_Traditional: 當你製作了一張床後，別忘了認領它。

English: Attacking with knives and bows while sneaking confers a large damage bonus.
Swedish: Med knivar och pilbågar kan du göra smygattacker för en stor skadebonus.
French: Attaquer avec des couteaux ou des arcs quand vous approchez discrètement permet d'infliger de gros dégâts bonus.
Italian: Attacking with knives and bows while sneaking confers a large damage bonus.
German: Der Angriff mit Messern und Bögen während des Schleichens gewährt einen signifikanten Schadensbonus.
Spanish: Recibirás una gran bonificación de daño si atacas con cuchillos o arcos mientras te encuentras en sigilo.
Russian: Атака ножами и стрелами во время подкрадывания дает большой бонус к урону.
Romanian: Attacking with knives and bows while sneaking confers a large damage bonus.
Bulgarian: Attacking with knives and bows while sneaking confers a large damage bonus.
Macedonian: Attacking with knives and bows while sneaking confers a large damage bonus.
Finnish: Saat suuren vahinkolisän kun hyökkäät käyttäen puukkoja ja jousipyssyjä samalla kun hiiviskelet.
Danish: Attacking with knives and bows while sneaking confers a large damage bonus.
Icelandic: Að nota hníf eða boga á meðan þú læðist veitir þér stóran skaðabónus.
Turkish: Gizlenirken bıçak ve yayla saldırmak, büyük bir hasar bonusu sağlar.
Lithuanian: Attacking with knives and bows while sneaking confers a large damage bonus.
Czech: Attacking with knives and bows while sneaking confers a large damage bonus.
Hungarian: Lopakodás közben a késekkel és íjakkal való támadás nagy sebzésbónuszt jelent.
Slovak: Attacking with knives and bows while sneaking confers a large damage bonus.
Polish: Atak przy użyciu noża lub łuku podczas skradania się zapewnia dużą premię do obrażeń.
Dutch: Val aan met messen en bogen terwijl je sluipt voor een grote schadebonus.
Portuguese: Attacking with knives and bows while sneaking confers a large damage bonus.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Ataque usando facas e arcos enquanto se esgueira para obter um grande bônus de dano.
Chinese: 在潜行时使用匕首和弓箭会造成超额的伤害。
Japanese: 忍び歩きをしている時にナイフや弓で攻撃すると、大きなボーナスダメージを与えられる。
Korean: 은신후 칼과 활로 공격하면 추가적인 피해를 입힐 수 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 在潛行時使用匕首和弓箭會造成巨量的傷害。

English: Birds are a good source of feathers. They will stay close to the ground while the weather is bad.
Swedish: Fåglar är en bra källa till fjädrar. De flyger lågt när vädret är dåligt.
French: Les oiseaux sont une bonne source de plumes. Ils resteront au sol quand la météo est mauvaise.
Italian: Birds are a good source of feathers. They will stay close to the ground while the weather is bad.
German: Vögel sind eine ausgezeichnete Quelle für Federn. Bei schlechtem Wetter halten sie sich normalerweise in Bodennähe auf.
Spanish: Los pájaros te servirán para conseguir plumas. Cuando hace mal tiempo, suelen quedarse cerca del suelo.
Russian: Птицы дают много перьев. В плохую погоду они будут держаться ближе к земле.
Romanian: Birds are a good source of feathers. They will stay close to the ground while the weather is bad.
Bulgarian: Birds are a good source of feathers. They will stay close to the ground while the weather is bad.
Macedonian: Birds are a good source of feathers. They will stay close to the ground while the weather is bad.
Finnish: Linnut ovat hyvä höyhenien lähde. Ne pysyvät lähellä maata kun sää on huono.
Danish: Birds are a good source of feathers. They will stay close to the ground while the weather is bad.
Icelandic: Veiddu fugl til að fá fjaðrir þeirra. Þeir halda sér nálægt jörðinni í vondu veðri.
Turkish: Kuşlar iyi birer tüy kaynağıdır. Hava şartları kötüyken toprağa yakın dururlar.
Lithuanian: Birds are a good source of feathers. They will stay close to the ground while the weather is bad.
Czech: Birds are a good source of feathers. They will stay close to the ground while the weather is bad.
Hungarian: A madarak jó tollforrást jelentenek. Rossz időjárás mellett a talaj közelében maradnak.
Slovak: Birds are a good source of feathers. They will stay close to the ground while the weather is bad.
Polish: Podczas złej pogody ptaki trzymają się blisko ziemi. Upoluj je aby zdobyć pióra.
Dutch: Vogels zijn een goede bron van veren. Als het slecht weer is, blijven ze dicht bij de grond.
Portuguese: Birds are a good source of feathers. They will stay close to the ground while the weather is bad.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Pássaros são uma boa fonte de penas. Eles ficam perto do solo quando o tempo está feio.
Chinese: 鸟类是羽毛的来源，天气不好的时候它们会待在地面上。
Japanese: 鳥からは羽根が手に入る。 鳥は天気が悪い時には地面の近くにいる。
Korean: 새들을 잡아 깃털을 얻을 수 있습니다. 날씨가 나쁘면 새들은 땅 가까이 머무릅니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 鳥類是羽毛很好的來源，天氣不好的時候牠們會停留在地面上。

English: Hugin the raven offers helpful hints.
French: Hugin le corbeau vous offre des astuces très utiles.
Italian: Hugin the raven offers helpful hints.
German: Der Rabe Hugin versorgt dich mit hilfreichen Tipps.
Spanish: Hugin el cuervo da consejos muy útiles.
Romanian: Hugin the raven offers helpful hints.
Bulgarian: Hugin the raven offers helpful hints.
Macedonian: Hugin the raven offers helpful hints.
Finnish: Korppi nimeltä Hugin tarjoaa hyödyllisiä vinkkejä.
Danish: Hugin the raven offers helpful hints.
Icelandic: Krákan hann Huginn gefur þér hjálplegar vísbendingar.
Lithuanian: Hugin the raven offers helpful hints.
Czech: Hugin the raven offers helpful hints.
Hungarian: Hugin, a holló hasznos tippekkel szolgál.
Slovak: Hugin the raven offers helpful hints.
Dutch: Hugin de raaf heeft nuttige hints voor je.
Portuguese: Hugin the raven offers helpful hints.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Hugin, o corvo, oferece dicas úteis.
Chinese: 乌鸦福金会给你有用的信息。
Japanese: 鴉のフギンは役に立つヒントを教えてくれる。
Korean: 까마귀 후긴은 도움이 되는 힌트를 많이 줍니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 烏鴉福金會給你有用的訊息。

English: Some resources require better gear to harvest them.
Swedish: Att samla vissa resurser kan kräva uppgraderade verktyg.
French: Il faut un meilleur équipement pour récolter certaines ressources.
Italian: Some resources require better gear to harvest them.
German: Einige Ressourcen erfordern bessere Ausrüstung, um sie zu sammeln.
Spanish: Necesitarás un equipo mejor para conseguir ciertos recursos.
Russian: Некоторые ресурсы требуют улучшенного снаряжения для их сбора.
Romanian: Some resources require better gear to harvest them.
Bulgarian: Some resources require better gear to harvest them.
Macedonian: Some resources require better gear to harvest them.
Finnish: Jotkut luonnonvarat tarvitsevat paremmat työkalut että voit kerätä niitä.
Danish: Some resources require better gear to harvest them.
Icelandic: Sumar auðlindir krefjast betri tóla til að geta gerts sér auð úr því.
Turkish: Bazı kaynakları çıkarmak için daha üst düzey ekipman gerekir.
Lithuanian: Some resources require better gear to harvest them.
Czech: Some resources require better gear to harvest them.
Hungarian: Egyes nyersanyagok begyűjtése jobb felszerelést igényel.
Slovak: Some resources require better gear to harvest them.
Polish: Do gromadzenia niektórych zasobów potrzeba lepszego sprzętu.
Dutch: Voor het oogsten van bepaalde hulpbronnen heb je betere uitrusting nodig.
Portuguese: Some resources require better gear to harvest them.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Alguns recursos exigem equipamentos melhores para serem coletados.
Chinese: 一部分资源需要更好的工具来开采。
Japanese: 資源の中には、より良い装備がないと採れないものがある。
Korean: 어떤 자원들은 캐기 위해서 더 좋은 장비를 필요로 하기도 합니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 部分資源需要更好的工具來開採。

English: Being rested helps to regenerate stamina and health faster.
Swedish: Att vara utvilad hjälper dig återhämta liv och ork snabbare.
French: Être en forme permet de régénérer l'endurance et la vie plus rapidement.
Italian: Being rested helps to regenerate stamina and health faster.
German: Wenn du ausgeruht bist, regenerieren sich deine Ausdauer und deine Gesundheit schneller.
Spanish: La salud y el vigor se regenerarán más rápido después de descansar.
Russian: Отдых помогает быстрее восстанавливать выносливость и здоровье.
Romanian: Being rested helps to regenerate stamina and health faster.
Bulgarian: Being rested helps to regenerate stamina and health faster.
Macedonian: Being rested helps to regenerate stamina and health faster.
Finnish: Energia ja elämä palautuvat nopeammin kun tunnet olosi levänneeksi.
Danish: Being rested helps to regenerate stamina and health faster.
Icelandic: Að vera hvíldur hjálpar að byggja upp þol hraðar.
Turkish: Dinlenmiş olmak, kondisyon ve sağlık niteliklerini daha hızlı tazeler.
Lithuanian: Being rested helps to regenerate stamina and health faster.
Czech: Being rested helps to regenerate stamina and health faster.
Hungarian: A pihenés segít a kitartás és az életerő gyorsabb regenerálódásában.
Slovak: Being rested helps to regenerate stamina and health faster.
Polish: Wypoczynek pozwala szybciej zregenerować kondycję i życie.
Dutch: Uitgerust zijn betekent dat je conditie en gezondheid sneller herstelt.
Portuguese: Being rested helps to regenerate stamina and health faster.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Descane para aumentar a taxa de regeneração de vigor e de vida.
Chinese: 当你在休息后的状态，你的生命值和耐力值恢复速度回加快。
Japanese: 休息すると、スタミナと体力が回復する速度が上がる。
Korean: 휴식을 취하면 스태미나와 체력을 더 빨리 회복할 수 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 當你充分休息過後，你的生命值和耐力值恢復速度會快上許多。

English: Yellow damage numbers indicate a weakness, grey numbers indicate a resistance.
Swedish: Gula skadeindikatorer innebär att du exploaterar en svaghet, medan grå siffror innebär att dina attacker är ineffektiva.
French: Les dégâts en jaune indiquent une faiblesse, ceux en gris indiquent une résistance.
Italian: Yellow damage numbers indicate a weakness, grey numbers indicate a resistance.
German: Gelbe Schadenszahlen weisen auf eine Schwäche hin, graue Zahlen auf einen Widerstand.
Spanish: Los números amarillos indican debilidad, mientras que los grises indican resistencia.
Russian: Желтые значения урона указывают на слабость, серые указывают на сопротивление.
Romanian: Yellow damage numbers indicate a weakness, grey numbers indicate a resistance.
Bulgarian: Yellow damage numbers indicate a weakness, grey numbers indicate a resistance.
Macedonian: Yellow damage numbers indicate a weakness, grey numbers indicate a resistance.
Finnish: Keltaiset vahinkonumerot kertovat heikkoudesta, harmaat numerot kertovat vastustuskyvystä.
Danish: Yellow damage numbers indicate a weakness, grey numbers indicate a resistance.
Icelandic: Gul skaðanúmer segja til um veikleika, grá skaðanúmer segja til um góða mótstöðu.
Turkish: Sarı hasar sayıları bir zayıflığa işaret ederken gri sayılar, direnci simgeler.
Lithuanian: Yellow damage numbers indicate a weakness, grey numbers indicate a resistance.
Czech: Yellow damage numbers indicate a weakness, grey numbers indicate a resistance.
Hungarian: A sárga sebzésszámok egy gyenge pontot, míg a szürkék ellenállást jelentenek.
Slovak: Yellow damage numbers indicate a weakness, grey numbers indicate a resistance.
Polish: Żółte liczby obrażenia wskazują na słabość, szare – na odporność.
Dutch: Gele schadecijfers staan voor een zwakte, grijze staan voor bestendigheid.
Portuguese: Yellow damage numbers indicate a weakness, grey numbers indicate a resistance.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Quando o dano é exibido em amarelo, indica uma fraqueza; quando é exibido em cinza, indica uma resistência.
Chinese: 当你的输出的伤害显示为黄色时，表明目标被削弱了，如果显示为灰色，则表明目标对此类伤害有抗性。
Japanese: 黄色いダメージの数字は弱点を、灰色の数字は耐性があることを示す。
Korean: 노란색 데미지 표기는 약점을 나타내며, 회색 표기는 저항을 나타냅니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 黃色傷害數字表示為弱點攻擊，而灰色則表示具有抗性。

English: The hoe can flatten the ground, which makes it much easier to construct buildings.
Swedish: Med en hacka kan du platta till marken, vilket gör det lättare att bygga.
French: La houe peut aplanir le sol, ce qui permet de construire des bâtiments plus facilement.
Italian: The hoe can flatten the ground, which makes it much easier to construct buildings.
German: Da der Hammer in der Lage ist, den Boden zu ebnen, ist es mit einem Hammer wesentlich leichter, Gebäude zu errichten.
Spanish: Puedes aplanar el suelo con la azada para que sea más fácil construir edificios.
Russian: Мотыга может выравнивать землю, что значительно упрощает строительство зданий.
Romanian: The hoe can flatten the ground, which makes it much easier to construct buildings.
Bulgarian: The hoe can flatten the ground, which makes it much easier to construct buildings.
Macedonian: The hoe can flatten the ground, which makes it much easier to construct buildings.
Finnish: Kuokalla voi tasoittaa maata, jonka jälkeen rakennusten rakentaminen on helpompaa.
Danish: The hoe can flatten the ground, which makes it much easier to construct buildings.
Icelandic: Hlújárn getur fletið land, sem gerir framkvæmdir bygginga mikið auðveldari.
Turkish: Çapayı kullanarak zemini düzleyebilir ve böylece yapıları çok daha rahat inşa edebilirsiniz.
Lithuanian: The hoe can flatten the ground, which makes it much easier to construct buildings.
Czech: The hoe can flatten the ground, which makes it much easier to construct buildings.
Hungarian: A kapa képes kiegyenlíteni a talajt, és lényegesen megkönnyíti az építkezést.
Slovak: The hoe can flatten the ground, which makes it much easier to construct buildings.
Polish: Motyka pozwala wyrównać teren, co znacznie ułatwia wznoszenie budynków.
Dutch: De schoffel maakt de grond effen, waardoor het makkelijker is om er gebouwen op te bouwen.
Portuguese: The hoe can flatten the ground, which makes it much easier to construct buildings.
Portuguese_Brazilian: A enxada pode aplainar o solo, o que facilita a construções de estruturas.
Chinese: 锄头可以锄平地面，在平缓的地面上建造房屋会更简单。
Japanese: 鍬があると地面を平らにできる。 そのため、建物を建てやすくなる。
Korean: 괭이로 땅을 평평하게 만들 수 있으며, 이를 이용해 건물을 편하게 지을 수 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 鋤頭可以鋤平地面，在平緩的地面上建造房屋會更簡單。

English: Build a cart to haul heavy goods over longer distances.
Swedish: Bygg en kärra för att frakta tungt gods längre.
French: Fabriquez un chariot pour transporter des objets lourds sur de longues distances.
Italian: Build a cart to haul heavy goods over longer distances.
German: Konstruiere einen Karren, um schwere Waren über große Entfernungen hinweg zu transportieren.
Spanish: Construye un carro para recorrer largas distancias con bienes pesados.
Russian: Постройте тележку для перевозки тяжестей на большие расстояния.
Romanian: Build a cart to haul heavy goods over longer distances.
Bulgarian: Build a cart to haul heavy goods over longer distances.
Macedonian: Build a cart to haul heavy goods over longer distances.
Finnish: Rakenna kärryt kuljettaaksesi painavia tavaroita pitkän matkan päähän.
Danish: Build a cart to haul heavy goods over longer distances.
Icelandic: Búðu til kerru til að draga þunga hluti yfir langar vegalengdir.
Turkish: Ağır eşyaları uzun mesafeler arasında taşımak için bir araba inşa edin.
Lithuanian: Build a cart to haul heavy goods over longer distances.
Czech: Build a cart to haul heavy goods over longer distances.
Hungarian: Építs egy kocsit a nehéz tárgyak nagyobb távolságokra történő szállításához!
Slovak: Build a cart to haul heavy goods over longer distances.
Polish: Zbuduj wózek do przewożenia ciężkich towarów na większe odległości.
Dutch: Bouw een kar om zware goederen over lange afstand te verplaatsen.
Portuguese: Build a cart to haul heavy goods over longer distances.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Construa uma carroça para transportar mercadorias pesadas por distâncias maiores.
Chinese: 如果想要长距离运送比较重的物品，你可以制作一辆板车。
Japanese: 荷車を作ると、重いものを遠くまで運べる。
Korean: 무거운 물건을 먼 거리로 옮길 때는 수레를 통해 운반하면 좋습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 如果想要長距離運送比較重的物品，你可以製作一輛雙輪貨車。

English: Boats are controlled by interacting with the steering oar.
Swedish: Skepp, flottar och båtar kontrolleras med akterrodret.
French: Contrôlez des bateaux en interagissant avec la rame.
Italian: Boats are controlled by interacting with the steering oar.
German: Boote werden mithilfe des Steuerruders gesteuert.
Spanish: Podrás controlar los barcos al interactuar con el remo de dirección.
Russian: Лодками можно управлять при помощи рулевого весла.
Romanian: Boats are controlled by interacting with the steering oar.
Bulgarian: Boats are controlled by interacting with the steering oar.
Macedonian: Boats are controlled by interacting with the steering oar.
Danish: Boats are controlled by interacting with the steering oar.
Icelandic: Bátum er stjórnað með stýrisblaðinu aftast á bátnum.
Turkish: Tekneleri, kürekle etkileşime geçerek kontrol edebilirsiniz.
Lithuanian: Boats are controlled by interacting with the steering oar.
Czech: Boats are controlled by interacting with the steering oar.
Slovak: Boats are controlled by interacting with the steering oar.
Polish: Łodziami można sterować poprzez interakcję ze sterem.
Dutch: Boten kun je besturen door de stuurspaan te bewegen.
Portuguese: Boats are controlled by interacting with the steering oar.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Para controlar um barco, interaja com o leme/remo principal.
Chinese: 通过操控操纵杆来控制船只走向。
Japanese: 船は、舵取りオールで操作することができる。
Korean: 보트는 노와 상호 작용하여 제어할 수 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 通過操控操縱杆來控制船隻走向。

English: Tin and copper can be found in the Black Forest.
Swedish: Tenn och koppar finner du i Svarta Skogen.
French: Vous trouverez de l'étain et du cuivre dans la Forêt noire.
Italian: Tin and copper can be found in the Black Forest.
German: Zinn und Kupfer können im Dunklen Wald gefunden werden.
Spanish: Hay cobre y estaño en el Bosque negro.
Russian: Олово и медь можно найти в Черном лесу.
Romanian: Tin and copper can be found in the Black Forest.
Bulgarian: Tin and copper can be found in the Black Forest.
Macedonian: Tin and copper can be found in the Black Forest.
Finnish: Tinaa ja kuparia voi löytää Mustasta Metsästä.
Danish: Tin and copper can be found in the Black Forest.
Icelandic: Tin og kopar er hægt að finna í Svartaskógi.
Turkish: Kalay ve bakır, Kara Orman'da bulunabilir.
Lithuanian: Tin and copper can be found in the Black Forest.
Czech: Tin and copper can be found in the Black Forest.
Hungarian: Ónt és rezet a Fekete erdőben találhatsz.
Slovak: Tin and copper can be found in the Black Forest.
Polish: Cynę i miedź można znaleźć w Czarnym lesie.
Dutch: Tin en koper vind je in het zwarte bos.
Portuguese: Tin and copper can be found in the Black Forest.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Estanho e cobre podem ser encontrados na Floresta Negra.
Chinese: 你可以在黑暗林山里找到锡和铜
Japanese: 黒い森ではスズや銅が見つかる。
Korean: 주석과 구리는 검은 숲에서 찾을 수 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 你可以在黑暗林山裡找到錫和銅

English: Look for berries and mushrooms. They help to keep your stomach full.\n
Swedish: Sök efter bär och svampar. De är goda och håller magen full.\n
French: Cherchez des baies et des champignons. Essayez de garder l'estomac plein.
Italian: Look for berries and mushrooms. They help to keep your stomach full.\n
German: Halte nach Beeren und Pilzen Ausschau. Sie helfen dir dabei, deinen Hunger zu stillen.
Spanish: Busca bayas y setas. Te servirán para tener el estómago lleno.
Russian: Ищите ягоды и грибы. Они помогают оставаться сытым.
Romanian: Look for berries and mushrooms. They help to keep your stomach full.\n
Bulgarian: Look for berries and mushrooms. They help to keep your stomach full.\n
Macedonian: Look for berries and mushrooms. They help to keep your stomach full.\n
Finnish: Etsi marjoja ja sieniä. Ne auttavat pitämään vatsasi täynnä.
Danish: Look for berries and mushrooms. They help to keep your stomach full.\n
Icelandic: Leitaðu af berjum og sveppum. Þeir hjálpa að halda maganum fullum.
Turkish: Yemiş ve mantar bulmaya çalışın. Bunlardan yiyerek karnınızı tok tutabilirsiniz.
Lithuanian: Look for berries and mushrooms. They help to keep your stomach full.\n
Czech: Look for berries and mushrooms. They help to keep your stomach full.\n
Hungarian: Keress bogyókat és gombákat! Segítenek kordában tartani az éhséget.
Slovak: Look for berries and mushrooms. They help to keep your stomach full.\n
Polish: Wypatruj jagód i grzybów. Dzięki nim twój żołądek pozostanie pełny.\n
Dutch: Zoek naar bessen en paddenstoelen. Die helpen je een volle buik te houden.
Portuguese: Look for berries and mushrooms. They help to keep your stomach full.\n
Portuguese_Brazilian: Procure por frutas silvestres e cogumelos para manter seu estômago cheio.
Chinese: 尝试寻找野莓和蘑菇，这样你才不会饿肚子。
Japanese: ベリーやキノコを探そう。 空腹を防ぐ役に立つ。
Korean: 베리나 버섯을 찾으세요. 이는 허기를 채우는데 도움을 줍니다. \n
Chinese_Traditional: 嘗試尋找野莓和蘑菇，它們可以幫助你填飽肚子。

English: Beware the deep trees, beware the true dark. When the night comes, keep close to your fire.
Swedish: Akta den djupaste skog, akta det sanna mörkret. När natten faller, håll elden hög och dig själv nära elden.
French: Attention aux profondeurs de la forêt, prenez garde à la véritable obscurité. Quand la nuit tombe, restez près du feu.
Italian: Beware the deep trees, beware the true dark. When the night comes, keep close to your fire.
German: Hüte dich vor den tiefen Bäumen und meide die wahre Dunkelheit. Wenn die Nacht hereinbricht, so halte dich nahe beim Feuer auf.
Spanish: Cuidado con el espesor de los bosques y con la oscuridad profunda. Quédate junto al fuego cuando caiga la noche.
Russian: Остерегайтесь лесных чащ, берегитесь истинной тьмы. Когда наступит ночь, держитесь поближе к огню.
Romanian: Beware the deep trees, beware the true dark. When the night comes, keep close to your fire.
Bulgarian: Beware the deep trees, beware the true dark. When the night comes, keep close to your fire.
Macedonian: Beware the deep trees, beware the true dark. When the night comes, keep close to your fire.
Finnish: Beware the deep trees, beware the true dark. When the night comes, keep close to your fire.
Danish: Beware the deep trees, beware the true dark. When the night comes, keep close to your fire.
Icelandic: Beware the deep trees, beware the true dark. When the night comes, keep close to your fire.
Turkish: Derindeki ağaçlara, zifirî karanlığa dikkat et. Gece çöktüğünde, ateşine yakın dur.
Lithuanian: Beware the deep trees, beware the true dark. When the night comes, keep close to your fire.
Czech: Beware the deep trees, beware the true dark. When the night comes, keep close to your fire.
Hungarian: Óvakodj a mélységi fáktól, óvakodj az igazi sötétségtől! Amikor eljön az éjszaka, maradj a tüzed közelében!
Slovak: Beware the deep trees, beware the true dark. When the night comes, keep close to your fire.
Polish: Strzeż się ukrytych w głębi drzew, strzeż się prawdziwej ciemności. Kiedy nadejdzie noc, trzymaj się blisko ognia.
Dutch: Pas op de diepe bomen, pas op het ware duister. Blijf dicht bij je vuur als de nacht valt.
Portuguese: Beware the deep trees, beware the true dark. When the night comes, keep close to your fire.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Cuidado com as árvores profundas, cuidado com a verdadeira escuridão. Quando cair a noite, não se afaste do fogo.
Chinese: 小心密林深处，小心正真的黑暗。 当夜晚来临，你需要让自己靠近火焰。
Japanese: 深い森と真の闇に気をつけよ。 夜が来たら火のそばを離れるな。
Korean: 깊은 숲과 짙은 어둠을 조심하라. 밤이 찾아오면 불의 곁을 떠나지 말아라.
Chinese_Traditional: 小心密林深處，小心正真的黑暗。 當夜晚來臨，你需要讓自己靠近火焰。

English: Beneath the ground, the roots of the forest twine together on a great loom. Pluck one thread and the whole weave will move. Chop down one tree and all the wood will know. Make yourself known to the One Who Walks, and he will seek you out.
Swedish: Under marken utgör skogens rötter en väldig väv. Drag i en tråd, och hela väven rör sig. Fäll ett träd, och hela skogen vet. Gör dig tillkänna för Han Som Vandrar, och söka upp dig han skall.
French: Sous le sol, les racines de la forêt s'entrelacent et forment un grand écheveau. Tirez un de ces fils et la toile tout entière bougera. Abattez un arbre et tout le bois le saura. Attirez l'attention de Celui qui Marche, et il viendra à vous.
Italian: Beneath the ground, the roots of the forest twine together on a great loom. Pluck one thread and the whole weave will move. Chop down one tree and all the wood will know. Make yourself known to the One Who Walks, and he will seek you out.
German: Unter der Erde verflechten sich die Wurzeln des Waldes zu einem großen Webstuhl. Wenn du an einem Faden ziehst, wird sich das ganze Gewebe bewegen. Bringe einen Baum zu Fall und der ganze Wald wird es wissen. Erringe die Aufmerksamkeit des Wandelnden und er wird dich aufsuchen.
Spanish: Bajo la tierra, las raíces del bosque se entrelazan tejiendo un gran telar. Si tiras de uno de sus hilos, se moverá el tejido entero. Si talas un árbol, el bosque lo sabrá. Si llamas la atención del Errante... irá en tu búsqueda.
Russian: Под землей корни леса сплетаются в большое полотно. Вырвешь одну нить, и все переплетение нарушится. Срубишь одно дерево, и весь лес об этом узнает. Выдашь себя ненароком Ступающему, и он найдет тебя.
Romanian: Beneath the ground, the roots of the forest twine together on a great loom. Pluck one thread and the whole weave will move. Chop down one tree and all the wood will know. Make yourself known to the One Who Walks, and he will seek you out.
Bulgarian: Beneath the ground, the roots of the forest twine together on a great loom. Pluck one thread and the whole weave will move. Chop down one tree and all the wood will know. Make yourself known to the One Who Walks, and he will seek you out.
Macedonian: Beneath the ground, the roots of the forest twine together on a great loom. Pluck one thread and the whole weave will move. Chop down one tree and all the wood will know. Make yourself known to the One Who Walks, and he will seek you out.
Finnish: Beneath the ground, the roots of the forest twine together on a great loom. Pluck one thread and the whole weave will move. Chop down one tree and all the wood will know. Make yourself known to the One Who Walks, and he will seek you out.
Danish: Beneath the ground, the roots of the forest twine together on a great loom. Pluck one thread and the whole weave will move. Chop down one tree and all the wood will know. Make yourself known to the One Who Walks, and he will seek you out.
Icelandic: Beneath the ground, the roots of the forest twine together on a great loom. Pluck one thread and the whole weave will move. Chop down one tree and all the wood will know. Make yourself known to the One Who Walks, and he will seek you out.
Turkish: Ormanın kökleri, zeminin altındaki büyük dokuma tezgâhında birbirlerine düğümlenirler. Bir ipliği bile koparırsan tüm kumaş harekete geçer. Bir ağacı bile kesersen tüm orman bundan haberdar olur. Adını Yürüyen'e duyurursan seni arayıp bulur.
Lithuanian: Beneath the ground, the roots of the forest twine together on a great loom. Pluck one thread and the whole weave will move. Chop down one tree and all the wood will know. Make yourself known to the One Who Walks, and he will seek you out.
Czech: Beneath the ground, the roots of the forest twine together on a great loom. Pluck one thread and the whole weave will move. Chop down one tree and all the wood will know. Make yourself known to the One Who Walks, and he will seek you out.
Hungarian: A föld alatt az erdő gyökerei akárha egy nagy szövőszéken tekeregnek. Ha kitépsz egy szálat, az egész szövet megmozdul. Ha kivágsz egy fát, az összes fa tudomást szerez róla. Tudasd a jelenlétedet a Bolyongóval, és a keresésedre fog indulni!
Slovak: Beneath the ground, the roots of the forest twine together on a great loom. Pluck one thread and the whole weave will move. Chop down one tree and all the wood will know. Make yourself known to the One Who Walks, and he will seek you out.
Polish: Pod ziemią korzenie lasu splatają się na wielkim krośnie. Zerwij jedną nić, a cały splot się poruszy. Zetnij jedno drzewo, a całe drewno się dowie. Daj się poznać Chodzącemu, a on cię odszuka.
Dutch: Onder de grond vlechten de wortels van het bos zich samen tot één groot spinnenweb. Pluk een enkele draad en het hele web beweegt. Hak een enkele boom om, en het hele bos zal het weten. Maak je bekend aan Hij Die Loopt, en hij zal je opzoeken.
Portuguese: Beneath the ground, the roots of the forest twine together on a great loom. Pluck one thread and the whole weave will move. Chop down one tree and all the wood will know. Make yourself known to the One Who Walks, and he will seek you out.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Sob o solo, as raízes da floresta entrelaçam-se em um grande tear. Puxe um fio e toda a trama vai se mover. Derrube uma árvore e todo o bosque vai saber. Faça-se saber a Aquele que Anda, e ele virá atrás de você.
Chinese: 森林里的树根在地底下紧紧的缠绕在一起。 拔出其中一根，所有的根茎都会移动。 砍掉一棵树，所有的树都会知道。 让那颗会走的树知道你，他便会开始寻找你的踪迹。
Japanese: 地面の下では森の木々の根が絡まり合い、大きな塊となっている。 一本を引き抜くと全体が動く。 一本の木を切り倒すとすべての森が知る。 歩く者に汝の存在を知らせよ。 そうすれば彼が汝を探し出す。
Korean: 땅 아래에는 숲의 뿌리가 하나의 커다란 베틀에 얽혀 있습니다. 한 가닥을 뽑으면 직물 전체가 움직일 것입니다. 나무 한 그루를 베면 모든 나무가 알게 될 것입니다. 걷는 자에게 자신을 알린다면 그 자는 당신을 찾아갈 것입니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 森林裡的樹根在地底下緊緊的纏繞在一起。 拔出其中一根，所有的根莖都會移動。 砍掉一棵樹，所有的樹都會知道。 讓那顆會走的樹知道你，他便會開始尋找你的蹤跡。

English: I was Harald, a man from the coast. I remember nothing more of my life in Midgard except that I was a warrior. In my dreams I see the faces of those I killed. I leave this stone that at least my name will remain.
Swedish: Jag var Harald, en man från kusten. Av mitt liv i Midgård minns jag intet utom krig. I mina drömmar ser jag ansiktena på dem jag dräpt. Denna sten reser jag så världen minns mitt namn.
French: Je suis Harald, un homme de la côte. Je ne me souviens de rien d'autre de ma vie sur Midgard, si ce n'est que j'étais un guerrier. Quand je rêve, je revois le visage de ceux que j'ai tués. Je laisse au moins cette pierre, que mon nom subsiste.
Italian: I was Harald, a man from the coast. I remember nothing more of my life in Midgard except that I was a warrior. In my dreams I see the faces of those I killed. I leave this stone that at least my name will remain.
German: Ich war einst Harald, ein Mann von der Küste. Doch ich habe keine Erinnerungen an mein vergangenes Leben in Midgard. Ich weiß nur, dass ich ein Krieger war. In meinen Träumen sehe ich die Gesichter all jener, die ich getötet habe. Ich hinterlasse diesen Stein, damit zumindest mein Name die Jahrhunderte überdauern möge.
Spanish: Yo era Harald, un hombre de la costa. Lo único que recuerdo de mi vida en Midgar es que era un guerrero. Veo en sueños las caras de la gente a la que asesiné. Dejo esta piedra para que, al menos, perdure mi nombre.
Russian: Меня звали Харальдом, человеком с побережья. Больше я ничего не помню из своей жизни в Мидгарде, кроме того, что я был воином. Во сне я вижу лица убитых мною. Я оставляю этот камень, пусть хотя бы имя мое запомнят.
Romanian: I was Harald, a man from the coast. I remember nothing more of my life in Midgard except that I was a warrior. In my dreams I see the faces of those I killed. I leave this stone that at least my name will remain.
Bulgarian: I was Harald, a man from the coast. I remember nothing more of my life in Midgard except that I was a warrior. In my dreams I see the faces of those I killed. I leave this stone that at least my name will remain.
Macedonian: I was Harald, a man from the coast. I remember nothing more of my life in Midgard except that I was a warrior. In my dreams I see the faces of those I killed. I leave this stone that at least my name will remain.
Finnish: I was Harald, a man from the coast. I remember nothing more of my life in Midgard except that I was a warrior. In my dreams I see the faces of those I killed. I leave this stone that at least my name will remain.
Danish: I was Harald, a man from the coast. I remember nothing more of my life in Midgard except that I was a warrior. In my dreams I see the faces of those I killed. I leave this stone that at least my name will remain.
Icelandic: I was Harald, a man from the coast. I remember nothing more of my life in Midgard except that I was a warrior. In my dreams I see the faces of those I killed. I leave this stone that at least my name will remain.
Turkish: Adım Harald, sahilden geldim. Eskiden savaşçı olduğum dışında Midgard'a dair hatırladığım bir şey yok. Rüyalarımda öldürdüklerimin yüzlerini görüyorum. Geride bu taşı bırakıyorum ki en azından adım yaşasın.
Lithuanian: I was Harald, a man from the coast. I remember nothing more of my life in Midgard except that I was a warrior. In my dreams I see the faces of those I killed. I leave this stone that at least my name will remain.
Czech: Byl jsem Harald, muž z pobřeží. Nic víc si nepamatuji na svůj život v Midgardu kromě toho, že jsem byl válečníkem. Ve svých snech vidím tváře těch, které jsem zabil. Nechávám tento kámen, ať alespoň moje jméno zůstane.
Hungarian: Egykor Harald voltam, egy férfi a partról. Semmi másra nem emlékszem midgardi életemből, csak arra, hogy harcos voltam. Álmaimban látom azoknak az arcát, akiket megöltem. Hátrahagyom ezt a követ, hogy legalább a nevem itt maradjon.
Slovak: I was Harald, a man from the coast. I remember nothing more of my life in Midgard except that I was a warrior. In my dreams I see the faces of those I killed. I leave this stone that at least my name will remain.
Polish: Byłem kiedyś Haraldem, człowiekiem z wybrzeża. Nie pamiętam nic więcej z mojego życia w Midgardzie poza tym, że byłem wojownikiem. W moich snach widzę twarze swoich ofiar. Zostawiam ten kamień, by chociaż moje imię nie poszło w zapomnienie.
Dutch: Ik was Harald, een man van de kust. Ik weet niets meer van mijn leven in Midgard, behalve dat ik een krijger was. In mijn dromen zie ik de gezichten van de mensen die ik om heb gebracht. Ik laat deze steen achter zodat mijn naam in ieder geval niet vergeten wordt.
Portuguese: I was Harald, a man from the coast. I remember nothing more of my life in Midgard except that I was a warrior. In my dreams I see the faces of those I killed. I leave this stone that at least my name will remain.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Eu era Harald, um homem do litoral. Pouco lembro da minha vida em Midgard, exceto que fui um guerreiro. Em meus sonhos, vejo os rostos dos homens que matei. Deixo aqui esta pedra, para que ao menos o meu nome permaneça.
Chinese: 我曾是哈拉尔德，一个来自海岸的男人。 我不记得除了我在人界曾是一名战士以外的任何事。 被我击杀过的面孔时常出现在我的梦魇里。 我留下这块石碑，这样至少有人会记得我的名字。
Japanese: 私はかつて、海岸に住むハーラルであった。 ミズガルズでの暮らしは、戦士であったことしか覚えていない。 夢の中で、殺した者たちの顔を見る。 せめて我が名が忘れ去られぬよう、この石を残す。
Korean: 나는 해안에 사는 해럴드였다. 미드가르드에서의 삶은 전사였던 것 밖에 기억나지 않는다. 나의 꿈속에는 내가 죽였던 자들의 얼굴들이 보인다. 적어도 내 이름이 잊혀지지 않도록 이 돌을 남긴다.
Chinese_Traditional: 我曾是哈拉爾德，一個來自海岸的男人。 我不記得除了我在人界曾是一名戰士以外的任何事。 被我擊殺過的面孔時常出現在我的夢魘裡。 我留下這塊石碑，這樣至少有人會記得我的名字。

English: Rest awhile and remember Ulf, who carved this stone with his own hand but could think of nothing to say.
Swedish: Vila en stund, och minns Ulf, som ristade denna sten för egen hand, men intet kunde komma på att skriva.
French: Reposez-vous et rappelez-vous d'Ulf, qui a gravé cette pierre de sa main, mais qui ne savait pas quoi y écrire.
Italian: Rest awhile and remember Ulf, who carved this stone with his own hand but could think of nothing to say.
German: Raste eine Weile und gedenke Ulf, der diesen Stein mit seinen eigenen Händen bearbeitete … Der allerdings keine Worte fand, um sie zu hinterlassen.
Spanish: Tómate un descanso y piensa en Ulf, que esculpió esta piedra con su propia mano, pero no se le ocurrió qué escribir.
Russian: Отдохните немного и вспомните Ульфа, который собственноручно вырезал этот камень, но не смог придумать, что сказать.
Romanian: Rest awhile and remember Ulf, who carved this stone with his own hand but could think of nothing to say.
Bulgarian: Rest awhile and remember Ulf, who carved this stone with his own hand but could think of nothing to say.
Macedonian: Rest awhile and remember Ulf, who carved this stone with his own hand but could think of nothing to say.
Finnish: Rest awhile and remember Ulf, who carved this stone with his own hand but could think of nothing to say.
Danish: Rest awhile and remember Ulf, who carved this stone with his own hand but could think of nothing to say.
Icelandic: Rest awhile and remember Ulf, who carved this stone with his own hand but could think of nothing to say.
Turkish: Biraz soluklan ve kendi elleriyle bu taşı yontmuş ancak söyleyecek bir şey bulamamış Ulf'u hatırla.
Lithuanian: Rest awhile and remember Ulf, who carved this stone with his own hand but could think of nothing to say.
Czech: Rest awhile and remember Ulf, who carved this stone with his own hand but could think of nothing to say.
Hungarian: Pihenj egy keveset, és emlékezz Ulfra, aki saját kezével faragta ki ezt a követ, de nem jutott eszébe semmi mondanivaló.
Slovak: Rest awhile and remember Ulf, who carved this stone with his own hand but could think of nothing to say.
Polish: Odpocznij chwilę i przypomnij sobie Ulfa, który własnoręcznie wyrył ten kamień, lecz nie miał nic do powiedzenia.
Dutch: Rust hier en gedenk Ulf, die met eigen hand in deze steen heeft gekerfd, maar niets kon verzinnen om te vertellen.
Portuguese: Rest awhile and remember Ulf, who carved this stone with his own hand but could think of nothing to say.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Descanse um pouco e lembre-se de Ulf, que esculpiu essa pedra com as próprias mãos, mas não conseguiu pensar em nada para dizer.
Chinese: 休息一下，并想想乌尔夫吧，他的双手雕刻了这块石碑却无话可说。
Japanese: しばし休み、ウルフを思い出せ。 自分の手でこの石を彫ったが言うべきことを何も思いつかなかった者のことを。
Korean: 잠시 쉬면서 이 돌을 자신의 손으로 조각했지만 딱히 적을 말을 떠올리지 못했던 울프를 기억해 주세요.
Chinese_Traditional: 休息一下，並想想烏爾夫吧，他的雙手雕刻了這塊石碑却無話可說。

English: Beware the Old One. The ravens say that in ages past he was a shoot of great Yggdrasil itself and a force of wisdom in the days when men and trees were friends. Now he scorns the axe and sets himself against the works of the Gods themselves. Odin banished him here for his pride but his roots are deep.
Swedish: Akta den Uråldrige. Korparna talar om förflutna tider, då Han var blott ett skott från Yggdrasil själv, och en visdomens kraft i de dagar då man och träd var fränder.\nNu föraktar Han yxan och arbetar mot Gudarna själva. För sin stolthet bannlystes Han av Oden, men Hans rötter sträcker sig djupt.
French: Prenez garde à l'Ancien. Les corbeaux racontent qu'autrefois, il était une pousse du grand Yggdrasil lui-même, et qu'il était une source de sagesse à l'époque où les hommes et les arbres étaient amis. À présent, il méprise la hache et s'oppose à l'œuvre des dieux en personne. Odin l'a banni ici pour le punir de son orgueil, mais ses racines s'enfoncent profondément dans la terre.
Italian: Beware the Old One. The ravens say that in ages past he was a shoot of great Yggdrasil itself and a force of wisdom in the days when men and trees were friends. Now he scorns the axe and sets himself against the works of the Gods themselves. Odin banished him here for his pride but his roots are deep.
German: Hüte dich vor dem Alten. Die Raben sagen, dass er einst ein Spross von Yggdrasil selbst und die personifizierte Weisheit gewesen sein soll - in einer Zeit, in der Mensch und Baum noch Freude waren. Heute verachtet er die Axt und wendet sich gegen alles Wirken der Götter. Für seinen Stolz wurde er von Odin verbannt. Doch seine Wurzeln reichen tief.
Spanish: Cuidado con el Longevo. Los cuervos dicen que hace eones era un brote de Yggdrasil, además de una fuente de sabiduría en la época en la que los hombres y los árboles eran amigos. Ahora se burla del hacha y se enfrenta a las creaciones de los mismísimos dioses. Odín lo exilió, pero tanto su orgullo como sus raíces no tienen fin.
Russian: Берегитесь Древнего. Вороны говорят, что в прошлом он был порождением великого Иггдрасиля и обладал мудростью в дни дружбы людей и деревьев. Позже он презрел топор и восстал против самих богов. Один изгнал его сюда за гордыню, но корни его крепки.
Romanian: Beware the Old One. The ravens say that in ages past he was a shoot of great Yggdrasil itself and a force of wisdom in the days when men and trees were friends. Now he scorns the axe and sets himself against the works of the Gods themselves. Odin banished him here for his pride but his roots are deep.
Bulgarian: Beware the Old One. The ravens say that in ages past he was a shoot of great Yggdrasil itself and a force of wisdom in the days when men and trees were friends. Now he scorns the axe and sets himself against the works of the Gods themselves. Odin banished him here for his pride but his roots are deep.
Macedonian: Beware the Old One. The ravens say that in ages past he was a shoot of great Yggdrasil itself and a force of wisdom in the days when men and trees were friends. Now he scorns the axe and sets himself against the works of the Gods themselves. Odin banished him here for his pride but his roots are deep.
Finnish: Beware the Old One. The ravens say that in ages past he was a shoot of great Yggdrasil itself and a force of wisdom in the days when men and trees were friends. Now he scorns the axe and sets himself against the works of the Gods themselves. Odin banished him here for his pride but his roots are deep.
Danish: Beware the Old One. The ravens say that in ages past he was a shoot of great Yggdrasil itself and a force of wisdom in the days when men and trees were friends. Now he scorns the axe and sets himself against the works of the Gods themselves. Odin banished him here for his pride but his roots are deep.
Icelandic: Beware the Old One. The ravens say that in ages past he was a shoot of great Yggdrasil itself and a force of wisdom in the days when men and trees were friends. Now he scorns the axe and sets himself against the works of the Gods themselves. Odin banished him here for his pride but his roots are deep.
Turkish: Ezelî Olan'a dikkat et. Kuzgunlar onun çağlar öncesinde yüce Yggdrasil'den filizlendiğini ve insanlarla ağaçların dost olduğu günlerde bilgelik dağıttığını söyler. Artık baltadan nefret ediyor ve Tanrıların eylemlerinin karşısında duruyor. Kibrinden dolayı Odin onu buraya sürdü ama kökleri hâlâ derin.
Lithuanian: Beware the Old One. The ravens say that in ages past he was a shoot of great Yggdrasil itself and a force of wisdom in the days when men and trees were friends. Now he scorns the axe and sets himself against the works of the Gods themselves. Odin banished him here for his pride but his roots are deep.
Czech: Beware the Old One. The ravens say that in ages past he was a shoot of great Yggdrasil itself and a force of wisdom in the days when men and trees were friends. Now he scorns the axe and sets himself against the works of the Gods themselves. Odin banished him here for his pride but his roots are deep.
Hungarian: Óvakodj az Ősöregtől! A hollók azt beszélik, hogy az elmúlt korokban ő maga a hatalmas Yggdrasil sarja volt, és a bölcsesség forrása azokban az időkben, amikor az emberek és a fák barátkoztak. Most már megveti a fejszét, és szembeszáll az istenek alkotásaival. Odin a büszkesége miatt száműzte ide, de a gyökerei mélyre futnak.
Slovak: Beware the Old One. The ravens say that in ages past he was a shoot of great Yggdrasil itself and a force of wisdom in the days when men and trees were friends. Now he scorns the axe and sets himself against the works of the Gods themselves. Odin banished him here for his pride but his roots are deep.
Polish: Strzeż się Prastarego. Kruki powiadają, że w minionych wiekach był on samym pędem wielkiego Yggdrasila – siłą mądrości w czasach, gdy ludzie i drzewa żyli ze sobą w zgodzie. Teraz gardzi siekierą i przeciwstawia się dziełom samych bogów. Odyn wygnał go tutaj przez jego dumę, lecz jego korzenie sięgają głęboko.
Dutch: Pas op de Oude. Volgens de raven was hij in voorbije eeuwen een spruit van de grootse Yggdrasil zelve, en een wijze kracht in de dagen waarin mensen en bomen vrienden waren. Nu veracht hij de bijl en verzet hij zich tegen de werken van de goden zelve. Odin heeft hem hierheen verbannen om zijn trots, maar hij heeft diepe wortels.
Portuguese: Beware the Old One. The ravens say that in ages past he was a shoot of great Yggdrasil itself and a force of wisdom in the days when men and trees were friends. Now he scorns the axe and sets himself against the works of the Gods themselves. Odin banished him here for his pride but his roots are deep.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Cuidado com o Longevo. Os corvos dizem que em tempos antigos ele foi um rebento da própria Yggdrasil, e uma força de sabedoria nos dias em que homens e árvores eram aliados. Agora ele despreza o machado e faz oposição às obras dos próprios deuses. Odin o exilou aqui por causa de seu orgulho, mas a verdade é que suas raízes são profundas.
Chinese: 小心老者。 乌鸦说很久以前，在人类和树木还是朋友的时候，他就是世界之树的新芽，也是一股强大的智慧之力。 现在他鄙夷斧子，让自己成为了众神之敌。 因为他的傲慢，他被奥丁放逐至此，但是他却在此深深扎根。
Japanese: 古き者に気をつけよ。 鴉たちによれば、その昔、彼は大いなるユグドラシルそのものの木の芽であり、人々と木々が友であった頃の知識の力であった。 今、彼は斧を嘲笑い、神々の創造物に敵対している。 オーディンはその自尊心のために彼を追放したが、その根は深い。
Korean: 오래산 자를 조심하십시오. 까마귀들이 말하길, 옛날에 그는 위대한 이그드라실의 새싹 이었으며, 인간과 나무가 친구였을 시절 지혜의 힘이었다고 합니다. 이제 그는 도끼를 경멸하고, 신들의 창조물에 대적하고 있습니다. 그의 오만함에 오딘이 그를 이곳으로 추방했지만 그의 뿌리는 깊습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 小心老者。 烏鴉說很久以前，在人類和樹木還是朋友的時候，他就是世界之樹的新芽，也是一股強大的智慧之力。 現在他鄙夷斧頭，讓自己成為了眾神之敵。 因為他的傲慢，他被奧丁放逐至此，但是他卻在此深深扎根。

English: We who were carried here by the Valkyrie are not the first men in this land. I have seen with my own eyes the halls they made beneath the ground and the ruins of their cities. Will the same fate await us?
Swedish: Ej först i dessa trakter är vi som hit burits av Valkyriorna. Med egna ögon har jag sett hallarna under marken, och ruinerna av uråldriga städer. Väntar samma öde på oss?
French: Nous qui avons été amenés ici par les Valkyries ne sommes pas les premiers hommes de ces terres. J'ai vu de mes yeux les palais qu'ils ont bâtis sous le sol et les ruines de leurs cités. Le même destin nous attendrait-il ?
Italian: We who were carried here by the Valkyrie are not the first men in this land. I have seen with my own eyes the halls they made beneath the ground and the ruins of their cities. Will the same fate await us?
German: Wir, die wir von den Walküren hierhergetragen wurden, waren nicht die ersten Menschen dieser Lande. Ich habe sie gesehen, ihre Hallen. Mit meinen eigenen Augen. Hallen, die sie unter der Erde anlegten. Und auch die Ruinen ihrer Städte. Ob uns ein ähnliches Schicksal blüht?
Spanish: Quienes vinimos con las valquirias no hemos sido los primeros en pisar estas tierras. He visto con mis propios ojos los salones que construyeron bajo tierra y sus ciudades en ruinas. ¿Correremos el mismo destino?
Russian: Мы те, кого принесла сюда валькирия, и мы не первые люди на этой земле. Моим глазам предстали коридоры, вырытые под землей, и руины городов. Ждет ли нас такая же участь?
Romanian: We who were carried here by the Valkyrie are not the first men in this land. I have seen with my own eyes the halls they made beneath the ground and the ruins of their cities. Will the same fate await us?
Bulgarian: We who were carried here by the Valkyrie are not the first men in this land. I have seen with my own eyes the halls they made beneath the ground and the ruins of their cities. Will the same fate await us?
Macedonian: We who were carried here by the Valkyrie are not the first men in this land. I have seen with my own eyes the halls they made beneath the ground and the ruins of their cities. Will the same fate await us?
Finnish: We who were carried here by the Valkyrie are not the first men in this land. I have seen with my own eyes the halls they made beneath the ground and the ruins of their cities. Will the same fate await us?
Danish: We who were carried here by the Valkyrie are not the first men in this land. I have seen with my own eyes the halls they made beneath the ground and the ruins of their cities. Will the same fate await us?
Icelandic: We who were carried here by the Valkyrie are not the first men in this land. I have seen with my own eyes the halls they made beneath the ground and the ruins of their cities. Will the same fate await us?
Turkish: Valkürler tarafından buraya getirilen bizler, bu diyarın ilk insanları değiliz. Yerin altına inşa ettikleri salonları ve diktikleri şehirlerin harabelerini kendi gözlerimle gördüm. Bizi de mi aynı kader bekliyor?
Lithuanian: We who were carried here by the Valkyrie are not the first men in this land. I have seen with my own eyes the halls they made beneath the ground and the ruins of their cities. Will the same fate await us?
Czech: We who were carried here by the Valkyrie are not the first men in this land. I have seen with my own eyes the halls they made beneath the ground and the ruins of their cities. Will the same fate await us?
Hungarian: Mi, akiket a valkűrök szállítottak ide, nem az első emberek vagyunk ezen a vidéken. Saját szememmel láttam a föld alatt épített termeket, és a városaik romjait. Ugyanez a sors várna ránk is?
Slovak: We who were carried here by the Valkyrie are not the first men in this land. I have seen with my own eyes the halls they made beneath the ground and the ruins of their cities. Will the same fate await us?
Polish: My, których przyniosła tu walkiria, nie jesteśmy pierwszymi ludźmi na tej ziemi. Widziałem na własne oczy wytyczone przez nich podziemne komnaty i ruiny ich miast. Czy czeka nas ten sam los?
Dutch: Wij die hier door de Walkuren heen zijn gebracht zijn niet de eerste mensen van dit land. Ik heb met eigen ogen de grote hallen onder de grond gezien en de ruïnes die ooit hun steden waren. Wacht ons eenzelfde lot?
Portuguese: We who were carried here by the Valkyrie are not the first men in this land. I have seen with my own eyes the halls they made beneath the ground and the ruins of their cities. Will the same fate await us?
Portuguese_Brazilian: Nós que fomos trazidos pelas Valquírias não somos os primeiros homens nesta terra. Vi com meus próprios olhos os corredores que construíram sob o solo e as ruínas de suas cidades. Teremos nós o mesmo destino?
Chinese: 被女武神送到这里来的我们并不是第一批来到这里的勇士。 我曾亲眼看见过他们在地下建造的宫殿和城市。 等待我们的将会是相同的命运吗？
Japanese: ワルキューレに運ばれてきた我々は、この地の最初の人間ではない。 彼らが地下に作った広間の数々、彼らの都市の遺跡の数々を、私はこの目で見た。 我々にも同じ運命が待ち受けているのか？
Korean: 발키리에 의해 이곳으로 옮겨진 우리는 이 땅의 첫 번째 인간이 아닙니다. 나는 그들이 지하에 만든 홀과 폐허가 된 그들의 도시를 두 눈으로 직접 보았습니다. 우리에게도 같은 운명이 기다리고 있을까요?
Chinese_Traditional: 被女武神送到這裡來的我們並不是第一批來到這裡的勇士。 我曾親眼看見過他們在地下建造的宮殿和城市。 等待我們的將會是相同的命運嗎？

English: Seven were the creatures banished to this world by mighty Odin in the first days of his kingship. Seven gods and monsters too proud to bear his yoke. I have heard the tread of the Old Ones in the forest and have crouched in the shadow of the Mountain Mother when she flies. Of the others I know little. I will add to this stone when I have seen more.
Swedish: Sju var de väsen som hit bannlystes av Oden allsmäktige under hans kungadömes första dagar. Sju gudar och monster för stolta för att bära hans ok. Jag har hört den Uråldrige i skogen, och duckat undan Bergsmoderns flykt. Om de andra vet jag litet. När jag mer vet skall jag på denna sten fortsätta.
French: Sept étaient les créatures bannies de ce monde par le tout-puissant Odin, lors de ses premiers jours de règne. Sept dieux et monstres trop fiers pour se soumettre à son autorité. J'ai entendu les Anciens fouler la forêt et l'ombre de la Mère de la montagne m'a englouti lorsqu'elle s'est envolée. Je ne connais que peu les autres. Je continuerai à écrire sur cette pierre quand j'en aurai vu davantage.
Italian: Seven were the creatures banished to this world by mighty Odin in the first days of his kingship. Seven gods and monsters too proud to bear his yoke. I have heard the tread of the Old Ones in the forest and have crouched in the shadow of the Mountain Mother when she flies. Of the others I know little. I will add to this stone when I have seen more.
German: Sieben Kreaturen verbannte der mächtige Odin während der ersten Tage seiner Herrschaft auf diese Welt. Sieben Götter und Monster, die zu stolz waren, um sich von Odin befehlen zu lassen. Ich hörte die Schritte der Alten im Wald und ich habe mich zusammengekauert, als ich den Schatten der Bergmutter erblickte, als diese vorüberflog. Von den anderen weiß ich nur wenig. Aber ich werde alles, was ich herausfinde, diesem Stein anvertrauen.
Spanish: El gran Odín desterró en este mundo a siete criaturas durante los primeros días de su reinado. Siete dioses y monstruos cuyo orgullo era tal que les impedía llevar su yugo. He oído a los Longevos vagar por el bosque y he tenido que agacharme a cobijo de la sombra de la Madre montaña cuando una de ellos echó a volar. Apenas sé nada de los otros, pero añadiré lo que descubra en esta piedra.
Russian: Семь существ были изгнаны в этот мир могущественным Одином в первые дни его царствования. Семь богов и монстров, слишком гордых, чтобы подчиниться ему. Заслышав шаги Древних в лесу, мне удалось скрыться в тени Матери гор, когда она пролетала мимо. Об остальных мне известно немного. Я дополню этот камень, когда познаю больше.
Romanian: Seven were the creatures banished to this world by mighty Odin in the first days of his kingship. Seven gods and monsters too proud to bear his yoke. I have heard the tread of the Old Ones in the forest and have crouched in the shadow of the Mountain Mother when she flies. Of the others I know little. I will add to this stone when I have seen more.

I will add to this stone when I have seen more.
