Hungarian:
Adj hálát Frey-nek az esőért és a napért,

a föld felszínét áttörő hajtásokért,

a szőlő gyümölcséért!

Köszönd meg Odinnak a húst és a csontot,

a főzés tüzének füstjét, a meleg irhát,

és a karod erejét!
Slovak:
Give thanks to Frey for the rain and sun

For the shoots that break the earth's skin

And the fruits of the vine

Give thanks to Odin for the flesh and bone

The smoke from the cooking fire, the warm pelt

And the strength of your arm
Polish:
Złóż podziękowania Frei za deszcz i słońce

Za pędy, które wyrastają z ziemi

I owoce winorośli

Podziękuj Odynowi za mięso i kości

Dym z palącego się ogniska, ciepłe futro

I siłę twojego ramienia
Dutch:
Geef dank aan Frey voor de regen en de zon.

Voor de scheuten die de aarde ontspruiten

En het fruit op de takken

Geef dank aan Odin voor vlees en bloed

Voor de rook van het kookvuur, de warme pels

En de kracht in je arm
Portuguese:
Give thanks to Frey for the rain and sun

For the shoots that break the earth's skin

And the fruits of the vine

Give thanks to Odin for the flesh and bone

The smoke from the cooking fire, the warm pelt

And the strength of your arm
Portuguese_Brazilian:
Agradeça a Frey pela chuva e pelo sol

Pelos brotos que rompem a terra

E pelos frutos da videira

Agradeça a Odin pela carne e pelos ossos

Pelo calor do forno e da pele quente

E pela força em seus braços
Chinese:
感恩弗雷带来的雨滴和阳光

冲破地面的嫩芽

和藤蔓上的果实

感恩奥丁赐予的血肉之躯

炊烟袅袅，暖暖皮袍

还有你强壮的臂膀
Japanese:
雨と晴れにはフレイに感謝を

地の皮を突き抜ける若枝に

蔓に実る果実に

肉と骨にはオーディンに感謝を

竈の煙と温かい毛皮

そして汝の腕力
Korean:
지구의 표면에 돋아나는 새싹과 

덩굴에서 자라나는 과일들

햇빛과 비에 대해 프레이 신께 감사드려라

요리를 할때 나오는 연기와, 따뜻한 가죽

그리고 팔의 힘에 대해 오딘께 감사드려라
Chinese_Traditional:
感恩弗雷帶來的雨滴和陽光

衝破地面的嫩芽

和藤蔓上的果實

感恩奧丁賜予的血肉之軀

炊煙裊裊，暖暖皮袍

還有你強壯的臂膀

English: Hold, traveller, and bear witness to my warning. We are many who have come before you, carried here by Odin's will to do his work. The path ahead is hard and the dangers great. If you hold your life dear, keep to these meadows and make your dwelling away from the trees. Fear the Horned One and spare his kin.\n
Swedish: Hejda dig, vandrare, och lyss till min varning. Mången är vi som kommit innan dig, av Odens vilja burna för att bedriva hans arbete. Vägen framför dig är svår och farorna stora. Om du håller livet kärt, håll dig till dessa ängar och bygg boning långt ifrån skogens bryn. Frukta den Hornbeklädde och skona hans fränder.\n
French: Halte, voyageur, et écoutez ma mise en garde. Nous sommes nombreux à être venus ici avant vous, guidés ici par Odin pour accomplir sa volonté. Le chemin qui vous attend est difficile et dangereux. Si vous tenez à vivre, restez dans ces champs et restez loin des arbres. Craignez le Cornu et épargnez les siens.
Italian: Hold, traveller, and bear witness to my warning. We are many who have come before you, carried here by Odin's will to do his work. The path ahead is hard and the dangers great. If you hold your life dear, keep to these meadows and make your dwelling away from the trees. Fear the Horned One and spare his kin.\n
German: Halt, Reisender, höre meine Warnung. Du bist nicht der erste, der hier erschien. Viele sind dem Ruf Odins gefolgt. Doch der Weg, der vor dir liegt, ist hart und gefährlich. Wenn dir etwas an deinem Leben liegt, dann solltest du deine Behausung in diesen Auen, weit weg von den Bäumen errichten … Hüte dich vor dem Gehörnten und verschone die Seinen.
Spanish: Detente, caminante, y sé testigo de mis advertencias. Somos muchos los que hemos pasado por aquí antes que tú, impulsados por el deseo de Odín de que hiciéramos su trabajo. El camino que te espera es arduo y tortuoso, al igual que los peligros que entraña. Si le tienes apego a la vida, haz de estas praderas tu morada y aléjate de los árboles. Teme al Astado y perdónales la vida a los suyos.
Russian: Постой, путник, и внемли моему предупреждению. Многие из нас пришли сюда раньше по воле Одина, дабы исполнить его приказ. Путь впереди труден, а опасности велики. Если дорожишь своей жизнью, ступай по этим лугам и держись подальше от деревьев. Остерегайся Рогатого и пощади его сородичей.
Romanian: Hold, traveller, and bear witness to my warning. We are many who have come before you, carried here by Odin's will to do his work. The path ahead is hard and the dangers great. If you hold your life dear, keep to these meadows and make your dwelling away from the trees. Fear the Horned One and spare his kin.\n
Bulgarian: Hold, traveller, and bear witness to my warning. We are many who have come before you, carried here by Odin's will to do his work. The path ahead is hard and the dangers great. If you hold your life dear, keep to these meadows and make your dwelling away from the trees. Fear the Horned One and spare his kin.\n

If you hold your life dear, keep to these meadows and make your dwelling away from the trees. Fear the Horned One and spare his kin.\n

If you hold your life dear, keep to these meadows and make your dwelling away from the trees. Fear the Horned One and spare his kin.\n
Turkish: Dur ve uyarıma kulak ver yolcu. Senden önce pek çoğumuz, Odin'in emriyle verdiği vazifeyi yerine getirmek üzere buraya getirildik. Önünde uzanan yol zorlu ve büyük tehlikelerle dolu. Canına kıymet veriyorsan, bu çayırlardan uzaklaşma ve yuvanı ağaçlardan uzakta bir yere kur. Boynuzlu'dan kork ve onun gibilerden sakın.
Lithuanian: Hold, traveller, and bear witness to my warning. We are many who have come before you, carried here by Odin's will to do his work. The path ahead is hard and the dangers great. If you hold your life dear, keep to these meadows and make your dwelling away from the trees. Fear the Horned One and spare his kin.\n
Czech: Hold, traveller, and bear witness to my warning. We are many who have come before you, carried here by Odin's will to do his work. The path ahead is hard and the dangers great. If you hold your life dear, keep to these meadows and make your dwelling away from the trees. Fear the Horned One and spare his kin.\n
Hungarian: Megállj, vándor, és légy tanúja a figyelmeztetésemnek! Sokan vagyunk, akik Odin akaratában előtted járunk, hogy elvégezzük a parancsát. Az előttünk álló út nehéz, a veszélyek pedig hatalmasak. Ha kedves az életed, maradj ezeken a mezőkön, lakhelyedet pedig a fáktól távol állítsd fel! Félj a Szarvastól, és kíméld meg a fajtársait!
Slovak: Hold, traveller, and bear witness to my warning. We are many who have come before you, carried here by Odin's will to do his work. The path ahead is hard and the dangers great. If you hold your life dear, keep to these meadows and make your dwelling away from the trees. Fear the Horned One and spare his kin.\n
Polish: Strzeż się, podróżniku, i daj świadectwo mojemu ostrzeżeniu. Wielu z nas przybyło przed tobą, by na rozkaz Odyna wypełnić jego wolę. Droga przed nami jest trudna, a niebezpieczeństwa czają się na każdym kroku. Jeśli życie ci miłe, trzymaj się tych łąk i szukaj schronienia z dala od drzew. Lękaj się Rogatego i oszczędź jego ród.
Dutch: Wacht, reiziger, en luister naar mijn waarschuwing. Velen zijn je voorgegaan, hier gebracht door Odins wil om voor hem te arbeiden. Het pad voor je is zwaar en vol gevaren. Als je leven je lief is, blijf dan in deze weiden en bouw je verblijf ver van de bomen. Vrees de Gehoornde en spaar zijn verwanten.
Portuguese: Hold, traveller, and bear witness to my warning. We are many who have come before you, carried here by Odin's will to do his work. The path ahead is hard and the dangers great. If you hold your life dear, keep to these meadows and make your dwelling away from the trees. Fear the Horned One and spare his kin.\n
Portuguese_Brazilian: Pare, viajante, e ouça o meu alerta. Fomos muitos os que viemos antes de você, aqui trazidos pela vontade de Odin. O caminho à frente é árduo e os perigos imponentes. Se você tem amor à preciosa vida, não se afaste destes prados e faça sua morada longe das árvores. Tema o Chifrudo e poupe a prole dele.
Chinese: 等等旅行者，请耐心听完我的提醒。 我们是在你之前来到这片土地上的，奥丁把我们带到了这里完成他的使命，你未来的道路艰难并危机重重。 如果你想远离危险，请留在青青草原并在远离树林的地方修建居所。 \n\n要对有犄角的保持敬畏并放过它的血脉。
Japanese: 旅人よ、待て。 忠告に耳を傾けよ。 我らは汝の前に、オーディンによってその仕事をするために送り込まれた多くの者。 行く手の道は険しく、危険は大きい。 命を大事と思うなら、草原から離れず、家は木々より遠くに建てよ。 角あるものを恐れ、その一族を殺すべからず。
Korean: 여행자여, 기다려라. 충고에 귀를 기울이라. 우리는 그대보다 먼저 오딘의 의지에 따라 당신의 일을 수행하기 위해 보내졌던 많은 자들중 하나다. 앞길은 위험하고 험난하다. 생명을 소중히 생각하거든 목초지를 떠나지 말고, 집은 나무에서 멀리 지으라. 뿔이 난 것을 두려워하고 그의 일족을 죽이지 말아라. \n
Chinese_Traditional: 等等旅行者，請耐心聽完我的提醒。 我們是在你之前來到這片土地上的，奧丁把我們帶到了這裡完成他的使命，你未來的道路艱難並危機重重。 如果你想遠離危險，請留在青青草原並在遠離樹林的地方修建居所。 \n\n要對有犄角的保持敬畏並放過它的血脈。

English: Heed these words of Ulf, a poor settler in a strange land. You will find here good stone and wood, all you need to build a house. You will need to craft a roof to keep out the rain. Then you will need walls to stop the roof from falling down. Finally, you must have a door or it will be much harder to go in and out.\n\nThese things Ulf has learned for himself. Now he writes them on this stone to help others. Pray to Odin for his soul.
Swedish: Lyss till dessa ord från Ulf, en fattig nybyggare i ett främmande land. Här finnes sten och starkt trä, allt du behöver för att bygga ett hem. Höj ett tak för att hålla regnet ute. Res sedan väggar för att hålla taket på plats. Bygg slutligen en dörr, ty svårt blir det annars att träda in och ut.\n\nDessa ting har Ulf lärt sig. Nu reser han denna sten för att hjälpa andra. Be till Oden för hans själ.
French: Entendez la parole d'Ulf, un simple hère dans ce lieu étrange. Ici, vous trouverez de la pierre et du bois, tout ce qu'il faut pour construire une maison. Vous devrez bâtir un toit pour vous protéger de la pluie. Puis il vous faudra des murs pour éviter que le toit ne s'écroule. Enfin, il vous faudra une porte, ou vous aurez du mal à entrer et sortir.\n\nUlf a appris cela par lui-même. À présent, il écrit ces conseils sur cette pierre pour aider les autres. Qu'Odin ait pitié de lui.
Italian: Heed these words of Ulf, a poor settler in a strange land. You will find here good stone and wood, all you need to build a house. You will need to craft a roof to keep out the rain. Then you will need walls to stop the roof from falling down. Finally, you must have a door or it will be much harder to go in and out.\n\nThese things Ulf has learned for himself. Now he writes them on this stone to help others. Pray to Odin for his soul.
German: Höre diese Worte von Ulf, einem armen Siedler in einem fremden Land. Du wirst hier gute Steine und gutes Holz finden, also alles, womit du ein Haus bauen kannst. Fertige ein Dach an, das dich vor dem Regen schützt. Errichte danach Mauen, um zu verhindern, dass dein Dach zu Boden fällt. Am Ende, fertige eine Tür, damit du hinein- und hinausgelangst.\n\nDiese Dinge hat Ulf gelernt. Jetzt hält er sie auf diesem Stein fest, um anderen zu helfen. Bete für seine Seele zu Odin.
Spanish: Atiende a las palabras de Ulf, un pobre habitante de unas tierras desconocidas. Aquí encontrarás piedras y madera de calidad: todo lo que necesitas para construir una casa. También te hará falta un tejado para protegerte de la lluvia y paredes para que el tejado no se derrumbe. Por último, necesitarás una puerta, o entrar y salir será una tarea un tanto complicada.\n\nUlf ha aprendido todo eso por su cuenta y ahora lo escribe en esta piedra para ayudar a los demás. Que Odín se apiade de su alma.
Russian: Прислушайтесь к словам Ульфа, бедного поселенца чужого края. Здесь вы найдете хороший камень и дерево — все, что нужно для постройки дома. Вам нужна будет крыша, чтобы укрыться от дождя. Для этого вам понадобятся стены, чтобы крыша не упала. Наконец, у вас должна быть дверь, иначе будет намного труднее входить и выходить.\n\nЭти вещи Ульф узнал сам. Теперь он пишет их на этом камне, чтобы помочь другим. Помолитесь Одину за его душу.
Romanian: Heed these words of Ulf, a poor settler in a strange land. You will find here good stone and wood, all you need to build a house. You will need to craft a roof to keep out the rain. Then you will need walls to stop the roof from falling down. Finally, you must have a door or it will be much harder to go in and out.\n\nThese things Ulf has learned for himself. Now he writes them on this stone to help others. Pray to Odin for his soul.
Bulgarian: Heed these words of Ulf, a poor settler in a strange land. You will find here good stone and wood, all you need to build a house. You will need to craft a roof to keep out the rain. Then you will need walls to stop the roof from falling down. Finally, you must have a door or it will be much harder to go in and out.\n\nThese things Ulf has learned for himself. Now he writes them on this stone to help others. Pray to Odin for his soul.

Then you will need walls to stop the roof from falling down. Finally, you must have a door or it will be much harder to go in and out.\n\nThese things Ulf has learned for himself. Now he writes them on this stone to help others. Pray to Odin for his soul.

Then you will need walls to stop the roof from falling down. Finally, you must have a door or it will be much harder to go in and out.\n\nThese things Ulf has learned for himself. Now he writes them on this stone to help others. Pray to Odin for his soul.

Then you will need walls to stop the roof from falling down. Finally, you must have a door or it will be much harder to go in and out.\n\nThese things Ulf has learned for himself. Now he writes them on this stone to help others. Pray to Odin for his soul.
Icelandic: Heed these words of Ulf, a poor settler in a strange land. You will find here good stone and wood, all you need to build a house. You will need to craft a roof to keep out the rain. Then you will need walls to stop the roof from falling down. Finally, you must have a door or it will be much harder to go in and out.\n\nThese things Ulf has learned for himself. Now he writes them on this stone to help others. Pray to Odin for his soul.
Turkish: Bu yaban topraklara göçen zavallı Ulf'un sözlerine kulak kabart. Burada evini inşa etmek için en iyisinden taş ve odun bulacaksın. Yağmuru uzak tutmak için bir çatı ve bu çatının çökmesini engellemek için duvar yapman gerekecek. Son olarak da bir kapın olmalı ki içeri kolayca girip çıkabilesin.\n\nUlf bu şeyleri kendi başına öğrendi. Şimdi de başkalarına yardımcı olmak için bu taşa yazıyor. Ruhu için Odin'e dua et.
Lithuanian: Heed these words of Ulf, a poor settler in a strange land. You will find here good stone and wood, all you need to build a house. You will need to craft a roof to keep out the rain. Then you will need walls to stop the roof from falling down. Finally, you must have a door or it will be much harder to go in and out.\n\nThese things Ulf has learned for himself. Now he writes them on this stone to help others. Pray to Odin for his soul.
Czech: Heed these words of Ulf, a poor settler in a strange land. You will find here good stone and wood, all you need to build a house. You will need to craft a roof to keep out the rain. Then you will need walls to stop the roof from falling down. Finally, you must have a door or it will be much harder to go in and out.\n\nThese things Ulf has learned for himself. Now he writes them on this stone to help others. Pray to Odin for his soul.
Hungarian: Szívleld meg Ulf, egy szegény telepes szavait egy furcsa földön! Itt jó kőre és fára lelsz, minden, ami egy házépítéshez kellhet. Tetőt kell készítened, hogy kívül tartsd az esőt. Azután falakra lesz szükséged, hogy megakadályozd a tető lezuhanását. Végül pedig kelleni fog egy ajtó, különben lényegesen megnehezül a ki- és bejárkálás.\n\nEzeket a dolgokat Ulf saját magától tanulta meg. Most erre a kőre jegyzi fel őket, hogy másoknak segítsen. Imádkozz Odinhoz a lelkéért!
Slovak: Heed these words of Ulf, a poor settler in a strange land. You will find here good stone and wood, all you need to build a house. You will need to craft a roof to keep out the rain. Then you will need walls to stop the roof from falling down. Finally, you must have a door or it will be much harder to go in and out.\n\nThese things Ulf has learned for himself. Now he writes them on this stone to help others. Pray to Odin for his soul.
Polish: Posłuchaj słów Ulfa, biednego osadnika w obcej krainie. Znajdziesz tu solidne kamienie i drewno – wszystko, czego potrzebujesz do budowy domu. Twoim zadaniem będzie utworzenie dachu, by chronić domostwo przed deszczem. Następnie musisz postawić ściany, by dach nie spadł. Wreszcie zbuduj drzwi, bez których wchodzenie i wychodzenie będzie znacznie trudniejsze.\n\nTych rzeczy Ulf sam się nauczył. Teraz wyrył je na tym kamieniu, by pomóc innym. Módlcie się do Odyna o jego duszę.
Dutch: Neem de woorden in acht van Ulf, een arme kolonist in een vreemd land. Je zult hier goede stenen en hout vinden, alles wat je nodig hebt om een huis te bouwen. Je zult een dak moeten bouwen om de regen buiten te houden. Daarna zul je muren nodig hebben om te zorgen dat het dak niet valt. Uiteindelijk zul je een deur moeten hebben, anders zal naar binnen en naar buiten gaan een stuk lastiger worden.\n\nDit heeft Ulf zelf geleerd. Nu schrijft hij het op deze steen om anderen te helpen. Bid tot Odin voor zijn ziel.
Portuguese: Heed these words of Ulf, a poor settler in a strange land. You will find here good stone and wood, all you need to build a house. You will need to craft a roof to keep out the rain. Then you will need walls to stop the roof from falling down. Finally, you must have a door or it will be much harder to go in and out.\n\nThese things Ulf has learned for himself. Now he writes them on this stone to help others. Pray to Odin for his soul.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Atenção a estas palavras de Ulf, um pobre colono em uma terra estranha. Aqui você encontrará pedras e madeira de qualidade, tudo de que precisa para construir uma casa. Fabrique um telhado para se proteger da chuva. Depois, erga paredes para evitar que o telhado caia. Por fim, uma porta se fará necessária, ou entrar e sair será uma coisa penosa.\n\nEssas coisas Ulf aprendeu por conta própria, conhecimento que ele agora escreve nesta pedra para ajudar os outros. Ore a Odin por sua alma.
Chinese:
听从乌尔夫的建议，一个在这片土地上生存过的定居者。 你会找到良好的石头和木材，这是你修建一间房子的所有必需品。 你需要建造屋顶来遮风挡雨。 然后你需要建造木墙来支撑屋顶。 最后，你需要一扇门来放置别人轻易进出你的房子。 


这是乌尔夫自己领悟到的，他把这些信息刻在了石碑上以帮助他人。 为奥丁的灵魂祈祷。
Japanese: 異国の地のあわれな居住者ウルフの言葉に留意せよ。 ここでは良き石と木が手に入る。 家を建てればよいだけだ。 雨を避ける屋根を作れ。 屋根が崩れぬよう、壁を作れ。 最後にドアを作るのだ。 ないと出入りに苦労する。 \n\nウルフはこれらを独学で身につけた。 他の者たちの助けになるよう、この石に書いておく。 ウルフの魂のため、オーディンに祈りを。
Korean: 낯선 땅에 사는 가난한 정착민 울프의 말에 귀를 기울이십시오. 이곳에서 집을 짓는 데 필요한 돌과 나무를 찾을 수 있습니다. 비를 막기 위해 지붕을 만들어야합니다. 그 다음 지붕이 무너지는 것을 막기 위해 벽이 필요합니다. 마지막으로, 문이 있어야합니다. 그렇지 않으면 출입하기가 훨씬 더 어려워집니다. \n\n이것들은 울프가 스스로 꺠달은 것들입니다. 이제 그는 다른 사람들을 돕기 위해 이 돌에 새겨넣습니다. 그의 영혼을 위해 오딘께 기도하세요.
Chinese_Traditional:
聽從烏爾夫的建議，一個在這片土地上生存過的定居者。 你會找到良好的石頭和木材，這是你修建一間房子的所有必需品。 你需要建造屋頂來遮風擋雨。 然後你需要建造木牆來支撐屋頂。 最後，你需要一扇門來防止別人輕易進出你的房子。 


這是烏爾夫自己領悟到的，他把這些訊息刻在了石碑上以幫助他人。 為奧丁的靈魂祈禱。

English: I was Astrid, a shieldmaiden of the forest. I know nothing of my life before I came here but my arm remembers the sword and my eyes see the course of the arrow. Now the raven guides me and I fight the great beasts in Odin's name.
Swedish: Jag var Astrid, en skogens sköldmö. Intet minns jag om mitt liv innan hit jag kom, men min arm minns svärdet och mina ögon ser pilens flykt. Korpen vägleder mig, och tar strid till urtidsbestarna gör jag nu i Odens namn.
French: J'étais Astrid, une guerrière de la forêt. Je ne sais rien de ma vie avant d'arriver ici, mais mon bras se rappelle mon épée, et mes yeux connaissent la trajectoire de la flèche. À présent, le corbeau me guide et j'affronte de féroces bêtes au nom d'Odin.
Italian: I was Astrid, a shieldmaiden of the forest. I know nothing of my life before I came here but my arm remembers the sword and my eyes see the course of the arrow. Now the raven guides me and I fight the great beasts in Odin's name.
German: Ich war einst Astrid, Schildmaid des Waldes. Ich weiß nichts mehr über mein Leben, bevor ich hier erwachte … doch mein Arm erinnert sich des Schwertes und meine Augen erkennen den Flug von Pfeilen. Und nun leiten mich die Raben. Heute kämpfe ich in Odins Namen gegen Biester und Bestien.
Spanish: Yo era Astrid, una doncella escudera del bosque. No sé cómo era mi vida antes de llegar aquí, pero estos brazos recuerdan la espada y estos ojos ven la trayectoria de las flechas. Ahora el cuervo me guía y lucho contra las bestias en nombre de Odín.
Russian: Меня звали Астрид, защитница леса. Я ничего не знаю о своей жизни до того, как попала сюда, но моя рука помнит меч, а мои глаза видят направление стрел. Теперь меня ведет ворон, и я сражаюсь с великими чудищами во имя Одина.
Romanian: I was Astrid, a shieldmaiden of the forest. I know nothing of my life before I came here but my arm remembers the sword and my eyes see the course of the arrow. Now the raven guides me and I fight the great beasts in Odin's name.
Bulgarian: I was Astrid, a shieldmaiden of the forest. I know nothing of my life before I came here but my arm remembers the sword and my eyes see the course of the arrow. Now the raven guides me and I fight the great beasts in Odin's name.
Macedonian: I was Astrid, a shieldmaiden of the forest. I know nothing of my life before I came here but my arm remembers the sword and my eyes see the course of the arrow. Now the raven guides me and I fight the great beasts in Odin's name.
Finnish: I was Astrid, a shieldmaiden of the forest. I know nothing of my life before I came here but my arm remembers the sword and my eyes see the course of the arrow. Now the raven guides me and I fight the great beasts in Odin's name.
Danish: I was Astrid, a shieldmaiden of the forest. I know nothing of my life before I came here but my arm remembers the sword and my eyes see the course of the arrow. Now the raven guides me and I fight the great beasts in Odin's name.
Icelandic: I was Astrid, a shieldmaiden of the forest. I know nothing of my life before I came here but my arm remembers the sword and my eyes see the course of the arrow. Now the raven guides me and I fight the great beasts in Odin's name.
Turkish: Ben ormanın kalkanlı kızlarından Astrid. Buraya gelmeden önceki hayatım hakkında hiçbir şey bilmesem de kolum kılıcı ve gözlerim ise okun çizdiği yolu hatırlıyor. Bana artık kuzgun rehberlik ediyor ve Odin'in şanı uğruna koca canavarlarla savaşıyorum.
Lithuanian: I was Astrid, a shieldmaiden of the forest. I know nothing of my life before I came here but my arm remembers the sword and my eyes see the course of the arrow. Now the raven guides me and I fight the great beasts in Odin's name.
Czech: I was Astrid, a shieldmaiden of the forest. I know nothing of my life before I came here but my arm remembers the sword and my eyes see the course of the arrow. Now the raven guides me and I fight the great beasts in Odin's name.
Hungarian: Astrid voltam, az erdő pajzshordója. Semmit sem tudok az életemről azelőttről, hogy idejöttem, de a karom emlékszik a kardra, a szemem pedig látja a nyílvessző útját. Most a holló vezet engem, én pedig Odin nevében harcolok a nagy fenevadakkal.
Slovak: I was Astrid, a shieldmaiden of the forest. I know nothing of my life before I came here but my arm remembers the sword and my eyes see the course of the arrow. Now the raven guides me and I fight the great beasts in Odin's name.
Polish: Byłam kiedyś Astrid, strażniczką lasu. Nie pamiętam nic o swoim życiu, zanim tu przybyłam, lecz moje ramię pamięta miecz, a oczy śledzą ruch strzały. Teraz prowadzi mnie kruk, a ja w imię Odyna walczę z ogromnymi bestiami.
Dutch: Ik was Astrid, een schildmaagd van het bos. Van mijn leven voor ik hier kwam weet ik niets, maar mijn arm herinnert zich mijn zwaard, en mijn ogen kunnen een pijl volgen in vlucht. Nu leidt de raaf me en vecht ik tegen grote beesten in Odins naam.
Portuguese: I was Astrid, a shieldmaiden of the forest. I know nothing of my life before I came here but my arm remembers the sword and my eyes see the course of the arrow. Now the raven guides me and I fight the great beasts in Odin's name.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Eu era Astrid, uma escudeira da floresta. Não sei nada da minha vida antes de chegar aqui, mas meu braço recorda-se da espada e meus olhos enxergam o caminho das flechas. Agora sigo o corvo e luto contra as terríveis feras em nome de Odin.
Chinese: 我曾是阿斯特丽德，一名护林女。 我不记得我来这里前的生活，但是我的手臂记得怎么用剑，我的眼睛能看见箭的轨迹。 现在那只乌鸦是我的向导，而我，为了奥丁而战。
Japanese: 私はアストリッド、森の楯の乙女であった。 ここに来る前のことは何も知らないが、この腕が剣を、目が矢の軌跡を覚えていた。 今は鴉に導かれ、オーディンの名において、大きな獣たちと戦っている。
Korean: 나는 아스트리드, 숲의 보호자였어. 이곳에 오기 전까지 내 삶에 대해 아무것도 모르지만 나의 팔은 검을 기억하고 나의 눈은 화살의 궤적을 본다. 지금은 까마귀의 인도를 받아 오딘의 이름으로 큰 짐승들과 싸우고 있지.
Chinese_Traditional: 我曾是阿斯特麗德，一名護林女。 我不記得我來這裡前的生活，但是我的手臂記得怎麼用劍，我的眼睛能看見箭的軌跡。 現在那隻烏鴉是我的嚮導，而我，為了奧丁而戰。

English:
Watch for him in moonlight

Haunter of the night.

Soft of foot

Sharp of tooth

Slow to stalk

Quick to bite.
Swedish:
Sök honom i månljuset

Nattlig jägare

Lätt tass

Vass tand

Långsamt spårar han

Kvickt biter han.
French:
Cherchez-le sous la lune

Il hante la nuit.

Pas de velours

Croc aiguisé

Chasseur appliqué

Morsure fatale.
Italian:
Watch for him in moonlight

Haunter of the night.

Soft of foot

Sharp of tooth

Slow to stalk

Quick to bite.
German:
Achtung er kommt, im Lichte der Nacht

Er jagt dir nach, so gut gibt Acht

Ist sanften Schrittes

Mit scharfen Zähnen

Und läuft bedächtig -

Doch beißt er zu, mit aller Macht.
Spanish:
A la luz de la luna has de buscar

Al ser que en la noche suele morar.

Pies ligeros

Colmillos afilados

Acecha con calma

Muerde sin falta.
Russian:
При свете луны

Охотник в ночи

Мягко ступает,

Больно кусает,

Легко догоняет

И убивает.
Romanian:
Watch for him in moonlight

Haunter of the night.

Soft of foot

Sharp of tooth

Slow to stalk

Quick to bite.

Watch for him in moonlight

Haunter of the night.

Soft of foot

Sharp of tooth

Slow to stalk

Quick to bite.

Watch for him in moonlight

Haunter of the night.

Soft of foot

Sharp of tooth

Slow to stalk

Quick to bite.
Finnish:
Watch for him in moonlight

Haunter of the night.

Soft of foot

Sharp of tooth

Slow to stalk

Quick to bite.
Danish:
Watch for him in moonlight

Haunter of the night.

Soft of foot

Sharp of tooth

Slow to stalk

Quick to bite.
Icelandic:
Watch for him in moonlight

Haunter of the night.

Soft of foot

Sharp of tooth

Slow to stalk

Quick to bite.
Turkish:
Mehtap varken dikkat et

Geceleri ziyaret eder.

Adımları yavaş

Dişleri keskin

Yavaşça izler

Çabucak ısırır.
Lithuanian:
Watch for him in moonlight

Haunter of the night.

Soft of foot

Sharp of tooth

Slow to stalk

Quick to bite.
Czech:
Watch for him in moonlight

Haunter of the night.

Soft of foot

Sharp of tooth

Slow to stalk

Quick to bite.
Hungarian:
Keresd a holdfényben

az éjszaka kísértőjét!

Talpa puha,

foga hegyes,

lassan cserkészve,

fürgén tép szét.
Slovak:
Watch for him in moonlight

Haunter of the night.

Soft of foot

Sharp of tooth

Slow to stalk

Quick to bite.
Polish:
Wypatruj go w świetle księżyca

Łowca nocy

O delikatnych chodzie

Z ostrymi zębami

Łatwy cel

Szybki kęs.
Dutch:
Wacht op hem in het maanlicht

Nachtjager

Zachtvoetige

Scherptand

Langzame sluiper

Snelle bijter.
Portuguese:
Watch for him in moonlight

Haunter of the night.

Soft of foot

Sharp of tooth

Slow to stalk

Quick to bite.
Portuguese_Brazilian:
Cuidado com ele ao luar

Augúrio da noite.

Pés leves

Dentes afiados

Espreita com vagar

Morde com rapidez.
Chinese:
在月光中眺望他

暗夜中的徘徊者

无声的脚步

尖利的牙齿

慢慢靠近

瞬间咬杀
Japanese:
彼の者、月のもとに現れぬ。 

夜をさまよう者。 

足音は軽く

歯は鋭く

歩みは急がず

すばやく噛む。
Korean:
달빛속의 그를 조심하라

밤의 사냥꾼. 

부드러움의 발

날카로움의 이빨

느리게 다가가

빠르게 물어뜯는다.
Chinese_Traditional:
在月光中眺望他

暗夜中的徘徊者

無聲的腳步

尖利的牙齒

慢慢靠近

瞬間咬殺

English: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Swedish: Få av oss fann vägen till dessa höjder. Tjugo var vi, och två är vi nu. Agda är döende, en Draugs pil nära hjärtat. Jag tar farväl brevid denna sten, och lämnar hennes aska till vinden. Sedan vänder jag anletet mot den högsta höjd, där den Bevingade väntar. Må Oden skänka mig ära eller död.
French: Peu d'entre nous ont trouvé le chemin de ces montagnes. Nous étions vingt et nous ne sommes plus que deux. Agda est mourante, une flèche Draugr fichée près de son cœur. Je lui dirai adieu près de cette pierre et offrirai ses cendres au vent. Je me tournerai ensuite vers le plus haut pic et chercherai l'Ailée. Qu'Odin m'accorde mort et gloire.
Italian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
German: Nur wenige von uns fanden ihren Weg in diese Berge. Wir waren einst zwanzig, doch nur sind wir nur noch zwei. Agda liegt im Sterben. Neben ihrem Herz befindet sich ein Draugr-Pfeil. Ich werde mich neben diesem Stein von ihr verabschieden und ihre Asche den Winden übergeben. Dann werde ich mich dem höchsten Gipfel zuwenden und den Geflügelten aufsuchen. Möge Odin mir Ruhm geben … oder Tod.
Spanish: No somos muchos los que dimos con el camino hacia estas montañas. Éramos veinte, pero ya solo quedamos dos. Agda, con una flecha de draugr junto al corazón, muere lentamente. Me despediré de ella junto a esta roca y le daré al viento sus cenizas. Después, miraré hacia la cima más alta y buscaré a la Alada. Que Odín me dé la muerte o la gloria.
Russian: Мало кто из нас попал в эти горы. Нас было двадцать, а теперь двое. Агда умирает, стрела драуга пронзила ее сердце. Я попрощаюсь с ней у этого камня и развею ее пепел по ветру. Затем повернусь я лицом к высочайшей горе и найду там Крылатого. Да подарит мне Один достойную смерть.
Romanian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Bulgarian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Macedonian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Finnish: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Danish: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Icelandic: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Turkish: Pek azımız bu dağların yolunu bulabildi. Sayımız yirmiydi ama iki kişi kaldık. Agda ölüyor, bir Draugr oku kalbinin yakınına saplandı. Bu taşın yanı başında ona veda edip küllerini rüzgâra savuracağım. Sonra da yüzümü en yüksek tepeye çevirip Kanatlı Varlık'ı arayacağım. Odin bana ya ölüm ya da zafer bahşetsin.
Lithuanian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Czech: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Hungarian: Kevesen találtuk meg az ezekbe a hegyekbe vezető utat. Huszan voltunk, és mostanra ketten maradtunk. Agda haldoklik, egy draugr nyílvessző a szíve közelében találta el. Elbúcsúzom tőle ezen kő mellett, és hamvait a szélnek eresztem. Azután a legmagasabb csúcs felé fordulok, és megkeresem a szárnyast. Odin biztosítson nekem halált vagy dicsőséget!
Slovak: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Polish: Niewielu z nas trafiło w te góry. Było nas dwadzieścioro, a zostało dwoje. Agda umiera, jej serce przeszyła strzała draugra. Pożegnam się z nią przy tym kamieniu i rozsypię jej prochy na wietrze. Wtedy odwrócę me oblicze ku najwyższemu szczytowi i odszukam Skrzydlatego. Niech Odyn ześle mi śmierć lub chwałę.
Dutch: Weinigen van ons wisten de bergen te bereiken. Waar we eerst met twintig waren, zijn er nu nog twee over. Agda is stervende, en een draugenpijl heeft haar nabij haar hart doorboort. Ik zeg haar vaarwel naast deze steen, en zal haar as aan de wind geven. Daarna wend ik mijn blik tot de hoogste piek en zoek ik de Gevleugelde. Moge Odin me glorie brengen, dan wel de dood.
Portuguese: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Poucos de nós encontraram o caminho até estas montanhas. Éramos vinte, e agora somos dois. Agda está morrendo, uma flecha dos Draugr aninhada perto de seu coração. Darei adeus a ela ao lado desta pedra e entregarei suas cinzas ao vento. Depois, buscarei o pico mais alto e partirei em busca do Alado. Que Odin me dê morte ou glória.
Chinese: 我们几个找到了去凛冽雪山的路。 我们开始有二十人，现在剩下两人。 阿格达快要死去了，她的心被一只尸鬼箭射中。 我将会在这块石碑旁给她举行一场告别仪式并把她的骨灰撒进风中。 然后我会将我的脸转向最高的地方并找到那对翅膀。 愿奥丁赐予我荣耀或是死亡。
Japanese: これらの山に足を踏み入れる者は少なかった。 最初は二十人いたものが、今では二人だ。 アグダは死にかけている。 ドラウグルの矢が心臓の近くに刺さったのだ。 私はこの石の近くで彼女に別れを告げ、彼女の灰を風に飛ばすだろう。 その後、顔を最も高い頂に向けて翼ある者を探すのだ。 オーディンが私に死か栄光をたまわらんことを。
Korean: 이 산에 발을 들여놓는 사람은 거의 없습니다. 처음에는 스무 명이 있었는데 지금은 두 명입니다. 아그다는 죽어가고 있습니다. 드라우그의 화살이 심장 근처에 꽂힌 것입니다. 나는 이 돌 근처에서 그녀에게 작별을 고하고 그녀의 재를 바람에 날릴 것입니다. 그런 다음 내 얼굴을 가장 높은 정상으로 향하게 하고 날개 달린 자를 찾을 것입니다. 오딘이 내게 죽음이나 영광을 주길 바랍니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 我們幾個找到了去凜冽雪山的路。 我們開始有二十人，現在剩下兩人。 阿格達快要死去了，她的心被一枝屍鬼箭射中。 我將會在這塊石碑旁給她舉行一場告別儀式並把她的骨灰撒進風中。 然後我會將我的臉轉向最高的地方並找到那對翅膀。 願奧丁賜予我榮耀或是死亡。

English: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Swedish: Denna sten markerar platsen där den första draken skådades av mig, Ulf, under min tredje sommar i Valheim. Hon stannade här för att lämna en dynghög i vilken jag fann benen av en hjort, ett svin, och en Grådvärg. Jag kommer aldrig till denna plats återvända.
French: Ceci marque l'endroit où moi, Ulf, ai vu la grande Drac pour la première fois, lors du troisième été de ma vie à Valheim. Elle s'est arrêtée pour se soulager d'un tas de fumier contenant des os de cerf, de sanglier et un crâne de Naingris. Je ne reviendrai plus jamais ici.
Italian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
German: Diese Stelle markiert den Ort, an dem ich, Ulf, zuerst den großen Drachen erblickte. Während meines dritten Sommers in Valheim. Sie machte hier Rast, um einen Haufen Exkremente zu hinterlassen, der aus den Knochen von Hirschen und Wildschweinen und dem Schädel eines Grauzwergs bestand. Ich werde mich diesem Ort nie wieder nähern.
Spanish: Aquí está el lugar en el que yo, Ulf, vi a la gran dragona por primera vez. Fue el tercer verano de mi vida en Valheim. Se detuvo a dejar una pila de basura formada por huesos de ciervo, jabalí e incluso el cráneo de un grisucio. Jamás volveré a acercarme a este lugar.
Russian: Это место, где я, Ульф, впервые увидел самку дракона, третьим летом моего пребывания в Вальхейме. Она остановилась здесь, оставив после себя переваренную кучу костей оленя, кабана и череп грейдворфа. Я никогда больше не подойду к этому месту.
Romanian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Bulgarian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Macedonian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Finnish: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Danish: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Icelandic: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Turkish: Ben Ulf tam da bu noktada, Valheim'daki hayatımın üçüncü yazında ulu ejderi ilk kez burada gördüm. Burada durup içinde geyik ve domuz kemikleri ile Bozcüce kafatası bulunan koca bir dışkı yığını bıraktı. Bir daha bu yerin yanına bile yaklaşmam.
Lithuanian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Czech: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Hungarian: Ez jelöli azt a helyet, ahol én, Ulf, életem harmadik nyarán Valheimben először pillantottam meg a nagy sárkányt. Itt állt meg, hogy szarvas és vaddisznó csontokat, valamint egy szürketörp koponyáját tartalmazó ürülékkupacot hagyjon maga után. Soha többé nem jövök a közelbe.
Slovak: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Polish: Ten znak wskazuje miejsce, gdzie po raz pierwszy ja, Ulf, ujrzałem wielką drakonę w trzecie lato mojego pobytu w Valheim. Zatrzymała się tutaj, by zostawić stos łajna pełnego kości jelenia, dzika i czaszki szarego karła. Nigdy więcej nie zbliżę się do tego miejsca.
Dutch: Dit is een merkteken voor de plek waar ik, Ulf, voor het eerst een grootse draak heb aanschouwd, in mijn derde zomer hier in Valheim. Ze stopte hier en liet een berg mest achter met daarin de botten van een hert en een everzwijn, en de schedel van een grijze dwerg. Ik zal me voortaan verre houden van deze plek.
Portuguese: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Isto marca o local onde eu, Ulf, avistei a grande mãe draco pela primeira vez, no terceiro verão da minha vida em Valheim. Ela parou aqui e defecou um monte de esterco com ossos de veado, javali e o crânio de um anão cinzento. Nunca mais vou chegar perto deste lugar.
Chinese: 这个标记是我，乌尔夫第一次看见霜龙的地方，那时是我在英灵神殿的第三个夏天。 她在这里留下了一堆沾着鹿骨，鬓猪骨和灰矮人头骨的粪便。 我再也不会到这附近来了。
Japanese: これは私、ウルフによって、Valheimで過ごす三度目の夏に初めて大いなるドレイクが目の当たりにされた場所を示すものである。 彼女はここに止まり、糞の山を残した。 その中には鹿や猪の骨、灰色ドワーフの頭蓋があった。 二度と私がこの場所に近づくことはないだろう。
Korean: 이곳은 저, 울프가 발하임에서 세 번째 보내는 여름에 거대한 드레이크를 처음 목격한 장소입니다. 그것은 이곳에 사슴과 멧돼지의 뼈 그리고 그레이 드워프의 두개골이 얽혀있는 배설물을 남기고 갔습니다. 저는 두 번 다시 이 근처에 오지 않을 것입니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 這個標記是我，烏爾夫第一次看見霜龍的地方，那時是我在瓦爾海姆的第三個夏天。 她在這裡留下了一堆沾著鹿骨，鬢豬骨和灰矮人頭骨的糞便。 我再也不會到這附近來了。

English: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Swedish: Stanna och lyssna, vandrare. På Valheims högsta höjder är luften tunn och karg. Härifrån kan du ibland höra ljudet från platser fjärran; stridens raseri från Midgård, sorlet av en fest från Valhalla, eller en Valkyrias skri när hon korsar intet mellan världar.
French: Arrêtez-vous et écoutez, voyageur. Sur les plus hautes cimes de Valheim, l'air est rare et fragile. D'ici, vous pouvez parfois entendre les bruits de lieux éloignés, le fracas des batailles de Midgard, le rugissement d'un festin au Valhalla ou le hurlement d'une Valkyrie qui traverse l'espace entre les mondes.
Italian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
German: Halte ein und höre zu, Reisender. Auf den höchsten Gipfeln Valheims ist die Luft nur sehr dünn. Von hier aus kannst du manchmal die Klänge anderer Orte vernehmen: den Schall des Kampfes von Midgard, das Gebrüll der Festgelage von Walhalla oder auch den Schrei einer Walküre, die gerade von einer in die andere Welt gelangt.
Spanish: Detente y escucha, caminante. En las cimas más altas de Valheim, el aire es escaso y frágil. Desde aquí puedes oír los sonidos procedentes de otros lugares: el repicar de una batalla en Midgard, el clamor de un banquete en el Valhalla o el alarido de una valquiria al cruzar la franja entre los mundos.
Russian: Постой и прислушайся, путник. На самых высоких вершинах Вальхейма воздух тонок и хрупок. Отсюда иногда можно уловить звуки из других мест: звон битвы в Мидгарде, шум пира в Вальгалле или крик валькирии, пересекающей пространство между мирами.
Romanian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Bulgarian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Macedonian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Finnish: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Danish: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Icelandic: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Turkish: Dur ve dinle yolcu. Valheim'ın en yüksek tepelerinde hava ince ve kırılgandır. Buradayken bazen başka diyarlardan gelen sesleri yakalayabilirsin: Midgard'daki bir muharebenin şıngırtılarını, Valhalla'da verilen bir ziyafetin kahkahalarını ya da bir dünyadan diğerine geçen bir Valkür'ün haykırışlarını.
Lithuanian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Czech: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Hungarian: Megállj, és fülelj, vándor! Valheim legmagasabb csúcsain a levegő ritka és múlandó. Innen néha más helyekről is hallhatsz hangokat: a midgardi csata gyűrűjét, a valhallai ünnep üvöltését vagy egy valkűr sikolyát, amikor áthalad a világok közötti téren.
Slovak: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Polish: Zatrzymaj się i posłuchaj, podróżniku. Na najwyższych szczytach Valheim powietrze jest rozrzedzone i słabe. Stąd czasem da się usłyszeć dźwięki pochodzące z innych zakątków – odgłosy toczącej się bitwy na Midgardzie, ryk uczty w Walhalli lub wrzask walkirii, gdy przemierza przestrzeń między światami.
Dutch: Stop, reiziger, en luister. Op de hoogste pieken van Valheim is de lucht dun en breekbaar. Je zult er soms geluiden kunnen horen die van elders komen: de strijdroep van Midgard, het gebulder van een feest in Walhalla, of de gil van een Walkure die de ruimte tussen de werelden doorkruist.
Portuguese: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Pare e ouça, viajante. Nos picos mais altos de Valheim, o ar é rarefeito e frágil. Daqui, por vezes é possível ouvir sons de outros lugares, um grito de batalha em Midgard, o rugido de um banquete em Valhalla ou o guincho de uma Valquíria que cruza o espaço entre os mundos.
Chinese: 请停下你的脚步并倾听，旅行者。 在英灵神殿最高的山峰，空气凛冽而稀薄。 在这里你有可能可以听到来自其他地方的声音，譬如人界战争的号角，瓦尔哈拉宴会的喧哗或女武神们穿梭在各个神界的哀鸣。
Japanese: 旅人よ、立ち止まり、聞け。 Valheimの最も高い頂においては空気は薄く、はかない。 ここでは、ミズガルズの戦いの響き、ヴァルハラの宴の騒ぎ、世界の間を飛び回るワルキューレの叫びなど、他の場所の音が聞こえることがある。
Korean: 멈추고 들어라, 여행자여. 발헤임의 가장 높은 봉우리에는 공기가 희박하고 깨지기 쉽습니다. 여기서는 미드가르드 전투의 울림, 발할라 잔치 소동, 세계를 날아다니는 발키리의 비명 지르는 소리가 들을 수 있습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 請停下你的腳步並傾聽，旅行者。 在瓦爾海姆最高的山峰，空氣凜冽而稀薄。 在這裡你有可能可以聽到來自其他地方的聲音，譬如人界戰爭的號角，英靈殿宴會的喧譁或女武神們穿梭在各個神界的哀鳴。

English: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Swedish: Där denna sten står såg jag en gång den stora draken ovan mig flyga, och gömde mig i en buske tills hon ej i fjärran syntes. Ulf den Modige reste denna sten.
French: De là, j'ai un jour vu la grande Drac me survoler et je me suis caché dans un buisson jusqu'à ce qu'elle s'en aille. Ulf le brave a gravé cette pierre.
Italian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
German: Der Ort, an dem dies steht, sah einst einen großen Drachen, der über mir schwebte - ich versteckte mich in einem Busch, bis er mich passiert hatte. Dieser Stein wurde von Ulf dem Mutigen gemeißelt.
Spanish: Una vez, donde está esta piedra, vi a la gran dragona sobrevolar este mismo lugar y tuve que esconderme en un arbusto hasta que se fue. Ulf el Audaz grabó esta piedra.
Russian: В этом месте я однажды увидел летящего надо мной огромного дракона. Тогда я спрятался в кустах, пока он не скрылся. Ульф Храбрый вырезал этот камень.
Romanian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Bulgarian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Macedonian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Finnish: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Danish: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Icelandic: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Turkish: Burada bir keresinde tepemde uçan bir ulu ejder görmüş ve geçene kadar çalılarda saklanmıştım. Bu taşı Cesur Ulf oydu.
Lithuanian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Czech: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Hungarian: Ahol ez áll, egyszer láttam egy hatalmas sárkány elrepülni felettem, és elbújtam egy bokorban, amíg nem távozott. Ulf, a bátor faragta ezt a követ.
Slovak: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Polish: Tam, gdzie stoi kamień, widziałem kiedyś wielką drakonę lecącą nade mną i ukryłem się w krzakach, dopóki mnie nie minęła. Ulf Odważny wyrył na tym kamieniu.
Dutch: Op deze plek zag ik eens een grootse draak overvliegen, en verstopte ik me in de struiken tot ze me voorbij was. Deze steen is gekerfd door Ulf de Dappere.
Portuguese: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Neste local eu vi a grande mãe draco voando sobre mim e me escondi em um arbusto até ela passar. Ulf, o Bravo, esculpiu esta pedra.
Chinese: 我曾在这里看到了正在盘旋的霜龙，我躲进了草丛直到她飞离了这里。 无畏者乌尔夫雕刻了这块石碑。
Japanese: これが立つ場所で、私は一度、大いなるドレイクが頭上を飛ぶのを見、彼女が去るまで茂みに隠れていた。 勇敢なるウルフがこの石に刻む。
Korean: 한 때 내가 서있는 곳에서 거대한 드레이크가 날아가는 것을 보았고 지나갈 때까지 덤불 속에 숨어있었어. 이 돌은 용사 울프가 조각한거야.
Chinese_Traditional: 我曾在這裡看到了正在盤旋的霜龍，我躲進了草叢直到她飛離了這裡。 無畏者烏爾夫雕刻了這塊石碑。

English: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Swedish: Låt den som mig läsa veta väl att på dessa höjder ej dröja; fjärran från hemmets härd och skogens trygga grönska. Odjuren i bergen är våldsamma och vildsinta, och värst av alla odjur är vinden själv. Bär tjocka hudar, bygg rasande eldar, och om du har livet kärt, vet att ej störa den stora drakens ägg.
French: Que ceux qui me lisent apprennent à ne pas lambiner sur ces versants, loin de leur foyer et de la sécurité des bois. Les bêtes de la montagne sont féroces, assoiffées de sang et il y a pire encore que ces créatures : le vent glacial. Portez d'épaisses fourrures, allumez de grands feux et ne dérangez sous aucun prétexte les œufs de la grande Drac si vous tenez à la vie.
Italian: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
German: Mögen jene, die dies lesen, an diesen Hügeln nicht lange verweilen - denn sie sind weit von der Sicherheit ihres Heims der grünen Wälder entfernt. Die Bestien der Berge sind tödlich und wild. Und sie hungern nach Fleisch. Doch die gefährlichste dieser Bestien ist der kalte Wind selbst. Möge ein jeder dicke Felle tragen, mächtige Feuer entfachen und sicherstellen, dass er nicht die Eier der großen Drachen stört … falls ihm sein Leben etwas bedeutet.
Spanish: Que todos quienes me lean no se entretengan en estas laderas, pues se encuentran lejos del hogar y de la protección del bosque. Las bestias de estas montañas son tan siniestras como feroces y hambrientas de carne. El peor de todas ellas es el viento gélido. Poneos pieles gruesas, encended hogueras y jamás molestéis a los huevos de la gran dragona si valoráis vuestras vidas.
Russian: Все, кто читает мои слова, знайте, что не стоит задерживаться на этих склонах, вдали от очага и безопасного леса. Звери в горах свирепые и дикие, они жаждут плоти. Но хуже зверей может быть только холодный ветер. Носите теплые меха, разводите большие костры и не трогайте яйца великих драконов, если дорожите своей жизнью.
Romanian: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.

Turkish: Bunu okuyanlar, evlerinin sıcağından ve çayırların o güvenli ortamından çok uzaktaki bu bayırlarda dolanmamaları gerektiğini bilsinler. Dağlarda kol gezen vahşi ve insafsız yaratıklar ete açtır ve bu yaratıklardan kötüsü de ayazın ta kendisidir. Canına değer veriyorsan kalın kürkünü giy, güçlü ateşler inşa et ve ulu ejderin yumurtalarına ilişme.
Lithuanian: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.

The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Hungarian: Azok, akik ezt olvassák, szerezzenek tudomást róla, hogy ne időzzenek ezeken a lejtőkön, messze a kandallójuk és a zöld rengeteg biztonságától! A hegyvidék fenevadjai könyörtelenek és vadak, húsra éheznek, és a legrosszabb közülük maga a hideg szél. Viselj vastag szőrmét, építs erős tüzeket, és ügyelj arra, hogy meg ne zavard a nagy sárkány tojásait, ha kedves az életed!
Slovak: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Polish: Niech czytelnicy wiedzą, żeby nie pozostawać na tych stokach, z dala od ogniska i schronienia liściastych lasów. Górskie bestie są dzikie i srogie, spragnione mięsa, a najgorszym z nich jest sam lodowaty wiatr. Noś grube futra, rozpalaj mocne ogniska i pamiętaj, by nie ruszać jaj wielkiej drakony, jeśli życie ci miłe.
Dutch: Laat degene die mij leest weten dat je op deze heuvels niet moet rusten, verre van je haard en de veiligheid van het groene bos. De beesten in deze bergen zijn wreed en ongenadig, en hongeren naar vlees; het ergste beest is de koude wind zelf. Draag dikke vachten, bouw stevige vuren, en zorg dat je de eieren van de grootse draak niet verstoord als je leven je lief is.
Portuguese: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Aos que leem, não se demorem nestas encostas, longe do lar e da segurança da floresta. Os animais das montanhas são cruéis e ferozes, famintos por carne, mas o pior deles é o próprio vento gélido. Vista peles grossas, monte fogueiras fortes e sob hipótese alguma perturbe os ovos da grande mãe draco, se é que você tem amor à vida.
Chinese: 让我告诉你，不要在这里停留，你已经离开安全范围很远很远了。 山里面的野兽凶残而狂暴，对新鲜的肉非常饥渴，比这些野兽更糟糕的是凛冽的寒风。 穿上厚实的护甲，升起篝火并保证不要打扰到霜龙的蛋，如果你还想活命的话。
Japanese: 我を読むものは心して、家の炉から、安全なる緑の森から離れたこの峰に、長くとどまるべからざることを知るべし。 山中の獣は気が荒く獰猛で肉に飢えている。 しかし最悪の獣は冷たい風それ自体である。 厚い毛皮を身にまとい、赤々と火を燃やし、命を大事と思うなら、ゆめ大いなるドレイクの卵に手を出すべからず。
Korean: 스스로를 읽는 자는 마음의 준비를 하고, 집의 난로에서 안전한 녹색 숲에서 떨어진 이 봉우리에 오래 머물지 않을 것임을 알아야 한다. 산중의 짐승은 성질이 사납고 사나워 고기에 굶주려 있다. 그러나 최악의 짐승은 찬바람 그 자체다. 두꺼운 털 가죽을 입고 새빨갛게 불을 지피고 목숨을 생각한다면 드레이크 알에 손을 대지 말 것.
Chinese_Traditional: 讓我告訴你，不要在這裡停留，你已經離開安全範圍很遠很遠了。 山裡面的野獸兇殘而狂暴，對新鮮的肉非常飢渴，比這些野獸更糟糕的是凜冽的寒風。 穿上厚實的護甲，升起篝火併保證不要打擾到霜龍的蛋，如果你還想活命的話。

English:
Great cities do not rise of themselves

Harden your heart, settler in a strange land

Build from the ground upwards
Swedish:
By och stad ej själva sig höja

Stärk ditt hjärta, du nybyggare i främmande land

Bygg från marken och uppåt
French:
Les grandes cités ne s'élèvent pas seules

Endurcissez votre cœur, étranger en ces terres

Bâtissez depuis le sol jusqu'au ciel
Italian:
Great cities do not rise of themselves

Harden your heart, settler in a strange land

Build from the ground upwards
German:
Große Städte entstehen nicht aus dem Nichts

Fasse dir ein Herz und besiedle ein befremdliches Land

Baue vom Boden aus nach oben
Spanish:
Las grandes ciudades no surgen solas

Fortalece tu corazón, habitante de una tierra desconocida de otrora

Construye desde el suelo en dirección al cielo
Russian:
Великие города не возникают сами по себе

Закали свое сердце, поселенец в чужой стране

Не бойся строить с нуля

Acélozd meg a szívedet, idegen föld telepese!

Építkezz lentről felfelé!
Slovak:
Great cities do not rise of themselves

Harden your heart, settler in a strange land

Wielkie miasta nie powstają same z siebie

Zahartuj swe serce, osadniku w obcej krainie

Buduj od poziomu ziemi w górę

Verstevig je hart, kolonist uit een vreemd land

Bouw omhoog vanaf de grond

Harden your heart, settler in a strange land

Build from the ground upwards

Chinese:
壮丽的城市从来不会平地而起

心如磐石，随遇而安

从零开始
Japanese:
大いなる都市は自然に作られるものにはあらず

異国の地に住まいを定めんとする者よ、心を強く持つべし

地面より高く目指し建物を建てよ
Korean:
위대한 도시는 스스로 생겨나지 않습니다

마음을 단련해, 이국의 정착민

처음부터 빌드 하는 것을 두려워하지 마십시오
Chinese_Traditional:
壯麗的城市從來不會平地而起

心如磐石，隨遇而安

從零開始

English: This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.\n\nSlay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
Swedish: Denna sten restes av mig, Astrid, under mitt sjunde år i Valheim. På denna plats talte Allfadern till mig. Från djup sömn vaknade jag att finna hans ord runt mig spridda, som småsten frusen på marken. Jag tinade dem i handen, och de talte till mig hans meddelande, ord för ord.\n\nDräp de Bannlysta. Häng deras huvuden. Jag skall komma.
French: Moi, Astrid, ai laissé cette pierre ici lors de ma septième année sur Valheim. C'est à cet endroit que le Père de Toute Chose m'a parlé. J'ai été tirée d'un profond sommeil par ses mots, éparpillés autour de moi sur le sol, emprisonnés dans la glace par le froid mordant. Quand je les ai réchauffés entre mes mains, ils ont fondu et m'ont transmis son message, un mot après l'autre.\n\nTriomphez des Déchus. Enchaînez leurs têtes. Je viendrai.
Italian: This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.\n\nSlay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
German: Dieser Stein wurde von mir, Astrid, hier platziert, während meines siebenten Jahres in Valheim. An einem Ort, an dem der Allvater selbst zu mir sprach. Ich erwachte aus einem tiefen Schlummer, nur um seine Worte um mich herum zu finden - auf dem Boden verstreut und aufgrund der Kälte zu Kieseln erfroren. Als ich sie in meiner Hand erwärmte, tauten sie auf, wodurch ich seine Botschaft vernahm. Ein Wort nach dem anderen.\n\nTöte die Wächter. Lege ihre Köpfe an die Kette. Ich werde kommen.
Spanish: Esta piedra la coloqué yo, Astrid, durante mi séptimo año en Valheim. El Padre Todopoderoso me habló en este lugar. Cuando me desperté de un sueño profundo, sus palabras se encontraban en el suelo, congeladas a causa del frío, a mi alrededor. Las cogí entre mis manos para que entraran en calor, y al derretirse me dieron el mensaje, palabra tras palabra.\n\n"Acaba con los Desterrados". "Encadénales las cabezas". "Acudiré".
Russian: Этот камень заложила я, Астрид, на седьмом году жизни в Вальхейме. Здесь со мной заговорил Всеотец. Я пробудилась ото сна и обнаружила, что его слова превратились в льдинки от сильного холода и рассыпались по земле вокруг меня. Когда я согрела их в руках, они оттаяли и передали мне его послание, слово за словом.\n\nУбей павших. Отруби им головы. Принеси их на алтарь. И я приду.
Romanian: This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.\n\nSlay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.

When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.\n\nSlay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
Turkish: Bu taş, Valheim'daki yedinci yılımda ben, yani Astrid tarafından yerleştirildi. İşte burada, Tanrıbaba benimle konuştu. Derin bir uykudan uyanıp Tanrıbaba'nın kelamını etrafımdaki toprağa dağılmış, derin soğukla donmuş çakıllarda buldum. Çakılları elime alıp ısıttığımda bana kelamını bir bir iletti.\n\nYitikler'i alt et. Başlarını zincirle. Geleceğim.
Lithuanian: This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.\n\nSlay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
