Czech: Something here might keep you alive a little longer. Though I don't know why you'd bother.
Hungarian: Valami itt lehet, hogy egy kicsit tovább életben fog tartani, habár fogalmam sincs, miért foglalkoznál vele.
Slovak: Something here might keep you alive a little longer. Though I don't know why you'd bother.
Polish: Coś tutaj może utrzyma cię przy życiu dłużej. Choć nie wiem, czy jest sens.
Dutch: Hier zit vast iets tussen wat je langer in leven houdt, al weet ik niet waarom je al die moeite zou doen.
Portuguese: Something here might keep you alive a little longer. Though I don't know why you'd bother.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Tem coisas aqui que ajudariam na sua sobrevivência, mas não sei por que se dar ao trabalho.
Chinese: 有些东西也许会让你延年益寿，不过我不知道你为啥想长寿。
Japanese: ここに並んでるもののおかげで、ちょっぴり長生きできるだろうよ。 おまえにはどうでもいいことだと思うがな。
Korean: 여기 있는 것 중엔 너를 조금 더 오래 살려 줄 수 있는 것도 있을지 몰라. 뭐, 그게 별 소용이 있겠냐마는.
Chinese_Traditional: 有些東西也許會讓你延年益壽，不過我不知道你為什麼想長寿。

English: Try not to wander too far. I want your things when you get killed.
Swedish: Gå inte för långt. Jag vill ha dina saker när du dör.
French: Évitez d'aller trop loin. Je veux récupérer vos affaires quand vous vous ferez tuer.
Italian: Try not to wander too far. I want your things when you get killed.
German: Versuche, dich nicht zu weit zu entfernen. Ich will nämlich deine Ausrüstung haben, wenn du stirbst.
Spanish: No te vayas muy lejos, así me quedaré tus pertenencias cuando mueras.
Russian: Не отходи слишком далеко, чтобы я смог забрать твои вещи, когда тебя убьют.
Romanian: Try not to wander too far. I want your things when you get killed.
Bulgarian: Try not to wander too far. I want your things when you get killed.
Macedonian: Try not to wander too far. I want your things when you get killed.
Finnish: Yritä olla vaeltamatta liian kauas. Haluan tavarasi kun sinut tapetaan.
Danish: Try not to wander too far. I want your things when you get killed.
Icelandic: Ekki ráfa og langt frá. Ég vill hluti þína þegar þú deyrð
Turkish: Fazla uzaklaşmamaya çalış. Öldüğünde eşyalarını alacağım.
Lithuanian: Try not to wander too far. I want your things when you get killed.
Czech: Try not to wander too far. I want your things when you get killed.
Hungarian: Próbálj meg nem túl messzire vándorolni! A holmijaidra vágyom, amikor megölnek.
Slovak: Try not to wander too far. I want your things when you get killed.
Polish: Staraj się nie odchodzić za daleko. Zabiorę twe rzeczy, kiedy zostaniesz zabity.
Dutch: Dwaal niet te ver af. Als je doodgaat, wil ik je spullen hebben.
Portuguese: Tentar não ires muito longe. Eu quero as tuas coisas quando fores morto.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Não vá muito longe. Quero suas coisas quando você morrer.
Chinese: 别晃荡得太远。 我想要你身上的物品，在你被击杀以后。
Japanese: あんまり遠くへ行くな。 おまえが死んだ時に、その持ち物をもらいたいからな。
Korean: 너무 멀리 가지는 말라고. 네가 죽으면 네 물건들은 내가 가져갈 거니까.
Chinese_Traditional: 試著別溜達得太遠。當你被殺死時我想要你身上的東西。

English: Away with you. I have things to do.
Swedish: Iväg med dig! Jag har annat att stå i.
French: Allez, ouste. J'ai des trucs à faire.
Italian: Away with you. I have things to do.
German: Fort mit dir. Ich habe einiges zu erledigen.
Romanian: Away with you. I have things to do.
Bulgarian: Away with you. I have things to do.
Macedonian: Away with you. I have things to do.
Finnish: Hus, mene siitä. Minulla on tekemistä.
Danish: Away with you. I have things to do.
Icelandic: Burt með þig. Ég hef betri verk að gera.
Lithuanian: Away with you. I have things to do.
Czech: Away with you. I have things to do.
Slovak: Away with you. I have things to do.
Polish: Precz z tobą. Mam co robić.
Dutch: Vort. Ik heb dingen te doen.
Portuguese: Away with you. I have things to do.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Vá embora. Tenho mais o que fazer.
Japanese: 行っちまえ。 俺にはやることがある。
Korean: 이제 가. 난 할 일이 많아.

English: Humph! Another scrap of flesh from the Valkyries...
Swedish: Pft! Ytterligare en av Valkyriornas fläskberg.
French: Pff ! Encore un sac de viande des Valkyries...
Italian: Humph! Another scrap of flesh from the Valkyries...
German: Hmpf! Was haben wir denn hier? Wieder so eine Seele, die von den Walküren angeschleppt wurde …
Spanish: Um... Otro pedazo de piel de las valquirias...
Russian: Хм! Валькирии принесли еще один кусок мяса...
Romanian: Humph! Another scrap of flesh from the Valkyries...
Bulgarian: Humph! Another scrap of flesh from the Valkyries...
Macedonian: Humph! Another scrap of flesh from the Valkyries...
Finnish: Humph! Another scrap of flesh from the Valkyries...
Danish: Humph! Another scrap of flesh from the Valkyries...
Icelandic: Fuss! Ein önnur hetjan frá valkyrjunum...
Turkish: Hah! Valkürlerden bir et parçası daha...
Lithuanian: Humph! Another scrap of flesh from the Valkyries...
Czech: Humph! Another scrap of flesh from the Valkyries...
Slovak: Humph! Another scrap of flesh from the Valkyries...
Polish: Ach! Kolejny skrawek mięsa zrzucony przez walkirię…
Dutch: Ha! Weer zo'n door de Walkuren achtergelaten vleeshomp…
Portuguese: Humph! Another scrap of flesh from the Valkyries...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Hunf! Outro pedaço de carne das Valquírias…
Chinese: 哼哼！又是一块女武神的碎片
Japanese: フン！またワルキューレが持ってきた屑肉か...
Korean: 흠! 발키리들이 또 한 명의 쓰레기를 보냈나 보군. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 哼！另一塊瓦爾基麗的碎肉

English: Let's see what scraps you've picked up...
Swedish: Låt se vad du har för plock och skräp.
French: Voyons un peu quels machins vous avez dégotés...
Italian: Let's see what scraps you've picked up...
German: Zeig mal her, was du so alles gefunden hast …
Spanish: A ver qué chatarra me traes...
Romanian: Let's see what scraps you've picked up...
Bulgarian: Let's see what scraps you've picked up...
Macedonian: Let's see what scraps you've picked up...
Danish: Let's see what scraps you've picked up...
Icelandic: Látum okkur sjá hvaða rusl þú týndir upp...
Lithuanian: Let's see what scraps you've picked up...
Czech: Let's see what scraps you've picked up...
Slovak: Let's see what scraps you've picked up...
Polish: Zobaczmy, jakie skrawki udało ci się zebrać…
Dutch: Eens zien wat je voor restjes hebt opgepakt…
Portuguese: Let's see what scraps you've picked up...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Vamos ver que sucata você trouxe…
Chinese: 让我看看你都捡了些啥破烂...
Japanese: おまえが拾ったゴミを見せてもらおうか...
Chinese_Traditional: 讓我看看你都撿了些什麼破爛...

German: Hm, was haben wir denn hier?

English: I wonder if anything sparkles amongst all this muck you carry...
Swedish: Undrar om det finns något guldkorn bland allt avskräde du bär...
French: Je me demande s'il y a quelque chose qui brille dans toute la boue que vous trimballez...
Italian: I wonder if anything sparkles amongst all this muck you carry...
German: Ich frage mich, ob sich unter all diesem unnützen Mist, den du hast, auch irgendwas Wertvolles befindet …
Spanish: Me pregunto si tendrás algo que valga la pena entra toda esta porquería...
Russian: Интересно, есть ли что-то стоящее среди того мусора, который ты таскаешь...
Romanian: I wonder if anything sparkles amongst all this muck you carry...
Bulgarian: I wonder if anything sparkles amongst all this muck you carry...
Macedonian: I wonder if anything sparkles amongst all this muck you carry...
Finnish: Mietin josko mikään kaikesta tästä kantamastasi rojusta edes kimaltaa...
Danish: I wonder if anything sparkles amongst all this muck you carry...
Icelandic: Ég velti fyrir mér hvort eitthvað gliti meðal drulluna sem þú berð...
Turkish: Acaba taşıdığın bu çer çöpün içinde parlak bir şeyler var mı...
Lithuanian: I wonder if anything sparkles amongst all this muck you carry...
Czech: I wonder if anything sparkles amongst all this muck you carry...
Hungarian: Kíváncsi vagyok, ragyog-e valami a sok kacat között, amit magaddal cipelsz...
Slovak: I wonder if anything sparkles amongst all this muck you carry...
Polish: Ciekawe, czy w tym brudnym tobołku znajdę coś godnego uwagi…
Dutch: Ik vraag me af of er nog mooie glimmertjes zitten in al die bagger die je me brengt…
Portuguese: I wonder if anything sparkles amongst all this muck you carry...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Será que tem alguma coisa brilhante no meio de todo esse lixo?
Chinese: 我倒要看看在你这堆破铜烂铁里能不能找出金子....
Japanese: おまえが持ってきたガラクタの中で何か光るもんがあるかな...
Korean: 네가 가지고 있는 쓰레기들 중에 무언가 빛나는 것이 있긴 한지 궁금하군. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 我倒要看看在你這堆破銅爛鐵裡能不能找出金子....

Dutch: Laat maar zien wat je hebt.

English: We're all lost here. The gods turned their eyes from Valheim a long time ago.
Swedish: Vi är alla vilsna här. Gudarna styrde blicken från Valheim för länge sedan.
French: On est tous perdus, ici. Les dieux ont abandonné Valheim depuis longtemps.
Italian: We're all lost here. The gods turned their eyes from Valheim a long time ago.
German: Wir sind hier alle verloren. Die Götter haben sich schon vor langer Zeit von Valheim abgewandt.
Spanish: Todos vamos sin rumbo en este sitio. Los dioses ya se han olvidado de Valheim.
Russian: Мы все тут пропадем. Боги давным-давно отвернулись от Вальхейма.
Romanian: We're all lost here. The gods turned their eyes from Valheim a long time ago.
Bulgarian: We're all lost here. The gods turned their eyes from Valheim a long time ago.
Macedonian: We're all lost here. The gods turned their eyes from Valheim a long time ago.
Finnish: Olemme kaikki kadoksissa täällä. Jumalat ovat kääntäneet silmänsä poispäin Valheimista kauan aikaa sitten.
Danish: We're all lost here. The gods turned their eyes from Valheim a long time ago.
Icelandic: Við erum öll týnd hér. Guðirnir gleymdu þessum heimi fyrir löngu síðan.
Turkish: Burada hepimiz hiçliğe yüz tuttuk. Tanrılar, Valheim'ı uzun süre evvel kaderine terk etti.
Lithuanian: We're all lost here. The gods turned their eyes from Valheim a long time ago.
Czech: We're all lost here. The gods turned their eyes from Valheim a long time ago.
Hungarian: Mindannyian eltévedtünk itt. Az istenek már régen elfordították a tekintetüket Valheimről.
Slovak: We're all lost here. The gods turned their eyes from Valheim a long time ago.
Polish: Wszyscy jesteśmy zgubieni. Bogowie już dawno odwrócili oczy od Valheim.
Dutch: We zijn hier allemaal verlaten. De goden hebben al lang geleden hun blikken afgewend van Valheim.
Portuguese: We're all lost here. The gods turned their eyes from Valheim a long time ago.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Estamos todos perdidos aqui. Os deuses deixaram Valheim para trás há muito tempo.
Chinese: 我们都是迷路人，诸神早已把英灵神殿遗忘。
Japanese: 俺らはみんな、ここで捨てられたのよ。 神々はずっと前に、Valheimに目も向けなくなっちまった。
Korean: 우리들은 다 웃긴 꼴이 된거야. 신들은 발하임에서 눈 돌린지 오래거든.
Chinese_Traditional: 我們都是迷路人，諸神早已把瓦爾海姆遺忘。

English: I suppose you're here to hunt the Forsaken Ones? I don't bother them and they don't bother me.
Swedish: Jag antar att du är här för att jaga de Bannlysta? Jag stör inte dem och de stör inte mig.
French: Vous êtes là pour chasser les Déchus ? Bah, je ne viens pas les embêter et ils ne m'embêtent pas.
Italian: I suppose you're here to hunt the Forsaken Ones? I don't bother them and they don't bother me.
German: Ich schätze, du bist hier, um Wächter zu jagen, wie? Nun, ich lasse sie in Ruhe und dafür tun sie mir nichts.
Spanish: Supongo que vienes a dar caza a los Desterrados, ¿no? Yo no los incordio, y ellos no me incordian a mí.
Russian: Полагаю, ты здесь, чтобы охотиться на павших? Я не трогаю их — они не трогают меня.
Romanian: I suppose you're here to hunt the Forsaken Ones? I don't bother them and they don't bother me.
Bulgarian: I suppose you're here to hunt the Forsaken Ones? I don't bother them and they don't bother me.
Macedonian: I suppose you're here to hunt the Forsaken Ones? I don't bother them and they don't bother me.
Finnish: Oletan että olet täällä metsästääksesi Unohdettuja? En häiritse heitä ja he eivät häirise minua.
Danish: I suppose you're here to hunt the Forsaken Ones? I don't bother them and they don't bother me.
Icelandic: Skilst mér rétt, að þú ætlar að veiða þá yfirgefnu? Ég ónáða þá ekki, og þeir ónáða mig ekki heldur.
Turkish: Yitikler'i avlamak için mi geldin? Ben onlara karışmıyorum, onlar da bana karışmıyor.
Lithuanian: I suppose you're here to hunt the Forsaken Ones? I don't bother them and they don't bother me.
Czech: I suppose you're here to hunt the Forsaken Ones? I don't bother them and they don't bother me.
Hungarian: Feltételezem azért jöttél, hogy a cserbenhagyottakra vadássz? Én nem zavarom őket, és ők sem engem.
Slovak: I suppose you're here to hunt the Forsaken Ones? I don't bother them and they don't bother me.
Polish: Przypuszczam, że jesteś tu, by polować na Wygnanych? Nie wchodzę im w drogę ani oni mnie.
Dutch: Jij bent hier zeker om jacht te maken op de Verlatenen? Ik laat hen met rust en zij mij.
Portuguese: I suppose you're here to hunt the Forsaken Ones? I don't bother them and they don't bother me.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Então você veio caçar os Guardiões? Eu não me incomodo com eles, e eles não se incomodam comigo.
Chinese: 你是来这击杀被遗忘者的吧？我和他们可是互不干扰的。
Japanese: 見捨てられしものを狩りに来たのか？こっちが手を出さなきゃ、向こうも何もしねぇのによ。
Korean: 버려진 자들을 사냥하러 여기 온 건가? 그들을 건들지 않으니 그들도 나를 가만 놔두더군.
Chinese_Traditional: 你是來這擊殺被遺忘者的吧？我和他們可是互不干擾的。

English: Fight, build, explore. It all ends in the grave.
Swedish: Slåss, bygg, utforska. Det slutar i graven hursom.
French: Combattez, bâtissez, explorez. Tout se termine avec une tombe.
Italian: Fight, build, explore. It all ends in the grave.
German: Kämpfen, bauen, erkunden. Das Ende ist immer das Gleiche: die Ruhe des Grabes.
Spanish: Lucha, construye, explora. ¿Qué más da? Acabarás en la tumba.
Russian: Битвы, постройки, исследования. Это все заканчивается могилой.
Romanian: Fight, build, explore. It all ends in the grave.
Bulgarian: Fight, build, explore. It all ends in the grave.
Macedonian: Fight, build, explore. It all ends in the grave.
Finnish: Taistele, rakenna, tutki. Se kaikki päättyy hautaan kuitenkin.
Danish: Fight, build, explore. It all ends in the grave.
Icelandic: Berjast, byggja, kanna. Þetta endar allt í gröfinni.
Turkish: Savaşmak, inşa etmek, keşfetmek... Hepsinin sonu mezarda bitiyor.
Lithuanian: Fight, build, explore. It all ends in the grave.
Czech: Fight, build, explore. It all ends in the grave.
Hungarian: Harcolj, építs, fedezz fel! Minden a sírban végződik.
Slovak: Fight, build, explore. It all ends in the grave.
Polish: Walcz, buduj, eksploruj. I tak wszystko kończy się w grobie.
Dutch: Vechten, bouwen, ontdekken. Het eindigt allemaal in het graf.
Portuguese: Fight, build, explore. It all ends in the grave.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Lutar, construir, explorar. Vai tudo dar na cova igual.
Chinese: 战斗，建造，探索。 不过最后都会被送进坟墓。
Japanese: 戦って、何か建てて、そこらを探し回る。 結局は墓に入って終わりさ。
Korean: 싸우고, 만들고, 탐험하고. 하지만 다 무덤에서 끝나더군.
Chinese_Traditional: 戰鬥，建造，探索。 不過最後都會被送進墳墓。

English: You're no different to all the others that came before you, warrior. And you'll end the same way.
Swedish: Du är inte olik de andra krigarna innan dig. Och du kommer gå samma öde till mötes.
French: Vous ressemblez à tous ceux qui sont venus ici avant vous, guerrier. Et vous finirez comme eux.
Italian: You're no different to all the others that came before you, warrior. And you'll end the same way.
German: Du bist auch nicht anders als all die anderen, die vor dir kamen, Krieger. Und auch du wirst dasselbe Schicksal erleiden.
Spanish: Eres exactamente igual que todos los que han venido antes que tú. Y correrás su mismo destino.
Russian: Ты ничем не отличаешься от других воинов. Все вы заканчиваете одинаково.
Romanian: You're no different to all the others that came before you, warrior. And you'll end the same way.
Bulgarian: You're no different to all the others that came before you, warrior. And you'll end the same way.
Macedonian: You're no different to all the others that came before you, warrior. And you'll end the same way.
Finnish: Et ole yhtään erilainen kuin kaikki muut jotka saapuivat ennen sinua, soturi. Ja sinä tulet päättymään samalla tavalla.
Danish: You're no different to all the others that came before you, warrior. And you'll end the same way.
Icelandic: Þú ert ekkert öðruvísi en allir þeir á undan þér, stríðsmaður. Þú endar eins og þeir.
Turkish: Senden önce gelenlerden pek farkın yok savaşçı. Sen de aynı kaderi tadacaksın.
Lithuanian: You're no different to all the others that came before you, warrior. And you'll end the same way.
Czech: You're no different to all the others that came before you, warrior. And you'll end the same way.
Hungarian: Nem különbözöl a többiektől, akik előtted érkeztek, harcos. Te is ugyanúgy fogod végezni.
Slovak: You're no different to all the others that came before you, warrior. And you'll end the same way.
Polish: Nie różnisz się od pozostałych, którzy przybyli przed tobą, wojowniku. I tak czeka cię ten sam los.
Dutch: Jij bent geen haar beter dan je voorgangers, krijger. Jullie eindigen allemaal op dezelfde manier.
Portuguese: You're no different to all the others that came before you, warrior. And you'll end the same way.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você não é diferente de todos os outros que vieram antes de você. E vai acabar igual.
Chinese: 你和之前的那些来这的人没什么区别。 而你们都会得到相同的结局。
Japanese: 戦士よ、おまえも前に来たヤツらと変わりねぇ。 同じ末路を迎えるだろうさ。
Korean: 너도 너보다 먼저 온 자들 과 다를게 없군, 전사여. 그리고 너도 똑같은 최후를 맞이 하겠지.
Chinese_Traditional: 你和之前的那些來這的人沒什麼區別。 而你們都會得到相同的結局。

English: Commerce is the only thing that separates us from the beasts.
Swedish: Handel är det enda som skiljer oss från djuren.
French: Le commerce est la seule chose qui nous sépare des animaux.
Italian: Commerce is the only thing that separates us from the beasts.
German: Der Handel ist das Einzige, dass uns von den Bestien unterscheidet.
Spanish: El comercio es lo único que nos diferencia de las bestias.
Russian: Торговля — единственное, что отличает нас от животных.
Romanian: Commerce is the only thing that separates us from the beasts.
Bulgarian: Commerce is the only thing that separates us from the beasts.
Macedonian: Commerce is the only thing that separates us from the beasts.
Finnish: Kaupankäynti on ainoa asia, joka erottaa meidät pedoista.
Danish: Commerce is the only thing that separates us from the beasts.
Icelandic: Viðskipti er það eina sem aðskilur okkur frá skrímslum þessa heims.
Turkish: Bizi yaratıklardan ayıran tek şey, ticaret yapmaktır.
Lithuanian: Commerce is the only thing that separates us from the beasts.
Czech: Commerce is the only thing that separates us from the beasts.
Hungarian: A kereskedelem az egyetlen dolog, amely elválaszt bennünket a fenevadaktól.
Slovak: Commerce is the only thing that separates us from the beasts.
Polish: Handel to jedyna rzecz, która odróżnia nas od bestii.
Dutch: De commercie is het enige dat ons onderscheidt van de beesten.
Portuguese: Commerce is the only thing that separates us from the beasts.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Comércio é a única coisa que nos separa dos animais.
Chinese: 贸易是我们和那些野兽们唯一的区别。
Japanese: 俺たちと獣の違いはただ一つ。 商売するかしねぇかだ。
Korean: 우리와 야수들의 다른 점은 상업의 존재 하나밖에 없네.
Chinese_Traditional: 貿易是我們和那些野獸們唯一的區別。

English: I'm interested in trade, not chatter. Do you want to buy something or not?
Swedish: Jag vill byteshandla, inte skvallra. Ska ni köpa nåt eller inte?
French: Je suis là pour marchander, pas papoter. Vous voulez m'acheter un truc ou pas ?
Italian: I'm interested in trade, not chatter. Do you want to buy something or not?
German: Ich bin hier, um zu handeln, nicht um zu tratschen. Willst du jetzt was kaufen oder nicht?
Spanish: Me interesan los negocios, no la cháchara. ¿Vas a comprar algo o no?
Russian: Мне интересна торговля, а не болтовня. Ты будешь что-то покупать или нет?
Romanian: I'm interested in trade, not chatter. Do you want to buy something or not?
Bulgarian: I'm interested in trade, not chatter. Do you want to buy something or not?
Macedonian: I'm interested in trade, not chatter. Do you want to buy something or not?
Finnish: Olen kiinnostunut kaupanteosta, en juttelusta. Haluatko ostaa jotain vai et?
Danish: I'm interested in trade, not chatter. Do you want to buy something or not?
Icelandic: Ég hef áhuga á viðskiptum, ekki smátali. Viltu versla við mig eða ekki?
Turkish: Çene çalmaktan ziyade ticaret yapmak istiyorum. Bir şey alacak mısın bari?
Lithuanian: I'm interested in trade, not chatter. Do you want to buy something or not?
Czech: I'm interested in trade, not chatter. Do you want to buy something or not?
Hungarian: Engem a kereskedelem foglalkoztat, nem a fecsegés. Vásárolsz valamit, vagy sem?
Slovak: I'm interested in trade, not chatter. Do you want to buy something or not?
Polish: Zajmuje się handlem, a nie gadaniem. Chcesz coś kupić czy nie?
Dutch: Ik ben hier om te handelen, niet om te kletsen. Koop je nog iets of hoe zit dat?
Portuguese: I'm interested in trade, not chatter. Do you want to buy something or not?
Portuguese_Brazilian: Eu quero fazer negócios, e não ficar batendo papo. E aí, vai comprar algo ou não?
Chinese: 我可没时间聊天，我只对生意有兴趣。 你到底买不买？
Japanese: 俺がしたいのは商売だ。 おしゃべりじゃない。 何か買いたいのか、どうなんだ？
Korean: 나는 대화보단 거래에 더 흥미가 있다고. 살꺼야 말꺼야?
Chinese_Traditional: 我可沒時間聊天，我只對生意有興趣。 你到底買不買？

English: Come, let us make a deal.
Italian: Come, let us make a deal.
Romanian: Come, let us make a deal.
Bulgarian: Come, let us make a deal.
Macedonian: Come, let us make a deal.
Danish: Come, let us make a deal.
Icelandic: Komdu hingað, við skulum stunda viðskipti.
Lithuanian: Come, let us make a deal.
Czech: Come, let us make a deal.
Slovak: Come, let us make a deal.
Dutch: Kom, laten we tot een akkoord komen.
Chinese: 来来来，看一看瞧一瞧了啊，便宜卖了啊。
Chinese_Traditional: 來來來，看一看瞧一瞧了啊，便宜賣了啊。

English: You're fortunate to have caught me in a good mood. Let us trade.
Swedish: Du har tur som fångar mig på bra humör. Låt oss köpslå.
French: Vous avez de la chance, je suis de bonne humeur. Voyons ce qu'on peut faire.
Italian: You're fortunate to have caught me in a good mood. Let us trade.
German: Du hast Glück, dass du mich in so guter Laune antriffst. Lass uns handeln.
Spanish: Tienes suerte de haberme pillado de buen humor. Hablemos de negocios.
Russian: Тебе повезло, что у меня сегодня хорошее настроение. Поторгуемся.
Romanian: You're fortunate to have caught me in a good mood. Let us trade.
Bulgarian: You're fortunate to have caught me in a good mood. Let us trade.
Macedonian: You're fortunate to have caught me in a good mood. Let us trade.
Finnish: Olet onnekas että olen hyvällä tuulella. Käydään kauppaa.
Danish: You're fortunate to have caught me in a good mood. Let us trade.
Icelandic: Heppnin er með þér, ég er í góðu skapi í dag. Stundum viðskipti.
Turkish: Şansına bu aralar havamdayım. Hadi ticaret yapalım.
Lithuanian: You're fortunate to have caught me in a good mood. Let us trade.
Czech: You're fortunate to have caught me in a good mood. Let us trade.
Hungarian: Szerencséd, hogy jó hangulatban találtál rám. Kereskedjünk!
Slovak: You're fortunate to have caught me in a good mood. Let us trade.
Polish: Masz szczęście, że złapałeś mnie w dobrym nastroju. Dokonajmy wymiany.
Dutch: Je hebt geluk dat ik in een goede bui ben. Tijd om te onderhandelen.
Portuguese: You're fortunate to have caught me in a good mood. Let us trade.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você tem sorte de me pegar de bom humor. Vamos negociar.
Chinese: 你运气不错，爷今天心情好，便宜卖了。
Japanese: 俺の気分が良くて、運が良かったな。 さあ取引だ。
Korean: 내가 기분이 좋을 때 오다니 운이 좋군. 거래해 보자고.
Chinese_Traditional: 你運氣不錯，爺今天心情好，便宜賣了。

English: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Swedish: Krax! Väl mött, krigare… Jag är Munin, broder till Hugin. Jag bär Allfaderns hälsningar. Hans öga ser genom mina, hans ord bär jag under min tunga. Var hans vägar sanna, så återvänder jag…
French: Croââ ! Salutations, voyageur... Je suis Munin, le frère de Hugin. Le Père de Toute Chose vous salue. Mes yeux sont le sien, ma langue porte ses mots. Continuez à lui obéir et il reviendra vers vous...
Italian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
German: Krah! So treffen wir uns wieder, Wanderer. Ich bin Munin, der Bruder von Hugin. Ich komme mit Grüßen vom Allvater. Sein Auge sieht durch die meinen. Und ich trage seine Worte auf der Zunge in meinem Schnabel. Handle, wie er es verlangt, und ich werde dich erneut aufsuchen.
Spanish: ¡Crouh! Dichosos los ojos, caminante. Soy Munin, el hermano de Hugin. Traigo saludos del Padre Todopoderoso. Ve a través de mis ojos y llevo sus palabras bajo la lengua. Sigue su camino y volveré a dar contigo...
Russian: Крра! Рад встрече, странник... Я Мунин, брат Хугина. Передаю приветствие от Всеотца. Я — его глаза и его уста. Слушайся его, и я снова приду к тебе...
Romanian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Bulgarian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Macedonian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Finnish: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Danish: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Icelandic: Krúnk! Vel gert, ferðalangi... Ég er Muninn, bróðir Hugins. Ég skila þér kveðju frá Alföður. Auga hans sér þig úr mínum augum, ég ber orð hans fram undan tungu minnar. Haltu þér í skefjum Alföðurs og við hittumst aftur...
Turkish: Kraa! Tanışdığımıza sevindim yolgezer... Benim adım Munin, Hugin'in kardeşiyim. Tanrıbaba'nın selamlarını getirdim. Tanrıbaba benim gözümden görür, kelamını dilimde taşırım. Tanrıbaba'nın yolundan sapmazsan seninle tekrar görüşeceğiz…
Lithuanian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Czech: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Hungarian: Kááár! Örvendek a találkozásnak, vándor... Munin vagyok, Hugin testvére. A Mindenatya üdvözletét hoztam magammal. A szeme az enyémen át figyel, a szavait az én nyelvem alatt hordozom. Teljesítsd az akaratát, és később újra meg foglak látogatni...
Slovak: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Polish: Kraa! Witaj, wędrowcze… Jestem Munin, brat Hugina. Przynoszę pozdrowienia od Wszechojca. Jego spojrzenie przenika przeze mnie, a jego słowa przemawiają z mych ust. Podążaj jego drogą, a ja znów cię odwiedzę…
Dutch: Kraa! Gegroet, reiziger... Ik ben Munin, de broer van Hugin. De Alvader groet je. Zijn oog ziet door de mijne, en ik draag op mijn tong zijn woorden met mij mee. Leef in navolging van zijn wil, dan kom ik je later weer bezoeken...
Portuguese: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Portuguese_Brazilian: Crá! Muito bem, viajante… Sou Munin, irmão de Hugin. Trago saudações do Pai de Todos. O olho dele vê através do meu, eu carrego as palavras sob a minha língua. Siga a vontade dele e eu voltarei para você…
Chinese: Kraa！幸会，流浪者...我是雾尼，福金的弟弟。 我代奥丁与你见面。 他可以看到我眼里看到的一切，我可以带他说出他想要说的话。 遵循他的旨意，我便会再回到你身边...
Japanese: クワァァ！よいところで会った、さすらい人よ... 我はムニン、フギンの弟だ。 最高神よりの挨拶を届ける。 この目を通して彼は見、この舌を通して彼の言葉は運ばれる。 彼の道を外さぬならば、また会うことになろう...
Korean: 까악! 안녕 방랑자. . . 나는 무닌이라고 해, 후긴과는 형제사이야. 최고신께서 안부 인사를 보내셨어. 그분은 나의 눈을 통해 보시고, 나는 나의 혀로 그분의 말씀을 전하지. 네가 그분의 뜻을 계속 따른다면 널 다시 만나러 올게. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 啞！幸會，流浪者...我是霧尼，福金的弟弟。 我代奧丁與你見面。 他可以看到我眼裡看到的一切，我可以帶他說出他想要說的話。 遵循他的旨意，我便會再回到你身邊...

English: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Swedish: Krax! Alla ögon på denne. Stora ögon, små ögon. Ögon från ovan och under. Även träden har ögon…
French: Croââ ! Tous les yeux se tournent vers vous. De grands yeux, des petits, du ciel et de la terre. Même les arbres ont des yeux...
Italian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
German: Krah! Alle Augen sind auf diesen Helden gerichtet. Große Augen, kleine Augen, Augen von oben und Augen von unten. Sogar die Bäume haben Augen …
Spanish: ¡Crouh! Todos los ojos miran a esta persona. Ojos grandes, pequeños, los que vienen de arriba, de abajo... Hasta los árboles tienen ojos...
Russian: Крра! Все взоры прикованы к тебе. Большие глаза и маленькие глазки, глаза сверху и глаза снизу. Даже у деревьев есть глаза...
Romanian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Bulgarian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Macedonian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Finnish: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Danish: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Icelandic: Krúnk! Öll augu beina að þessum. Stór augu, lítil auga, auga að ofan, og augu að neðan. Jafnvel trén hafa augu...
Turkish: Kraa! Tüm gözler bunun üzerinde. Büyük gözler, küçük gözler, yukarıdakiler, aşağıdakiler. Ağaçların bile gözleri vardır…
Lithuanian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Czech: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Hungarian: Káár! Minden szem erre a példányra figyel. Nagy szemek, kis szemek, szemek fentről és szemek alulról. Még a fáknak is vannak szemeik...
Slovak: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Polish: Kraa! Tylko spójrzcie na to. Duże oczy i małe, oczy z góry i oczy z dołu. Nawet drzewa je mają…
Dutch: Kraa! Alle ogen zijn op je gericht. Grote ogen, kleine ogen, ogen vanboven en ogen vanonder. Zelfs de bomen hebben ogen...
Portuguese: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Portuguese_Brazilian: Crá! Todos os olhos estão voltados para este. Olhos grandes, olhos pequenos, olhos de cima e olhos de baixo. Até as árvores têm olhos…
Chinese: Kraa！所有的眼睛都在这里。 大眼睛，小眼睛，天之眼和地之眼。 甚至树木也有眼睛...
Japanese: クワァァ！すべての目がこの者を見る。 大きな目、小さな目、上からの目、下からの目。 木々にも目はあるのだぞ...
Korean: 까악! 모든 눈이 이 자를 본다. 큰 눈, 작은 눈, 위쪽 눈, 아래쪽 눈. 나무에도 눈이. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 啞！所有的眼睛都在這裡。 大眼睛，小眼睛，天之眼和地之眼。 甚至樹木也有眼睛...

English: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Swedish: Du lever än, krigare? Jag hade hoppats på en liten munsbit från ditt lik, en måltid kadaver... Nå, Allfadern kommer bli nöjd.
French: Vous êtes encore en vie, guerrier ? J'espérais grignoter vos restes, faire un festin de votre charogne... Ah, le Père de Toute Chose sera satisfait.
Italian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
German: Du bist immer noch am Leben, Krieger? Ich hatte schon gehofft, ich könnte mich an deinem Leichnam laben … Wie auch immer, jedenfalls wird sich der Allvater freuen.
Spanish: ¿Sigues con vida? Yo que quería darme un pequeño festín de carroña con tu cadáver... En fin, el Padre Todopoderoso estará contento.
Russian: Смерть еще не добралась до тебя? А я-то надеялся полакомиться твоим трупом… Тем не менее, Всеотец будет доволен.
Romanian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Bulgarian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Macedonian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Finnish: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Danish: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Icelandic: Þú lifir en, stríðsmaður? Ég var að vonast til að snarla á leifum þínum, smá biti af hræ... En, þú munt hafa áunnið þér heilli Alföðurs.
Turkish: Hâlâ hayatta mısın savaşçı? Cesedinden leşe dönmüş ufak bir lokma alır atıştırmalık yaparım diyordum… Yine de bu durum, Tanrıbaba'nın hoşuna gidecek.
Lithuanian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Czech: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Hungarian: Még életben vagy, harcos? Abban reménykedtem, hogy falatozhatok egy kicsit a holttestedből, egy falatnyi döghúst... Mindazonáltal a Mindenatya örülni fog ennek.
Slovak: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Polish: Nadal żyjesz, wojowniku? Liczyłem na małą przekąskę z twojego ciała, kawałeczek padliny… Mimo to Wszechojciec będzie zadowolony.
Dutch: Je leeft nog, krijger? Ik had gehoopt een hapje van je resten te mogen nemen, een stukje van je kadaver... Ach, de Alvader zal in ieder geval verheugd zijn.
Portuguese: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Segue com vida, combatente? Eu esperava fazer um lanchinho do seu cadáver, talvez um pedaço de carniça… Enfim, o Pai de Todos ficará satisfeito.
Chinese: 勇士，你竟然还活着？我本来还想等你死后饱餐一顿呢，打个牙祭你懂的...好吧，诸神之父会满意的。
Japanese: 戦士よ、まだ生きているのか？おまえの死体から少々の軽食をいただけるかと期待していたのだが。 一口の腐肉をな... いずれにしても、最高神は喜ぶであろう。
Korean: 아직 살아 있나, 전사여? 안타깝네. 시체에서 자그마한 간식을 빼 먹고 싶었는데. 그래도 오딘은 기뻐하시겠구나.
Chinese_Traditional: 勇士，你竟然還活著？我本來還想等你死後飽餐一頓呢，打個牙祭你懂的...好吧，諸神之父會滿意的。

English: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Swedish: Är du vilse i dimman, krigare? Jag ser saker dina ögon en gång sett; stigar du farit och ansikten du älskat. Stackars krigare…
French: Vous vous égarez dans le brouillard, guerrier ? Je vois des choses que vos yeux ont connues, des chemins que vous avez parcourus et des visages que vous avez aimés. Pauvre guerrier...
Italian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
German: Hast du dich im Nebel verlaufen, Krieger? Ich sehe Dinge, die deine Augen einst kannten. Wege, die du beschritten und Gesichter, die du geliebt hast. Du arme Kriegerseele …
Spanish: ¿Te has perdido entre la niebla? Veo cosas que tus ojos conocían muy bien, los caminos que has recorrido e incluso las caras de tus seres queridos. Qué lástima das...
Russian: Ты потерялся в тумане, воин? Я вижу то, что когда-то видели твои глаза, пути, которыми ты шел, и лица, которые ты любил. Бедняга...
Romanian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Bulgarian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Macedonian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Finnish: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Danish: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Icelandic: Ertu týndur í þokuni, stríðsmaður? Ég sé það sem þú eitt sinn þekktir, leiðir þú gekkst, andlit þú elskaðir. Vesalings stríðsmaður...
Turkish: Sisin içinde kayıp mı oldun savaşçı? Bir zamanlar bildiğin şeyleri, yürüdüğün yolları ve sevdiğin yüzleri görüyorum. Zavallı şey…
Lithuanian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Czech: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Hungarian: Eltévedtél a ködben, harcos? Olyan dolgokat látok, amelyeket a szemeid egykor ismertek; járt ösvényeket és szeretett arcokat. Szegény harcos...
Slovak: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Polish: Nie potrafisz znaleźć drogi we mgle, wojowniku? Widzę rzeczy, które kiedyś ujrzały twe oczy, przebyte ścieżki i ukochane twarze. Biedny wojowniku…
Dutch: Ben je verdwaald in de mist, krijger? Ik zie wat je ogen ooit wisten, de paden die je hebt bewandeld, en de gezichten die je ooit liefhad. Arme krijger...
Portuguese: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você se perdeu na névoa, combatente? Eu vejo coisas que seus olhos conheceram, caminhos que você trilhou e rostos que você amou. Pobre combatente…
Chinese: 勇士，你在迷雾中迷路了吗？我可以看到你眼里的景象，你走过的路，你爱过的人。 太可怜了...
Japanese: 戦士よ、霧に迷ったか？見えるぞ。 おまえの目がかつて知っていたもの、おまえが歩いた道、愛した顔が。 哀れな戦士よ...
Korean: 전사여, 안갯속에서 길을 잃었니? 나에게 네 안구에 맺혔던 것들이 보여. 네가 살아왔던 길, 네 사랑했던 얼굴들. 불쌍한 전사여. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 勇士，你在迷霧中迷路了嗎？我可以看到你眼裡的景象，你走過的路，你愛過的人。 太可憐了...

English: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Swedish: Krax! Glöm inte ditt uppdrag, vandrare! Minns varför Allfadern sänt dig hit. De Bannlysta måste förgöras! Minns!
French: Croââ ! N'oubliez pas votre quête, aventurier ! N'oubliez pas pourquoi le Père de Toute Chose vous veut sur ce monde. Les Déchus doivent être détruits. Ne l'oubliez pas !
Italian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
German: Krah! Vergiss nicht deine Aufgabe, Wanderer! Vergiss nicht, warum Odin dich hierher gesandt hat. Die Wächter müssen vernichtet werden. Vergiss das nicht!
Spanish: ¡Crouh! ¡No te olvides de tu misión, caminante! Recuerda por qué te envió el Todo Poderoso. Debes destruir a los Desterrados. ¡No lo olvides!
Russian: Крра! Помни о своем задании, странник! Помни, почему Всеотец послал тебя сюда. Павшие должны быть уничтожены. Не забудь!
Romanian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Bulgarian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Macedonian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Finnish: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Danish: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Icelandic: Krúnk! Ekki gleyma að þú átt verkefni óklárað, ferðalangi! Mundu afhverju Alfaðir senti þig hingað. Hinir yfirgefnu þurfa að deyja. Mundu það!
Turkish: Kraa! Görevini unutma yolgezer! Tanrıbaba'nın seni buraya neden gönderdiğini hatırla. Yitikler yok edilmeli. Unutma!
Lithuanian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Czech: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Hungarian: Káár! Ne feledkezz meg a küldetésedről, vándor! Emlékezz arra, miért küldött ide a Mindenatya! A cserbenhagyottakat el kell pusztítani, ne feledd!
Slovak: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Polish: Kraa! Nie zapomnij o swojej misji, wędrowcze! Pamiętaj, dlaczego Wszechojciec cię tu przysłał. Wygnani muszą zostać zgładzeni. Nie zapomnij o tym!
Dutch: Kraa! Vergeet je queeste niet, krijger! Vergeet niet waarom de Alvader je hierheen gestuurd heeft. De Verlatenen moeten worden vernietigd. Vergeet dat niet!
Portuguese: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Portuguese_Brazilian: Crá! Não se esqueça de sua missão, viajante! Lembre-se por que o Pai de Todos enviou você para cá. Os Guardiões devem ser destruídos. Lembre-se!
Chinese: Kraa！别忘了你的任务，流浪者！记得你为什么被诸神之父送来这里。 被遗忘者必须被摧毁。 切记！
Japanese: クワァァ！使命を忘れるな、さすらい人！最高神になぜここに送られたか思い出せ。 見捨てられしものは倒されねばならぬ。 覚えておけ！
Korean: 까악! 사명을 잊지 마, 방랑자! 최고신께서 어째서 너를 이곳에 보냈는지 기억해. 버림받은 자들은 쓰러져야만 한다고. 기억해라!
Chinese_Traditional: 啞！別忘了你的任務，流浪者！記得你為什麼被諸神之父送來這裡。 被遺忘者必須被摧毀。 切記！

English: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Swedish: Ah, du har vuxit dig till en mäktig krigare. Som en artighet kan jag förtälja att vi bestämt att Hugin ska få ditt vänstra öga när du dör, och jag ditt högra.\nMen vi önskar dig all lycka till!
French: Ah, vous êtes digne qu'on vous appelle guerrier, à présent ! Je devrais vous informer, par politesse, que si vous mourez, Hugin mangera votre œil gauche et moi, le droit. Mais nous vous souhaitons bonne chance !
Italian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
German: Du hast dich zu einem mächtigen Kämpfer entwickelt! Aus reiner Höflichkeit sollst du wissen - wenn du stirbst, wird Hugin dein linkes Auge fressen und ich dein rechtes. Aber wir wünschen dir dennoch alles Gute.
Spanish: Te has vuelto muy fuerte, sí señor. Como muestra de cortesía, te haré saber que Hugin y yo hemos acordado que, cuando mueras, yo me quedaré tu ojo derecho y él el izquierdo. ¡Pero te deseamos lo mejor!
Russian: Ах, какой славный воин из тебя вышел! С радостью расскажу тебе о нашем с Хугином договоре. После твоей смерти он получит твой левый глаз в качестве угощения, а я — правый. Но мы желаем тебе удачи!
Romanian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Bulgarian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Macedonian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Finnish: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Danish: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Icelandic: Þú hefur vaxið í myndarlegan stríðsmann! Sem kurteisi, þá ætti ég að tilkynna þér að þegar þú deyrð, mun Huginn fá vinstra augað þitt að borða og ég það hægra. En, við óskum þér góðs gengis!
Turkish: Hah, iyi bir savaşçıya dönüşmüşsün! Nezaketen bir şeyi bilmeni istiyorum: Öldüğünde Hugin sol gözünü alacak ve ben de sağ gözünü. Yine de sana bol şans dileriz!
Lithuanian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Czech: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Hungarian: Áh, remek harcossá váltál. Figyelmességből el kell árulnom neked, megegyeztem Huginnal, hogy amikor meghalsz, a bal szemedet ő kapja csemegének, míg a jobbat én. Viszont mind ketten jó egészséget kívánunk neked.
Slovak: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Polish: Ach, ale z ciebie wspaniały wojownik! Z grzeczności powiem ci, że kiedy umrzesz, ustaliliśmy, że Hugin dostanie do schrupania twoje lewe oko, a ja prawe. Ale życzymy powodzenia!
Dutch: Je bent een goede krijger geworden! Uit goed fatsoen moet ik je vertellen dat als je doodgaat, we het erover eens zijn dat Hugin je linkeroog mag hebben als tussendoortje, en ik je rechter. Maar we wensen je verder alle goeds!
Portuguese: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Portuguese_Brazilian: Ah, que grande combatente você se tornou! Como cortesia, devo dizer que, quando você morrer, concordamos que Hugin terá seu olho esquerdo e eu, o direito. Mas desejamos tudo de bom!
Chinese: 哇，你成长成一名强壮了战士了！不过其实出于礼貌，我应该在你死的时候才告诉你这个的，我和福金都商量好了，他吃你的左眼，我吃你的右眼。 \n嗯，祝安好！
Japanese: おお、良い戦士になったものだ！礼儀として伝えておこう。 おまえが死んだ時のフギンとの取り決めだ。 フギンはおまえの左目を、我はおまえの右目をいただくことになっている。 だが無事を祈っているぞ！
Korean: 아, 넌 훌륭한 전사가 되었구나! 이건 예의상 말하는 건데, 우리는 네가 죽으면 후긴이 너의 왼쪽 눈을 간식으로 가져가고, 나는 오른쪽 눈을 가지기로 동의했어. 하지만 우리는 네가 성공하길 바라!
Chinese_Traditional: 哇，你成為一名強壯的戰士了！不過其實出於禮貌，我應該在你死的時候才告訴你這個的，我和福金都商量好了，他吃你的左眼，我吃你的右眼。 \n嗯，祝安好！

English: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Swedish: Krax! Tjäna Allfadern väl, så kan jag ge dig dina minnen åter. Minns du livet du hade innan detta? Det minns dig, ännu...
French: Croââ ! Servez le Père de Toute Chose comme il le faut et votre mémoire vous sera rendue. Vous rappelez-vous votre vie avant celle-ci ? Et pourtant, elle se souvient de vous...
Italian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
German: Krah! Diene dem Allvater, so gut du kannst, und er wird mir erlauben, deine Erinnerungen wiederherzustellen. Erinnerst du dich an das Leben, das du vor diesem hier hattest? Zumindest erinnert es sich an dich …
Spanish: ¡Crouh! Sirve bien al Padre Todopoderoso, pues me ha dado permiso para recuperarte la memoria. ¿Recuerdas la vida que tuviste antes de esta? Porque ella sí que te recuerda a ti...
Russian: Крра! Служи Всеотцу хорошо, и он позволит мне восстановить твои воспоминания. Помнишь ли ты мир, в котором жил до этого? А он тебя помнит...
Romanian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Bulgarian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Macedonian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Finnish: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Danish: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Icelandic: Krúnk! Þjónaðu Alföður vel og hann leyfir mér að endurvekja minningar þínar úr fyrra lífi. Mannstu eitthvað úr því? Það man eftir þér...
Turkish: Kraa! Tanrıbaba'ya iyi hizmet edersen anılarını sana geri verebileceğimi söyledi. Bundan önceki hayatını hatırlıyor musun? O seni hatırlıyor...
Lithuanian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Czech: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Hungarian: Káár! Ha jól szolgálod a Mindenatyát, lehetővé tette számomra, hogy helyreállítsam az emlékeidet. Emlékszel az életedre a mostani előttről? Az még emlékszik rád...
Slovak: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Polish: Kraa! Służ dobrze Wszechojcu, a on pozwoli mi przywrócić twoje wspomnienia. Czy pamiętasz swoje ówczesne życie? Ono jeszcze cię pamięta...
Dutch: Kraa! Dien de Alvader goed, dan mag ik van hem je herinneringen teruggeven. Weet je nog wat voor leven je had voor je hier kwam? Het herinnert zich jou wel…
Portuguese: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Crá! Sirva bem o Pai de Todos e ele me deu permissão para restaurar suas memórias. Você se lembra da vida que teve antes dessa? Pois ela se lembra de você…
Chinese: Kraa！奥丁对你很满意，让我来恢复你的记忆。 你还记得你的前世吗？其实你的前世还记得你...
Japanese: クワァァ！最高神によく仕えれば、おまえの記憶を取り戻してよいという許可を授かっておる。 今の前に送っていた人生を覚えているか？人生はおまえを覚えているぞ...
Korean: 까악! 최고신을 잘 섬기세요. 당신의 기억을 되살리기 위해 제게 휴가를 주셨어요. 당신은 이 이전 삶을 기억하나요? 아직도 당신을 기억하고 있습니다. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 啞！奧丁對你很滿意，讓我來恢復你的記憶。 你還記得你的前世嗎？其實你的前世還記得你...

English: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Swedish: Jag trodde aldrig du skulle överleva så här länge… Men var på din vakt mot stoltheten, min vän. Slagfält är banketter för mig, och jag vet hur stora krigare tenderar sluta…
French: Je ne pensais pas que vous survivriez aussi longtemps... Mais ne paradez pas. Les champs de bataille sont mes festins, je sais comment finissent tous les grands guerriers...
Italian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
German: Ich hätte nicht gedacht, dass du so lange überleben würdest … Aber hüte dich vor deinem eigenen Stolz. Für mich sind Schlachtfelder nichts anderes als große Bankette: Ich weiß also, wie alle großen Krieger enden …
Spanish: Jamás creí que fueras a sobrevivir tanto tiempo, pero no dejes que te consuma el orgullo. Los campos de batalla son mis banquetes personales, y sé de sobra cómo acaban los guerreros más poderosos...
Russian: Я не думал, что ты так долго проживешь... Но берегись гордыни, дружище. Поля сражений для меня — пир. Я знаю, как заканчивают все великие воины...
Romanian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Bulgarian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Macedonian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Finnish: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Danish: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Icelandic: Ég hafði ekki hugsað mér að þú myndir lifa svona lengi... En verum ekki of stoltir, vinur. Stríðsvellir eru veisluhöld fyrir mér, ég veit hvernig öll líf góðra bardagamanna enda...
Turkish: Bu kadar uzun süre hayatta kalabileceğini düşünmezdim… Lakin kibirden sakın dostum. Savaş meydanları benim şölen soframdır ve her büyük savaşçının sonunu bilirim...
Lithuanian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Czech: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Hungarian: Nem gondoltam volna, hogy ilyen sokáig életben maradsz... Viszont óvakodj a büszkeségtől, barátom! A csatamezők számomra ünnepségek, és tudom, az összes nagy harcos hogyan végzi...
Slovak: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Polish: Nie sądziłem, że przeżyjesz tak długo… Ale strzeż się dumy, przyjacielu. Pola bitew są dla mnie ucztą. Wiem, jak kończą wszyscy śmiałkowie...
Dutch: Ik had niet gedacht dat je nog in leven zou zijn… Maar hoed je voor trots, vriend. Slagvelden zijn mijn banket, en ik weet hoe alle grote krijgers aan hun eind komen…
Portuguese: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Não pensei que você fosse sobreviver por tanto tempo… Mas não se deixe tomar pelo orgulho. Os campos de batalha são banquetes para mim, eu sei como todos os grandes guerreiros terminam…
Chinese: 我没想到你竟然可以活这么久....不过别太骄傲，朋友。 战场对我来说就是宴席，我知道所有勇猛战士的结局..
Japanese: おまえがこれほど長く生きるとは思っていなかった... だが驕るな、友よ。 戦場は我には宴会の場。 偉大なる戦士がどのように斃れたかよく知っているぞ...
Korean: 네 이리 오래 살아남을 줄은 몰랐는데 말이야. . . 하지만 오만해지지 않도록 주의하라고, 친구. 나는 전장을 연회장 드나들듯 다녀서 위대한 전사들의 끝이 어땠는지 잘 알고 있어.
Chinese_Traditional: 我沒想到你竟然可以活這麼久....不過別太驕傲，朋友。 戰場對我來說就是宴席，我知道所有勇猛戰士的結局..

English: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Swedish: Krax! Lyss till mig nu, när mina gåtor upphör. Jag är Munin, minnenas väktare och skattkammare. På Allfaderns vänstra axel sitter jag, och agerar bud i Världarna Tio. Jag har sett stora krigare resa sig och falla, men du är en av de största. Vet väl att Oden själv vakar över dig...
French: Croââ ! Écoutez-moi bien, j'irai désormais droit au but. Je suis le grand Munin, le réceptacle des souvenirs. Je me perche sur l'épaule gauche du Père de Toute Chose et j'accomplis sa volonté dans les dix mondes. J'ai vu nombre de guerriers s'élever et tomber, mais vous faites partie des plus grands. Sachez qu'Odin lui-même vous regarde...
Italian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
German: Krah! Hör mich an, mich den großen Munin, mich, eine Enzyklopädie des Wissens, mich, der ich auf der linken Schulter des Allvaters sitze und ihm in den zehn Welten zu Diensten bin: Ich habe schon so manchen großen Krieger aufsteigen und fallen gesehen. Doch du zählst zu den größten von ihnen. Wisse, dass Odin selbst ein Auge auf dich hat.
Spanish: ¡Crouh! Escúchame bien, ¡no me andaré con más enigmas! Soy el gran Munin, la tesorería de los recuerdos. Reposo sobre el hombro del Padre Todopoderoso y hago su voluntad en los diez mundos. He visto nacer y caer a grandes guerreros, pero tú brillas con más fuerza que la mayoría. El mismísimo Odín vela por ti...
Russian: Крра! Услышь меня, я больше не буду загадывать тебе загадки. Я — великий Мунин, хранитель памяти. Я сижу на левом плече Всеотца и передаю его приказы в десяти мирах. Я видел много великих воинов, которые поднимались и падали, но ты один из величайших. Знай, что сам Один наблюдает за тобой...
Romanian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Bulgarian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Macedonian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Finnish: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Danish: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Icelandic: Krúnk! Nú skal hlusta á mig. Ég mun ekki lesa þér ljóð ei lengur. Ég er hinn mikli Muninn, safnari minninga. Ég sit á vinstri öxl Alföðurs og hlíði skipunum hans í öllum tíu heimum. Ég hef séð ótal marga stríðsmenn rísa og falla, en þú ert á meðal þeirra bestu. Vita skal að Óðinn sjálfur fylgist með þér...
Turkish: Kraa! Bana kulak ver, artık bilmece yok. Ben yüce Munin'im, anıları bünyemde beslerim. Tanrıbaba'nın sol omzunda oturur, on dünyadaki işlerini görürüm. Pek çok büyük savaşçının yükseliş ve düşüşüne tanıklık ettim ama sen en yücelerindensin. Bil ki Odin seni bizzat izliyor...
Lithuanian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Czech: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Hungarian: Káár! Hallgass most meg, többé nem titkolózom előtted. A hatalmas Munin vagyok, az emlékek kincstára. A Mindenatya bal vállán ülök, és tíz világban teljesítem a parancsait. Sok harcos láttam felemelkedni, és elbukni, de te a legnagyobbak között vagy. Tudd, hogy maga Odin figyelemmel követ téged...
Slovak: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Polish: Kraa! Wysłuchaj mnie teraz, a już nie będę cię zagadywać. Jestem wielki Munin, skarbnica pamięci. Siedzę na lewym ramieniu Wszechojca i wykonuję jego rozkazy w Dziesięciu światach. Widziałem, jak wielu wielkich wojowników powstaje i upada, ale ty jesteś jednym z największych. Wiedz, że sam Odyn cię obserwuje...
Dutch: Kraa! Hoor mij, want ik zal je niet langer van raadsels voorzien. Ik ben de grote Munin, de schatkamer der herinneringen. Ik zit op de linkerschouder van de Alvader, en doe in de tien werelden wat hij me opdraagt. Ik heb veel grote krijgers zien vallen en opstaan, maar jij bent een van de grootsten. Weet dat Odin zelve je in het oog houdt…
Portuguese: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Crá! Escute bem, não serei mais enigmático. Eu sou o grande Munin, tesouro da memória. Eu sento no ombro esquerdo do Pai de Todos e sigo suas ordens nos dez mundos. Já vi muitos guerreiros grandiosos ascenderem e caírem, mas você está entre os maiores. O próprio Odin está observando…
Chinese: Kraa！听着！我不会再给你指引了。 我是伟大的雾尼，记忆宝库。 我站在诸神之父的左肩上为他在第十大神界压标。 我曾经看到了各个战士的起起落落，但是是最伟大的战士之一。 记住，奥丁一直在看着你...
Japanese: クワァァ！とくと聞け。 もはや謎かけはせぬ。 我は偉大なるムニン、記憶の宝庫である。 我は最高神の左の肩に止まり、十の世界で彼の命を成し遂げる。 多くの偉大なる戦士の栄光と没落を見てきたが、おまえは最高の戦士のひとりだ。 オーディンそのひとが見ていると知れ...
Korean: 까악! 내 말을 들어라. 더 이상 수수께끼는 하지 않는다. 나는 위대한 무닌, 기억의 보고다. 나는 최고 신의 왼쪽 어깨에 머물며, 10개의 세계에서 그의 명령을 실행한다. 많은 위대한 전사들의 영광과 몰락을 봤지만, 너는 최고의 전사 중 한 명이야. 오딘이 널 지켜보고 있는 걸 알아둬라. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 啞！聽著！我不會再給你指引了。 我是偉大的霧尼，記憶寶庫。 我站在諸神之父的左肩上為他在第十大神界壓標。 我曾經看到了各個戰士的起起落落，但是是最偉大的戰士之一。 記住，奧丁一直在看著你...

English: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Swedish: Krax! Allfadern sänder hälsningar. Han väntar på ditt ord att skicka bron. Dräp de Bannlysta och bana väg!
French: Croââ ! Le Père de Toute Chose vous salue ! Il n'attend qu'un signe pour envoyer le grand pont. Tuez les Déchus et dégagez la voie !
Italian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
German: Krah! Der Allvater hat wichtige Neuigkeiten für dich! Er wartet darauf, für dich die große Brücke zu öffnen. Also brich auf, töte Wächter und mache den Weg frei!
Spanish: ¡Crouh! ¡Traigo noticias del Padre Todopoderoso! Está a la espera de tu señal para enviar el gran puente. Acaba con los Desterrados y despeja el camino.
Russian: Крра! Услышь Всеотца! Он ждет тебя, чтобы опустить великий мост. Убей павших и расчисть путь!
Romanian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Bulgarian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Macedonian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Finnish: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Danish: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Icelandic: Krúnk! Alfaðir sendir tíðindi! Hann bíður eftir þér og sendir brúna miklu á þínu orði. Dreptu hina yfirgefnu og hreinsaðu vegin!
Turkish: Kraa! Tanrıbaba'dan haber var! Büyük köprüyü göndermek için senden haber bekliyor. Yitikler'i öldür ve yolu temizle!
Lithuanian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Czech: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Hungarian: Káár! A Mindenatya híreket küld! A szavadra vár, hogy elküldhesse a nagy hidat. Öld meg a cserbenhagyottakat és tisztítsd meg az utat!
Slovak: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Polish: Kraa! Wszechojciec przesyła wieści! Czeka na twoje słowo, by pojawił się wielki most. Zgładź Wygnanych i oczyść drogę!...
Dutch: Kraa! Ik breng nieuws van de Alvader! Hij staat klaar om op jouw verzoek de grote brug te openen. Dood de Verlatenen en maak de weg vrij!
Portuguese: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Portuguese_Brazilian: Crá! O Pai de Todos manda notícias! Ele está apenas esperando você para enviar a grande ponte. Mate os Guardiões e abra caminho!
Chinese: Kraa！诸神之父发出了他的旨意! He waits on your word to send the great bridge.击杀被遗忘者们，并清理你的前路！
Japanese: クワァァ！最高神よりの言葉だ！大いなる橋に送り出さんとする知らせをお待ちである。 見捨てられしものを倒し、道を開け！
Korean: 까악! 최고신의 말이다! 그는 위대한 다리를 보내기 위해 너의 말을 기다리고 있다. 버림받은 놈들을 쓰러뜨리고 길을 열어라!
Chinese_Traditional: 啞！諸神之父發出了他的旨意！祂正等著你的消息傳達偉大之橋。擊殺被遺忘者們，並清理你的前路！

English: Emits a magic seal on the nearby surroundings that prevents other players from constructing buildings or opening doors.
Swedish: Ger ifrån sig ett magiskt sken som hindrar spelare i närheten från att interagera med dörrar och skada byggnader.

Turkish: Daha düşük sağlık ve kondisyon tazelenmesi.
Polish: Niższy poziom regeneracji życia i kondycji.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Reduz a vida e a regeneração de vigor.
Chinese: 生命值和耐力值恢复速度变慢。
Japanese: 体力とスタミナの回復度が減る。
Chinese_Traditional: 生命值和耐力值恢復速度變慢。

English: You can run longer and take significantly less damage from physical attacks.
Swedish: Du kan springa längre och tar avsevärt mindre skada från fysiska attacker.
French: Vous pouvez courir plus longtemps et subissez beaucoup moins de dégâts physiques.
Italian: You can run longer and take significantly less damage from physical attacks.
German: Du kannst länger sprinten und erleidest wesentlich weniger physischen Schaden.
Spanish: Puedes correr más y recibes menos daño de los ataques físicos.
Russian: Вы можете бежать дольше и получать значительно меньше физического урона от атак.
Romanian: You can run longer and take significantly less damage from physical attacks.
Bulgarian: You can run longer and take significantly less damage from physical attacks.
Macedonian: You can run longer and take significantly less damage from physical attacks.
Finnish: Voit juosta pidempään ja ottaa paljon vähemmän vahinkoa fyysisistä hyökkäyksistä.
Danish: You can run longer and take significantly less damage from physical attacks.
Icelandic: Þú getur hlaupið lengur og tekur margfalt minni skaða frá líkamslegum árásum.
Turkish: Daha hızlı koşup fiziksel saldırılardan büyük ölçüde daha az hasar alıyorsun.
Lithuanian: You can run longer and take significantly less damage from physical attacks.
Czech: Můžeš běžet déle a výrazně sníží udržené poškození fyzickými útoky.
Hungarian: Hosszabb ideig futhatsz, és lényegesen kevesebb sebzést szenvedsz el a fizikai támadásoktól.
Slovak: You can run longer and take significantly less damage from physical attacks.
Polish: Możesz biegać dłużej i otrzymujesz znacznie mniejsze obrażenia od ataków fizycznych.
Dutch: Je kunt langer rennen en loopt aanzienlijk minder schade op door fysieke aanvallen.
Portuguese: You can run longer and take significantly less damage from physical attacks.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você não pode mais correr e sofre dano físico reduzido.
Chinese: 你跑得更快并且受到的物理伤害大大减少。
Japanese: より長く走ることができ、物理攻撃からのダメージが大きく低下する。
Korean: 더 오래 달릴 수 있고 물리 데미지 피해를 적게 받습니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 你跑得更遠並且受到的物理傷害大大減少。

English: You activate the power of Eikthyr.
Italian: You activate the power of Eikthyr.
German: Du aktivierst die Kraft von Eikthyr.

Lithuanian: You activate the power of Eikthyr.
Slovak: You activate the power of Eikthyr.

Chinese: 你激活了赤血灵鹿的力量。
Japanese: エイクスュルの力を発動する。
Chinese_Traditional: 你啟動了赤血靈鹿的力量

English: Your ability to run and jump is improved.
French: Votre aptitude à courir et à sauter est améliorée.
Italian: Your ability to run and jump is improved.
German: Deine Fertigkeiten, zu sprinten und zu springen, sind verbessert.
Spanish: Mejora tu habilidad para correr y saltar.
Russian: Ваша способность бегать и прыгать улучшается.

Bulgarian: Your ability to run and jump is improved.
Macedonian: Your ability to run and jump is improved.
Finnish: Kykysi juosta ja hyppiä ovat parantuneet.
Danish: Your ability to run and jump is improved.
Icelandic: Hæfni þín í hlaupi og stökki eykst
Lithuanian: Your ability to run and jump is improved.
Czech: Tvoje schopnost běhat a skákat je vylepšená.
Hungarian: Javul a futási és ugrási képességed.
Slovak: Your ability to run and jump is improved.
Polish: Zdolność biegania i skakania jest ulepszona.

Chinese: 你跑和跳的技能更强了。
Japanese: 走りとジャンプの能力が上がる。

Icelandic: Þú ert að bera of mikið
Þú ert að bera of mikið

English: You are encumbered and cannot run.
Swedish: Du är överbelamrad och kan inte springa.
French: Vous ne pouvez plus courir à cause de l'encombrement.
Italian: You are encumbered and cannot run.
German: Du bist zu schwer beladen und kannst nicht sprinten.
Spanish: Llevas mucha carga y no puedes correr.
Russian: Вы перегружены и не можете бежать.
Romanian: You are encumbered and cannot run.
Bulgarian: You are encumbered and cannot run.
Macedonian: You are encumbered and cannot run.
Finnish: Kannat liikaa painoa, et voi juosta.
Danish: You are encumbered and cannot run.
Icelandic: Þú ert að bera of mikið og getur ekki hlupið
Lithuanian: You are encumbered and cannot run.
Hungarian: Leterhelt vagy, és nem tudsz futni.
Slovak: You are encumbered and cannot run.
Polish: Za dużo dźwigasz, nie możesz biec.
Dutch: Je bent te belast en kan niet rennen.
Portuguese: Estás sobrecarregado e não consegues correr.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você está com muito peso e não pode correr.
Chinese: 你负重太多并无法跑步。
Japanese: 荷物が重くて走れない。
Chinese_Traditional: 你負重太多並無法跑步。

French: De la chaleur venant d'un bon feu.
Spanish: Mantienes el calor de un fuego agradable.
Chinese: 舒适的火给你带来温暖。
Japanese: 気持ちのいい火で温まっている。
Chinese_Traditional: 舒適的火給你帶來溫暖。

English: You are freezing, no health regeneration and significant lowered stamina regeneration.
Swedish: Du förfryser! Din hälsa regenererar inte, och du får tillbaka orken mycket långsammare.
French: Vous êtes en train de geler. Pas de régénération de vie et régénération d'endurance extrêmement diminuée.
Italian: You are freezing, no health regeneration and significant lowered stamina regeneration.
German: Du bist am Erfrieren. Deine Gesundheitsregeneration beträgt 0 und deine Ausdauerregeneration ist stark verringert.
Spanish: Te congelas. No recuperarás salud y el vigor se recupera mucho más despacio.
Russian: Вы замерзаете. Здоровье не восстанавливается, выносливость почти не восстанавливается.
Romanian: You are freezing, no health regeneration and significant lowered stamina regeneration.
Bulgarian: You are freezing, no health regeneration and significant lowered stamina regeneration.
Macedonian: You are freezing, no health regeneration and significant lowered stamina regeneration.
Finnish: Sinä jäädyt, Elämä ei palaudu lainkaan ja Energia palautuu huomattavasti hitaammin.
Danish: You are freezing, no health regeneration and significant lowered stamina regeneration.
Icelandic: You are freezing, no health regeneration and significant lowered stamina regeneration.
Turkish: Donuyorsun, sağlığın tazelenmiyor ve kondisyon tazeleme büyük ölçüde düştü.
Lithuanian: You are freezing, no health regeneration and significant lowered stamina regeneration.
Czech: Mrzneš, žádná regenerace zdraví a výrazně snížená regenerace výdrže.
Hungarian: Fagyoskodsz, nincs életerő regeneráció és jelentősen csökkent a kitartás regeneráció is.
Slovak: You are freezing, no health regeneration and significant lowered stamina regeneration.
Polish: Marzniesz, brak regeneracji życia i znacznie obniżona regeneracja kondycji.
Dutch: Je bent bezig te bevriezen. Geen gezondheidsherstel en beduidend minder conditieherstel.
Portuguese: You are freezing, no health regeneration and significant lowered stamina regeneration.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você está congelando, sua vida não será restaurada e a taxa de regeneração de vigor ficará reduzida.
Chinese: 你快要冻僵了，生命值不再恢复，耐力值恢复速度大大下降。
Japanese: 凍えている。 体力は回復せず、スタミナの回復量は大きく低下する。
Korean: 얼어붙고 있습니다, 체력이 회복되지 않고 스태미나 회복이 현저히 떨어집니다.
Chinese_Traditional: 你快要凍僵了，生命值不再恢復，耐力值恢復速度大大下降。

Chinese: 你为体温过低感到痛苦。
Japanese: 低体温に苦しんでいる。
Chinese_Traditional: 你為體溫過低感到痛苦。

Chinese_Traditional: 古樹長老的力量在你身體裡湧動

French: Vitesse de coupe du bois améliorée.

Spanish: Te mueves de forma más sigilosa.
Japanese: より人目につかなくなる。
Chinese_Traditional: 更加隱蔽，使你更難被敵人發現。

Romanian: Esti din ce in ce mai ud

French: Vous êtes à nouveau au sec
Japanese: あなたはスッキリ乾いた

English: Lowering your health and stamina regeneration.

English: Helps you find hidden things. Move in the direction the pings get more intense.
Swedish: Hjälper dig finna dolda ting. Gå i den riktning signalerna hörs som starkast.
French: Vous aide à trouver des objets cachés. Dirigez-vous là où ses signaux s'intensifient.
Italian: Helps you find hidden things. Move in the direction the pings get more intense.
German: Hilft dir beim Finden versteckter Sachen. Bewege dich in die Richtung, in der die Signale intensiver werden.
Spanish: Sirve para encontrar cosas ocultas. Muévete en la dirección en la que la señal se vuelve más intensa.
Russian: Помогает находить спрятанные вещи. Двигайтесь туда, где сигналы сильнее.
Romanian: Helps you find hidden things. Move in the direction the pings get more intense.
Bulgarian: Helps you find hidden things. Move in the direction the pings get more intense.
Macedonian: Helps you find hidden things. Move in the direction the pings get more intense.
Finnish: Auttaa sinua löytämään piilotettuja asioita. Liiku siihen suuntaan missä kilahdukset muuttuu voimakkaammaksi.
Danish: Helps you find hidden things. Move in the direction the pings get more intense.
Icelandic: Hjálpar þér að finna hluti. Gakktu í áttina sem óskabeinið leiðir þig.
Turkish: Gizli şeyleri bulmana yardım eder. Uyarının yoğunlaştığı yöne doğru git.
Lithuanian: Helps you find hidden things. Move in the direction the pings get more intense.
Czech: Pomůže ti najít skryté věci. Pohybuj se směrem, kde jsou intenzivnější označení.
Hungarian: Segít megtalálni az elrejtett dolgokat. Haladj abba az irányba, amerre a pittyegések erősebbé válnak!
Slovak: Helps you find hidden things. Move in the direction the pings get more intense.
Polish: Pomaga znaleźć ukryte rzeczy. Przejdź w kierunku, w którym wibracje stają się bardziej intensywne.
Dutch: Helpt je om verborgen dingen te vinden. Ga in de richting waar het pulseren intenser wordt.
Portuguese: Helps you find hidden things. Move in the direction the pings get more intense.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Ajuda a encontrar coisas escondidas. Siga a direção em que o som se intensifica.
Chinese: 帮助你找到隐藏宝物。 越接近宝物，提示音会越紧凑。
Japanese: 隠れたものを見つけられる。 より強く脈打つ方向に移動せよ。
Korean: 감춰진 것들을 찾는 것을 도와줍니다. 신호가 더 세지고 있는 방향으로 이동하십시오.
Chinese_Traditional: 幫助你找到隱藏寶物。 越接近寶物，提示音會越緊湊。

Polish: Odporność na obrażenia od magii i błyskawic.

Italian: Game restart is required when changing language.

Bulgarian: Поглъщане на щети при блокиране с оръжие или щит.
