English: You have found the summoning place of one of the Forsaken. Make the correct offering at their altar and they will come.\n\nBe wary though, the Forsaken are not easy prey. So craft a wicked weapon, don your finest armor, and eat a hearty meal before engaging them in combat.
Swedish: Du har funnit ett offeraltare till en av de Bannlysta. Offra rätt gåva för att åkalla dem.\n\nMärk väl, de Bannlysta utgör inga lätta byten. Bygg ett mäktigt vapen, bär din starkaste rustning, och ät en kraftig måltid innan du ger dig i strid med dem.
French: Vous avez trouvé le lieu d'invocation d'un des Déchus. Faites la bonne offrande sur son autel et il apparaîtra.\n\nMais prenez garde, les Déchus ne sont pas des proies faciles. Alors forgez une arme redoutable, enfilez votre meilleure armure et mangez un repas copieux avant de les défier.
Italian: You have found the summoning place of one of the Forsaken. Make the correct offering at their altar and they will come.\n\nBe wary though, the Forsaken are not easy prey. So craft a wicked weapon, don your finest armor, and eat a hearty meal before engaging them in combat.
German: Du hast einen Beschwörungsort der Wächter gefunden. Bringe an ihrem Altar das richtige Opfer, damit sie zu dir kommen.\n\nAber nimm dich in Acht - die Wächter sind keine leichte Beute. Also stelle zunächst eine mächtige Waffe her, lege deine beste Rüstung an und iss eine herzhafte Mahlzeit, bevor du es auf einen Kampf ankommen lässt.
Spanish: Has encontrado el lugar de invocación de uno de los Desterrados. Aparecerá si haces la ofrenda correcta en el altar.\n\nPero has de tener muchísimo cuidado, pues no son presas fáciles. Hazte con un arma poderosa, ponte tu mejor armadura y llénate bien el estómago antes de enfrentarte a uno de ellos.
Russian: Вы нашли место призыва одного из павших. Сделайте правильное подношение алтарю, и павший появится.\n\nОднако будьте осторожны, павших нелегко одолеть. Так что наденьте лучшие доспехи, создайте оружие посильнее и поешьте как следует, прежде чем вступать с ними в бой.
Romanian: You have found the summoning place of one of the Forsaken. Make the correct offering at their altar and they will come.\n\nBe wary though, the Forsaken are not easy prey. So craft a wicked weapon, don your finest armor, and eat a hearty meal before engaging them in combat.
Bulgarian: You have found the summoning place of one of the Forsaken. Make the correct offering at their altar and they will come.\n\nBe wary though, the Forsaken are not easy prey. So craft a wicked weapon, don your finest armor, and eat a hearty meal before engaging them in combat.
Macedonian: You have found the summoning place of one of the Forsaken. Make the correct offering at their altar and they will come.\n\nBe wary though, the Forsaken are not easy prey. So craft a wicked weapon, don your finest armor, and eat a hearty meal before engaging them in combat.
Finnish: You have found the summoning place of one of the Forsaken. Make the correct offering at their altar and they will come.\n\nBe wary though, the Forsaken are not easy prey. So craft a wicked weapon, don your finest armor, and eat a hearty meal before engaging them in combat.
Danish: You have found the summoning place of one of the Forsaken. Make the correct offering at their altar and they will come.\n\nBe wary though, the Forsaken are not easy prey. So craft a wicked weapon, don your finest armor, and eat a hearty meal before engaging them in combat.
Icelandic: You have found the summoning place of one of the Forsaken. Make the correct offering at their altar and they will come.\n\nBe wary though, the Forsaken are not easy prey. So craft a wicked weapon, don your finest armor, and eat a hearty meal before engaging them in combat.
Turkish: Yitiklerden birinin çağrı yerini buldun. Sunakta doğru adağı adarsan ortaya çıkacaklar.\n\nDikkatli olmalısın, çünkü Yitikler kolay hedef değiller. Çatışmaya girmeden önce güçlü bir silah üret, en kaliteli zırhını giy ve doyurucu bir yemek ye.
Lithuanian: You have found the summoning place of one of the Forsaken. Make the correct offering at their altar and they will come.\n\nBe wary though, the Forsaken are not easy prey. So craft a wicked weapon, don your finest armor, and eat a hearty meal before engaging them in combat.
Czech: Našel jsi přivolávací místo jednoho ze Ztracených. Nabídni správnou oběť u jejich oltáře a oni přijdou.\n\nBuď opatrní, Ztracený nejsou snadnou kořistí. Vyrob svou nejlepší zbraň, oblékněte si své nejlepší brnění a sněz vydatné jídlo, než vyrazíš do boje.
Hungarian: Rábukkantál az egyik cserbenhagyott idézőhelyére. Ajánld fel a megfelelő áldozatot az oltárnál, és meg fog jelenni.\n\nViszont legyél óvatos, a cserbenhagyottak nem jelentenek könnyű zsákmányt! Tehát készíts egy félelmetes fegyvert, húzd magadra a legkiválóbb páncélt, és fogyassz el egy kiadós vacsorát, mielőtt harcba bocsátkozol velük!
Slovak: You have found the summoning place of one of the Forsaken. Make the correct offering at their altar and they will come.\n\nBe wary though, the Forsaken are not easy prey. So craft a wicked weapon, don your finest armor, and eat a hearty meal before engaging them in combat.
Polish: Udało ci się znaleźć miejsce przywołania jednego z Wygnanych. Złóż odpowiednią ofiarę na ich ołtarzu, a przybędą.\n\nUważaj jednak – Zapomnianych nie pokonasz łatwo. Zanim więc ruszysz do walki, wytwórz zabójczą broń, załóż najlepszą zbroję i zjedz obfity posiłek.
Dutch: Je hebt de oproepplek van een van de Verlatenen gevonden. Maak het juiste offer bij het altaar en de Verlatene zal komen.\n\nWees echter voorzichtig, want de Verlatenen zijn geen makkelijke prooi. Maak dus eerst een stevig wapen, trek je beste bescherming aan en eet een stevige maaltijd voor je de strijd met hen aangaat.
Portuguese: You have found the summoning place of one of the Forsaken. Make the correct offering at their altar and they will come.\n\nBe wary though, the Forsaken are not easy prey. So craft a wicked weapon, don your finest armor, and eat a hearty meal before engaging them in combat.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você encontrou o local de invocação de um dos Guardiões. Faça a oferenda correta e ele virá.\n\nMas tenha cuidado, pois os Guardiões não são presas fáceis. Fabrique uma arma poderosa, coloque sua melhor armadura e coma uma refeição saudável antes de entrar em combate.
Chinese: 你找到了召唤被遗忘者的祭坛，在祭坛献上正确的祭品他们便会出现。 \n\n注意！被遗忘者们可不是轻易被降服的。 在战斗前你需要打造有威力的武器，穿上最坚固的护甲和好好大吃一顿，
Japanese: 見捨てられしものの一つを召喚する場所を見つけたな。 祭壇に正しい供物を捧げると呼び出すことができる。 \n\nただし気をつけろ。 見捨てられしものはたやすく狩れる相手ではない。 戦いに望む前に、強い武器を作り、最上の防具を身に着け、栄養のあるものを食べておくのだ。
Korean: 버려진 자 중 하나를 소환할 수 있는 제단을 찾았군. 조건에 맞는 아이템을 올리면 버려진 자가 찾아올걸세. \n\n조심하게, 그들은 쉬운 사냥감이 아니야. 그들과 마주하기 전 잘 드는 무기를 만들고, 최상의 갑옷을 입고, 좋은 음식을 먹게.
Chinese_Traditional: 你找到了召喚被遺忘者的祭壇，在祭壇獻上正確的祭品他們便會出現。 \n\n注意！被遺忘者們可不是輕易被降服的。 在戰鬥前你需要製造強勁的武器，穿上最堅固的護甲和好好大吃一頓，

English: Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.\n\nAnother improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Swedish: Sov bort nattens timmar i sängen och vakna uppfriskad och full av energi.\n\nEn annan förbättring till ditt hem vore lite kistor att lagra föremål i. Det är en god vana att <color=yellow>spara lite reservutrustning</color> för oförutsedda eventualiteter.
French: Dormez dans votre lit pour vous réveiller le matin en débordant d'énergie.\n\nAméliorez aussi votre maison en y ajoutant des coffres, pour y stocker vos objets. <color=yellow>Il vaut mieux toujours avoir de l'équipement en plus</color>, au cas où il arriverait quelque chose pendant que vous êtes en pleine exploration...
Italian: Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.\n\nAnother improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
German: Verbringe die Nacht in deinem Bett, um gestärkt und voller Energie zu erwachen.\n\nEine weitere Verbesserung deines Eigenheims würden ein paar Kisten darstellen, in denen du Gegenstände lagern kannst. <color=yellow>Es ist nie verkehrt, immer ein wenig Ersatzausrüstung vorrätig zu haben</color> - nur für den Fall, dass dir während deiner Erkundungen irgendetwas Unvorhersehbares zustoßen sollte …
Spanish: Duerme a pierna suelta en la cama y te despertarás con las energías recargadas por completo.\n\nTambién puedes colocar cofres en casa para guardar objetos y, de paso, mejorar tu morada. <color=yellow>Nunca está de más tener equipo de repuesto</color> por si te ocurre alguna desgracia cuando salgas a explorar...
Russian: Спите всю ночь напролет в своей кровати и просыпайтесь в бодром состоянии и с полным запасом энергии.\n\nЕще одним улучшением вашего дома могут стать сундуки для хранения предметов. <color=yellow>Хорошо всегда иметь при себе запасное снаряжение</color> на случай, если с вами случится что-то неприятное во время исследования...
Romanian: Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.\n\nAnother improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Bulgarian: Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.\n\nAnother improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Macedonian: Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.\n\nAnother improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Finnish: Nuku yön yli sängyssäsi ja herää levänneenä ja täynnä energiaa.\n\nToinen parannus jonka voit tehdä kotiisi on rakentaa laatikoita, joihin voit säilöä tavaraa. <color=yellow>On viisasta aina säilyttää ylimääräisiä varusteita</color>, jos sinulle sattuu tapahtumaan jotakin, kun tutkit ympäristöäsi...
Danish: Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.\n\nAnother improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Icelandic: Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.\n\nAnother improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Turkish: Geceyi yatağında uyuyarak geçirip dinç ve enerjik şekilde uyan.\n\nEvindeki olmazsa olmazlardan biri de eşyalarını depolayabileceğin sandıklardır.Keşif yaparken talihsiz bir durum yaşama ihtimaline karşı <color=yellow>yedek ekipman bulundurmak her zaman yararına olur</color>...
Lithuanian: Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.\n\nAnother improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Czech: Spi celou noc ve své posteli a probuď se svěží a plní energie.\n\nDalší vylepšení tvého domova by byly nějaké truhly, kam si můžeš uložit věci. <color=yellow> Je dobrým zvykem mít vždy nějaké náhradní vybavení </color>, pokud by se ti při zkoumání stalo něco nešťastného ...
Hungarian: Aludd át az éjszakát az ágyadban, és ébredj felfrissülve, tele energiával!\n\nEgy újabb fejlesztést az otthonodban néhány láda jelentene, ahol eltárolhatod a tárgyakat. <color=yellow>Mindig jó ötlet felszerelést tartaléknak félretenni</color>, ha valami szerencsétlenség történne veled felfedezés közben...
Slovak: Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.\n\nAnother improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Polish: Prześpij całą noc w swoim łóżku i obudź się wypoczętym i pełnym energii.\n\nKolejnym ulepszeniem twojego domu mogą być skrzynie, w których przechowasz swoje przedmioty. <color=yellow>Dobrą praktyką jest zawsze mieć przy sobie zapasowe wyposażenie</color>, jeśli podczas eksploracji przytrafi ci się nieszczęście.
Dutch: Slaap 's nachts lekker in je bed, en word uitgerust en vol energie wakker.\n\nJe kunt je huis verder verbeteren door wat kisten te plaatsen waarin je items kunt opslaan. <color=yellow>Het is een goed idee om wat reserve-uitrusting te hebben</color>, voor het geval je tijdens je avonturen iets onfortuinlijks overkomt…
Portuguese: Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.\n\nAnother improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Passe a noite na cama para se recuperar e acordar com muito mais disposição.\n\nOutra melhoria em sua casa seriam baús para guardar objetos. <color=yellow>É uma boa ideia sempre ter equipamentos de sobra</color>, caso você sofra algum infortúnio durante suas explorações…
Chinese: 晚上好好的睡一觉，醒来时才能有满满的力量和振作的精神来迎接新一天的挑战。 \n\n有家的另一个好处就是，你可以制作一些可以保存物品的宝箱。 <color=yellow>你最好随时都有一些备用的武器和装备</color>，以备不时之需，比如你在探索时如果不幸出了什么意外....
Japanese: ベッドで一晩眠れば、爽やかな気持ちで活力一杯の目覚めが迎えられる。 \n\nさらに、物を保管しておけるチェストをいくつか作れば家がより良い場所となる。 <color=yellow>装備には、常に予備を持つようにしておくといいだろう</color>。 探索中に不幸に見舞われることもあろうし...
Korean: 침대에서 하룻밤 푹 자고 나면 상쾌한 기분으로 활력 넘치는 아침을 맞을 수 있지. \n\n그대의 집에 필요한 또 다른 개선점으로는 아이템들을 보관 할 수 있는 상자를 들 수 있겠군. <color=yellow>여분의 장비를 비치해 두는 것은</color> 탐험 도중에 불행한 일이 생겼을 때를 대비할 수 있는 좋은 습관이지. . .
Chinese_Traditional: 晚上好好的睡一覺，醒來時才能有滿滿的力量和振作的精神來迎接新一天的挑戰。 \n\n有家的另一個好處就是，你可以製作一些儲藏箱存放物品。 <color=yellow>你最好隨時都有一些備用的武器和裝備</color>，以備不時之需，比如你在探索時不幸出了什麼意外....

Swedish: En plats att vila ditt huvud!
Dutch: Een rustplaats voor wie moe is!
Chinese: 睡吧，睡吧我亲爱的宝贝！

English: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Swedish: Du har strövat in i den Svarta Skogen. Denna plats har skördat många oförberedda krigares liv. Visa dig värdig genom att först besegra Eikthyrnir.
French: Vous avez atteint la Forêt noire. Cet endroit peut être très dangereux pour ceux qui ne sont pas assez préparés. Prouvez votre valeur en éliminant Eikthyr.
Italian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
German: Du hast dich in den dunklen Wald begeben. Dieser Ort kann für alle, die nicht vorbereitet sind, äußerst tödlich sein. Stelle deine Wert unter Beweis, indem du Eikthyr tötest.
Spanish: Te has adentrado en el Bosque negro. Este lugar puede ser muy peligroso para quienes no estén preparados... Así que acaba con Eikthyr para demostrar que tienes la fuerza suficiente para acceder.
Russian: Вы забрели в Черный лес. Это место может быть очень опасным для неподготовленных. Докажите, что вы достойны, убив Эйктюра.
Romanian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Bulgarian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Macedonian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Finnish: Olet vaeltanut Mustaan Metsään. Tämä paikka voi olla erittäin vaarallinen niille, jotka eivät ole valmistautuneet sen vaaroihin. Todista ensin väärtisi surmaamalla Eikthyr.
Danish: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Icelandic: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Turkish: Kara Orman'a adım attın. Kara Orman, hazırlık yapmayanlar için çok tehlikeli bir yer olabilir. Eikthyr'i öldürerek hazır olduğunu kanıtla.
Lithuanian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Czech: Zatoulal ses do Černého lesa. Toto místo může být pro nepřipravené velmi nebezpečné. Dokažte svou zásluhu tím, že zabiješ Eikthyra.
Hungarian: Betévedtél a Fekete erdőbe. Ez a hely nagyon veszélyes lehet a felkészületlenek számára. Bizonyítsd a rátermettségedet az Eikthyr megölésével!
Slovak: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Polish: Trafiasz do Czarnego lasu. To niezwykle niebezpieczny teren dla niedoświadczonych podróżników. Pokaż, na co cię stać, zabijając Eikthyra.
Dutch: Je bent het zwarte bos ingegaan. Deze plek kan erg gevaarlijk zijn voor wie niet voldoende is voorbereid. Bewijs dat je waardig bent door Eikthyr te verslaan.
Portuguese: Vagueaste até à Floresta negra. Este lugar pode ser muito perigoso para aqueles que não estão preparados. Prova o que vales matando Eikthyr.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você entrou na Floresta Negra, um lugar muito perigoso para quem não está preparado. Antes de mais nada, mate Eikthyr para provar o seu valor.
Chinese: 你游荡到了黑暗林山。 在没有准备好的情况下这里是非常危险的。 你必须击败赤血灵鹿才能获得探索这里的资格。
Japanese: 黒い森に迷い込んだな。 ここは不用意に足を踏み入れると、非常に危険な目に遭うことがある。 エイクスュルを倒し、自分の力を証明せよ。
Korean: 검은 숲에 걸어들어 왔군. 이곳은 준비되지 않은 자에게 매우 위험할 수 있어. 아이크티르를 무찌르고 실력을 증명해 보이는 것이 어떤가.
Chinese_Traditional: 你遊蕩到了黑暗林山。 在沒有準備好的情況下來到這裡是非常危險的。 擊敗赤血靈鹿證明你有資格進入這裡。

English: Turn back! This is a dangerous place
Italian: Turn back! This is a dangerous place
German: Dreh um! Dieser Ort ist gefährlich
Romanian: Turn back! This is a dangerous place
Bulgarian: Turn back! This is a dangerous place
Macedonian: Turn back! This is a dangerous place
Finnish: Käänny takaisin! Tämä on vaarallinen paikka.
Danish: Turn back! This is a dangerous place
Icelandic: Turn back! This is a dangerous place
Turkish: Geri dön! Burası tehlikeli bir yer
Lithuanian: Turn back! This is a dangerous place
Czech: Běž zpět! Tohle je nebezpečné místo
Hungarian: Fordulj vissza! Ez egy veszélyes hely!
Slovak: Turn back! This is a dangerous place
Dutch: Ga terug! Deze plek is gevaarlijk
Portuguese: Volta para trás! Este lugar é perigoso
Portuguese_Brazilian: Volte! Este é um lugar perigoso
Japanese: 戻れ！ここは危険な場所だ
フギン：見捨てられしもののトロフィー

English: Return to the Sacrificial Stones with your Forsaken trophy and offer it as a sacrifice to make the Gods smile upon you.
Swedish: Återvänd till offerstoderna med din trofé och offra den till Gudarna för att vinna deras gunst.
French: Retournez aux Pierres sacrificielles avec votre trophée de Déchu et offrez-le en sacrifice pour que les dieux vous accordent leur bénédiction.
Italian: Return to the Sacrificial Stones with your Forsaken trophy and offer it as a sacrifice to make the Gods smile upon you.
German: Kehre mit deiner Wächter-Trophäe zu den Opfersteinen zurück und bringe den Göttern ein Opfer, damit diese dir wohlgesonnen sind.
Spanish: Dirígete a las piedras de sacrificio con el trofeo de los Desterrados y haz una ofrenda con él para que te sonrían los dioses.
Russian: Вернитесь к жертвенным камням с трофеем павших и принесите его в дар богам, чтобы те оказали вам милость.
Romanian: Return to the Sacrificial Stones with your Forsaken trophy and offer it as a sacrifice to make the Gods smile upon you.
Bulgarian: Return to the Sacrificial Stones with your Forsaken trophy and offer it as a sacrifice to make the Gods smile upon you.
Macedonian: Return to the Sacrificial Stones with your Forsaken trophy and offer it as a sacrifice to make the Gods smile upon you.
Finnish: Palaa Uhrauskivien luo Unohdetun Pokaalin kanssa ja tarjoa se uhrilahjana, jotta Jumalat hymyilisivät sinulle.
Danish: Return to the Sacrificial Stones with your Forsaken trophy and offer it as a sacrifice to make the Gods smile upon you.
Icelandic: Return to the Sacrificial Stones with your Forsaken trophy and offer it as a sacrifice to make the Gods smile upon you.
Turkish: Yitik avı ganimetini Kurban Taşları'na götür ve Tanrıları hoşnut etmek için adak olarak ada.
Lithuanian: Return to the Sacrificial Stones with your Forsaken trophy and offer it as a sacrifice to make the Gods smile upon you.
Czech: Vrať se k Obětním kamenům se svou trofejí Ztraceného a obětuj ji jako oběť, aby se na tebe Bohové usmáli.
Hungarian: Térj vissza az áldozati kövekhez a cserbenhagyott trófeáddal, és ajánld fel áldozatként az istenek kegyeiért!
Slovak: Return to the Sacrificial Stones with your Forsaken trophy and offer it as a sacrifice to make the Gods smile upon you.
Polish: Zabierz trofeum Wygnanego do Kamieni Ofiarnych i złóż je w ofierze, aby bogowie byli dla ciebie przychylni.
Dutch: Keer terug naar de Offerstenen met je Verlatenentrofee en bied die aan als offer, zodat de goden je toelachen.
Portuguese: Return to the Sacrificial Stones with your Forsaken trophy and offer it as a sacrifice to make the Gods smile upon you.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Retorne às pedras de sacrifício e ofereça seu troféu dos Guardiões aos deuses para atrair a boa vontade deles.
Chinese: 带着你获得的被遗忘者战利品返回献祭石并献祭，这样才能让众神对你另眼相看。
Japanese: 見捨てられしもののトロフィーを手に、犠牲の石に戻るのだ。 犠牲として捧げれば、神々が微笑んでくれることだろう。
Korean: 버려진 자의 트로피를 가지고 희생의 돌로 돌아가 바치면 신들의 은총을 받을수 있을걸세.
Chinese_Traditional: 帶著你獲得的被遺忘者戰利品返回獻祭石並獻祭，這樣才能讓眾神對你另眼相看。

English: When the temperature drops at night, or if you are wet, you will suffer from being cold. This reduces your stamina regeneration.\n\nSeeking shelter by an open flame is your best option when this happens.
Swedish: När natten faller och kylan infinner sig kommer du bli frusen - särskilt om du är våt! Du kommer bli trött snabbare och hämta dig långsammare.\n\nSök skydd i lä vid en öppen eld för att få tillbaka värmen i kroppen.
French: Quand la température baisse pendant la nuit, ou si vous êtes humide, vous aurez froid. Cet état réduit la régénération de votre endurance.\n\nSi cela arrive, la meilleure solution et de vous rapprocher d'un feu.
Italian: When the temperature drops at night, or if you are wet, you will suffer from being cold. This reduces your stamina regeneration.\n\nSeeking shelter by an open flame is your best option when this happens.
German: Wenn die Temperatur bei Nacht fällt oder wenn du durchnässt bist, wird dir kalt, wodurch deine Ausdauerregeneration sinkt.\n\nIn diesen Fällen solltest du bei offenem Feuer Zuflucht suchen.
Spanish: Cuando la temperatura desciende al caer la noche o si te empapas, empezarás a sufrir por el frío y se reducirá tu regeneración de vigor.\n\nLo mejor que puedes hacer es cobijarte junto al fuego.
Russian: Если ночью температура упадет или вы промокнете, вам станет холодно. Выносливость будет восстанавливаться медленнее.\n\nВ таких случаях лучше всего найти укрытие у открытого огня.
Romanian: When the temperature drops at night, or if you are wet, you will suffer from being cold. This reduces your stamina regeneration.\n\nSeeking shelter by an open flame is your best option when this happens.
Bulgarian: When the temperature drops at night, or if you are wet, you will suffer from being cold. This reduces your stamina regeneration.\n\nSeeking shelter by an open flame is your best option when this happens.
Macedonian: When the temperature drops at night, or if you are wet, you will suffer from being cold. This reduces your stamina regeneration.\n\nSeeking shelter by an open flame is your best option when this happens.
Finnish: When the temperature drops at night, or if you are wet, you will suffer from being cold. This reduces your stamina regeneration.\n\nSeeking shelter by an open flame is your best option when this happens.
Danish: When the temperature drops at night, or if you are wet, you will suffer from being cold. This reduces your stamina regeneration.\n\nSeeking shelter by an open flame is your best option when this happens.
Icelandic: When the temperature drops at night, or if you are wet, you will suffer from being cold. This reduces your stamina regeneration.\n\nSeeking shelter by an open flame is your best option when this happens.
Turkish: Geceleri hava sıcaklığı düştüğünde veya ıslandığında, soğuktan etkileneceksin. Bu durum, kondisyon tazelenmesini azaltır.\n\nBu durum başına geldiğinde açık bir ateşin başına sığınmak, elindeki en iyi seçenektir.
Lithuanian: When the temperature drops at night, or if you are wet, you will suffer from being cold. This reduces your stamina regeneration.\n\nSeeking shelter by an open flame is your best option when this happens.
Czech: Když teplota v noci poklesne, nebo pokud jsi mokrý, budeš trpět zimou. To snižuje regeneraci tvojí výdrže. Když se to stane, je nejlepší hledat úkryt s ohništěm.
Hungarian: Amikor a hőmérséklet éjszaka lecsökken, vagy ha nedves vagy, szenvedni fogsz a hidegtől. Ez csökkenti az kitartásod regenerálódását.\n\nHa ez történik, a legjobb megoldás, ha nyílt láng mellett keresel menedéket.
Slovak: When the temperature drops at night, or if you are wet, you will suffer from being cold. This reduces your stamina regeneration.\n\nSeeking shelter by an open flame is your best option when this happens.
Polish: Kiedy temperatura spada w nocy lub gdy masz mokre ciało, ucierpisz z powodu zimna. Zmniejsza to regenerację wytrzymałości.\n\nW takiej sytuacji najlepszym rozwiązaniem będzie znalezienie schronienia przy otwartym ogniu.
Dutch: Als de temperatuur 's nachts daalt, of als je nat bent, zul je het koud krijgen. Dit vermindert het herstel van je conditie.\n\nWanneer dit gebeurt, is beschutting zoeken bij een open vlam je beste optie.
Portuguese: Quando a temperatura cai à noite, ou se estiveres molhado, vais sofrer com frio. Isso reduz a tua regeneração de energia.\n\nProcurar um abrigo com fogo é a tua melhor opção quando isso acontece.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Quando a temperatura cair à noite, ou se você tiver se molhado, vai passar frio, o que reduz sua regeneração de vigor.\n\nProcurar abrigo perto do fogo é o melhor a se fazer quando isso acontece.
Chinese: 当夜晚来临温度降低，或者你湿了，你会感觉到非常寒冷。 这会让你的耐力值恢复速度变慢。 \n\n找到靠近火源的庇护所是解决这个问题最好的办法。
Japanese: 夜に気温が下がったり、身体が濡れたりすると、寒さに苦しむことになる。 するとスタミナの回復が遅くなる。 \n\nそのような時は、屋根のある場所で火のそばにいるのが一番だ。
Korean: 밤에 기온이 떨어지거나 젖은 상태에서는 추위에 영향을 받을것이다. 그렇게 되면 스태미나 회복이 느려지지. \n\n이것을 막는 최선책은 불이 있는 피난처에 몸을 피하는 것이지.
Chinese_Traditional: 當黑夜來臨而溫度下降，或者你濕了，你會感覺到非常寒冷。 這會讓你的耐力值恢復速度變慢。 \n\n找到靠近火源的庇護所是解決這個問題最好的辦法。

English: Delves and dungeons can be found across the 10th World. They are monuments of the past, and most often filled with the riches of civilizations long lost.\n\nRemember to bring a light source!
Swedish: Grottor och gravkammare finner du över hela den 10:e världen. De är monument till det förflutna, och ofta fyllda med forna civilisationers skatter och rikedomar.\n\nDu gör bäst i att minnas en fackla!
French: Des donjons mystérieux sont disséminés aux quatre coins du 10e monde. Ce sont des monuments du passé, souvent remplis de richesses issues de civilisations disparues depuis longtemps.\n\nN'oubliez pas d'emporter de quoi vous éclairer !
Italian: Delves and dungeons can be found across the 10th World. They are monuments of the past, and most often filled with the riches of civilizations long lost.\n\nRemember to bring a light source!
German: Überall in der 10. Welt existieren Höhlen und Dungeons - Monumente der Vergangenheit, die mit den Reichtümern längst vergessener Zivilisationen gefüllt sind.\n\nVergiss nicht, eine Lichtquelle mitzuführen.
Spanish: Hay minas y mazmorras por todo el décimo mundo. Son monumentos del pasado y suelen estar a rebosar de riquezas de las civilizaciones de antaño.\n\nEso sí, no te olvides de llevar algo de luz.
Russian: В 10-м мире есть шахты и подземелья. Это памятники прошлого, и чаще всего они наполнены богатствами давно утраченных цивилизаций.\n\nНе забудьте захватить источник света!
Romanian: Delves and dungeons can be found across the 10th World. They are monuments of the past, and most often filled with the riches of civilizations long lost.\n\nRemember to bring a light source!
Bulgarian: Delves and dungeons can be found across the 10th World. They are monuments of the past, and most often filled with the riches of civilizations long lost.\n\nRemember to bring a light source!
Macedonian: Delves and dungeons can be found across the 10th World. They are monuments of the past, and most often filled with the riches of civilizations long lost.\n\nRemember to bring a light source!
Finnish: Delves and dungeons can be found across the 10th World. They are monuments of the past, and most often filled with the riches of civilizations long lost.\n\nRemember to bring a light source!
Danish: Delves and dungeons can be found across the 10th World. They are monuments of the past, and most often filled with the riches of civilizations long lost.\n\nRemember to bring a light source!
Icelandic: Delves and dungeons can be found across the 10th World. They are monuments of the past, and most often filled with the riches of civilizations long lost.\n\nRemember to bring a light source!
Turkish: 10. Dünya'nın dört bir köşesinde mahzen ve zindanlar bulunabilir. Geçmişin hatırası olan bu yerler, çoğunlukla evvelde yitip gitmiş uygarlıkların hazineleriyle doludur.\n\nYanında bir ışık kaynağı taşımayı unutma!
Lithuanian: Delves and dungeons can be found across the 10th World. They are monuments of the past, and most often filled with the riches of civilizations long lost.\n\nRemember to bring a light source!
Czech: Zákopy a podzemí najdeš po celém 10. světě. Jsou to památky minulosti a často plné bohatstvím civilizací dávno ztracených.\n\nNezapomeň si vzít pochodeň!
Hungarian: Barlangok és kripták találhatók szerte a 10. világban. Ezek a múlt emlékei, és igen gyakran a rég eltűnt civilizációk gazdagságát rejtik.\n\nNe felejts el fényforrást magaddal hozni!
Slovak: Delves and dungeons can be found across the 10th World. They are monuments of the past, and most often filled with the riches of civilizations long lost.\n\nRemember to bring a light source!
Polish: W Dziesiątym świecie można znaleźć liczne jamy i lochy. Stanowią one pomniki przeszłości, a najczęściej wypełnione są bogactwem dawno zaginionych cywilizacji.\n\nNie zapomnij zabrać ze sobą źródła światła!
Dutch: Onderaardse krochten en kerkers zijn overal in de 10e wereld te vinden. Het zijn monumenten uit het verleden, die vaak vol zitten met rijkdommen van verloren beschavingen.\n\nDenk er wel aan dat je een lichtbron meeneemt!
Portuguese: Delves and dungeons can be found across the 10th World. They are monuments of the past, and most often filled with the riches of civilizations long lost.\n\nRemember to bring a light source!
Portuguese_Brazilian: O 10º Mundo é cheio de profundezas e masmorras, monumentos antigas que costumam abarcar tesouros de civilizações perdidas.\n\nLembre-se de trazer uma fonte de luz!
Chinese: 在第十大神界中可以找到地洞和地下城。 它们是过往的纪念碑，而且大多数的地洞和地下城都藏满了早已遗失的文明和宝藏。 \n\n请记得带上光源！
Japanese: 第10世界のあちこちに、洞穴やダンジョンがある。 それらは過去の遺物だ。 往々にして、長く失われた文明の富が多く残されている。 \n\n光源を持っていくことを忘れるな！
Korean: 열 번째 세계에서는 많은 곳에서 동굴들과 던전들을 찾을 수 있다네. 그곳들은 과거의 기념비이자, 거의 대부분이 과거 문명의 재물을 감추고 있지. \n\n어두우니 불을 잊지 말게!
Chinese_Traditional: 在第十大神界中可以找到地洞和地下城。 它們是過往的紀念碑，而且大多數的地洞和地下城都藏滿了早已遺失的文明和寶藏。 \n\n請記得帶上光源！

Spanish: Los tesoros están en las profundidades

English: Each time you are struck down, you will <color=yellow">forget a small part of your abilities and drop your belongings</color> at the site of the accident.\n\nIf you wish you were home by now I'd recommend <color=yellow">building a bed</color>, wherever home may be.
Swedish: Varje gång du går Döden till mötes kommer du <color=yellow>förlora en del av dina minnen och förmågor</color>, och <color=yellow>tappa dina tillhörigheter</color> där du stupade.\n\nOm du önskar att du var hemma nu rekommenderar jag att du <color=yellow>bygger en säng</color>, varhelst hem nu må vara.
French:
Vous êtes mort!

Vous allez réapparaitre à votre point d'apparition actuel. Si vous n'en avez pas défini un, vous réapparaissez à votre point de départ.

Lorsque vous mourrez, vos possessions sont stockées dans une pierre tombale au moment de votre mort. Un crâne sur la carte marque l’emplacement de votre dernière mort.
Italian: Ad ogni tua morte, <color=yellow">dimenticherai alcune delle tue abilità e lascerai i tuoi possedimenti</color> nel luogo del tuo decesso.\n\nSe in questo momento vorresti essere a casa ti consiglio di <color=yellow">costruire un letto</color>, ovunque sia la tua base.
German: Jedes Mal, wenn du niedergestreckt wirst, <color=yellow">vergisst du einen kleinen Teil deiner Fertigkeiten und du lässt deinen Besitz fallen</color>, an dem Ort, an dem dich der Tod umarmt hat.\n\nWenn du dir inzwischen wünschen solltest, wieder zu Hause zu sein, dann empfehle ich dir, dort ein <color=yellow">Bett zu bauen</color>, wo auch immer du dich nun zu Hause fühlst.
Spanish: Cada vez que te derroten, <color=yellow">olvidarás una pequeña parte de tus habilidades y tus pertenencias se quedarán</color> en el lugar del accidente.\n\nSi desearías estar en casa ahora mismo, te recomiendo que <color=yellow">construyas una cama</color>, esté donde esté tu hogar.
Russian: Каждый раз, когда вы повержены, <color=yellow">небольшая часть ваших способностей и вещей будет потеряна</color> на месте.\n\nЕсли вы хотите перемещаться домой из любой точки, я бы порекомендовал <color=yellow">построить кровать</color>.
Romanian:
Ai murit!

Vei reaparea la punctul de spawnare pe care l-ai setat. Daca nu ai setat unul, atunci te vei spawna la locatia de start.

Cand mori obiectele tale sunt adunate intr-un mormant. Un craniu pe harta arata locul unei ai murit ultima data.
Bulgarian: Each time you are struck down, you will <color=yellow">forget a small part of your abilities and drop your belongings</color> at the site of the accident.\n\nIf you wish you were home by now I'd recommend <color=yellow">building a bed</color>, wherever home may be.
Macedonian: Each time you are struck down, you will <color=yellow">forget a small part of your abilities and drop your belongings</color> at the site of the accident.\n\nIf you wish you were home by now I'd recommend <color=yellow">building a bed</color>, wherever home may be.
Finnish: Each time you are struck down, you will <color=yellow">forget a small part of your abilities and drop your belongings</color> at the site of the accident.\n\nIf you wish you were home by now I'd recommend <color=yellow">building a bed</color>, wherever home may be.
Danish: Each time you are struck down, you will <color=yellow">forget a small part of your abilities and drop your belongings</color> at the site of the accident.\n\nIf you wish you were home by now I'd recommend <color=yellow">building a bed</color>, wherever home may be.
Icelandic: Each time you are struck down, you will <color=yellow">forget a small part of your abilities and drop your belongings</color> at the site of the accident.\n\nIf you wish you were home by now I'd recommend <color=yellow">building a bed</color>, wherever home may be.
Turkish: Her öldüğünde, <color=yellow">yeteneklerinin küçük bir kısmını unutacak ve kazanın yaşandığı yerde eşyalarını düşüreceksin</color>.\n\nKeşke evde olsaydım diyorsan da evinin olmasını istediğin yere <color=yellow">bir yatak inşa etmeni</color> önerebilirim.
Lithuanian: Each time you are struck down, you will <color=yellow">forget a small part of your abilities and drop your belongings</color> at the site of the accident.\n\nIf you wish you were home by now I'd recommend <color=yellow">building a bed</color>, wherever home may be.
Czech: Pokaždé když zemřeš tak <color=yellow">zapomeneš malou část svých dovedností a na zem spadnou tvoje předměty</color>.\n\nPokud si teď přeješ abys byl doma tak <color=yellow">doporučuji postavit postel</color> kdekoliv má být tvůj domov.
Hungarian: Minden egyes alkalommal, amikor a földre kerülsz, akkor <color=yellow>elfeleded a képességeid egy kisebb részét, és ledobod a holmidat </color>az eset helyszínén.\n\nHa mostanra már azt kívánod, bárcsak otthon lehetnél, azt javaslom, <color=yellow>építs egy ágyat</color>, bárhol is legyen az az otthon.
Slovak: Each time you are struck down, you will <color=yellow">forget a small part of your abilities and drop your belongings</color> at the site of the accident.\n\nIf you wish you were home by now I'd recommend <color=yellow">building a bed</color>, wherever home may be.
Polish:
Umierasz!

Zostaniesz wskrzeszony w aktualnym miejscu odradzania. Jeżeli nie posiadasz ustawionego miejsca, odrodzisz się w początkowej lokalizacji.

Kiedy umrzesz, twój ekwipunek zostanie umiejscowiony w nagrobku w miejscu twojej śmierci. Czaszka na mapie pokazuje, gdzie zginąłeś.
Dutch: Iedere keer dat je het leven laat, <color=yellow">vergeet je een klein deel van wat je kunt, en laat je je bezittingen vallen</color> op de plek waar je sneuvelde.\n\nAls je nu liever thuis was geweest, stel ik voor dat je <color=yellow">een bed bouwt</color>, waar je thuis ook mag zijn.
Portuguese: Each time you are struck down, you will <color=yellow">forget a small part of your abilities and drop your belongings</color> at the site of the accident.\n\nIf you wish you were home by now I'd recommend <color=yellow">building a bed</color>, wherever home may be.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Sempre que você cai em combate, <color=yellow">esquece uma pequena parte de suas habilidades e deixa seus pertences</color> no local do incidente.\n\nSe o que você gostaria é de estar em casa agora, recomendo <color=yellow">construir uma cama</color>, onde quer que seja o seu lar.
Chinese: 每一次你被击倒, 你都会在你阵亡的地方<color=yellow">丢失你的物品和忘记一小部分技能</color> 。 \n\n如果你希望自己现在在家醒来那我建议你<color=yellow">造一张床</color>, 因为床在哪里，家就在哪里。
Japanese: あなたは倒れるたびに<color=yellow">能力のわずかな一部を忘れ、持ち物を</color>事故の起きた場所に落とす。 \n\n家に戻りたいと望むなら、家となる場所に<color=yellow">ベッドを作るのだ</color>。
Korean: 그대가 쓰러질 때마다, 그대는 <color=yellow">능력중 일부를 잊을것이고 소지품들이 사고 현장에 떨어질 것이다. </color> \n\n지금쯤 집에 도착했으면 하는 생각이 든다면, 집이 어디에 있든지 간에 그곳에 <color=yellow">침대를 만드는것을</color> 추천하지.
Chinese_Traditional: 每一次你被擊倒, 你都會在你陣亡的地方<color=yellow">遺失你的物品和忘記一小部分技能</color> 。 \n\n如果你希望自己在家醒來的話那我建議你<color=yellow">造一張床</color>, 因為床在哪裡，家就在哪裡。

German: Aufstehen! Du bist noch nicht fertig, Krieger …
Dutch: Je hebt een dodelijke klap opgelopen!

English: You have found a snack, consume it to improve your health and stamina.\n\nBe aware that before long you will grow hungry again, so try to always have at least a couple of different meals ready.
Swedish: Du har funnit en matbit. Ät den för att förbättra din hälsa och ork.\n\nMärk väl att du kommer bli hungrig igen innan du vet ordet av, så se till att alltid ha lite varierad proviant med dig.
French: Manger de la nourriture augmente votre total de santé. En mangeant différents types de nourriture, vous pouvez l'augmenter encore plus.
Italian: Hai trovato del cibo, consumalo per aumentare la quantità totale di salute e stamina.\n\nSii consapevole che tra non molto avrai di nuovo fame, cerca sempre di avere un paio di pasti pronti.
German: Du hast etwas zu essen gefunden. Verzehre es, um deine Gesundheit und Ausdauer wiederherzustellen.\n\nBedenke, dass es nicht lange dauern wird, bis du hungrig wirst. Daher solltest du immer einige Nahrungsmittel mit dir herumtragen.
Spanish: Has encontrado un aperitivo, cómetelo para mejorar tanto la salud como el vigor.\n\nTen en cuenta que, pasado un rato, volverás a tener hambre, por lo que lo ideal es tener al menos un par de comidas distintas preparadas.
Russian: Вы нашли, чем перекусить. Поешьте скорее, чтобы улучшить свое здоровье и выносливость.\n\nПомните, что вскоре вы снова проголодаетесь, поэтому старайтесь всегда иметь наготове хотя бы пару разных блюд.
Romanian: Mancand iti cresti nivelul total de viata. Mancand mai multe tipuri de mancare il poti creste si mai mult.
Bulgarian: You have found a snack, consume it to improve your health and stamina.\n\nBe aware that before long you will grow hungry again, so try to always have at least a couple of different meals ready.
Macedonian: You have found a snack, consume it to improve your health and stamina.\n\nBe aware that before long you will grow hungry again, so try to always have at least a couple of different meals ready.
Finnish: You have found a snack, consume it to improve your health and stamina.\n\nBe aware that before long you will grow hungry again, so try to always have at least a couple of different meals ready.
Danish: You have found a snack, consume it to improve your health and stamina.\n\nBe aware that before long you will grow hungry again, so try to always have at least a couple of different meals ready.
Icelandic: Þú hefur fundið þér mat, snæddu þér á honum til að bæta heilsu þína og þol.\n\nVarist þó, borðir þú ekki aftur í tíma mun hungrið mæta. Því er best að alltaf hafa smá munnbita með sér til að grípa í.
Turkish: Bir atıştırmalık buldun ve bu atıştırmalığı tüketerek sağlığını ve kondisyonunu geliştirebilirsin.\n\nÇok geçmeden tekrar acıkacağını unutma ve yanında en azından birkaç farklı yiyeceği hazır bulundur.
Lithuanian: You have found a snack, consume it to improve your health and stamina.\n\nBe aware that before long you will grow hungry again, so try to always have at least a couple of different meals ready.
Czech: Našel jsi menší občerstvení, sněz ho pro zlepšení tvého života a výdrže.\n\nMěj na paměti, že postupem času budeš hladovět, takže se pokus u sebe mít trochu rozdílného jídla.
Hungarian: Rágcsálnivalóra bukkantál. Az elfogyasztása megnöveli az életerődet és a kitartásodat.\n\nNe feledkezz meg róla, hogy hamarosan újra éhes leszel, ezért lehetőleg mindig álljon rendelkezésedre többféle élelem!
Slovak: You have found a snack, consume it to improve your health and stamina.\n\nBe aware that before long you will grow hungry again, so try to always have at least a couple of different meals ready.
Polish: Jedzenie zwiększa twoją ilość zdrowia. Jedząc różne typy jedzenia możesz zwiększyć ją jeszcze bardziej.
Dutch: Je hebt een lekker hapje gevonden, eet het op om je gezondheid en conditie te verbeteren.\n\nWees je er wel van bewust dat je straks weer honger gaat hebben, dus zorg dat je altijd wat verschillende maaltijden klaar hebt staan.
Portuguese: You have found a snack, consume it to improve your health and stamina.\n\nBe aware that before long you will grow hungry again, so try to always have at least a couple of different meals ready.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você encontrou um lanche, consuma-o para melhorar sua vida e vigor.\n\nMas lembre-se que em breve você voltará a sentir fome, então tente ter algumas refeições diferentes sempre à disposição.
Chinese: 你发现了一种小吃，吃掉它会强化你的生命值和耐力值。 \n\n需要注意的是，你会定期感到饥饿，所以最好随身携带几种不同的食物哦。
Japanese: 軽食を見つけたな。 それを食べて体力とスタミナを増やすのだ。 \n\nそれほど時間が経たないうちに、また空腹になるだろう。 常に、少なくとも二、三個、さまざまな種類の食物を手元に持っておくことだ。
Korean: 간식을 찾았군. 섭취해서 체력과 스태미나를 향상시키게. \n\n얼마 지나지 않아 다시 배가 고플테니 여러 종류의 음식을 조금씩 가지고 다닐 수 있도록.
Chinese_Traditional: 你發現了一種小吃，吃掉它會強化你的生命值和耐力值。 \n\n需要注意的是，你會定期感到飢餓，所以最好隨身攜帶幾種不同的食物哦。

English: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Swedish: Gårdsvakten utsöndrar en stark magi som hindrar utomstående från att bygga i närheten. Den låser även dörrar inom dess omnejd.
French: La balise émet une aura puissante empêchant les autres Vikings de construire dans cette zone. Elle verrouille également les portes dans sa zone d'effet.
Italian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
German: Der Wächterstein verströmt eine mächtige Aura, die andere Wikinger am Errichten von Gebäuden hindert. Außerdem verschließt er alle Türen in seinem Einflussbereich.
Spanish: La piedra guardiana emite un aura poderosa que impide que los demás vikingos construyan cosas. También cierra las puertas que estén bajo su influencia.
Russian: Оберег излучает сильную ауру, не позволяющую другим викингам строить. Он также запирает все двери в пределах своего влияния.
Romanian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Bulgarian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Macedonian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Finnish: Suojeluskivi säteilee vahvaa auraa joka estää muita viikinkejä rakentamasta rakennuksia. Se myös lukitsee kaikki ovet vaikutusalueellaan.
Danish: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Icelandic: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Turkish: Nazar, diğer vikinglerin bir şeyler inşa etmesini engelleyen güçlü bir aura yayar. Ayrıca etkisi altındaki kapıları da kilitler.
Lithuanian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Czech: Stážce vydává kouzelné těsnění na blízké okolí, které brání ostatním hráčům ve stavbě budov nebo otevírání dveří.
Hungarian: Ez a védőkő erős aurát bocsát ki, és megakadályozza a többi vikinget az építkezésben, emellett bezárja az összes ajtót is a hatókörében.
Slovak: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Polish: Kamień strażniczy emituje silną aurę, która uniemożliwia innym wikingom budowanie w jej zasięgu. Zamyka również wszystkie drzwi w swoim zasięgu.
Dutch: Deze verzegeling heeft een sterke aura, wat voorkomt dat andere Vikingen hier dingen kunnen bouwen. Het doet ook alle deuren onder zijn invloed op slot.
Portuguese: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Portuguese_Brazilian: A proteção emite uma aura forte que impede outros vikings de construírem coisas, além de trancar todas as portas sob sua influência.
Chinese: 这块带着强大光环的守护石能阻止其他维京战士在区域内建造或拆除。 它也能锁上区域内所有的门。
Japanese: 守護石は強いオーラを放ち、他のバイキングが建物に近づくことを防ぐ。 また、その影響下にあるすべてのドアに鍵をかける。
Korean: 경비석은 다른 바이킹들이 건물을 짓는 것을 방해하는 강한 기운을 내뿜지. 또한 영향력 아래에 있는 모든 문들을 잠가버린다네.
Chinese_Traditional: 這塊帶著強大光環的守護石能阻止其他維京戰士在區域內建造或拆除。 它也能鎖上區域内所有的門。

English: With this tool you will raise mighty halls and towering fortifications.\n\nStart by building a <color=yellow>Workbench</color>, this in turn will enable you to construct other things.
Swedish: Med detta verktyg kommer du resa mäktiga hallar och tornande fort.\n\nBörja med att bygga en <color=yellow>Snickarbänk</color>, som i sin tur kommer låta dig tillverka ytterligare ting.
French: Vous élèverez d'immenses salles et d'imposantes fortifications grâce à cet outil.\n\nCommencez par bâtir une <color=yellow>table de fabrication</color>, qui vous permettra ensuite de construire d'autres choses.
Italian: With this tool you will raise mighty halls and towering fortifications.\n\nStart by building a <color=yellow>Workbench</color>, this in turn will enable you to construct other things.
German: Mit diesem Werkzeug kannst du mächtige Hallen und hohe Befestigungen aus dem Boden stampfen.\n\nBeginne mit der Errichtung einer <color=yellow>Werkbank</color>, mit deren Hilfe du andere Dinge herstellen kannst.
Spanish: Podrás erigir salas enormes y fortificaciones gigantescas con esta herramienta.\n\nAntes de nada, construye un <color=yellow>banco de trabajo</color> y así podrás fabricar más cosas.
Russian: С помощью этого инструмента вы сможете возводить надежные помещения и высокие укрепления.\n\nНачните со строительства <color=yellow>верстака</color>, который позволит вам создавать другие объекты.
Romanian: With this tool you will raise mighty halls and towering fortifications.\n\nStart by building a <color=yellow>Workbench</color>, this in turn will enable you to construct other things.
Bulgarian: With this tool you will raise mighty halls and towering fortifications.\n\nStart by building a <color=yellow>Workbench</color>, this in turn will enable you to construct other things.
Macedonian: With this tool you will raise mighty halls and towering fortifications.\n\nStart by building a <color=yellow>Workbench</color>, this in turn will enable you to construct other things.
Finnish: With this tool you will raise mighty halls and towering fortifications.\n\nStart by building a <color=yellow>Workbench</color>, this in turn will enable you to construct other things.
Danish: With this tool you will raise mighty halls and towering fortifications.\n\nStart by building a <color=yellow>Workbench</color>, this in turn will enable you to construct other things.
Icelandic: With this tool you will raise mighty halls and towering fortifications.\n\nStart by building a <color=yellow>Workbench</color>, this in turn will enable you to construct other things.
Turkish: Bu aleti kullanarak kudretli salonlar ve yüksek tahkimatlar inşa edebilirsin.\n\nBir <color=yellow>Tezgâh</color> üret ve bunu kullanarak diğer şeyleri üretmeye başla.
Lithuanian: With this tool you will raise mighty halls and towering fortifications.\n\nStart by building a <color=yellow>Workbench</color>, this in turn will enable you to construct other things.
Czech:
S tímto nástrojem postavíš velké haly a opevnění.

Začni postavením <color=yellow>Pracovního stolu</color>, což ti umožní postavit další věci.
Hungarian: Ezzel a szerszámmal hatalmas csarnokokat és tornyosuló erődítményeket fogsz emelni.\n\nKezdd egy <color=yellow>munkaasztal</color> építésével, amely cserébe elérhetővé tesz más dolgok létrehozását!
Slovak: With this tool you will raise mighty halls and towering fortifications.\n\nStart by building a <color=yellow>Workbench</color>, this in turn will enable you to construct other things.
Polish: Przy użyciu tego narzędzia wzniesiesz potężne komnaty i sięgające do nieba fortyfikacje.\n\nZacznij od skonstruowania <color=yellow>stołu warsztatowego,</color> co z kolei pozwoli ci wytworzyć pozostałe przedmioty.
Dutch: Met dit gereedschap zul je grootse huizen en stevige vestingwerken bouwen.\n\nBegin met de bouw van een <color=yellow>werkbank</color>. Daarmee zul je weer andere dingen kunnen bouwen.
Portuguese: With this tool you will raise mighty halls and towering fortifications.\n\nStart by building a <color=yellow>Workbench</color>, this in turn will enable you to construct other things.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Com esta ferramenta, você poderá erigir saguões grandiosos e fortificações elevadas.\n\nComece construindo uma <color=yellow>bancada</color>, que por sua vez permitirá erguer outras construções.
Chinese:
你可以用这把工具锤建造雄伟的大殿和坚固的堡垒。 

不过首先你需要制作一个<color=yellow>工作台</color>，这样你才可以开始建造其他设施。
Japanese: この道具があれば、広大な広間やそびえる要塞を作ることができよう。 \n\nまず<color=yellow>作業台</color>を作るのだ。 これによって、他の物を作ることができる。
Korean: 이것만 손에 있으면 드높은 전당과 강대한 요새도 세울 수 있지. \n\n우선 <color=yellow>작업대</color>를 만드는 것부터 시작하게. 그걸 통해서 다른 것들도 만들 수 있게 될 테니.
Chinese_Traditional:
你可以用這把工具錘建造雄偉的大殿和堅固的堡壘。 

不過首先你需要製作一個<color=yellow>工作檯</color>，這樣你才可以開始建造其他設施。

English: This tool is used for landscaping, you could say it is the perfect complement to the Hammer.\n\nUse it to clear the ground and manipulate the terrain. It is easier to create buildings on level ground!
Swedish: Det här verktyget använder du för att förändra terrängen. Det perfekta komplementet till Hammaren, skulle man kunna säga.\n\nAnvänd den för att platta till och höja marken. Det är lättare att bygga där det är jämt!
French: Cet outil permet de travailler la terre, c'est l'outil complémentaire idéal pour le marteau.\n\nUtilisez-le pour dégager le sol et manipuler le terrain. C'est plus facile de créer des bâtiments sur un sol plat !
Italian: This tool is used for landscaping, you could say it is the perfect complement to the Hammer.\n\nUse it to clear the ground and manipulate the terrain. It is easier to create buildings on level ground!
German: Dieses Werkzeug wird zur Landwirtschaft verwendet. Man könnte sagen, dass es sich mit einem Hammer perfekt ergänzt.\n\nVerwende sie, um den Boden zu säubern und das Terrain zu manipulieren. Es ist leichter, Gebäude auf ebenem Boden zu errichten.
Spanish: Esta herramienta es la clave de la jardinería y podría decirse que es el complemento perfecto del martillo.\n\nÚsala para despejar y manipular el terreno. Es mucho más sencillo construir edificios en superficies planas.
Russian: Этот инструмент используется для возделывания почвы, а также как идеальное дополнение к молоту.\n\nИспользуйте его, чтобы расчищать землю и изменять ландшафт. Строить на ровной местности проще!
Romanian: This tool is used for landscaping, you could say it is the perfect complement to the Hammer.\n\nUse it to clear the ground and manipulate the terrain. It is easier to create buildings on level ground!
Bulgarian: This tool is used for landscaping, you could say it is the perfect complement to the Hammer.\n\nUse it to clear the ground and manipulate the terrain. It is easier to create buildings on level ground!
Macedonian: This tool is used for landscaping, you could say it is the perfect complement to the Hammer.\n\nUse it to clear the ground and manipulate the terrain. It is easier to create buildings on level ground!
Finnish: This tool is used for landscaping, you could say it is the perfect complement to the Hammer.\n\nUse it to clear the ground and manipulate the terrain. It is easier to create buildings on level ground!
Danish: This tool is used for landscaping, you could say it is the perfect complement to the Hammer.\n\nUse it to clear the ground and manipulate the terrain. It is easier to create buildings on level ground!
Icelandic: Þetta verkfæri er notað til að breyta landslagi, þú gætir sagt að þetta sé fullkomið viðbót við hamarinn.\n\nNotaðu það til að ryðja jörðina og móta landslaginu að þínum þörfum. Það er mun auðveldara að byggja byggingar á flötum grunni!
Turkish: Toprağı işlemek için kullanacağın bu alet, çekiçle harika bir partner diyebiliriz.\n\nÇapayı kullanarak toprağı temizle ve araziyi şekillendir. Düz zeminde bina inşa etmek daha kolaydır!
Lithuanian: This tool is used for landscaping, you could say it is the perfect complement to the Hammer.\n\nUse it to clear the ground and manipulate the terrain. It is easier to create buildings on level ground!
Czech:
Tento nástroj se používá pro úpravu terénu, dalo by se říct, že je dokonalým doplňkem kladiva. 

Použij jej k zahlazování země a manipulaci s terénem. Stavění budov na rovném terénu je snazší!
Hungarian: Ez a szerszám tereprendezésre használatos, mondhatni, tökéletes kiegészíti a kalapácsot.\n\nA segítségével megtisztíthatod, és átalakíthatod a talajt. Vízszintes területen könnyebb épületeket létrehozni.
Slovak: This tool is used for landscaping, you could say it is the perfect complement to the Hammer.\n\nUse it to clear the ground and manipulate the terrain. It is easier to create buildings on level ground!
Polish: To narzędzie służy do kształtowania krajobrazu. Można rzec, że jest doskonałym uzupełnieniem młota.\n\nUżywaj go do oczyszczania ziemi i manipulowania terenem. Łatwiej jest bowiem tworzyć budowle na równym terenie!
Dutch: Dit gereedschap wordt gebruikt voor de landbouw en sluit perfect aan op de hamer.\n\nGebruikt het om de grond mee om te woelen en het terrein te manipuleren. Het is makkelijker bouwen op vlakke grond!
Portuguese: This tool is used for landscaping, you could say it is the perfect complement to the Hammer.\n\nUse it to clear the ground and manipulate the terrain. It is easier to create buildings on level ground!
Portuguese_Brazilian: Esta ferramenta é usada para paisagismo, e é considerada o par perfeito do martelo.\n\nUse-a para limpar o solo e manipular o terreno. É mais fácil erguer construções em terreno plano!
Chinese: 这个工具可以用来改善地面环境，可以说是工具锤的最佳伴侣。 \n\n它可以用作清理地面，和管理地貌。 在平坦的地面环境上建造房屋会更加容易。
Japanese: この道具は、地面に手を加えるために使うものだ。 ハンマーをうまく補助するものと言えるだろう。 \n\nこれを使って地面をならし、形を整えるといい。 平らな場所の方が建物を建てやすいからな！
Korean: 이 도구는 조경에 사용되지. 망치의 완벽한 파트너라고 할 수 있겠군. \n\n그것을 사용하여 땅을 고르거나 지형을 가다듬을 수 있지. 평평한 땅에 건물을 짓는 것이 훨씬 쉬우니까 말이야!
Chinese_Traditional: 這個工具可以用來整地，可以說是工具錘的最佳伙伴。 \n\n它可以用作清理地面，和管理地貌。 在平坦的地面上會更加容易建造房屋。

English: Consuming food is of <color=yellow>utmost importance</color> to a viking warrior, even in the afterlife. Having a full belly both fortifies your health and improves your stamina.\n\nFood can be found everywhere in the world, and a great deal of it can be prepared at a <color=yellow>Cooking station</color>.
Swedish:
Kosthållningen är av <color=yellow>största vikt</color> för en vikingakrigare, även i livet efter.
En full mage stärker både din hälsa och din ork.

Mat kan du finna överallt i Valheim, och mycket av den kan du tillreda på en <color=yellow>Matlagningsstation</color>.
French: Manger de la nourriture est de la <color=yellow>plus haute importance</color> pour un guerrier viking, même après la mort. Avoir le ventre plein augmente votre vie et améliore votre endurance.\n\nLa nourriture se trouve partout dans le monde, et la plupart peut être préparée dans une <color=yellow>cuisine</color>.
Italian: Consuming food is of <color=yellow>utmost importance</color> to a viking warrior, even in the afterlife. Having a full belly both fortifies your health and improves your stamina.\n\nFood can be found everywhere in the world, and a great deal of it can be prepared at a <color=yellow>Cooking station</color>.
German: Für einen Wikingerkrieger ist der Verzehr von <color=yellow>Nahrung</color> überlebenswichtig. Sogar, wenn er bereits tot ist. Ein voller Magen sorgt für eine gute Gesundheit und verbessert deine Ausdauer.\n\nGlücklicherweise kannst du Nahrung überall in der Welt finden, und sehr viele Nahrungsmittel können an der <color=yellow>Kochstelle</color> zubereitet werden.
Spanish: El consumo de alimentos es de <color=yellow>suma importancia</color> para los vikingos, incluso en la otra vida. Si tienes el estómago lleno, tendrás mejor salud y vigor.\n\nPodrás encontrar comida en cualquier rincón del mundo, y puedes prepararla a tu gusto en la <color=yellow>estación de cocina</color>.
Russian: Потребление пищи имеет <color=yellow>первостепенное значение</color> для викинга даже в загробной жизни. Сытость укрепляет ваше здоровье и повышает выносливость\n\nЕду можно найти повсюду, и большую ее часть можно приготовить на <color=yellow>стойке для готовки</color>.
Romanian: Consuming food is of <color=yellow>utmost importance</color> to a viking warrior, even in the afterlife. Having a full belly both fortifies your health and improves your stamina.\n\nFood can be found everywhere in the world, and a great deal of it can be prepared at a <color=yellow>Cooking station</color>.
Bulgarian: Consuming food is of <color=yellow>utmost importance</color> to a viking warrior, even in the afterlife. Having a full belly both fortifies your health and improves your stamina.\n\nFood can be found everywhere in the world, and a great deal of it can be prepared at a <color=yellow>Cooking station</color>.
Macedonian: Consuming food is of <color=yellow>utmost importance</color> to a viking warrior, even in the afterlife. Having a full belly both fortifies your health and improves your stamina.\n\nFood can be found everywhere in the world, and a great deal of it can be prepared at a <color=yellow>Cooking station</color>.
Finnish: Consuming food is of <color=yellow>utmost importance</color> to a viking warrior, even in the afterlife. Having a full belly both fortifies your health and improves your stamina.\n\nFood can be found everywhere in the world, and a great deal of it can be prepared at a <color=yellow>Cooking station</color>.
Danish: Consuming food is of <color=yellow>utmost importance</color> to a viking warrior, even in the afterlife. Having a full belly both fortifies your health and improves your stamina.\n\nFood can be found everywhere in the world, and a great deal of it can be prepared at a <color=yellow>Cooking station</color>.
Icelandic: Að borða mat er <color=yellow>eitt það mikilvægasta</color> sem víkingur skal gera, jafn vel í framhaldslífi. Fullur magi bætir bæði heilsu þína og þol.\n\nHægt er að finna alskonar mat í þessum heimi, og margt af því er hægt að elda í <color=yellow>matreiðslustöðinni</color>
Turkish: Beslenmek, öteki dünyada bile bir viking savaşçısı için <color=yellow>en önemli şeydir</color>. Karnını tok tutmak, sağlığını güçlendirir ve kondisyonunu geliştirir.\n\nYiyecekleri dünyanın dört bir köşesinde bulabilir ve büyük bir çoğunluğunu <color=yellow>Pişirme İstasyonu</color>'nda hazırlayabilirsin.
Lithuanian: Consuming food is of <color=yellow>utmost importance</color> to a viking warrior, even in the afterlife. Having a full belly both fortifies your health and improves your stamina.\n\nFood can be found everywhere in the world, and a great deal of it can be prepared at a <color=yellow>Cooking station</color>.
Czech: Konzumace jídla je pro vikingského válečníka <color=yellow> nanejvýš důležitá </color>, dokonce i v posmrtném životě. Plné břicho posiluje zdraví a zlepšuje výdrž. Jídlo najdeš všude na světě a hodně z něj lze připravit na <color=yellow> rožni </color>.
Hungarian: Az evés <color=yellow>rendkívül fontos</color> egy viking harcos számára, még a túlvilágon is. A teli has megnöveli az életerődet, és javítja a kitartásodat.\n\nÉlelmet a világ minden táján találhatsz, és a nagyobb részét egy <color=yellow>főzőállomáson</color> készítheted el.
Slovak: Consuming food is of <color=yellow>utmost importance</color> to a viking warrior, even in the afterlife. Having a full belly both fortifies your health and improves your stamina.\n\nFood can be found everywhere in the world, and a great deal of it can be prepared at a <color=yellow>Cooking station</color>.
Polish: Spożywanie pożywienia ma <color=yellow>ogromne znaczenie</color> dla przetrwania wikińskiego wojownika, nawet w życiu pozagrobowym. Pełny żołądek zarówno wzmacnia życie, jak i poprawia kondycję.\n\nŻywność można znaleźć na całym obszarze świata, a większość z niej przyrządzisz na <color=yellow>stanowisku do gotowania</color>.
Dutch: Voedsel verbruiken is <color=yellow>van enorm belang</color> voor een Vikingkrijger, zelfs in het hiernamaals. Een volle buik verstevigt de gezondheid en verbetert je conditie.\n\nVoedsel kun je overal ter wereld vinden, en het overgrote deel ervan kan worden bereid met een <color=yellow>kookstation</color>.
Portuguese: Consuming food is of <color=yellow>utmost importance</color> to a viking warrior, even in the afterlife. Having a full belly both fortifies your health and improves your stamina.\n\nFood can be found everywhere in the world, and a great deal of it can be prepared at a <color=yellow>Cooking station</color>.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Comer é <color=yellow>extremamente importante</color> para guerreiros vikings, mesmo após a morte. Uma barriga cheia aumenta sua vida e melhora seu vigor.\n\nÉ possível encontrar comida em qualquer lugar do mundo, e grande parte pode ser preparada em uma <color=yellow>bancada de cozinha</color>.
Chinese:
对于维京战士来说，<color=yellow>最重要的事</color>就是干饭，即使你已经转世。 
只有吃饱了才可以强化你的生命值和耐力值。 

在所有区域都可以找到食物，不过最好的办法还是准备一个 <color=yellow>烹饪台</color>。
Japanese: たとえ死後であってさえ、バイキングの戦士にとって食べ物を摂ることは<color=yellow>非常に重要</color>だ。 満腹であれば体力が維持され、スタミナが向上する。 \n\n食べ物は世界のどこででも見つかる。 多くは<color=yellow>調理設備</color>で用意することができる。
Korean: 음식을 섭취하는 것은 사후에도 바이킹 전사에게 있어서 <color=yellow>가장 중요한 일이야</color>. 속이 든든하면 체력이 강화되고 스태미나가 향상된다네. \n\n음식은 세계 곳곳에서 찾을 수 있고, 대부분 <color=yellow>요리 작업대</color>에서 준비 할 수 있지.
Chinese_Traditional:
對於維京戰士來說，<color=yellow>最重要的事</color>就是吃飯，即使你已經轉世。 
只有吃飽了才可以強化你的生命值和耐力值。 

在所有區域都可以找到食物，不過最好的辦法還是準備一個 <color=yellow>烹飪檯</color>。

Japanese: フギン：インベントリー

English: Most items must be crafted. However, due to your recent departure from Midgard, you will have to recall the true shape of objects. Just pick things up and it will all come back to you, I'm sure.\n\nMy lesser brother, Munin, tells me one can fashion a Stone Axe out of <color=yellow>Wood and Stone</color>.
Swedish: Du måste tillverka de flesta föremål själv. Din avfärd från Midgård har otvivelaktligen grumlat ditt minne, och du kan finna det svårt att minnas föremåls form och funktion. Ta upp saker och undersök dem så minns du snart.\n\nMin underlägsne broder, Munin, påstår att man kan plocka ihop en stenyxa med <color=yellow>Trä</color> och <color=yellow>Sten</color>.
French:
Ceci est l'écran d'inventaire et de création. Les nouvelles recettes seront déverrouillées une fois que vous aurez tous les ingrédients nécessaires pour les fabriquer.

Essayez de fabriquer un club en bois ou une hache en bois et en pierre.

Astuce: le silex se trouve près de l'eau.
Italian: La maggior parte degli oggetti deve essere creata. Purtroppo, dato che hai lasciato di recente Midgard, dovrai ricordare la vera forma di questi oggetti. Inizia a raccogliere risorse e sono sicuro che riuscirai a ricordare.\n\nMio fratello minore, Munin, Mi ha riferito della possibilità di creare un'ascia di pietra con <color=yellow>legno e pietre</color>.
German: Die meisten Gegenstände müssen hergestellt werden. Da du Midgard allerdings kürzlich verlassen hast, musst du dich an die wahre Form von Gegenständen zunächst erneut erinnern. Hebe einfach alles auf, was du findest, und es fällt dir schon wieder ein.\n\nMein kleiner Bruder, Munin, sagt mir, dass sich mithilfe von <color=yellow>Holz und Stein</color> eine Steinaxt herstellen lässt.
Spanish: La mayoría de los objetos han de fabricarse. Sin embargo, como acabas de dejar Midgard, aún has de recordar la verdadera forma de muchos de ellos. No me cabe duda de que irás recuperando la memoria a medida que recojas cosas.\n\nMi hermano pequeño, Munin, me ha dicho que puedes hacer un hacha de piedra con <color=yellow>madera y piedra</color>.
Russian: Большинство предметов необходимо создавать. Так как вы только недавно покинули Мидгард, вам придется вспоминать истинную форму вещей. Просто собирайте все предметы, и я уверен, что все вспомнится.\n\nМой младший брат Мунин сказал мне, что можно сделать каменный топор из <color=yellow>древесины и камня</color>.
Romanian: Most items must be crafted. However, due to your recent departure from Midgard, you will have to recall the true shape of objects. Just pick things up and it will all come back to you, I'm sure.\n\nMy lesser brother, Munin, tells me one can fashion a Stone Axe out of <color=yellow>Wood and Stone</color>.
Bulgarian: Most items must be crafted. However, due to your recent departure from Midgard, you will have to recall the true shape of objects. Just pick things up and it will all come back to you, I'm sure.\n\nMy lesser brother, Munin, tells me one can fashion a Stone Axe out of <color=yellow>Wood and Stone</color>.
Macedonian: Most items must be crafted. However, due to your recent departure from Midgard, you will have to recall the true shape of objects. Just pick things up and it will all come back to you, I'm sure.\n\nMy lesser brother, Munin, tells me one can fashion a Stone Axe out of <color=yellow>Wood and Stone</color>.
